Title: Business Analyst Finance
Duration: 6 Months
Location: Kennesaw, GA


Short Description:
Responsible for conducting financial data analysis, design, collection, and report solutions to satisfy and support finance stakeholders.

Complete Description:
Local Candidates

Serves as the liaison between functional and technical teams by understanding and conceptualizing applications from each area's point of view. Responsible for conducting financial data analysis, design, collection, and report solutions to satisfy and support finance stakeholders. Monitors the quality of various technical and functional business processes, identifies data issues, and provides resolutions. Responsibilities will include collecting requirements, developing reports and dashboards, testing, assisting with the implementation of new software applications, process improvements, and training to support the objectives of the Institution.

MINIMUM EDUCATION REQUIRED:
Bachelor's Degree from an accredited institution of higher education in Business, Finance, Accounting, Information Systems or related field or equivalent combination of education and/or experience

MINIMUM EXPERIENCE REQUIRED:
Four (4) years previous experience in Business, Finance, Accounting, Information Technology or Systems Analysis

ADDITIONAL QUALIFICATIONS: (Preferred qualifications)
Experience with reporting/query tools and coding in Tableau, SAS, SAS Enterprise Guide, Oracle Databases, and/or SQL (or gathering data from other relation database systems)
Extensive experience in data analysis, dashboards, analytics and decision support systems
Experience successfully working as part of a team with a collaborative approach to problem solving
Working knowledge of fund accounting, budget and finance
Strong IT and Financial skills

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:
1. Interfaces with clients to define business processes, specifications, reporting needs, and functional requirements
2. Designs report and dashboard mock-ups to effectively meet business needs
3. Documents system processes, functionality and implements improvements as applicable
4. Develops and maintains user manuals, training documents and guidelines
5. Conducts meetings with end users to clarify issues, gather requirements, and resolve requests
6. Devises test plans to ensure that the outcome meets the specified requirements and expectations of business users
7. Develops and implements reports and dashboards to provide up-to-date information on functional actives
8. Maintains issues log and collaborates with team to mitigate risks and proactively searches for improvement opportunities
9. Prioritizes problem resolution based on business need, timelines, and scale of impact
10. Presents data resolution findings to relevant stakeholders with recommendations to ensure business needs are meet
11. Designs, builds, implements, and maintains Oracle SQL scripts and procedures in Oracle backend finance data warehouse SQL development software
12. Consults finance users on current and future data visualization and reporting solutions to identify customer needs
13. Provides backup support for operational and technical processes, and system changes
14. Administrator of PeopleSoft eProcurement responsibilities
15. Hosts training sessions on the system applications
16. Maintains content on the department and division webpage
17. Maintains financial data integrity

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, ABILITIES*:
Understanding of database concepts such as schemas and data relationshipsKnowledge of relational databasesFamiliar with API concepts such as web servicesAble to work autonomously and with managers to ensure business requirements and needs are metAble to communicate in financial and technical termsAble to communicate complex technical concepts to the end-usersAble to handle multiple tasks or projects at one time meeting assigned deadlinesAble to understand programming concepts such as structured and object-oriented programmingExcellent interpersonal, initiative, teamwork, problem solving, independent judgment, organization, communication (verbal and written), time management, project management and presentation skillsPolished and professional demeanorSelf-motivated with the ability to learn new concepts quicklyProficient with computer applications and programs associated with the position (i.e., Microsoft Office suite)Strong attention to detail and follow up skillsStrong customer service skills and phone and e-mail etiquette

OTHER INFORMATION
This is not a supervisory position.
This position does not have any financial responsibilities.
No, this position will not be required to drive.
This role is considered a position of trust.
This position will not travel.

In the business analyst position, you would assist and support project management in all phases of the software development life cycle for business application and/or data management systems. You would be compiling detailed project and/or data modeling/analysis/mapping documentation for all of Montana State Fund’s applications, including gather requirements related to Guidewire PolicyCenter and BillingCenter. You would also work closely with customers and coordinate communication amongst the project team to ensure products meet specified requirements. In addition, you would apply system solutions to business problems by developing and producing business queries, including querying relational databases through SQL.
Another key component of this position is coordinating offshore/onsite vendor resources to ensure execution for all aspects of the software development life cycle, including successful production deployments of defect-free software.

About Anuvu For over a decade, our clients in aviation and maritime have used our technology-driven products and services to keep their passengers entertained and connected to the things they love, from anywhere in the world. Brands such as Southwest Airlines, Norwegian Cruise Lines, Emirates and Celebrity Cruises have trusted us to provide solutions from high-speed broadband internet to movies, television and games.Our team of global experts take pride in providing clients what they need today while creating a strategic road map for tomorrow through reliable, scalable, and affordable content and connectivity solutions designed to meet the ever-changing technology needs of our clients' passengers and guests.Be Part of the Movement Anuvu is embarking on a new chapter with a new story to tell. As one of the leading providers of high-speed connectivity and entertainment solutions for worldwide mobility markets, we deliver what customers need today, while remaining flexible and future-focused.Role SummaryThe Sr. Financial Analyst will be a key business partner reporting into the Director, Business Finance. They will provide regular management reporting, business analytics, variance analysis and decision support to senior management and stakeholders throughout the organization. The individual will understand revenue and cost drivers, provide the business with insights to improve and predict performance, and lead variance analysis. They will ensure results are tracked against budget/forecast and develop insights and analysis that drive results. Key responsibilities will also include commercial analysis of deal economics, decision support, and to best position Anuvu’s product offering. They will partner with segment and other functional leaders throughout the organization to deliver the most impactful information to key stakeholders and ensure the accuracy and timely delivery of the prescribed reports.The successful candidate will be an experienced, self-motivated, hands-on person with excellent organizational and project management skills, along with the ability to set and meet strict timelines. They will possess the ability to navigate through various financial and accounting systems and simplify big data to create clear value-added management tools and reports to support decision-making. The successful candidate will have a strong work ethic, ability to multi-task, think proactively/independently, very strong modelling skills, strong excel and data analytics skills, a deep desire to be successful, and a passion for finance.Location: Can be anywhere in the United States (Denver, CO preferred - relocation assistance available)Remote Options: Option to be 100% remote or on a hybrid Coin Metrics is a leading provider of cryptoasset data for institutions. We deliver transparent and actionable data and analytics to various industry stakeholders including asset managers, custodians, trading venues, research desks, and data/application providers. Coin Metrics' data empowers its clients and the public to better understand, use and value open crypto networks.

Join a fast-paced startup pioneering novel metrics, data products, and intelligence solutions, which offer insights into the economics, markets, usage, health, and other aspects of public cryptocurrency blockchains like Bitcoin and Ethereum and other crypto networks.

You will be surrounded by talented people passionate about decentralized economies and the data behind them. Break new ground, create exciting new data-driven research and products, and help shape the future of finance.
YOUR PURPOSE

The Business Analyst Indexes will be the right hand for our Chief Index Officer & Index Product Manager. They will assist in product planning, delivery, maintenance and oversight of the product.

YOUR VALUE
Conducting market research on potential index and product features.
Gathering and prioritizing index, product and customer requirements.
Articulating index and product requirements to engineering teams and ensuring requirements are understood.
Managing product releases.
Providing estimates to the Product Manager on delivery timing based on feedback by the Engineering, Development and Data Scientists teams.
Surfacing and escalating delivery blockers.
Developing test scenarios/plans and engaging in product QC.
Helping to coordinate and shape user research by working with our UX/user researchers.
Understanding the competitive landscape.
Create, support and document detailed written SOPs for daily processes. Develop and implement KPIs for the CMBI team.
Briefing and training the sales and customer success team and helping to articulate product selling points, pricing and positioning strategies.
Assisting with client and prospect requests (including research requests and data requests)
Updating/refreshing product documentation in GitBooks and elsewhere (e.g., sales collateral, website) and reviewing and suggesting updates on API documentation related to product.
YOUR EXPERTISE AND EXPERIENCE
Interest in crypto and crypto assets
Prior strategic analysis, business analysis or product management experience with demonstrated success in defining and launching products
Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Business or other relevant field
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Excellent teamwork skills
Strong problem solving skills
Ability to multitask and work under pressure
Proven ability to influence cross-functional teams without formal authority
LIFE AT COIN METRICS

Coin Metrics is a fun and fast-paced team with employees located in 8 countries. We are united by our OPEN (Open, Pioneering, Elucidating, and Neutral) core values. Our employees are empowered to do what's best for our products, customers, and team members. Other benefits of working at Coin Metrics include:

Competitive salary, 401(k) retirement plan, bonus and options plans
Comprehensive medical, dental, vision
Remote or hybrid work options with generous equipment reimbursement offering
Paid time off
Global company offsites
Coin Metrics Labs where associates pursue their passions
OUR INTERVIEW PROCESS
30 minute video interview with Talent Sherpa (Recruiter)
3-4 video interviews with members of our team
Case Study
WORK LOCATION

Greater Boston, MA (remote considered)

At Northrop Grumman, our employees have incredible opportunities to work on revolutionary systems that impact people's lives around the world today, and for generations to come. Our pioneering and inventive spirit has enabled us to be at the forefront of many technological advancements in our nation's history - from the first flight across the Atlantic Ocean, to stealth bombers, to landing on the moon. We look for people who have bold new ideas, courage and a pioneering spirit to join forces to invent the future, and have fun along the way. Our culture thrives on intellectual curiosity, cognitive diversity and bringing your whole self to work — and we have an insatiable drive to do what others think is impossible. Our employees are not only part of history, they're making history.
Northrop Grumman is currently looking for a Principal Business Process Analyst for our Northridge, CA. Location.
This lucky person will Analyze business and technical processes to formulate and develop new and modified business information processing systems, such as production and inventory control systems, financial tracking systems, marketing and human resources systems. Represents the business unit to define requirements and business cases for the technology developments. Coordinates with business and technology teams, ascertaining system requirements, such as program functions, output requirements, input data acquisition, and system techniques and controls. Requires knowledge of e-commerce tools, computer system capabilities, business processes, and work flow.
Job Responsibilities
Collecting quantitative data and reporting qualitative analysis for Supply Chain, OPS, Financial Reporting, and New Sales
Gathering status of action items and providing updated and organized information
Identifying issues and trends in the data analysis
Presenting analytical data with brevity and clarity for the audience’s understanding
Providing daily, weekly, monthly reporting
Developing and implementing additional behavior-changing metrics
Reviewing improvement (Six Sigma/Lean Manufacturing) processes and status projects
Owner of Supplier and Buyer scorecards
Supporting special administrative projects
Required Experience
Familiarity with Supply Chain processes
Advanced Microsoft Excel skills
Proficient in Microsoft PowerPoint
Familiarity with Tableau and Alteryx a plus
Ability to perform complex tasks in an efficient manner, with minimal oversight
Experience with data mining, analysis, and reporting
Experience with MRP/ERP environments
Attention to detail
Ability to think creatively and establish new metrics
Excellent communication skills
Outstanding organizational ability
Basic Qualifications:
BA and 6 years of experience or MA and 4 years of experience


Salary Range: 92000 - 138000

Employees may be eligible for a discretionary bonus in addition to base pay. Annual bonuses are designed to reward individual contributions as well as allow employees to share in company results. Employees in Vice President or Director positions may be eligible for Long Term Incentives. In addition, Northrop Grumman provides a variety of benefits including health insurance coverage, life and disability insurance, savings plan, Company paid holidays and paid time off (PTO) for vacation and/or personal business.

Northrop Grumman is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, age, veteran status, disability, or any other protected class. For our complete EEO/AA and Pay Transparency statement, please visit http://www.northropgrumman.com/EEO. U.S. Citizenship is required for most positions.

The Reporting/Data Analyst-Workday will be a critical part of the Human Resources team, reporting to the Vice President People Services and Technology. In this role you will be the primary subject matter expert for our reporting/data analytics solutions and needs. You will work closely with the VP People Services and Technology, HR Business Units, and Managers/Leaders to build impactful partnerships with various stakeholders. You will use data to understand business patterns and trends and promotes best practices in data analysis and reporting. We offer a flexible work environment, allowing you to work from home up to two days a week for all staff.For over 75 years Global Partners has been delivering the energy, products, and services that make life better. This longevity and success begin and ends with people.  We create career paths and provide development programs for all roles in the organization.  We’ve also successfully developed community integrated convenience stores where we are transforming the customer experience and rethinking what it means to lead as an adaptive energy distribution company. This is a source of pride and frankly we don’t plan on stopping. With our recent game changers such as PaybyCar Contactless Payment and Renewable Diesel Fuel, we are looking to continue responsible and innovative growth. From design, supply, and tech we’re looking for people to contribute to our company’s direction. Global Partners is a great opportunity for those looking to develop their career with a longstanding company motivated by what’s next.  The Types of “Energy” You Bring Excellent communication and collaboration skillsAdvance knowledge of Microsoft Excel and experience manipulating complex data setsTimely execution and decision makingAbility to manage competing prioritiesProactive approach to process improvementCollaboration with cross functional teams“Gauges” of Responsibility Analyze internal and external data through quantitative researchUse data mining to extract information from data sets and identify correlations and patternsOrganize and transform information into comprehensible structuresUse data to predict trends in the customer base and the consumer population as a wholePerform statistical analysis of dataUse tools and techniques to visualize data in easy-to-understand formats, such as diagrams and graphsManage and design the reporting environment, including data sources, security, and metadataWork with VP Peoples Services and Technology to build and support Company annual budgetCreate and maintain custom reports and calculated fields based on user requirements. Test and validate reporting solutions for completeness and accuracy. Design, configure, setup, and maintain dashboards, alerts and scheduled reports in WorkdayEducate end-users on reporting capabilities, and continuously seek reporting enhancements to support evolving company requirementsServe as a point-of-contact for Workday reporting related questionsTroubleshoots issues and appropriately escalates issues not able to be resolved.Maintain awareness of current trends in Workday Reporting and complete ad-hoc data requestsPerform other duties as assigned“Fuel” for You Coins! About the role:
As an Enterprise Project Analyst with TQL, you will be a key member of one of our fastest growing sales departments. You will be working directly with department leadership to identify opportunities for revenue growth, productivity enhancement and cost savings. You will be tasked with leveraging tools such as SQL, Excel and Power BI to produce actionable reporting and analyses that will support stakeholder objectives.

What’s in it for you:
Competitive compensation and benefits package
Paid relocation to Cincinnati, OH
Advancement opportunities within structured career paths
Employee referral bonus opportunities
Up to $5,000/yr in tuition reimbursement
We win wherever we go – Voted 2019 and 2020 Fortune 100 Best Companies to Work For

What you’ll be doing:
Take ownership of reporting projects to identify areas of productivity and cost saving improvements
Perform data mining, analysis and create visualizations using SQL, Excel and Power BI
Analyze and document business processes and metrics to identify improvement opportunities
Forecast and provide recommendations for proper department staffing and scheduling
Assist with carrier route optimization development and analysis
Work with cross functional teams including finance to report on revenue, customer and logistics data
Assist with robotic process automation (RPA) development and maintenance projects

What you need:
Bachelor’s degree in Business Analytics, Business Intelligence, Data Science, Information Systems or equivalent discipline preferred
Experience with Power BI, SQL and or managing large amounts of data is a plus
Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel, creating dashboards, forms and scorecards
Good oral and written communication skills, with ability to effectively communicate with a variety of disciplines and diverse groups of people
Exceptional organizational skills and a demonstrated ability to handle multiple tasks, follow and achieve timelines is critical
Self-starter with a strong work ethic, attention to detail and able to work in a fast-paced environment

Job Title: Data Scientist (Non-Civil Service), Data Analytics and Busin...
Description:
The salary listed on this job posting is the starting salary range; amount offered will depend upon qualifications.

The Data Scientist evaluates, analyzes, and reviews various data streams and utilization of large data sets to determine unique insights to further business needs. Assists and supports the City's goals to become smarter, more efficient, and effective in delivering services and programs to constituents.
Essential Functions
• Partners with key city agencies and work within the team to identify, scope, and execute analytic efforts that answer business questions, solve business needs and add business values. • Maintains a broad understanding of the key problem statement and be fully engaged with the project team, bringing an objective voice to the table and facilitating decisions grounded in data.
Works with departments to apply statistical analysis, pattern recognition with domain and program specific knowledge to solve business issues.Uses predictive modeling to increase and optimize customer experiences, revenue generation, and other business outcomes.Develops tools to monitor and analyze model performance and data accuracy.Works with data engineers to facilitate technical design of complex data sourcing.
• Identifies opportunities for leveraging data to drive program, service and department solutions. • Develops mechanisms to ingest, analyze, validate, normalize, and clean data.
Retrieves and combines data from databases, websites, department systems, etc.Contributes to all stages of data science and decision modeling projects, including problem formulation to solution developments.Designs dynamic, real time dashboards for program managers, department leaders, and executive leadership, as appropriate to project deliverables.Builds Community of Practice for staff in data-oriented roles and manage data analytics trainings.
Minimum Qualifications
The candidate will be intricately involved in running analytical experiments in a methodical manner and will regularly evaluate alternate models via theoretical approaches. Responsibilities include analyzes of various data streams, utilization of large data sets to determine unique insights to further business needs. This includes finding innovative ways to combine fields of data that don't naturally mesh together as well as exploratory data analysis to navigate a dataset and come out with conclusions based on certain assumptions. The ideal candidate will assist in building out the analytics eco system for the City and transforming data as a key input in solving challenging real-world problems. By using available data and information, the Data Scientist will help the City become smarter, more efficient and effective in delivering services and programs to constituents.

Bachelor's degree in statistics, data management, quantitative analysis, or related field; Advanced degree strongly preferred.
• 5+ years of experience with database management, operations, and statistical analysis. • Demonstrated proficiency in statistical analysis tools such as Tableau, MATLAB, Stata, SPSS, PowerBI, or similar.

Demonstrated proficiency in R and/or Python.
Demonstrated experience in creating intuitive & interactive data visualizations or applications.
Demonstrated experience in creating custom data models and algorithms to apply to data sets.
Experience mentoring or supervising junior data scientists or data analysts a plus.

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities Required to Perform Work
Ability to communicate orally and in writing with stakeholders about data insights using non-technical language.Ability to assess the effectiveness and accuracy of new data sources and data gathering techniques.Proven ability to work independently with stakeholders to identify opportunities for application of business dataStrong problem-solving skills to decompose complex problems.Ability to develop code and processes that are repeatable and easily maintained.Superb communication and organization skills to manage multiple tasks efficiently and effectively.
• Effective project management skills to manage and track individual and team tasks. • Ability to establish and maintain an effective working relationship with all levels of management, city officials, vendors, other government agencies, other employees and the general public.

Criminal Justice Information Systems (CJIS) Clearance: The work involves the use of sensitive data and all Office of Data Analytics and Business Intelligence employees are required to obtain this clearance. Inability to maintain this clearance may result in discharge from the position.
The following offenses would prevent obtaining the required clearance.No felony or class A misdemeanor convictions.No class B misdemeanor convictions within the last ten (10) years.No family violence convictions

Working Conditions and Hazards:
Normal office conditions. Works under limited direction with extensive latitude for the use of initiative and independent judgment.

The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work performed by personnel assigned to this classification and is not necessarily and exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required

Description
Job Purpose or Objective(s): Plan, coordinate, develop, and implement the enterprise Geographic Information System (GIS) while managing the daily operations of the system and related activities. Provide full cycle management of internal and external business opportunities including the identification, development, review, analysis, due diligence, business planning, capital funding, and final integration into Choctaw Nation.
Primary Tasks:
Forecast and analyze GIS technology and industry trends to determine organizational objectives and develop strategic plans to meet goals.

Conduct competitor and market research on current and prospective businesses in areas such as value chains, market size, market growth, market share, relative profit margins, distribution strength, and production capacity.

Support GIS users, including senior management, through training, technical support, and spatial analysis.

Work with the other departments and clients in a way which will promote the vision and mission of the Choctaw Nation.

Develop best practices for the creation, management, storage and distribution of geographic data.

Conduct internal analyses to identify, recommend, negotiate, structure, and obtain internal approvals for potential business opportunities.

Define, collect, and maintain key metrics and databases that measure business portfolio performance and business development opportunities.

Provide oversight and support in the delivery of business analysis activities across the portfolio of projects.

Prepare presentations, proposals, and business plans in connection with business development opportunities.

Perform other duties as may be assigned.

Required Education, Skills and Experience:
MINIMUM
Bachelor’s degree in geographic information systems, geography, computer science, management science, finance, accounting, business, economics or related quantitative field

Technical knowledge of ESRI suite of desktop software and supporting applications

Ability to create, use and manage relational database structures

Experience with custom desktop map production and web map publishing using ArcGIS Online and Portal for ArcGIS applications

Hands on proficiency with key software programs within Microsoft Office and the potential to use advanced decision support analytic tools

Strong analytical, written, verbal, and interpersonal communication skills

Ability to work efficiently and effectively on multiple projects simultaneously

Ensure confidentiality of all business development opportunities, documentation, and information

Five (5) years directly related experience

TARGET
Master’s Degree in geographic information systems, geography, computer science, management science, finance, accounting, business, economics, or related quantitative field

Experience with ArcGIS Server, SQL Server, Portal for ArcGIS, and ArcGIS Online

Working knowledge of overall business operations

Excellent commercial and financial acumen and attention to detail

Ensure confidentiality of all business development opportunities, documentation, and information

Hands on proficiency with key software programs within Microsoft Office and the potential to use advanced decision support analytic tools

Strong analytical, written, verbal, and interpersonal communication skills

Ability to work efficiently and effectively on multiple projects simultaneously

Seven (7) years of full-time, direct career experience in GIS, using ESRI products

Req ID: 21014681

Chicago Fire FC is Chicago’s ambassador to the global sport of football. Founded in 1997, and competing in Major League Soccer, Chicago Fire won its first championship in its debut season and was foundational in the careers of several current MLS coaches and players, as well as international and UEFA Champions League coaches.

Under new ownership, the Club recently returned to Soldier Field as well as opened a new 50,000 square foot office in the heart of the city. With tremendous growth and expansion, the Club is laying the foundation for an audacious and ambitious vision that will transform the brand and the company in the coming years.

Chicago Fire FC is committed to fostering, cultivating, and preserving a culture of diversity, equity, accessibility, and inclusion. Our diversity initiatives start with the recruitment and selection process; therefore, we’d like to welcome all diverse candidates to apply to opportunities within our Club.

Chicago Fire Football Club is seeking a dedicated Junior Data Analyst to join our team!
Job Responsibilities:
Identify business and technical requirements for solutions and translate to accurate answers, valuable insights, on-time information, and actionable conclusions
Systematically assess the quality and completeness of available data
Expand database concepts and develop analytical models to further business performance
Use an analytics-driven approach in analyzing business problems
Implement statistical methodologies to predict, forecast, or diagnose business outcomes
Interpret and validate analysis results
Build processes to increase efficiencies across technology platforms
Communicate insights through data visualizations and storytelling
Present findings and recommendations to bring about insights for decision making
 Qualifications:
 Pursuing a bachelor’s or master’s degree in business, economics, mathematics, or a related field
Practical experience with analytic tools (s): Python, SQL, Stata, etc.
Has an interest in database management platforms like Snowflake or Microsoft Azure SQL
Base knowledge of CRM systems, preferably Salesforce
Working knowledge of data visualization software like Tableau or Power BI
Advanced working knowledge of Excel; Strong PowerPoint skills
Attention to detail and organizational skills with the ability to meet firm deadlines
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, both written and verbal
Ability to work autonomously and use excellent judgment in escalating issues to supervisors
Willingness to learn in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial, high-performing work environment

The Company does not discriminate in employment opportunities or practices on the basis of race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy), national origin, ancestry, ethnicity, citizenship, age, veteran or military status, disability, sexual orientation, sexual orientation, or expression, marital status or any other characteristic protected by law. This policy governs all aspects of employment, including hiring, promotion, compensation, discipline, termination, and access to benefits and training.
If, because of a medical condition or disability, you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application process, please contact the Human Resources Department at hr@chicagofirefc.com to let us know the nature of your request and your contact information.

Notes: As a UW employee, you will enjoy generous benefits and work/life programs. For detailed information on Benefits for this position, click here.


As a UW employee, you have a unique opportunity to change lives on our campuses, in our state and around the world. UW employees offer their boundless energy, creative problem solving skills and dedication to build stronger minds and a healthier world.


UW faculty and staff also enjoy outstanding benefits, professional growth opportunities and unique resources in an environment noted for diversity, intellectual excitement, artistic pursuits and natural beauty.


UW-IT is the central IT organization for the University of Washington, providing technology solutions to all three campuses, UW medical centers and global research operations. UW-IT collaborates with University partners to advance teaching, learning, innovation and discovery at the UW. UW-IT is currently looking for a Business Analyst who will support the UW-IT work on Finance Transformation, the University’s large scale project to modernize its finance operations, business systems and processes. The position is a role in the newly established UW-IT FT program (ITF).


The Business Analyst will perform detailed requirements analysis, document business processes, and identify areas for improvement. Working in a team with other analysts, this position will participate in best practices and processes for business analysis. This position must work with and influence decisions across multiple teams, including: teams responsible for legacy systems, enterprise IT services, and integrations; the UW’s Finance Transformation program; and partner IT and business units at the UW.


This position will support the ITF program in meeting objectives, creating and maintaining deliverables, driving design issues to solution, ad hoc analysis, understanding data, testing, training and stabilization support. The position must be able to understand business, system and technical issues, and facilitate problem solving and issue resolution. In order to be successful, the incumbent will need to exhibit keen attention to detail while remaining aware of broader University objectives. Additionally, the role will excellent analytical acumen and documentation skills, an ability to prioritize multiple timelines and competing goals and excellent documentation skills.


This position does not have supervisory responsibilities but may be asked to coach other analysts. The position will work closely with other analysts in multiple teams. The Business Analyst is expected to develop stakeholder relationships and facilitate meetings successfully.


REQUIREMENTS:

Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration, Information Science, Computer Science or related area or experience

Minimum of five years of experience performing progressively more complex work in business analysis.

Demonstrated experience in business analysis and requirements gathering.

Demonstrated collaboration skills with colleagues at all levels and across different organizations.

Demonstrated ability to work independently and with minimal supervision.

Experience facilitating meetings, constructively addressing input and criticism, and resolving conflicts.

Effectively presents complex technical material to non-technical audiences in an approachable way.

Able to understand and communicate business relevance to management / leadership teams.

Demonstrated excellent written/oral communication skills, technical documentation skills, user liaison skills, and personal interaction abilities.


Equivalent education/experience will substitute for all minimum qualifications except when there are legal requirements, such as a license/certification/registration.


DESIRED:

Experience with data deliverables as part of an ERP program team using Workday or comparable products

Proficient using SQL for data profiling and data analysis.

Experience in data modeling and data design, incl. relational and dimensional.

Experience with data management / data integration design and implementations.

Experience conducting quality assurance and/or user acceptance testing.

Demonstrated knowledge and work experience with enterprise-wide relational databases, scripting languages, XML, SQL Server, BI reporting tools.

Knowledge of multiple business subject areas, i.e. Finance and Student, etc.

Experience in a major research university setting.

Experience in an Agile software development environment.

:


Work in an open office environment and contribute to collaborative team work focused on problem-solving. Daily interactions with other team members, subject matter experts and stakeholders at all levels of the organization. While the general working hours are within Monday through Friday, 8 a.m.-5 p.m. will on occasion, need to adjust hours to accommodate the business needs and deadlines.


This position on the Finance Transformation Project is temporarily funded; continued employment is contingent on ongoing funding and performance.


This position is eligible for 100% remote work.


Multiple openings are available.


Application Process:

The application process for UW positions may include completion of a variety of online assessments to obtain additional information that will be used in the evaluation process. These assessments may include Work Authorization, Cover Letter and/or others. Any assessments that you need to complete will appear on your screen as soon as you select “Apply to this position”. Once you begin an assessment, it must be completed at that time; if you do not complete the assessment you will be prompted to do so the next time you access your “My Jobs” page. If you select to take it later, it will appear on your "My Jobs" page to take when you are ready. Please note that your application will not be reviewed, and you will not be considered for this position until all required assessments have been completed.


Applicants considered for this position will be required to disclose if they are the subject of any substantiated findings or current investigations related to sexual misconduct at their current employment and past employment. Disclosure is required under Washington state law.

THE POSITION
Looking for a rewarding job making a difference in the lives of children? Join the Office of Children, Youth and Families team! As a member of our team, you’ll be part of a diverse network that supports and strengthens families in Pennsylvania to provide safe, nurturing and healthy environments for children. The work is challenging, but extremely rewarding! There are opportunities for professional development and growth AND free parking!
DESCRIPTION OF WORK
This position is part of the Systems and Data Management Section within the Bureau of Policy, Programs and Operations, and is part of a team of Business Analysts responsible for supporting the program offices in the planning, development, implementation and operation of information systems for the programs administered and supervised by OCYF.

The Systems and Data Management Section manages the existing Child Welfare Information Solution (CWIS) and is responsible for providing leadership and direction for the planning, development and implementation of a new Statewide Child Welfare Case Management System. The Section also manages other legacy applications for the office and is responsible for data management, data quality, and reporting.

The person in this position will perform analysis of county and/or state business processes and requirements that will be supported in a new case management system. Additional job duties are to include engaging users in business process reengineering and user stories, participating in the design and development of the case management system, performing user acceptance testing, and providing implementation support (training and technical assistance).

A portion of the person’s time may also include providing child welfare and OCYF procedural expertise for operational support and technical assistance for the following systems and processes: DocuShare, Account Administration (Business Partner account/technical assistance), Continuity of Operations, CWIS (Child Welfare Information System), and management of the CWIS County Helpdesk Resource Account.

The work also involves representing the program office and providing child welfare expertise in the identification and documentation of existing business processes, and in the development and implementation of improved business processes for their application to an IT system in support of agency programs and policy.

Work Hours and Additional Information:
Full time employment.
Work hours: 8:00 am - 4:30 pm, Monday - Friday with 1 hour lunch.
You will have the opportunity to work from home (telework), part-time up to 4 days a week. In order to telework, you must have a securely configured high-speed internet connection. If you are unable to telework, you will have the option to report to the headquarters office in Harrisburg.

REQUIRED EXPERIENCE, TRAINING & ELIGIBILITY
Qualifications:
Minimum Experience and Training Requirements - One year as a Business Analyst 1; OR one year as an Information Technology Trainee; OR one year of business process analysis experience and a bachelor’s degree; OR five years of business process analysis experience; OR an equivalent combination of experience and training.
Must meet PA residency requirement – For more information on ways to meet PA residency requirements, follow the link and click on Residency.
Do not submit resumes, cover letters, and similar documents. These documents will not be reviewed and the information contained therein will not be considered for the purposes of determining your eligibility for the position or to determine your score. Information to support your eligibility for the position must be provided on the application (i.e., relevant, detailed experience/education).
If you are claiming education in your answers to the supplemental application questions, you must attach a copy of your college transcripts for your claim to be accepted toward meeting the minimum requirements. Unofficial transcripts are acceptable.
Must be able to perform essential job functions.

Business Analyst - Investment Banking (Technology & Services)-2103253
Description
Job Summary
Under general direction, uses knowledge and skills obtained through education and experience to conduct industry and M&A market research, company financial and transaction data reporting and financial analyses to assess and identify opportunities to support the business strategy and growth of the banking sector. This person will be responsible for gathering company and market information, synthesizing, organizing and presenting data and information in reports (primarily PowerPoint) for the investment banking team and their clients as well as RJTS management and utilizing CRM tools to conduct data analytics and market research. Has the ability to contribute and generate original ideas while working both independently and collaboratively on multiple projects with significant scope and impact.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities
Collect, organize and validate data on public and private companies using internal and external data sources.Analyze financial and market data and identify key trends to support strategies, initiatives and growth of the business.Develop and maintain weekly reports for distribution to sector M&A banking team.Perform financial analysis of public company comparables and precedent market transactions.Assist in the preparation of proprietary written market analyses and presentations.Assist in the preparation of proprietary reports for use in business development meetings with private equity and strategic clients and prospects.Performs other duties and responsibilities as assigned.

Qualifications
Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities
Knowledge of
Proficiency with Microsoft Office (particular Excel and PowerPoint).Familiarity with investment banking terms, markets and products.
Skill in
Conducting market research, segmenting market financial and qualitative data.Analyzing and interpreting financial analyses.Performing data analytics, reporting and synthesizing.Strong written and oral communication skills.Operating standard office equipment and using required software applications to produce correspondence, reports, electronic communication and spreadsheets.
Ability to
Support multiple detailed tasks and assignments.Organize and manage competing priorities.Work in a fast-paced environment with changing deadlines.Convey information clearly and effectively.Work independently as well as collaboratively within a team-driven environment.Project a positive and proactive professional image.
Educational/Previous Experience Requirements
Undergraduate Degree in a business-related discipline and at least one year of work experience in a business-related role.~or~Any equivalent combination of experience, education, and/or training approved by Human Resources.
Licenses/Certifications
None Required

Abbott is a global healthcare leader that helps people live more fully at all stages of life. Our portfolio of life-changing technologies spans the spectrum of healthcare, with leading businesses and products in diagnostics, medical devices, nutritionals, and branded generic medicines. Our 109,000 colleagues serve people in more than 160 countries.
About Abbott
Point-of-care diagnostics is a growing and dynamic industry helping to improve clinical and economic outcomes globally. Abbott brings a variety of expert viewpoints on new innovations, insights, and impacts that are shaping the future of diagnostics around the world.
Abbott Rapid Dx North America, LLC’s Orlando site is part of Global Business Services (GBS) within the Abbott Rapid Diagnostics (ARDx) Division. GBS has a global accountability to deliver an exceptional customer experience and create business value through compliance, standardization, and data analytics. The GBS group fosters a collaborative, team-focused and winning environment where employees are accountable and encouraged to develop themselves.
The Business Intelligence Analyst is a key member of the Business Services Support team. This role supports data analytics, operational reporting, efficiency projects, and problem resolution. This individual will address complex operational challenges and analyze and define strategic and operational improvements within our workgroups. This team member will also interface with the Customer Service, Operations, and Finance teams to recommend solutions and efficiencies, report out on status of existing projects, and develop templates to create efficiencies within existing reporting requirements.
WHAT YOU’LL DO
Collects/receives INR results from patient.
Gather and analyze large amounts of information quickly and problem solve effectively.
Develop, track, and report on key operational metrics in partnership with business leaders.
Actively monitor daily business results and anticipate developing trends and potential impacts to future results.
Interpret results autonomously using a variety of techniques ranging from simple data aggregation via statistical analysis to complex data mining.
Strategically analyze reports across all departments to identify gaps or opportunities that drive business improvement.
Work both independently and in groups in a variety of situations requiring analytical-interpretive, evaluative, and constructive thinking.
Understand data-management controls and business process intelligence.
Understand and translate business requirements into system requirements incorporating timing, contingencies, and limitations.
Exercise sound judgment and critical decision making within approved guidelines on business-process and system requirements.
Clearly document workflows and processes.
Identify areas for process improvement and standardization.
Assist in development of key sales and operating metrics with the goal of developing executive-level dashboards.
Promote, engage, and demonstrate intuitive and visual analytics tools to all partners.
Regularly ensure that reporting delivered to internal customers is accurate, useful, and actionable.
Support ad hoc analysis and special projects on an as-needed basis.
EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE YOU’LL BRING
Required
Bachelor’s Degree with quantitative focus, or related required
3+ years financial or operations analyst experience required
Advanced experience with SAP required
Business Analytics tool experience required (Power BI preferred)
Advanced experience in Excel and proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite (Outlook, Access, Word, PowerPoint) required
Preferred
Excellent attention to detail, well-organized, highly accountable, and self-motivated
Excellent analytical insight, prioritization, and problem-solving skills
Strong oral, written, and interpersonal skills
Experience presenting and analyzing large quantities of data with strong spreadsheet and database query experience (e.g. SQL, Python, Power BI)
Comfortable working in a fast-paced environment with limited guidance
Self-motivated, action-oriented individual with the perseverance to push high-value projects through to completion
Developed time-management and priority-setting skills required to work in an often ambiguous and constantly changing business environment
Demonstrated ability to succinctly present complex analysis to all levels within the organization
WHAT WE OFFER
At Abbott, you can have a good job that can grow into a great career. We offer:
Training and career development, with onboarding programs for new employees and tuition assistance
Financial security through competitive compensation, incentives and retirement plans
Health care and well-being programs including medical, dental, vision, wellness and occupational health programs
Paid time off
401(k) retirement savings with a generous company match
The stability of a company with a record of strong financial performance and history of being actively involved in local communities
Learn more about our benefits that add real value to your life to help you live fully: http://www.abbottbenefits.com/pages/candidate.aspx
Follow your career aspirations to Abbott for diverse opportunities with a company that provides the growth and strength to build your future. Abbott is an Equal Opportunity Employer, committed to employee diversity.
Connect with us at www.abbott.com, on Facebook at www.facebook.com/Abbott and on Twitter @AbbottNews and @AbbottGlobal.

Deloitte's Strategy team architect's programs that transform our clients' businesses. To do this, we have assembled a practice of leading business and technology strategy experts that each contribute unique capabilities and insights - including Corporate & Business Unit Strategy, Strategy Execution, Growth Transformation, Technology Strategy & Insights, Enterprise Model Design, Enterprise Cloud Strategy, and Business Transformation.


Strategy professionals serve as trusted advisors to our clients, working with them to make clear, data-driven choices about where to play and how to win in order to drive growth and unlock enterprise value.


Strategy helps our clients:

Identify strategies for growth and value creation
Develop the appropriate business models, operating models, and capabilities to support their strategic vision
Maximize the ROI on technology investments and leverage technology and Cloud trends to architect future business strategies.


Qualifications


Required:


1+ year of prior experience in a research or business analyst role
Undergraduate degree with a focus in economics, engineering, finance or accounting preferred
Outstanding academic achievement and demonstrated leadership
An interest in consulting and/or investment management
Strong quantitative and analytical skills
Ability to build Excel-based financial and operating models a plus
Excellent written and verbal communication
Strong interpersonal and influencing skills
A passion for learning, professional growth and knowledge sharing
A desire to be part of an entrepreneurial, fast-paced and fun team environment
Limited immigration sponsorship may be available
Travel up to 50% (While 50% travel is a requirement of the role, due to COVID-19, non-essential travel has been suspended until further notice.)


Preferred:
Ability to define trends across industries and articulate their impact to clients' business and strategic choices
Knowledge of or experience in broader G&A functions (i.e. HR, IT, Finance, Procurement, Commercial Operations
Exposure to customer journey maps - must be able to understand customer journeys, consumer behavior, including engagement with digital channel
Basic understanding of the core digital technologies that underpin world class customer experiences (e.g. CRM, E-Commerce, Content Management)
Experience creating road maps and detailed financial business cases for change
Experience and comfort in using analytical methods to create project analysis and recommendation support
Past experiences should include customer journey mapping, primary customer research, solution design, roadmap development, business case development
Advanced degree in business (e.g., MBA) from a top tier program

Company Name: Harvard Partners, LLP, Trusted Advisors to IT
Description:
Job Description:
The Business/Data Analyst will be responsible for supporting the improvement of management and operational reporting within the Onboarding and Payment Operations division.
You will be tasked with reviewing existing reporting routines and leverage Business Intelligence tools (i.e. Tableau, Alteryx, etc.) to streamline and automate the processes.
Qualification/Experience:

The successful candidate will have experience working with disparate systems/data sources and various BI tools.
In addition to having a history of challenging the status quo with the ability to succeed in ambiguous situations and seek out solutions and resolve problems with little managerial oversight.

About Harvard Partners, LLP, Trusted Advisors to IT:

Harvard Partners is a management consulting firm focused on helping companies more effectively leverage their IT investment. We engage with the C-Suite and Technology Team to help them better understand their IT infrastructure and process in order to align the technology strategy and organization to reach the firm’s strategic business goals.Some of our practices include:• Program/Project Management and "PMO as a Service"• IT Assessments• Business Continuity/Disaster Recovery• Optimized Infrastructure• Concierge Managed Services• Data Center Strategy, Transformation, and Migration• Cloud Management Programs• Security Assessments and Remediation• Staffing, technical & tacticalWorking with the client’s staff, vendors, and consultants, we deliver supportive and collaborative engagements where direct dialog, simplified reporting, productive meetings, and clear responsibility and accountability encourage active participation resulting in consensus-based business outcomes.

Abbott is a global healthcare leader that helps people live more fully at all stages of life. Our portfolio of life-changing technologies spans the spectrum of healthcare, with leading businesses and products in diagnostics, medical devices, nutritionals, and branded generic medicines. Our 109,000 colleagues serve people in more than 160 countries.
About Abbott
Point-of-care diagnostics is a growing and dynamic industry helping to improve clinical and economic outcomes globally. Abbott brings a variety of expert viewpoints on new innovations, insights, and impacts that are shaping the future of diagnostics around the world.
Abbott Rapid Dx North America, LLC’s Orlando site is part of Global Business Services (GBS) within the Abbott Rapid Diagnostics (ARDx) Division. GBS has a global accountability to deliver an exceptional customer experience and create business value through compliance, standardization, and data analytics. The GBS group fosters a collaborative, team-focused and winning environment where employees are accountable and encouraged to develop themselves.
The Business Intelligence Analyst is a key member of the Business Services Support team. This role supports data analytics, operational reporting, efficiency projects, and problem resolution. This individual will address complex operational challenges and analyze and define strategic and operational improvements within our workgroups. This team member will also interface with the Customer Service, Operations, and Finance teams to recommend solutions and efficiencies, report out on status of existing projects, and develop templates to create efficiencies within existing reporting requirements.
WHAT YOU’LL DO
Collects/receives INR results from patient.
Gather and analyze large amounts of information quickly and problem solve effectively.
Develop, track, and report on key operational metrics in partnership with business leaders.
Actively monitor daily business results and anticipate developing trends and potential impacts to future results.
Interpret results autonomously using a variety of techniques ranging from simple data aggregation via statistical analysis to complex data mining.
Strategically analyze reports across all departments to identify gaps or opportunities that drive business improvement.
Work both independently and in groups in a variety of situations requiring analytical-interpretive, evaluative, and constructive thinking.
Understand data-management controls and business process intelligence.
Understand and translate business requirements into system requirements incorporating timing, contingencies, and limitations.
Exercise sound judgment and critical decision making within approved guidelines on business-process and system requirements.
Clearly document workflows and processes.
Identify areas for process improvement and standardization.
Assist in development of key sales and operating metrics with the goal of developing executive-level dashboards.
Promote, engage, and demonstrate intuitive and visual analytics tools to all partners.
Regularly ensure that reporting delivered to internal customers is accurate, useful, and actionable.
Support ad hoc analysis and special projects on an as-needed basis.
EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE YOU’LL BRING
Required
Bachelor’s Degree with quantitative focus, or related required
3+ years financial or operations analyst experience required
Advanced experience with SAP required
Business Analytics tool experience required (Power BI preferred)
Advanced experience in Excel and proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite (Outlook, Access, Word, PowerPoint) required
Preferred
Excellent attention to detail, well-organized, highly accountable, and self-motivated
Excellent analytical insight, prioritization, and problem-solving skills
Strong oral, written, and interpersonal skills
Experience presenting and analyzing large quantities of data with strong spreadsheet and database query experience (e.g. SQL, Python, Power BI)
Comfortable working in a fast-paced environment with limited guidance
Self-motivated, action-oriented individual with the perseverance to push high-value projects through to completion
Developed time-management and priority-setting skills required to work in an often ambiguous and constantly changing business environment
Demonstrated ability to succinctly present complex analysis to all levels within the organization
WHAT WE OFFER
At Abbott, you can have a good job that can grow into a great career. We offer:
Training and career development, with onboarding programs for new employees and tuition assistance
Financial security through competitive compensation, incentives and retirement plans
Health care and well-being programs including medical, dental, vision, wellness and occupational health programs
Paid time off
401(k) retirement savings with a generous company match
The stability of a company with a record of strong financial performance and history of being actively involved in local communities
Learn more about our benefits that add real value to your life to help you live fully: http://www.abbottbenefits.com/pages/candidate.aspx
Follow your career aspirations to Abbott for diverse opportunities with a company that provides the growth and strength to build your future. Abbott is an Equal Opportunity Employer, committed to employee diversity.
Connect with us at www.abbott.com, on Facebook at www.facebook.com/Abbott and on Twitter @AbbottNews and @AbbottGlobal.

Fixed Income Business Analyst

The Opportunity: As a Fixed Income Business Analyst you will be responsible for supporting various initiatives across the Financial Services Firm Fixed Income division with an emphasis on understanding the project(s) requirements from the business perspective and to ensure those requirements are translated into the appropriate functional deliverables.

You will:
Convert business requirements to functional specifications comprising of data flows, workflows
Ability to visualize stuff based upon discussions and existing artifacts.
Fixed income and structured products (CMBS, RMBS, CLO) knowledge required.
Interact with business users to seek requirement clarification.
Participate in design sessions and contribute to ensure that the design fulfills the business requirements.
Work with developers to explain the business requirement and functional specifications.
Create a UAT test plan and write system and integration test cases.
Conduct functional testing.
Fixed Income security knowledge will be required.
SQL knowledge.
Experience with JIRA and Confluence.
Proactive and Problem-solving.
Soft skills:
Excellent problem-solving skills and initiative; able to find innovative and elegant solutions to complex problems.
Good communication skills with high standards in visual, written, and oral communication.
Ability to build strong relationships with both technical and non-technical team members.
Disciplined and independent personal management skills can work to deadlines and standards with minimum supervision when required.
Enthusiastic and energetic in the execution of their tasks.
Commercially aware; Focused on achieving the right results with good, maintainable solutions.
About Portfolio Bi:
Portfolio BI (PBI) empowers the most sophisticated buy-side rms to take control of their portfolio and operational data. Born from the merger with Hentsu, and backed by Credit Suisse Asset Management's NEXT Investors, our customers benefit from our integrated platforms, local technological expertise, and seasoned financial experts. We are an asset management technologist, and we provide a fully managed cloud platform for hedge funds, with on-demand trading, research, and corporate technology, as well as connectivity to market data providers, brokers, and exchanges. Our vision is to drive agile transformation across financial services through public cloud technologies, SaaS, and data science.

What we commit to:
We are committed to developing our team as we grow by offering a variety of opportunities to increase knowledge, build skills, and take charge of your career.

Description
The Cloud Renewal Strategy Manager (RSM) is responsible for maintaining a focus on renewals within their assigned segment pillar. They will provide subject matter expertise in working with Oracle ASMs to secure the renewal and contracted revenue growth of Oracle Cloud accounts. This is strategically important to the health and growth of Oracleâ€™s Cloud business. The Renewal Strategy Manager will have a defined segment (e.g. Up market, Majors/SMB, Public Sector) within the Oracle CX Sales and Service Product Pillar. The Renewal Strategy Manager is responsible for participating in weekly forecast cadence calls and knowing/communicating the renewal status of all accounts in the teamâ€™s territories.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities
Renewals Leadership: Responsible for overseeing the Renewals business associated with the assigned sales segment to include achievement of specific renewal goals assigned. Understand renewal rate and churn trends within the assigned segment. Partner with the segment GVP to develop a plan to improve future renewal rates and minimize churn based on these trends.
Mentorship: train and mentor Inside Sales Representatives (ISRs) in your assigned segment to ensure they follow best practices in their prosecution of renewals opportunities.
Strategic Renewals Plan: Develop a strategic Renewals plan to include the goals, objectives and tactics associated with the assigned sales segment. Drive programs that proactively position our customers for successful and timely renewals.
Collaboration: It is critical that the RSM collaborates with our center of Excellence (COE) organization and our Cloud Field Sales organization to ensure optimal engagement with clients in advance of, and during the renewal cycle.
Trusted business partner : Become a trusted renewal advisor to the sales GVP and team you support. Get to know the renewals business and understand the market you support. Provide thought leadership and find innovative ways to make improvements. Understand the renewals business trends, goals, issues, requirements.
General Awareness: Ensure your sales teams are focused on Renewals. Understand the renewals in your segment and drive a regular cadence (in partnership with the ASMs) to ensure all risk is understood.
Future focus: Proactively inspect future quarter renewals (5 quarters out) and advise your leadership as issues are uncovered. Identify key â€œat-riskâ€� renewal clients early in the cycle and define issues inhibiting a successful, timely renewal. Ensure usage trends are understood relevant to upcoming renewals.
Annual Plan: Identify all upcoming renewals for the year to be sure accurate quota assignments occur; address any potential churns with Finance to ensure accuracy.
Forecast accuracy/deal inspection: Review all renewals forecasted each week to identify any areas of concern and engage with ASMs to address get well plans if needed.
Sales Tools : Enable ASMs on the tools that are critical to drive renewals. Drive usage of OSC, Sales Manager Central, Touchstone, SI and the pipeline dashboards â€“ to ensure efficiency, consistency and adoption relative to renewals. Obtain feedback on automation opportunities and bring forward for implementation.
Essential Knowledge, Skills, Abilities, and Background
Experience with cloud-based/SaaS business process solution offerings
Product experience in Sales, Marketing and Service Automation
Finance background is beneficial â€“ understanding of accounting and financial principles such as Budgeting, ROI, Project Payback, Time Value of Money, TCO-based Selling
Understanding of the basic legal and financial concepts in SaaS contracts such as ramping, SLAs and Revenue Recognition
Ability to effectively negotiate in both challenging and collaborative sales engagements
Ability to excel in a high-energy, quarterly-results driven sales culture
Team player who will work within the company to continue improving organization processes
5-7 Years sales experience in technology-based company
Bachelorâ€™s degree in Finance or IT related discipline
Intermediate / advanced excel skills, experience in word, power point and CRM systems


Provides programs to improve operational efficiency, consistency, and compliance in support of the organization's financial and tactical business objectives. Provides business practices and processes. Develops, communicates, and trains the organization on business practices and processes.


Serve as a liaison with other divisions such as Finance, Contracts, HR, Legal, Shared Services, Accounts Receivable, Purchasing, and Risk Management in an effort to ensure accurate and timely transaction processing. Collect, input, verify, correct, and analyze data to measure key performance indicator actual versus business objectives. Provide updates to management regarding budget to actual, informing them of deviations and opportunities. Provide management with economic impact and compliance issues surrounding key business decisions and/or deals. Communicate Oracle Business Practices to the organization and monitor process and approvals for full compliance. Drive implementation of new processes and procedures.


Leading contributor individually and as a team member, providing direction and mentoring to others. Work is non-routine and very complex, involving the application of advanced technical/business skills in area of specialization. Ability to collect, organize, and display data in spreadsheet format. Follow-through skills necessary to get information from internal and third parties and have data errors/omissions corrected. For this, relationship management skills strongly desired. Strong written and verbal communication skills. 8 plus years relevant work experience.
