WHAT IS BOX?
Box is the market leader for Cloud Content Management. Our mission is to power how the world works together. Box is partnering with enterprise organizations to accelerate their digital transformation by creating a single platform for secure content management, collaboration and workflow. We have an amazing opportunity to further establish ourselves as leaders in the space, and we need strong advocates to help us achieve that goal.

By joining Box, you will have the unique opportunity to help capture a majority of this developing market and define what content management looks like for the digital enterprise. Today, Box powers over 97,000 businesses, including 70% of the Fortune 500 who trust Box to manage their content in the cloud.

WHY BOX NEEDS YOU
Are you excited by using analytics to drive growth? Do you possess exceptional business smarts, and are passionate about bringing together analytics, strategy, and operations? Do you want to work in an entrepreneurial but well-resourced environment? If so, we are looking for you to join our Business Analytics team to drive strategic decision making within our Marketing team. In this role, you will own the relationship with senior leaders across Marketing to drive analytical insight into business actions.


WHAT YOU'LL DO
You will use analytics to drive business decisions and strategy, with the goal of increasing revenue and improving Marketing spend ROI at Box.
You will be a strategic thought partner to our Marketing leaders in helping plan, execute, measure and improve the outcome of different marketing programs. This also includes driving the budget planning process for Marketing.
You will formulate new ideas to improve Marketing performance, leveraging your prior Marketing experience in combination with a deep understanding of how Box's Marketing team is performing.
You will test your ideas. This includes 1) performing analytical deep-dives to identify problems, opportunities and actions required; 2) leveraging large amounts of disparate data sources by using SQL/Tableau and/or other scripting and statistical tools, and 3) designing and managing test/pilot programs.
You will implement and track your ideas. This includes 1) working with Engineering and Operations to institute measurement tracking and 2) driving weekly reviews of Marketing performance with the entire Marketing team.

WHO YOU ARE
You're a "business thought partner" with a strong analytical mindset and enjoy finding ways to improve the business. It just so happens that you use data analytics as the tool to prove that your suggestions are the right ones.
Your analytics skills are strong, with 2+ years of experience in an analytics role and proficiency with either advanced Excel, SQL, or data visualization tools (e.g. Tableau, Looker, Domo).
You have Marketing experience in at least one of following areas: Digital Marketing, Demand Generation, Branding/Awareness, B2B Marketing, Pipeline creation, Lead/MQL management, etc
Your business judgment is strong. You've got the ability to take ambiguous business problems and solve them in a structured, hypothesis-driven, data-supported way. Strategy consulting experience or other client-facing professional services experience is a strong plus.
You have strong presentation skills and can communicate effectively with senior leaders.

BENEFITS

Visit this webpage to check out all of our exciting benefits: https://join.collectivehealth.com/box

EQUAL OPPORTUNITY
We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

For details on how we protect your information when you apply, please see our Personnel Privacy Notice.

Are you passionate about leveraging large volumes of data sets to draw deep insights designed to improve business strategies and customer experience with marketing programs to drive impact? If yes then IDEAs (Insights Data Engineering and Analytics) group is looking for qualified candidates to work with us with us to leverage the power of data, the skill of analysis, the science of learning to empower our stakeholders with insights on growth levers.
Our team plays a key role in providing data and analytics for Microsoft 365 and owns the end to end reporting and owns key data assets utilized for leadership review.
Responsibilities
Conduct data analyses deliver insights and learnings on marketing initiatives / programs (BI) for Commercial Managed segments.
Define, generate, and monitor KPI metrics for different Modern Workplace solutions and Land and Expand initiatives
Automate reporting and provide exploration capability for reporting users
Partner with multiple marketing and engineering teams to explore data, design learning plan, and conduct analyses
Present insights and learnings to key stakeholders / executives with data backed story telling
Provide thought leadership on modern workplace marketing based on the insights / learning from analyses
Qualifications
2+ years of experience in analyzing large volumes of data, extracting insights processing large data sets using SQL or SQL-like scripting language
2+ years of experience in processing and building visualizations using reporting tool as Power BI
Strong skills in statistics/machine learning languages and packages such as Python, R, Azure ML
Excellent written and oral communication skills, particularly the ability to synthesize complex issues/scenarios into easy-to-understand concepts
Attention to detail with self-discipline and a drive for results
Demonstrated ability to work in ambiguous situations and across organizational boundaries
Experience breaking down problems into hypothesis that can be analyzed and validated to drive data driven decisions with strong story telling
Bachelors or Master’s degree in statistics, data science, applied mathematics, computer science, econometrics or a related field, or equivalent alternative education, skills, and/or practical equivalent experience
Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form.
Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.

We're transforming the grocery industry

Instacart is the North American leader in online grocery and one of the fastest-growing companies in e-commerce. Since 2012, we've been working towards creating a world where everyone has access to the food they love and more time to enjoy it together.

Groceries delivered to your door in as little as an hour. It seems simple, right? Well, it's more complex than that. From re-routing deliveries during snowstorms, to connecting customers with coupons and deals for their favorite brands, to updating over half a billion grocery data lines every night...our efforts bring Instacart closer to being the operating system for the grocery industry.
OVERVIEW

In this role, you will support strategic decision making processes through your analytics, heavy data-driven approach, and operational mindset. You should possess superior analytical skills, excellent time-management and organizational habits, and the ability to clearly communicate and present information to key stakeholders. You'll work closely with leadership to help create manage dashboards and provide the ad hoc and KPI reporting that drives critical decision-making and propels organizational success.

ABOUT THE JOB

Own daily and weekly analysis on workflows, projects, and experiments to inform important strategic decisions improving the support experience
Create, maintain, and continue to optimize weekly, monthly and quarterly reporting
Develop scalable, automated dashboards to provide benchmarking and progress against key performance goals and initiatives; understand root causes of what impacts attainment of those objectives
Review data models and queries while performing weekly and ad hoc data analysis to ensure our operations engine running at full speed
Dig into the details behind how metrics are calculated, and ensure that the source data matches the needs of the business
Provide analytical insights into current state of the business that can be leveraged for growth opportunities and operational efficiency gains
Develop models on large datasets to extract trends, measure results and outcomes, and to predict future performance

ABOUT YOU

Advanced SQL Skills - able to write complex and performant queries to extract data from our Snowflake cluster
Proficient with Tableau or other analytical visualization tools
 2 - 4 years of experience in data analysis, data science, business intelligence, or similar roles
Data-driven individual with a strong business acumen and focus on analytical problem solving, data manipulation and management skills
Creative, intellectually curious, and able to effectively collaborate cross-functionally, partnering with stakeholders to drive business performance
Proven ability to work independently, multi-task, and thrive in a fast-paced environment
Excellent written and verbal communication, and the ability to turn data into a story for our business partners
Excited about analyzing big data
Bachelor's degree in math, economics, statistics, engineering, computer science, or other quantitative field, or equivalent level of experience

Preferred Qualifications:

Experience in programming, especially with data science and visualization libraries in Python or R
Advanced knowledge of experimentation and statistical methods
Experience in ETL and data pipeline development
Ability to mentor junior Analysts on the team
Advanced degree in statistics, math, economics, engineering, computer science, or other quantitative field

Company Info: We help companies test and improve machine learning models via our global AI Community of 1 million+ annotators and linguists. Our proprietary AI training platform handles all data types (text, images, audio, video and geo) across 500+ languages and dialects. Our AI Data Solutions vastly enhance AI systems across a range of applications from advanced smart products, to better search results, to expanded speech recognition, to more human-like bot interactions and so much more.Position Open: The position will allow you to work from home as an Independent Contractor on a flexible schedule of up to 20 hours per week completing tasks in a web-based evaluation tool. The tasks will involve determining the relevance and accuracy of information by performing online research and referring to guidelines provided to you. You will be rating tasks to validate data. You will be helping to authenticate data that will be used in live online search tools and applications by millions of users across the world.Ideal Candidate: Candidates for this position will need to have good research skills and a strong understanding of local and national information. Cultural, geographical, social media and current affairs knowledge are important in this role.Job Requirements: · You must speak and write in English at an idiomatic level.· You must be living in the United States· Working knowledge of local and national geographical areas· Passing an online evaluation to demonstrate capability of reading and applying the guidelines· Experience/know-how of using online maps, search engines and website research· You must have familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media and cultural affairs in United States· Access to and use of a broadband internet connection and associated computer and software to perform the work, all provided at your own expensePart-time hours: up to 20 per weekThis is a freelance independent contractor position.Job Types: Part-time, TemporaryPay: Up to $14.50 per hourBenefits:Flexible scheduleWork Location: One location

The Home Depot is able to offer virtual employment of this position in the following states: AL, AK, AZ, AR, DE, DC, FL, GA, HI, ID, IL, IN, IA, KS, KY, LA, ME, MD, MA, MI, MN, MS, MO, MT, NE, NH, NJ, NM, NY, NC, ND, OH, OK, OR, PA, RI, SC, SD, TN, TX, UT, VT, VA, WA, WV, WI, WY

POSITION PURPOSE
The Online Business Analyst provides web analytics on online data using various analytical tools to uncover trends and provide insight that will maximize HomeDepot.com online marketing efforts. Works with the Merchandising and Marketing departments to monitor online marketing programs, identify opportunities for optimizing campaigns and proactively alerting the team when programs deviate from expected results. Identifies underperforming areas of the site and opportunities to improve site performance. Works with various business teams to establish a cross-channel analytics process to optimize the navigational paths customers take to complete an order on HomeDepot.com. Analyzes and understands the key drivers of performance related to Homedepot.com's online objectives.

MAJOR TASKS, RESPONSIBILITIES AND KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES
30% Responsible for updating and maintaining reporting on key performance indicators for distribution to senior leadership team
20% Responsible for updating the channel plans for the various marketing channels and actively reporting back to the business partners successes and/or failures
20% Manage off-shore and/or onshore analyst efforts for various reports including clickmap and department dashboard reporting
20% Create new operational processes and improvements to ensure data collection and reporting accuracy, including documenting the new procedures
10% Perform ad hoc reporting based on the business needs and extract the proper data from relevant THD systems

NATURE AND SCOPE
Position reports to Manager, Reporting & Analytics

Responsible for helping others and providing on-the-job training or guidance
ENVIRONMENTAL JOB REQUIREMENTS

Environment:
Located in a comfortable indoor area. Any unpleasant condition

Travel:
Typically requires overnight travel less than 10% of the time.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
Must be eighteen years of age or older.
Must be legally permitted to work in the United States.

Education Required: The knowledge, skills and abilities typically acquired through the completion of a bachelor's degree program or equivalent degree in a field of study related to the job

Years of Relevant Work Experience: 2 years

Physical Requirements:
Most of the time is spent sitting in a comfortable position and there is frequent opportunity to move about. On rare occasions there may be a need to move or lift light articles.

Knowledge, Skills, Abilities and Competencies:
Strong quantitative and analytical skills
Effective presentation skills
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Ability to work effectively across functions and departments
Ability to deal with occasional off-hour calls effectively and professionally

Job Title: Product Operation Analyst, TikTok Business Account and Promo...
Location: Mountain View, CA 94041 (Old Mountain View area)
Description:
TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok has global offices including Mountain View, Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Mumbai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul, and Tokyo.

The Monetization Product team at TikTok focuses on building a global marketing platform that fuels growth for businesses of all sizes. This role connects to that vision by helping small businesses and creators grow through products such as Business Accounts and Promote. This role will be a part of the SMB Growth team, a function that supports product development from beginning to end, including driving product strategy, support product launches and manage direct growth channels to SMB audiences.

This role will ensure the smooth end-to-end operation of products that support millions of businesses on TikTok's platform. This role will support test, rollout & iterate products, as well as the communication throughout the product development cycle and growth efforts. Product Operations Analyst are passionate about delivering an excellent customer experience, achieving product objectives, and working with multiple partners.

Responsibilities

Monitor product performance and work cross-functionally to quickly identify problems and implement solutions.
Review user cases and on-platform behavior and synergize into product feedback and user education best practices
Coordinate, aggregate, and disseminate customer feedback throughout product life-cycle.
Support growth campaign launch, monitoring and troubleshooting.
Work with cross-functional partners including Product Management, Business, and Compliance to guarantee operational readiness. Ensure functional partners are aligned on key objectives and timelines.
BA/BS degree
1+ years in operation, consulting, program management or equivalent roles
Strong communication skills across diverse functions and teams

Preferred qualifications:

Analytical skillsets, with experience drawing insights from multiple data sources
Highly skilled at synthesizing business insights and problem solving

TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We believe individuals shouldn't be disadvantaged because of their background or identity, but instead should be considered based on their strengths and experience. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.

TikTok is committed to providing reasonable accommodations during our recruitment process. If you need assistance or an accommodation, please reach out to us at USRC@tiktok.com.

Job Title: Quantitative Business Analyst, Analytics and Decision Suppor...
Description:
This role may also be located in our Playa Vista, CA campus.
Note: By applying to this position you will have an opportunity to share your preferred working location from the following: San Bruno, CA, USA; Los Angeles, CA, USA; New York, NY, USA.
Minimum qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Computer Science, a quantitative field, or equivalent practical experience.
3 years of experience in working with datasets and conducting data analysis using SQL and Python.
Experience creating executive communications (e.g., memos, slide decks, etc.) and presenting to non-technical/analytics audiences.
Preferred qualifications:

Master’s degree in a quantitative discipline (e.g., Business Analytics, Statistics, Computer Science, Economics, Math, Physics, Engineering).
Experience designing data models or table schema.
Experience in application of machine learning such as supervised/unsupervised learning, forecasting, predictive modeling, etc.
Experience working in consulting, direct-to-consumer, or similar industries.
Experience working with multiple functions/domains and managing projects.
About the job
The YouTube Strategy, Business Operations (BizOps), and Analytics (SBA) team’s mission is to make YouTube commercially sustainable and more valuable, by identifying and steering the business towards opportunities, guiding the organization to make the best possible decisions, and enabling effective implementation and operations. With teams world wide, SBA teams work with YouTube leadership across the product, engineering, and business organizations to address challenges and opportunities across the company, help chart the long-term direction for YouTube, and provide analytics and decision support for planning.
As a Quantitative Business Analyst within Analytics and Decision Support, you'll be part of a community of technical data analysts who work on impactful projects analyzing the content and distribution partnerships, the creator and user ecosystem, and business generation. You will help guide business leadership on optimizing the effectiveness and efficiency of our partner, operations, and business-facing teams. You will work on strategic business challenges centered on the economics of YouTube’s content business. You will provide analytical support for the business teams, including performance measurement, causal impact, estimation, predictive modeling, and metric definition.
At YouTube, we believe that everyone deserves to have a voice, and that the world is a better place when we listen, share, and build community through our stories. We work together to give everyone the power to share their story, explore what they love, and connect with one another in the process. Working at the intersection of cutting-edge technology and boundless creativity, we move at the speed of culture with a shared goal to show people the world. We explore new ideas, solve real problems, and have fun — and we do it all together.
Responsibilities

Manage larger strategic and cross-functional initiatives both on an on-going basis and on an ad-hoc basis.
Conduct non-routine analyses, including data gathering from large and complex datasets, processing, analysis employing advanced statistical and machine learning methods, with ongoing deliverables to improve the quality of Insights teams.

Summary:
The Business Strategy and Analytics group functions as an enterprise-wide service and corporate development group focused on delivering insights and analyses that drive both current performance and long-term corporate health.

This role will play a vital role in working with Blackhawks leadership and functional groups to identify and develop plans to fuel both organic and acquisitive business growth. He/she will also partner with the functional departments to foster an operating culture that focuses on delivering results against long-range planning objectives for the company.

Areas of focus for this role include ticket pricing & allocation, demand modeling, portfolio optimization, business intelligence & dashboarding, and other quantitative analysis.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.
Primary Responsibilities:
Develop and deploy insights to optimize the P&L (ticketing, sponsorship, marketing, retail, F&B, etc.)
Model ticketing demand and supply to allocate inventory across distribution channels
Assist ticketing operations with inventory management and placement
Build and maintain KPI sets and dashboards to continuously review and report on performance
Build and maintain internal financial and artificial intelligence models (i.e., supervised and unsupervised, reinforcement, NLP, recommender, ROI, forecasting, retention, propensity, churn, lead scoring, etc.)
Formulate hypotheses, collect, organize, clean and analyze data, test, synthesize, develop and effectively deliver insights and recommendations through compelling narratives and presentations
Conduct benchmarking to continually assess and advance the Blackhawks’ competitive position
Manage relationships with third-party vendors to ensure maximization of partnerships
Analyze shifts in consumer behavior to inform new product development
Innovate our ticketing strategy based on consumer insights research and analysis
Collaborate across all verticals (Ticketing, Sponsorship, Marketing, Community Relations, BSA, etc.) to understand and execute against organizational objectives.

Qualifications & Requirements:
1-3 years of experience in quantitative, analytical and/or client-facing businesses
Degree in business analytics, computer science, statistics, economics, finance, or related field
Must have proficiency with analytics tools including SQL, R, Python, Tableau, Power BI, etc.
Experience with Ticketmaster a plus
Understanding of predictive and prescriptive modeling, artificial intelligence and optimization algorithms
Business intuition and expertise with the ability to describe analytical processes, including when and why specific approaches are favored
Excellent communication skills with ability to demonstrate clear, concise articulation of scenarios, options, risks, mitigations, and recommendations
Exceptional problem-solving skills with the power to develop creative and efficient solutions
Aptitude using data visualization and business intelligence tools to effectively communicate complex ideas
Experience in financial modeling, market research, consumer insights, segmentation and survey analytics
Capacity to lead and work collaboratively in a consultative role at all levels of an organization
Ability to manage priorities and coordinate tasks to solve day-to-day challenges in a dynamic environment
Values: Inclusive, team player, driven, humble, curious, innovative, positive, results-focused, accountable

Position Summary:
The Associate Business Analyst provides business analysis and project support for revenue assurance and collections activities to deliver efficient and effective service to the firm and external clients. This role will facilitate strategies to ensure effective and optimal use of resources and minimization of delinquencies while reducing revenue discrepancies.
Principal Responsibilities:
Performs daily root cause analysis of systematic process completion and articulates any identified issues that require assistance in resolving.
Monitors daily transaction completing, error task assignment/verification and report generation completion.
Assists with defining and executing test cases for code and product changes pending implementation.
Performs daily reporting and processing of ACH payment returns.
Completes daily reporting and processing of credit/debit card chargebacks and retrievals.
Researches transactional data to identify anomalies and facilitate process improvement efforts.
Develop and maintain an escheatment process for undelivered refunds to insurance customers.

Education, Experience, Skills and Abilities Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree preferred, but relevant years’ experience considered.
Experience with use case development and testing coordination.
Knowledge of process analysis and process efficiencies.
Proficiency in Microsoft Word and Excel
Important Notice:
This position description is intended to describe the level of work required of the person performing in the role and is not a contract. The essential responsibilities are outlined; other duties may be assigned as needs arise or as required to support the organization. All requirements may be modified to reasonably accommodate physically or mentally challenged colleagues.

POSITION PURPOSE
The Online Business Analyst provides web analytics on online data using various analytical tools to uncover trends and provide insight that will maximize HomeDepot.com online marketing efforts. Works with the Merchandising and Marketing departments to monitor online marketing programs, identify opportunities for optimizing campaigns and proactively alerting the team when programs deviate from expected results. Identifies underperforming areas of the site and opportunities to improve site performance. Works with various business teams to establish a cross-channel analytics process to optimize the navigational paths customers take to complete an order on HomeDepot.com. Analyzes and understands the key drivers of performance related to Homedepot.com's online objectives.

MAJOR TASKS, RESPONSIBILITIES AND KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES
30% Responsible for updating and maintaining reporting on key performance indicators for distribution to senior leadership team
20% Responsible for updating the channel plans for the various marketing channels and actively reporting back to the business partners successes and/or failures
20% Manage off-shore and/or onshore analyst efforts for various reports including clickmap and department dashboard reporting
20% Create new operational processes and improvements to ensure data collection and reporting accuracy, including documenting the new procedures
10% Perform ad hoc reporting based on the business needs and extract the proper data from relevant THD systems

NATURE AND SCOPE
Position reports to Manager, Reporting & Analytics

Responsible for helping others and providing on-the-job training or guidance
ENVIRONMENTAL JOB REQUIREMENTS

Environment:
Located in a comfortable indoor area. Any unpleasant condition

Travel:
Typically requires overnight travel less than 10% of the time.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
Must be eighteen years of age or older.
Must be legally permitted to work in the United States.

Education Required: The knowledge, skills and abilities typically acquired through the completion of a bachelor's degree program or equivalent degree in a field of study related to the job

Years of Relevant Work Experience: 2 years

Physical Requirements:
Most of the time is spent sitting in a comfortable position and there is frequent opportunity to move about. On rare occasions there may be a need to move or lift light articles.

Knowledge, Skills, Abilities and Competencies:
Strong quantitative and analytical skills
Effective presentation skills
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Ability to work effectively across functions and departments
Ability to deal with occasional off-hour calls effectively and professionally

Our Purpose
We work to connect and power an inclusive, digital economy that benefits everyone, everywhere by making transactions safe, simple, smart and accessible. Using secure data and networks, partnerships and passion, our innovations and solutions help individuals, financial institutions, governments and businesses realize their greatest potential. Our decency quotient, or DQ, drives our culture and everything we do inside and outside of our company. We cultivate a culture of inclusion for all employees that respects their individual strengths, views, and experiences. We believe that our differences enable us to be a better team – one that makes better decisions, drives innovation and delivers better business results.
Job Title
Business Analyst I
Who is Mastercard?


We are the global technology company behind the world’s fastest payments processing network. We are a vehicle for commerce, a connection to financial systems for the previously excluded, a technology innovation lab, and the home of Priceless®. We ensure every employee has opportunity to be a part of something bigger and to change lives. We believe as our company grows, so should you. We believe in connecting everyone to endless, priceless possibilities.




Mastercard Launch is a full-time graduate development program designed to build the skills we leverage most as an innovator in the payments space, connects employees in enriching ways, and immerses new talent into our Doing Well by Doing Good culture. This program is meant for those who dare to be greater and those who wish to make a real impact in the world. Eligible candidates are graduating from a bachelor's or master's degree program in Fall 2021 or Spring 2022.


Overview

The Technology Solutions Consulting is the team in Operations and Technology at Mastercard that offers innovative, cutting edge technical solutions to complex business challenges. We are looking for outstanding applicants interested in a challenging and rewarding Technology Consulting Program Launch position focused on Commercial Programs and leading the Technology Solutions Community of Practice.

The role will have a dual responsibility including:

1) Delivering technology consulting services to internal product and engineering stakeholders globally and regionally in support of Mastercard’s business strategies. Responsibilities include partnering with business teams to provide technology leadership, define business capabilities and work with the global technology delivery teams to produce lasting technical solutions.


2) Drive transformation, standardization, and best practices for the Technology Solutions Community of Practice; ensuring adherence to proven processes enabling repeatable and consistent delivery excellence. Responsibilities include design and implementation of the community collaboration forum, governance, metric definition, and ownership of communication.


Are you passionate about leveraging technology to drive business change?
Are you motivated to be a part of global company driving innovation in the payments industry?
Are you a best-in-class communicator with a passion for technology innovation and new product design?
Does being a key partner with teams who are innovating and developing leading edge technology solutions excite you?
Do you have the capability to think on your feet, be hugely creative, encourage and collaborate?

Role

Establish and develop strategic deep relationships with senior product and engineering stakeholders to provide technology consulting services for key enterprise initiatives.
Oversee the development and documentation of strategic business capabilities with the purpose of driving innovative, forward thinking technical solutions leveraging technology capabilities inside and outside of MasterCard to solve business and regulatory challenges.
Leverage a variety of technology frameworks and methods to develop and promote technology architecture that drive strategic alignment of IT with business.
Document and promote Technology Solutions Consulting defined best practices
Implement and lead training and development program
Govern adherence to best practices and track metrics


All About You

Currently enrolled in a bachelor's or master's degree program with a graduation date of Fall 2021 or Spring 2022.
Thrive in a fast- paced, entrepreneurial environment.
Ability to translate technical information into business concepts and back.
Ability to effectively collaborate in a geographically distributed environment.
Strong interest in payments technology
Leadership skills: Must be able to navigate complex relationship scenarios & able to influence others without direct reporting relationships.
Communication skills: Must have persuasive presence and ability to effectively communicate technology to business people and business to technology people.
Organized, with an ability to provide expert facilitation skills in environments where the team agenda is not clear and the obvious solutions are not always best suited from a strategic point of view.
High-energy, can-do attitude, very strong sense of ownership and desire to succeed with commensurate analytical, technical and strategic skills.
Ability to act effectively as a Mastercard brand ambassador.
Provide strategic thinking and leadership related to a wide range of business units and technology services.
Provide advanced business and technical knowledge for the technical solution development.
Strong understanding of software methodologies, principles, theories and concepts.
Knowledge of latest technology trends such as API and gRPC based development, cryptocurrency, block chain, artificial intelligence and machine learning as it relates to the global and regional Payments market.
Due to COVID-19, most of our employees are working from home. We’ve implemented a virtual hiring process and continue to interview candidates by phone or video and are onboarding new hires remotely. We value the safety of each member of our community because we know we’re all in this together.

Every person working for, or on behalf of, Mastercard is responsible for information security. All activities involving access to Mastercard assets, information, and networks comes with an inherent risk to the organization and therefore, it is expected that the successful candidate for this position must:

Work with the other departments and clients in a way which will promote the vision and mission of the Choctaw Nation.

Develop best practices for the creation, management, storage and distribution of geographic data.

Conduct internal analyses to identify, recommend, negotiate, structure, and obtain internal approvals for potential business opportunities.

Define, collect, and maintain key metrics and databases that measure business portfolio performance and business development opportunities.

Provide oversight and support in the delivery of business analysis activities across the portfolio of projects.

Prepare presentations, proposals, and business plans in connection with business development opportunities.

Perform other duties as may be assigned.

MINIMUM
Bachelor’s degree in geographic information systems, geography, computer science, management science, finance, accounting, business, economics or related quantitative field

Technical knowledge of ESRI suite of desktop software and supporting applications

Ability to create, use and manage relational database structures

Experience with custom desktop map production and web map publishing using ArcGIS Online and Portal for ArcGIS applications

Hands on proficiency with key software programs within Microsoft Office and the potential to use advanced decision support analytic tools

Strong analytical, written, verbal, and interpersonal communication skills

Ability to work efficiently and effectively on multiple projects simultaneously

Ensure confidentiality of all business development opportunities, documentation, and information

Five (5) years directly related experience

TARGET
Master’s Degree in geographic information systems, geography, computer science, management science, finance, accounting, business, economics, or related quantitative field

Experience with ArcGIS Server, SQL Server, Portal for ArcGIS, and ArcGIS Online

Working knowledge of overall business operations

Excellent commercial and financial acumen and attention to detail

Ensure confidentiality of all business development opportunities, documentation, and information

Hands on proficiency with key software programs within Microsoft Office and the potential to use advanced decision support analytic tools

Strong analytical, written, verbal, and interpersonal communication skills

Ability to work efficiently and effectively on multiple projects simultaneously

Seven (7) years of full-time, direct career experience in GIS, using ESRI products

Microsoft is on a mission to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. Our culture is centered on embracing a growth mindset, a theme of inspiring excellence, and encouraging teams and leaders to bring their best each day. In doing so, we create life-changing innovations that impact billions of lives around the world. You can help us achieve our mission.
We believe in what people make possible. We stand in awe of what people dare to achieve, and we aim to help them in all aspects of their lives. Everything we do is grounded in this belief. It’s why we come to work, why we innovate and why we create technology that empowers people to thrive, in ordinary and extraordinary ways, every single day.
Come join a team who is helping enable innovation related to the Employee Experience at Microsoft. We drive data-based decisions to tackle strategic challenges and opportunities for various organizations at Microsoft. We partner with HR Leaders and Business Leaders to help shape the workforce of the future.
Microsoft’s HR Business Insights (HRBI) team is looking for an HR Analyst with a vision for strategy, strong customer focus, brilliant consulting capabilities and exceptional analytical skills. Our team advises the HR Line through data-based insights and compelling storytelling to achieve business objectives and people priorities, enables deep insights for the HR Line supporting key people and organization decisions and initiatives (including ROBs), and partners to grow data capability and enable modern data solutions that enhance HR Line organizations’ work with data.
In this strategic role, you will partner with HRLT and Business Leaders, to understand the business and people priorities while discovering ways to measure and analyze their big bets related to D&I, Career Development, Employee Voice etc. The ideal candidate will be comfortable leading and consulting through ambiguity, presenting and consulting with Senior Leaders across the Company and is a creative problem solver that recognizes opportunities. You will have the ability to think strategically at a global level and be able to effectively problem solve, and project manage across all layers of the organization. All with the highest focus for customer obsession.
Responsibilities
In this role you will be challenged to:
Design an analytical approach, and deliver research and findings using data, visualizations, and effective storytelling techniques.
Translate findings into succinct, actionable business insights, often in coordination with partners to help you tell a holistic story.
Apply a breadth of tools and analytical techniques to answer a wide range of high-impact people-related business questions.
Solve sometimes ambiguous business problems by formulating and facilitating solutions that realize the needs and provide for the requirements arising in the organization.
Exhibit excellence in execution by effectively contracting and communicating with customers, partners, and co-workers to define and provide deliverables, timelines, and responsibilities, all the while balancing and prioritizing across multiple and sometimes shifting priorities.
Qualifications
Required Qualifications:
5+ years applied work experience using analytical methods to solve business problems, driving improved decision-making and outcomes preferred.
Preferred Qualifications
Exceptional customer focus and project management skills – able to interact and contract professionally with a diverse group of executives, managers, and subject matter experts.
Passionate about client relationships and optimizing impactful analysis-based deliveries with the opportunity to train and promote on thoughtful self-serve solutions.
Polished presentation skills: building meaningful slides, presenting them effectively to senior level clients and management, responding to questions on-the-fly based on in-role business context and acumen. Strong attention to detail and high commitment to accuracy and auditing.
Proficiency in Microsoft Technology including Excel and PowerBI.

RWC is looking for a Jr. Business Intelligence Analyst to join our Analytics team in the Americas. This is an exciting opportunity that requires a lot of interaction with internal and external business partners and building the right solutions that empower the business teams in taking better decisions. In a fast-paced environment, you will have an opportunity to work with lot of tools and technologies and will be challenged to think outside the box.
We are looking for a problem solver and an innovative thinker, to work alongside a lean and agile team of analysts and architects. Developing sound functional and systems knowledge, support the creation of increased business intelligence and analytics capabilities across the organization and across multiple data sources.
Position Responsibilities:
Partner with end users to understand business challenges, explore and analyze a variety of data sets to provide the right solutions.
Develop a fundamental understanding of cross-functional business processes (ERP and other) to support reporting initiatives.
Create reports, dashboards, and analysis that cater to the needs of different levels of users in various business functions.
Collaboration with the Sr. Business Intelligence Analyst, global Business Intelligence team and the Americas IT team, to help influence analytics strategy, developing requirements, and designing solutions.
Provide support to the executive team by building summaries, management reporting, and what-if analysis.
Ownership, enhancements, and maintenance of the existing reporting portfolio, schedules and documentation.
Educating & Training the user community on Business Objects and Analytics.
Collaborate with global, virtual teams, be able to work on a flexible schedule and juggle multiple priorities.
Essential Functions:
Multi-tasking: Ability to handle multiple tasks at any one time and prioritize effectively
Accuracy: Ability to ensure information, facts and figures are accurate and free from mistakes
Sense of Urgency: Ability to respond as needed within appropriate timeframe
Problem Solving: Analytical thinker with ability to solve problems and seek support/help when needed
Organization: Ability to organize effectively
Team-Player: Ability to work both within and across teams to ensure work is completed with appropriate input from others
Decision Making: Ability to make decisions on work issues that impact the successful completion of tasks
Focus: Ability to work calmly & effectively under pressure to tight deadlines
Customer Service: focused with demonstrable ‘soft skills’ and empathy with user’s issues
Delivery: Delivery focused with a commitment to get the job done
Extra Mile: Going above and beyond to exceed customer expectations
Communication Skills: Strong written & verbal communication skills
Education, Knowledge, Skills and Expertise:
Education: Bachelor’s degree or equivalent work experience
Intermediate knowledge of SQL is desired
Working knowledge of Business Objects Suite (Webi, IDT, CMC)
Experience in Tableau, building advanced analytics and managing Tableau Online preferred
Working experience or knowledge of SAP ERP
Prior working experience with SAP HANA, and modeling is desired
Basic Knowledge on BI, reporting, data warehousing, cloud infrastructure and analytics concepts
Ability to lead cross functional meetings and assist in developing content
Working closely with users to collect and document business requirements
Documenting requirements as user stories that communicate the expectations of the business to the project team, developers, and/or vendors
Ability to quickly understand new business data and processes to detect areas of improvement
Working Conditions & Physical Demands:
This position will be an in-office environment with occasional project-based travel required.
Travel requirement - 20% domestic, international trips possible
Physical demands - Job requires both sitting and standing. Excellent vision, hearing, speech, and motor skills are required to perform essential functions of the job.

PEOPLE BUSINESS ANALYST (North America)
Thirdera is searching for the right team player to assist in all aspects of People Operations for our North America region working alongside our People Senior Manager. This is an exciting opportunity for anyone looking to work on a generalist role with multiple opportunities to grow, develop and expand their careers. You will have your hands in every aspect of the employee life cycle, including onboarding, coaching, performance management and development, payroll, benefits, employee engagement, offboarding, system support and driving people related analytics.
Key responsibilities:
Serve as a subject matter expert and consult with line management and provide daily HR guidance
Execute onboarding and offboarding sessions and programs following the frameworks and guidance provided by the centre of excellence (CoEx)
Analyze trends and metrics with the People department
Assist and partner with people manager in resolving employee relations issues and address grievances
Partner with culture and talent development centres of excellence in deploying their processes and programs throughout the region.
Build strong business relationships with employees and managers in the region. Work closely with management and employees to improve work relationships, build morale and increase productivity and retention
Provide positive customer service by responding to employee and manager on People- related questions. Provide reference to People policies and procedures and deliver internal webinar / trainings as needed.
Coach managers to document performance and behavior. Actively manage performance and behavior issues to resolution.
Assist on payroll and on benefits programs’ design for USA and Canada
Assist Sr Manager with visa-related requirements
Recommend and perform quality control procedures as defined to ensure accurate and compliant records, including records related to promotions, job transfers and new hires.
Deliver culture activities and support our learning activities in USA and Canada.
Requeriments:
3 to 5 years of Human Resources Business Analyst or equivalent HR functional experience
Strong verbal and written communication skills.
Global mindset and experience working in global companies
Strong coaching and influencing skills.
Ability to manage and work in a fast-paced environment that is constantly changing.
Experience in leading change management initiatives.
Ability to effectively navigate through ambiguous situations.
Demonstrated ability to manage multiple priorities, assess People implications and manage details.
Experience in multiple HR disciplines including compensation practices, employee relations, talent management, diversity, performance management, and federal and state laws.
Someone ready to promote and encourage innovative thoughts and ideas!
Maintain a high level of confidentiality, professionalism, integrity, respect and teamwork in all matters.
Experience working in an IT Services environment a plus.
Excellent interpersonal, presentation, and facilitation skills.

Position Summary:
The Associate Business Analyst provides business analysis and project support for revenue assurance and collections activities to deliver efficient and effective service to the firm and external clients. This role will facilitate strategies to ensure effective and optimal use of resources and minimization of delinquencies while reducing revenue discrepancies.
Principal Responsibilities:
Performs daily root cause analysis of systematic process completion and articulates any identified issues that require assistance in resolving.
Monitors daily transaction completing, error task assignment/verification and report generation completion.
Assists with defining and executing test cases for code and product changes pending implementation.
Performs daily reporting and processing of ACH payment returns.
Completes daily reporting and processing of credit/debit card chargebacks and retrievals.
Researches transactional data to identify anomalies and facilitate process improvement efforts.
Develop and maintain an escheatment process for undelivered refunds to insurance customers.

Bachelor’s degree preferred, but relevant years’ experience considered.
Experience with use case development and testing coordination.
Knowledge of process analysis and process efficiencies.
Proficiency in Microsoft Word and Excel

Job Title: Product Operation Analyst, TikTok Business Account and Promo...
Location: Mountain View, CA 94041 (Old Mountain View area)
Description:
TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok has global offices including Mountain View, Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Mumbai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul, and Tokyo.

The Monetization Product team at TikTok focuses on building a global marketing platform that fuels growth for businesses of all sizes. This role connects to that vision by helping small businesses and creators grow through products such as Business Accounts and Promote. This role will be a part of the SMB Growth team, a function that supports product development from beginning to end, including driving product strategy, support product launches and manage direct growth channels to SMB audiences.

This role will ensure the smooth end-to-end operation of products that support millions of businesses on TikTok's platform. This role will support test, rollout & iterate products, as well as the communication throughout the product development cycle and growth efforts. Product Operations Analyst are passionate about delivering an excellent customer experience, achieving product objectives, and working with multiple partners.

Responsibilities

Monitor product performance and work cross-functionally to quickly identify problems and implement solutions.
Review user cases and on-platform behavior and synergize into product feedback and user education best practices
Coordinate, aggregate, and disseminate customer feedback throughout product life-cycle.
Support growth campaign launch, monitoring and troubleshooting.
Work with cross-functional partners including Product Management, Business, and Compliance to guarantee operational readiness. Ensure functional partners are aligned on key objectives and timelines.
BA/BS degree
1+ years in operation, consulting, program management or equivalent roles
Strong communication skills across diverse functions and teams

Preferred qualifications:

Analytical skillsets, with experience drawing insights from multiple data sources
Highly skilled at synthesizing business insights and problem solving

TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We believe individuals shouldn't be disadvantaged because of their background or identity, but instead should be considered based on their strengths and experience. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.

TikTok is committed to providing reasonable accommodations during our recruitment process. If you need assistance or an accommodation, please reach out to us at USRC@tiktok.com.

Job Description
Everyone at Kite is grounded by one common goal – curing cancer. Every single day, we seek to establish a direct line between that purpose and our day-to-day work. Would you like to join us in this mission?
We are seeking a highly motivated, detail-oriented contributor to join us as a Supply Chain Business Analyst for our custom Salesforce products. In this role, the Analyst will provide oversight into day to day production support while also guiding new enhancements from inception to implementation. Internally known as a Manager of Supply Chain, the Incumbent will report up to the Associate Director of Supply Chain, partnering closely with IT, Quality, Site Planning, and Validation teams. Working with their business customers in identifying system and data issues while partnering with IT to ensure these issues are resolved within agreed upon SLAs, the Analyst will also partner with their business customers in identifying new enhancements to their Salesforce systems, guiding these requests through a product development lifecycle. This includes request prioritization, gathering of detailed requirements and subsequent updating of existing specifications, authoring of test scripts and training materials, conducting user acceptance testing, updating of support documents, and overall adherence to Kite’s validation framework.
While our preference is for this position to be based out of our Frederick, Maryland facility, this opportunity can be a remotely-based position in the contiguous United States, with preference going to candidates who are centrally located or based on the East Coast.
The Supply Chain Business Analyst should expect 10-20% travel (both domestic and international) as determined by the business' needs.
Responsibilities of the Supply Chain Business Analyst include:
Known Subject Matter Expert for Site Planning and Quality systems built on the Salesforce platform
Proactively identify and report production issues (both system and data) related to Salesforce systems
Create Salesforce reports in order to identify data issues and verify successful data corrections
Train users on the use of Kite Salesforce systems and creation of Salesforce reports
Drill down into root cause of production issues along with proposed solutions (technical and process)
Present findings, options, and recommendations for proposed solutions to business users
Lead process re-engineering workshops with business and IT stakeholders
Document process steps and system enhancements required to support process
Oversee approval for user access requests to Salesforce products
Support development of business cases for new system capabilities
Work alongside business groups to capture requirements and their priorities
Support creation and management of change requests
Perform impact assessment on new or changing product capabilities, including impact to integrated (boundary) systems
Author system related documents including requirement specifications, process flow diagrams, test scripts, work instructions, SOPs, and various assessments per Kite Validation procedures
Support future Salesforce custom application implementations and migrations
Coordinate the testing of changes and enhancements with the business to ensure successful delivery
Basic Qualifications:
MA / MS degree with 5+ years of Supply Chain and/or Business Information Systems and/or cGMP manufacturing domain experience
OR
BS / BA degree with 7+ years of the aforementioned experience
OR
High School degree with 11+ years of the aforementioned experience
Preferred Qualifications:
6+ years of experience in an operations role in the life sciences and/or medical devices industry
Strong understanding of E2E logistics, Manufacturing, Quality, and related system processes (PTD)
Knowledge of the Salesforce Lightning Platform solution
Experience building reports in Salesforce Lightning

Microsoft is on a mission to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. Our culture is centered on embracing a growth mindset, a theme of inspiring excellence, and encouraging teams and leaders to bring their best each day. In doing so, we create life-changing innovations that impact billions of lives around the world. You can help us achieve our mission.
We believe in what people make possible. We stand in awe of what people dare to achieve, and we aim to help them in all aspects of their lives. Everything we do is grounded in this belief. It’s why we come to work, why we innovate and why we create technology that empowers people to thrive, in ordinary and extraordinary ways, every single day.
Come join a team who is helping enable innovation related to the Employee Experience at Microsoft. We drive data-based decisions to tackle strategic challenges and opportunities for various organizations at Microsoft. We partner with HR Leaders and Business Leaders to help shape the workforce of the future.
Microsoft’s HR Business Insights (HRBI) team is looking for an HR Analyst with a vision for strategy, strong customer focus, brilliant consulting capabilities and exceptional analytical skills. Our team advises the HR Line through data-based insights and compelling storytelling to achieve business objectives and people priorities, enables deep insights for the HR Line supporting key people and organization decisions and initiatives (including ROBs), and partners to grow data capability and enable modern data solutions that enhance HR Line organizations’ work with data.
In this strategic role, you will partner with HRLT and Business Leaders, to understand the business and people priorities while discovering ways to measure and analyze their big bets related to D&I, Career Development, Employee Voice etc. The ideal candidate will be comfortable leading and consulting through ambiguity, presenting and consulting with Senior Leaders across the Company and is a creative problem solver that recognizes opportunities. You will have the ability to think strategically at a global level and be able to effectively problem solve, and project manage across all layers of the organization. All with the highest focus for customer obsession.
Responsibilities
In this role you will be challenged to:
Design an analytical approach, and deliver research and findings using data, visualizations, and effective storytelling techniques.
Translate findings into succinct, actionable business insights, often in coordination with partners to help you tell a holistic story.
Apply a breadth of tools and analytical techniques to answer a wide range of high-impact people-related business questions.
Solve sometimes ambiguous business problems by formulating and facilitating solutions that realize the needs and provide for the requirements arising in the organization.
Exhibit excellence in execution by effectively contracting and communicating with customers, partners, and co-workers to define and provide deliverables, timelines, and responsibilities, all the while balancing and prioritizing across multiple and sometimes shifting priorities.
Qualifications
Required Qualifications:
5+ years applied work experience using analytical methods to solve business problems, driving improved decision-making and outcomes preferred.
Preferred Qualifications
Exceptional customer focus and project management skills – able to interact and contract professionally with a diverse group of executives, managers, and subject matter experts.
Passionate about client relationships and optimizing impactful analysis-based deliveries with the opportunity to train and promote on thoughtful self-serve solutions.
Polished presentation skills: building meaningful slides, presenting them effectively to senior level clients and management, responding to questions on-the-fly based on in-role business context and acumen. Strong attention to detail and high commitment to accuracy and auditing.
Proficiency in Microsoft Technology including Excel and PowerBI.

Title: Business Analyst Finance
Duration: 6 Months
Location: Kennesaw, GA


Short Description:
Responsible for conducting financial data analysis, design, collection, and report solutions to satisfy and support finance stakeholders.

Complete Description:
Local Candidates

Serves as the liaison between functional and technical teams by understanding and conceptualizing applications from each area's point of view. Responsible for conducting financial data analysis, design, collection, and report solutions to satisfy and support finance stakeholders. Monitors the quality of various technical and functional business processes, identifies data issues, and provides resolutions. Responsibilities will include collecting requirements, developing reports and dashboards, testing, assisting with the implementation of new software applications, process improvements, and training to support the objectives of the Institution.

MINIMUM EDUCATION REQUIRED:
Bachelor's Degree from an accredited institution of higher education in Business, Finance, Accounting, Information Systems or related field or equivalent combination of education and/or experience

MINIMUM EXPERIENCE REQUIRED:
Four (4) years previous experience in Business, Finance, Accounting, Information Technology or Systems Analysis

ADDITIONAL QUALIFICATIONS: (Preferred qualifications)
Experience with reporting/query tools and coding in Tableau, SAS, SAS Enterprise Guide, Oracle Databases, and/or SQL (or gathering data from other relation database systems)
Extensive experience in data analysis, dashboards, analytics and decision support systems
Experience successfully working as part of a team with a collaborative approach to problem solving
Working knowledge of fund accounting, budget and finance
Strong IT and Financial skills

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:
1. Interfaces with clients to define business processes, specifications, reporting needs, and functional requirements
2. Designs report and dashboard mock-ups to effectively meet business needs
3. Documents system processes, functionality and implements improvements as applicable
4. Develops and maintains user manuals, training documents and guidelines
5. Conducts meetings with end users to clarify issues, gather requirements, and resolve requests
6. Devises test plans to ensure that the outcome meets the specified requirements and expectations of business users
7. Develops and implements reports and dashboards to provide up-to-date information on functional actives
8. Maintains issues log and collaborates with team to mitigate risks and proactively searches for improvement opportunities
9. Prioritizes problem resolution based on business need, timelines, and scale of impact
10. Presents data resolution findings to relevant stakeholders with recommendations to ensure business needs are meet
11. Designs, builds, implements, and maintains Oracle SQL scripts and procedures in Oracle backend finance data warehouse SQL development software
12. Consults finance users on current and future data visualization and reporting solutions to identify customer needs
13. Provides backup support for operational and technical processes, and system changes
14. Administrator of PeopleSoft eProcurement responsibilities
15. Hosts training sessions on the system applications
16. Maintains content on the department and division webpage
17. Maintains financial data integrity

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, ABILITIES*:
Understanding of database concepts such as schemas and data relationshipsKnowledge of relational databasesFamiliar with API concepts such as web servicesAble to work autonomously and with managers to ensure business requirements and needs are metAble to communicate in financial and technical termsAble to communicate complex technical concepts to the end-usersAble to handle multiple tasks or projects at one time meeting assigned deadlinesAble to understand programming concepts such as structured and object-oriented programmingExcellent interpersonal, initiative, teamwork, problem solving, independent judgment, organization, communication (verbal and written), time management, project management and presentation skillsPolished and professional demeanorSelf-motivated with the ability to learn new concepts quicklyProficient with computer applications and programs associated with the position (i.e., Microsoft Office suite)Strong attention to detail and follow up skillsStrong customer service skills and phone and e-mail etiquette

OTHER INFORMATION
This is not a supervisory position.
This position does not have any financial responsibilities.
No, this position will not be required to drive.
This role is considered a position of trust.
This position will not travel.

What you’ll achieve

Act as the subject matter expert on the data, offering feedback and guidance that supports programs and initiatives across Dell towards improving the customer experience
Present findings and trending insights to leadership, along with recommended actions and next steps derived from analysis
Participate in and/or lead meetings and workshops to drive business corrective action planning
Take the first step towards your dream career
Every Dell Technologies team member brings something unique to the table. Here’s what we are looking for with this role:

Strong analytical skills to work with data and ability to coalesce data into meaningful quantitative insights

TikTok is the world's premier destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. The US Trust and Safety Policy Team works to proactively identify safety risks on platform and codify policies to ensure our users are safe while using our platform and also have the freedom to express themselves authentically.
As a member of the Escalations Team, you will be integral to ensuring that TikTok is a safe and trustworthy place for our community. You will be shaping the landscape of Trust and Safety and we expect you to find solutions and create opportunities with a minimum of hand-holding. You will build data visuals and provide key data insights to cross-functional partners in moments of crises and work on some of the highest priority safety issues at TikTok.
Responsibilities

Transform data sets and quantitative and qualitative analysis into compelling visuals
Write data queries for data targeting, collection, analysis, and/or visual creation in a fast-paced and dynamic environment
Support Trust and Safety, Communications, Public Policy, and other cross-functional teams in providing data insights for briefs, letters, and reports
Provide guidance in data investigation and analysis to internal and external partners to support real-time crises
Independently and collaboratively drive strategic and ad hoc projects from start to finish
Support the analysis of data systems and trends to develop improvements to the overall escalation processes
1-2+ years professional experience in data or quantitative analysis, data visualization, or other relevant topic
Advanced proficiency in SQL and Excel.
Experience working independently with impeccable judgment.
Strategic, data-driven thinker with analytical and creative problem-solving skills.
Experience translating data insights and analysis to technical and non-technical audiences
Accuracy and acute attention to detail; ability to accurately implement last-minute changes
Demonstrated experience managing pressure and meeting deadlines in a fast-paced environment.

Preferred Qualifications

Experience in Trust & Safety or content moderation; familiarity with content moderation metrics
Multiple programming/scripting languages (e.g., Python, C++, Perl, Java, etc.).

Role Title: IT Business Intelligence Functional Analyst



Overall Responsibilities:


The person in this role works closely with business users and IT colleagues to identify & document

business and customer requirements. They support the design, build/enhancement and delivery of

Business Intelligence (BI) & Data Analytics solutions using applications such as Power BI, IBM Controller,

Microsoft Dynamics D365 and integration with other business applications. This particular role works with

our Global Finance customers, across multiple time zones, and assumes responsbility for administration

and support of IBM Planning Analytics used for budget and forecasting solutions.

Specific accountabilities:

IBM PAX / TM1
 Administer, support and maintain IBM Planning Analytics for the Company. Communicating

system outages / issues, plan upgrades and manage third party developers.

Cognos Controller.

ensure PAX is updated with new hierarchies.
Business Analysis
 
Work closely with our Finance business division users to understand and analyze business
requirements, evaluate options, research and propose suitable solutions related to Management

Reporting and Data analysis.

developers to create technical design documents and requirements traceability matrices;

be stored in the Enterprise Data Warehouse.

Testing.

Qualifications and experience:
 Proven track record of accomplishment in a similar Finance-based role for 5+ years.

Demonstratable hands-on experience with IBM Planning Analytics (PAX / TM1) to administer
data cubes and hierarchies and troubleshoot issues on behalf of Finance teams, integration of

data with external applications and Data Stores
 Experience of conducting requirements elicitation, gap analysis and stakeholder management.
 
Understanding of common Business Analysis tools and techniques, especially related to data
gathering and mapping.

Good working knowledge of the BI Development Life Cycle. Understanding of data models and

 
Experience with Data Analytics tools such as Power BI, Tableau or QIik to present and explain
findings

Experience of creating robust project plans for smaller projects and taking responsibility for

 Experience of working in a global organization with geographically dispersed team members and

 
Strong analytical skills, attention to detail

Highly organized with strong interpersonal skills

Deloitte's Strategy team architect's programs that transform our clients' businesses. To do this, we have assembled a practice of leading business and technology strategy experts that each contribute unique capabilities and insights - including Corporate & Business Unit Strategy, Strategy Execution, Growth Transformation, Technology Strategy & Insights, Enterprise Model Design, Enterprise Cloud Strategy, and Business Transformation.


Strategy professionals serve as trusted advisors to our clients, working with them to make clear, data-driven choices about where to play and how to win in order to drive growth and unlock enterprise value.


Strategy helps our clients:

Identify strategies for growth and value creation
Develop the appropriate business models, operating models, and capabilities to support their strategic vision
Maximize the ROI on technology investments and leverage technology and Cloud trends to architect future business strategies.


Qualifications


Required:


1+ year of prior experience in a research or business analyst role
Undergraduate degree with a focus in economics, engineering, finance or accounting preferred
Outstanding academic achievement and demonstrated leadership
An interest in consulting and/or investment management
Strong quantitative and analytical skills
Ability to build Excel-based financial and operating models a plus
Excellent written and verbal communication
Strong interpersonal and influencing skills
A passion for learning, professional growth and knowledge sharing
A desire to be part of an entrepreneurial, fast-paced and fun team environment
Limited immigration sponsorship may be available
Travel up to 50% (While 50% travel is a requirement of the role, due to COVID-19, non-essential travel has been suspended until further notice.)


Preferred:
Ability to define trends across industries and articulate their impact to clients' business and strategic choices
Knowledge of or experience in broader G&A functions (i.e. HR, IT, Finance, Procurement, Commercial Operations
Exposure to customer journey maps - must be able to understand customer journeys, consumer behavior, including engagement with digital channel
Basic understanding of the core digital technologies that underpin world class customer experiences (e.g. CRM, E-Commerce, Content Management)
Experience creating road maps and detailed financial business cases for change
Experience and comfort in using analytical methods to create project analysis and recommendation support
Past experiences should include customer journey mapping, primary customer research, solution design, roadmap development, business case development
Advanced degree in business (e.g., MBA) from a top tier program

Job Description & Qualifications
At Ford Motor Company, we believe freedom of movement drives human progress. We also believe in providing you with the freedom to define and realize your dreams. With our incredible plans for the future of mobility, we have a wide variety of opportunities for you to accelerate your career potential as you help us define tomorrow’s transportation.

Creating the future of smart mobility requires the highly intelligent use of data, metrics and analytics. That’s where you can make an impact as part of our Global Data Insight & Analytics team. We are the trusted advisers that enable Ford to clearly see business conditions, customer needs and the competitive landscape. With our support, key decision makers can act in meaningful, positive ways. Join us and use your data expertise and analytical skills to drive evidence-based, timely decision making.
What you’ll be able to do:
We are seeking expert Business Intelligence professionals to add to our team to drive the metrics and analytics capability in Business Intelligence. Business Intelligence Analysts work in a Product Management Delivery model working end-to-end with business managers, product owners, product designers, data engineers, software developers to deliver next-gen analytics innovation.

Requires outstanding organization skills combined with critical thinking, problem-solving and agile management tools to support team success.
Facilitates meetings with business subject matter experts, decision makers, systems owners, and end users to define goals and requirements for reports, dashboards, and analytics; mentor business users on reporting design
Analyzes business requirements and translates them into high level design based on BI best practices.
Design, develop, deliver reporting instruments, dashboards and ad-hoc solutions using BI tools (semantic layer, analytics, dashboards, report definitions)
Become a Subject Matter Expert in the commercial vehicle business by being able to understand the business operations, metrics definitions to deliver insights that will drive the business forward
Ensures quality data creation, presentation, and data flow across systems
Develop and implement BI report objects supporting end-user business requirements
You will work on a business team of talented BI/Data professionals driven to provide scalable, automated solutions around the globe.
Collaborates within the technical stakeholder teams such as Data Architects, Data Modelers, ETL Developers, Enterprise Architects, BI Developers, Project Managers, Platform Architects, Data Science Managers for implementation of the large-scale data analytics/BI solution.
Clearly articulates rationale for design decisions to various user groups from business to technical

The minimum requirements we seek:
Bachelor’s degree
5+ years of experience in Microsoft Office products
3+ years in Data Visualization or Business Intelligence tools (e.g. Tableau, Qlik, Looker, Cognos or Power BI)
3 + years of experience in Data Engineering (e.g. ETL, SQL, Python or Alteryx)

Our preferred requirements:
Strong SQL skills and various BI/Reporting tools to build self-serve reports, analytic dashboards and ad-hoc packages leveraging our enterprise data warehouse.
Strong experience consuming data models, developing SQL, addressing data quality issues, proposing BI solution architecture, articulating best practices in end-user visualizations, coupled with hardworking
Development delivery experience.
Candidates for this position are expert business intelligence and analytics developers
Solid understanding of BI tools, architectures and visualization solutions.

What you’ll receive in return:
As part of the Ford family, you’ll enjoy excellent compensation and a comprehensive benefits package that includes generous PTO, retirement, savings and stock investment plans, incentive compensation and much more. You’ll also experience exciting opportunities for professional and personal growth and recognition.

If you have what it takes to help us redefine the future of mobility, we’d love to have you join us.
