What You'll Be Doing

Wake County Health and Human Services is currently seeking a Senior Business Analyst to join our team. The purpose of this position is to develop and implement measurement-based approaches that enables various levels of management to gain insights and make data-based quality business decisions. The Senior Business Analyst will focus on gathering and analyzing data to answer complex questions and assist with data collection, analysis, and visualizations for multiple disciplines and data storage systems. This position focuses on identifying and implementing steps that foster continual, incremental improvement.

The primary duties of the Senior Business Analyst include:
Creating business intelligence tools or systems, including design of related databases, spreadsheets, or outputs
Documenting specifications for business intelligence or information technology reports, dashboards, or other outputs
Maintaining or updating business intelligence tools, databases, dashboards, systems, or methods
Providing technical direction and consultation to business unit management and staff to introduce improved efficiencies and effectiveness in order to achieve the business strategies and goals of department
Documenting project scope, compiling business requirements, and creating detailed business requirements for the proposed solution
Providing project management and program leadership data analysis in order to facilitate business decisions
Generating standard or custom reports summarizing business, financial, or economic data for review by executives, managers, clients, and other stakeholders

NOTE: Wake County Health and Human Services employees are required to be in their current role for a minimum of one (1) year to be eligible to apply for another Human Services position. Upon acceptance of employment you acknowledge that (i) you will rescind your application for any other positions within Wake County Health and Human Services, (ii) after accepting your position with Wake County Health and Human Services you must remain in your role for one (1) year before you are eligible to apply for another position within Wake County Health and Human Services, (iii) if you work in the Health Clinics and Public Health Division, influenza immunization is a condition of initial and continued employment, subject to compliance with federal law, (iv) actively supports and participates in department emergency preparedness and response activities, which may include temporary changes in responsibilities and working hours.

About Our Team

Wake County Health and Human Services (WCHHS) is the consolidation of programs and services that include social services, public health, job search assistance, child support, and transportation. Our mission, in partnership with the community, is to facilitate full access to high quality and effective health and human services for Wake County residents. In addition to our numerous standard programs, Wake County Health and Human Services (WCHHS) is engaged in a number of special initiatives that are impacting services and programs throughout our entire agency. Whether legislated down from the changing regulations on the Federal or State level or bubbling up from the entrepreneurial spirit of our staff, you can always look forward to Wake County Health and Human Services implementing new and exciting enhancements to our services and programs.

The Basics (Required Education and Experience)
Bachelor’s degree Business or Public Administration or related field
Two (2) years of experience in fiscal, policy, and/or management analysis
Equivalent education or experience is accepted
Beyond the Basics (Preferred Education and Experience)

Master’s Degree in Data Science, Business Analytics or related discipline preferred but not required
Four (4) years of experience supporting and understanding business requirements, and anticipating future requirements to produce data models and solutions that support business needs promoting data quality AND EITHER
Three (3) years of experience in Business Intelligence, data analytics, reporting and/or data warehousing, OR four (4) years of experience working with Business Intelligence and reporting tools, including data warehouse and or data mining tools
Experience working with and knowledge of Health and Human Services data sets
Three (3) years of GIS and ESRI geo-mapping software experience

How Will We Know You're 'The One'?
Advanced level analytical, quantitative, and problem-solving skills
Proficiency in Microsoft Excel, Microsoft Power BI and other data manipulation and analysis tools
Familiarity with web-based management & business intelligence systems
Ability to lead discovery conversations with stakeholders to define issue/subject and recommend optimal approach
Expertise in developing methodologies and assumptions, using data software to conduct the analyses, and synthesizing findings to drive actionable insights
Ability to gather and interpret complex information to enable high level decision making and strategy formation
Strong organizational, planning, and project management skills
Excellent written and verbal communication skills

What Makes Wake Great

Home to the State Capital, Wake County is one of the fastest growing areas in the nation and the most populous county in the state, with more than 1.1 million residents. The County has received national and international rankings and accolades from publications such as Money, Fortune, and Time magazines as being one of the best places to live, work and play. The central location of the County allows for a short drive to the spectacular mountains or coast. Wake County Government is governed by a seven-member Board of Commissioners, who are elected at-large to serve two-year terms. Wake County Government has a general operating budget of $1.57 billion, employs over 4400 employees, experiences minimal turnover, and is an award-winning leader in wellness and technology initiatives; such as offering employees and covered spouses free access to the Employee Health Center. Wake County Government offers a wide range of training and development opportunities, a stable career in public service with a balance of work and family life, flexible work schedules and a competitive salary and benefits package.

Performs daily root cause analysis of systematic process completion and articulates any identified issues that require assistance in resolving.

Performs daily reporting and processing of ACH payment returns.

Researches transactional data to identify anomalies and facilitate process improvement efforts.
Develop and maintain an escheatment process for undelivered refunds to insurance customers.

Education, Experience, Skills and Abilities Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree preferred, but relevant years’ experience considered.
Experience with use case development and testing coordination.
Knowledge of process analysis and process efficiencies.
Proficiency in Microsoft Word and Excel

Identify opportunities to automate and streamline promotion processes

Microsoft is on a mission to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. Our culture is centered on embracing a growth mindset, a theme of inspiring excellence, and encouraging teams and leaders to bring their best each day. In doing so, we create life-changing innovations that impact billions of lives around the world. You can help us achieve our mission.
We believe in what people make possible. We stand in awe of what people dare to achieve, and we aim to help them in all aspects of their lives. Everything we do is grounded in this belief. It’s why we come to work, why we innovate and why we create technology that empowers people to thrive, in ordinary and extraordinary ways, every single day.
Come join a team who is helping enable innovation related to the Employee Experience at Microsoft. We drive data-based decisions to tackle strategic challenges and opportunities for various organizations at Microsoft. We partner with HR Leaders and Business Leaders to help shape the workforce of the future.
Microsoft’s HR Business Insights (HRBI) team is looking for an HR Analyst with a vision for strategy, strong customer focus, brilliant consulting capabilities and exceptional analytical skills. Our team advises the HR Line through data-based insights and compelling storytelling to achieve business objectives and people priorities, enables deep insights for the HR Line supporting key people and organization decisions and initiatives (including ROBs), and partners to grow data capability and enable modern data solutions that enhance HR Line organizations’ work with data.
In this strategic role, you will partner with HRLT and Business Leaders, to understand the business and people priorities while discovering ways to measure and analyze their big bets related to D&I, Career Development, Employee Voice etc. The ideal candidate will be comfortable leading and consulting through ambiguity, presenting and consulting with Senior Leaders across the Company and is a creative problem solver that recognizes opportunities. You will have the ability to think strategically at a global level and be able to effectively problem solve, and project manage across all layers of the organization. All with the highest focus for customer obsession.
Responsibilities
In this role you will be challenged to:
Design an analytical approach, and deliver research and findings using data, visualizations, and effective storytelling techniques.
Translate findings into succinct, actionable business insights, often in coordination with partners to help you tell a holistic story.
Apply a breadth of tools and analytical techniques to answer a wide range of high-impact people-related business questions.
Solve sometimes ambiguous business problems by formulating and facilitating solutions that realize the needs and provide for the requirements arising in the organization.
Exhibit excellence in execution by effectively contracting and communicating with customers, partners, and co-workers to define and provide deliverables, timelines, and responsibilities, all the while balancing and prioritizing across multiple and sometimes shifting priorities.
Qualifications
Required Qualifications:
5+ years applied work experience using analytical methods to solve business problems, driving improved decision-making and outcomes preferred.
Preferred Qualifications
Exceptional customer focus and project management skills – able to interact and contract professionally with a diverse group of executives, managers, and subject matter experts.
Passionate about client relationships and optimizing impactful analysis-based deliveries with the opportunity to train and promote on thoughtful self-serve solutions.
Polished presentation skills: building meaningful slides, presenting them effectively to senior level clients and management, responding to questions on-the-fly based on in-role business context and acumen. Strong attention to detail and high commitment to accuracy and auditing.
Proficiency in Microsoft Technology including Excel and PowerBI.

Job Title: Business/Operational Analyst
Department: Finance
Company: Dimension Development
Reports To: Assistant CFO
Supervises: N/A

Job Purpose: Thoroughly analyzes financial and operational key performance metrics and clearly communicates findings to stakeholders.

Job Responsibilities:
1. Use proprietary software (Dimension Development Hotel Accounting Program) as well as external sources to identify, generate, gather, verify, review, research, analyze, comprehend, interpret, and report on key performance indicators and financial information.
2. Analyze variances and data trends and prepare reports, charts and other outputs as required. To convert information into insightful findings and actionable recommendations to optimize existing and future operations across the company.
3. Provide high-quality recurring and ad-hoc performance reports to assist senior management with operational decisions, as required.
4. Assist the Assistant CFO with the development and maintenance of various analytical models.
5. Prepare a monthly reporting package that includes financial, operational, competitive, and customer satisfaction metrics. To analyze key business trends.
6. Work closely with all regional and property leaders to identify areas of improvement. To support and contribute expertise to projects relating to the achievement of property financial, guest service, and operational goals.
7. Assist hotel leadership with the actual implementation of new processes.
8. Assist with the preparation of annual budgets. To consolidate budget data from business unit leaders, evaluate data received and follow up directly with budget holders as appropriate. Ensure that all budgets are accurate, comprehensive and completed on time.
9. Serve as a super user of business intelligence tools (such as Broadvine and MicroStrategy) in the creation of dashboards and reports.
10. Research and evaluate different analysis tools, business intelligence tools, and modeling techniques to identify possible opportunities for process improvement.
11. Other duties as assigned.

Job Skills:
1. Track record of problem solving complex issues and continuous process improvement skills.
2. Advanced Microsoft Excel skills are required, and will be tested, including pivot tables and advanced formulas. Must be proficient in Microsoft Office.
3. To maintain a thorough understanding of financial and operational metrics across the industry.
4. Ability to work proactively, independently and as a strategic partner in a cross-functional team environment. To establish and maintain cooperative working relationships with fellow team members, management, external contacts, guests, and the public. Demonstrated ability to manage conflict/resolution.
5. Demonstrated strong analytical skills. To define and analyze problems and identify root causes. To set challenging and productive goals; prioritizing tasks, accepting responsibility, and overcoming obstacles.
6. To work successfully in a dynamic, fast-paced setting, and effectively manage multiple priorities within a broad team of cross-regional and cross-functional members. To perform a variety of duties, often changing from one task to another of a different nature, with frequent interruptions and distractions. To adapt to frequent changes in the workload and be able to adjust priorities quickly as circumstances dictate while completing tasks within established timeframes.
7. To thrive in an environment that is both strategic and creative, and which requires rapid learning, multitasking and prioritizing under tight deadlines
8. To remain highly-driven and self-motivated. To remain positive, productive, and professional in high stress situations.
9. To maintain a high level of accuracy and attention to detail at all times. To be well-organized and detail-oriented in order to manage multiple tasks, deadlines, and expectations simultaneously.
10. To sustain a high level of confidentiality.
11. To demonstrate partnering, influencing, and communication skills at all levels of the organization.
12. To maintain excellent written and verbal communication and comprehension skills, including the ability to clearly explain complex analytical topics to a wide audience who may or may not be familiar with analytics or the subject matter.
13. Other duties as assigned.

Experience: One year experience in the job offered or two year’s experience in a business intelligence or similar analytical capacity or related role. Hospitality/Entertainment Industry experience is preferred.

Work Location: Remote or home based

Works with stakeholders across the organization to identify and document business requirements for several Operational functions

Job Summary:

Job Title: IT Business Analyst/Project Manager
FLSA Status: Salary
Reports to: IT Application Development Director
The IT Business Analyst/Project Manager is responsible for planning, overseeing, and leading IT projects from ideation through completion. This includes analyzing, specifying, and validating the business needs of stakeholders, guests or business partners, by interviewing stakeholders, gathering and compiling user requirements to understand the technology solutions they need. This role is also responsible for developing detailed project plans to ensure resource availability, allocation, and on-time project delivery within budget and scope. The IT Business Analyst/Project Manager will also apply proven communication, analytical, and problem-solving skills to guide the business towards make beneficial technology decisions. This role will require a proactive approach to collaboration with IT Peers when seeking new technologies to optimize business processes and will also play a pivotal role in ensuring IT’s understanding of business requirements.

Job Description:
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Primary Responsibilities
Ensure that the project is completely and correctly planned according to established methodologies and standards.
Ensure that the project work plan is followed and is continually updated to ensure customer requirements are met in a timely manner.
Ensure appropriate communication and maintain contact with users, executive sponsor, department managers and directors and upper-level management personnel as directed by the methodology and the supervisor.
Keep manager and director informed on the status of all assigned projects.
Conduct interviews to gather user requirements via workshops, questionnaires, surveys, site visits, workflow storyboards, use cases, scenarios, and other methods.
Identify and establish scope and parameters of requirements analysis on a project-by-project basis to define project impact, outcome criteria, and metrics.
Work with stakeholders and project team to prioritize collected requirements.
Analyze and verify requirements for completeness, consistency, comprehensibility, feasibility, and conformity to standards.
Develop and utilize standard templates to accurately and concisely write requirements specifications.
Translate conceptual user requirements into functional requirements in a clear manner that is comprehensible to developers/project team.
Where applicable, develop prototypes of interfaces and attributes based on the user requirements.
Create process models, specifications, diagrams, and charts to provide direction to developers and/or the project team.
Develop and conduct peer reviews of the business requirements to ensure that requirement specifications are correctly interpreted.
Assist with the interpretation of user requirements into feasible options, and communicating these back to the business stakeholders.
Manage and track the status of requirements throughout the project lifecycle; enforce and redefine as necessary.
Communicate changes, enhancements, and modifications of business requirements– verbally or through written documentation – to project managers, sponsors, and other stakeholders so that issues and solutions are understood.
Develop, maintain and publish the project book according to Festival’s IT Project Methodology.
Assist in continuous process improvement initiatives as directed.
Assist in business process improvement initiatives through approved projects.
Promote technology where appropriate to add value to business process.
Coordinate with IT and business departments to determine staffing needs; delegate work assignments and coach Team Members to ensure systems are implemented according to specifications and standards.
Provide guidance and/or instruction as applicable.
Other duties as assigned.
Regular, timely attendance in compliance with the work schedule, and adequate notice to find a replacement for occasional absences.
Strategy & Planning
Manage IT projects from inception through completion utilizing Festival’s Project Management methodology.
Provide mentoring, consulting, and support of Festival’s Project Management methodology.
Collaborate with business partners to determine project value, scope, and vision.
Research, review, and analyze the effectiveness and efficiency of Project Management and Business Analysis processes and develop strategies for enhancing or further leveraging these processes.
Manage vendor and outsourced projects and relationships as necessary.
Responsible for sponsor and Team Member satisfaction as it relates to project completion, project success criteria or as identified by Festival’s IT Department and Methodology.
Acquisition & Deployment
Assist in conducting research on software and hardware products to meet agreed-upon requirements and to support purchasing efforts.
Participate in the QA of purchased solutions to ensure features and functions have been enabled and optimized.
Participate in the selection of any requirements documentation software solutions that the organization may opt to use.
Assist with solution implementation planning and solution implementations including software installations, documentation and training.
QUALIFICATIONS
College diploma or university degree in the field of Business Administration, computer science, Finance, or Information Systems required.
3-5 years of directly related work experience (retail Large Enterprise preferred).
Business Analysis or Project Management certifications preferred.
Excellent supervisory, management and performance management skills; interpersonal skills; customer service skills; organizational skills; project management skills and knowledge of project management tools; and verbal and written communication skills.
Demonstrated knowledge of the organization’s core business process and operations.
Proven experience with business and technical requirements analysis, elicitation, modeling, verification, and methodology development.
Ability to create systematic and consistent requirements specifications in both technical and user-friendly language.
Exceptional analytical and statistical skills with the ability to apply them to systems issues and products as required.
Demonstrated project management skills and project management software skills, including planning, organizing, and managing resources.
Understanding of application development and software development life cycle concepts (i.e.: SCRUM and Agile).
Understanding of the organization’s core software applications, including POS, Merchandise and Marketing systems, Financial ERP and Financial reporting.
Able to exercise independent judgment and take action on it.
Excellent analytical, mathematical, and creative problem-solving skills.
Excellent listening, interpersonal, written, and oral communication skills.
Logical and efficient, with keen attention to detail.
Highly self-motivated and directed.
Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks while under pressure.
Experience working in a team-oriented, collaborative environment.
PHYSICAL DEMANDS AND WORK ENVIRONMENT
Sitting or standing at a computer 50% of the time.
Bending, stretching, and occasional lifting of up to 30 lbs. is required.
Dexterity of hands and fingers required to operate a computer keyboard or mouse, and to handle other computer components.
Work Schedule
The IT Business Analyst/Project Manager is a full-time, salaried position. Occasional evening and weekend work to meet deadlines.

Travel may include some evenings and weekend days.**NOTE: COVID-19 restrictions prohibit travel at this time; however, when restrictions are lifted, this role may be expected to travel as needed to meet the requirements of this position.The NC Department of Health and Human Services seeks contract resources to provide on-site support for county department of social services NC FAST users as they learn the NC FAST Case Management System. Work hours may occasionally include evenings and weekends. Travel expenses are reimbursed using the state’s protocol for submitting expenses after travel. Per diem is paid directly to the contractor, most hotel expenses are direct billed to the state resulting in no out of pocket for the contractor. The contractor will, at the direction of management, either ride with an employee driving a state car or drive their personal vehicle and be reimbursed mileage after travel.**Job Types: Full-time, Contract, TemporaryPay: $40.00 - $90.00 per hourSchedule:8 hour shiftWork Location: One location

The Business Operations Analyst (Defensive Line) will provide strategic analysis and essential project management at an executive level. You will lead in the development of high impact projects across all departments, ensuring understanding of deliverables and allocation of resources. You will develop relationships across all levels and geographies to maintain the cultural pulse of the team. We are looking for both strategic framing and project execution. Furthermore, the Defensive Line will analyze resource allocation and budgetary spend.

RESPONSIBILITIES
Areas that play to your strengths
All the responsibilities we'll trust you with:
Expand all
Strategic Planning & Analysis
Contribute to the development of long-term strategic missions and goals across business segments and responsibilities.
Develop Goal tracking and business metric dashboards
Evaluate proper use and allocation of resources across business segments and responsibilities and provide solutions
Engage and secure leadership partnerships
Provide analyses of business goals; identify helpful and harmful factors contributing to their success
Develop scorecards, trackers, tools, and reports that assist the LT (Marketing, Key Accounts, On Premise, and Distribution) in assessing BU performance.
Evaluate proper use and allocation of resources across business segments and recommend solutions to increase efficiency.
Provide qualitative analytic support on projects requiring financial or data analysis.
Business Process Improvement
Work with department and regional leads to evaluate and improve current business and role processes and provide recommendations to leadership on improvements, automation, or new capability opportunities.
Develop improvements to EABU project and annual BP process to increase focus, efficiency, and empowerment with the field and ensure understanding across all levels of your team
Help identify performance gaps across the EABU business and provide solutions to close gaps that increase efficiency and growth.
Project Management
Provide leadership and support from project development to implementation including business case proposals, budgeting, scheduling, managing, and reporting results.
Partner with project leaders to manage documentation and tracking of project milestones, schedules, and resource needs
Develop and enhance project management methodologies ensuring that a streamlined process exists, and ensure that projects are implemented and delivered to meet requirements.
Build relationships across all levels and geographies to monitor the cultural health and pulse of the team and make recommendations based on those assessments.

EXPERIENCE
Your areas of knowledge and expertise
that matter most for this role:
3+ years experience in an project management role
Understanding of P&L, goals, and interactions
Experience in CPG marketing
Understanding of business insights/ category management principles
Can organize meetings and communications
Collaborative with the ability to work with executives across multiple departments
Bachelors in Business, Marketing, Finance or related field
Bachelor’s Degree preferred
Fluent in English, additional language skills an advantage
Travel up to 10%

Are you passionate about leveraging large volumes of data sets to draw deep insights designed to improve business strategies and customer experience with marketing programs to drive impact? If yes then IDEAs (Insights Data Engineering and Analytics) group is looking for qualified candidates to work with us with us to leverage the power of data, the skill of analysis, the science of learning to empower our stakeholders with insights on growth levers.
Our team plays a key role in providing data and analytics for Microsoft 365 and owns the end to end reporting and owns key data assets utilized for leadership review.
Responsibilities
Conduct data analyses deliver insights and learnings on marketing initiatives / programs (BI) for Commercial Managed segments.
Define, generate, and monitor KPI metrics for different Modern Workplace solutions and Land and Expand initiatives
Automate reporting and provide exploration capability for reporting users
Partner with multiple marketing and engineering teams to explore data, design learning plan, and conduct analyses
Present insights and learnings to key stakeholders / executives with data backed story telling
Provide thought leadership on modern workplace marketing based on the insights / learning from analyses
Qualifications
2+ years of experience in analyzing large volumes of data, extracting insights processing large data sets using SQL or SQL-like scripting language
2+ years of experience in processing and building visualizations using reporting tool as Power BI
Strong skills in statistics/machine learning languages and packages such as Python, R, Azure ML
Excellent written and oral communication skills, particularly the ability to synthesize complex issues/scenarios into easy-to-understand concepts
Attention to detail with self-discipline and a drive for results
Demonstrated ability to work in ambiguous situations and across organizational boundaries
Experience breaking down problems into hypothesis that can be analyzed and validated to drive data driven decisions with strong story telling
Bachelors or Master’s degree in statistics, data science, applied mathematics, computer science, econometrics or a related field, or equivalent alternative education, skills, and/or practical equivalent experience

Job Title: Data Analyst Associate - Entry Level - Level 1
Description:
COVID-19 continues to significantly impact our employees, families and communities. With employee health and safety as our top priority, and as a federal contractor, Lockheed Martin is taking action to address the increased risk and uncertainty COVID variants pose in the workplace and ensuring we meet our commitments to national security.

As directed by Executive Order 14042: Ensuring Adequate COVID Safety Protocols for Federal Contractors, all current and newly hired employees, in the United States, are required to be fully vaccinated by January 18, 2022.
Description:
Lockheed Martin Aeronautics. Be More Than You Can Imagine.

The selected candidate will perform Modeling, Simulation & Analysis (MS&A) in support of F-35 Sustainment.

1) Apply modeling & simulation technical principles, concepts and techniques to assess Performance Based Logistics (PBL) metrics using commercial, government, and LM developed tools. Establish and maintain Integrated Lines of Balance (ILOB) with respect to part levels associated with F-35 Performance Based Logistics.

2) Support coordination and development of problem statements, modeling approaches and ground rules and assumptions (GR&A)
3) Work under the guidance of a technical lead to perform analysis to establish a total cost to performance picture for Sustainment
4) Analyze F-35 fielded performance developing solutions to assigned problems for the purpose of forecasting, root cause analysis, evaluation of potential solutions, and assessment of corrective actions.

A level 1 employee Typically has 0 - 3 years of professional experience.

What’s In It For You
Our employees play an active role in strengthening the quality of life where we live and work by volunteering more than 850,000 hours annually. Here are some of the benefits you can enjoy:
MedicalDental401kPaid time offWork/life balanceCareer developmentMentorship opportunitiesRewards & recognition
Learn more about Lockheed Martin’s comprehensive benefits package here.

This position is in Fort Worth, TX Discover Fort Worth.
Basic Qualifications:
Bachelor of Science degree in Engineering or a related technical discipline (Industrial, Mechanical, Aerospace, Electrical, Etc); Physics, Data Science, Data Analysis, Physics, or Mathematics (use of stochastic and deterministic data models) or related technical disciplines with an emphasis in modeling, data manipulation, and/or the application of mathematical and statistical methods to apply to business and risk management problems.

Must be a US Citizen; this position will require a government security clearance. This position is located at a facility that requires special access.
Desired Skills:
Coursework or experience with/knowledge of conducting performance and cost analysis, Database systems (SQL and NO SQL based), Descriptive statistics and exploratory data analysisPredictive analytics – modeling, simulation and forecasting (for higher level employees), Statistical programming and data processing skills.Knowledge of scripting (one or more common languages e.g., Python and R), statistics (descriptive and inferential), data munging, and data visualizationExperienced in data structures and hierarchiesExperience collecting and compiling datasets from disparate data sources into the required data structure.Computer programming experience with SAS or other high-level language. Ability to query databases using Structured Query Language (SQL). Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau.Ability to perform analysis via multi-criteria decision modeling including discrete event simulations, statistical & risk analysis, life-cycle cost analysis, performance & cost trade-offs, and business case analysisProficiency with MS Office tool suite.Experience managing data quality and configuration control.Coursework or previous experience analyzing supply chain networks.Strong analytical skills and understanding of system databases, data elements and application software solutions to optimize data gathering and analysis
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS:
job.Qualifications

Company: FedEx Services
Job Title: Business Product Analyst III
Job Requisition Number: RC428249
Category: Information Technology
Pay Type: Exempt
Locations:
Collierville, Tennessee 38017
United States
Job Summary:


Act as a key leader for cross-functional Scrum development team to deliver valuable product enhancements and integrations. Understand and convey the business processes and problems to the Scrum team. This job represents the voice of the customer to elicit, understand, analyze, document, refine and communicate business needs, so that business and/or technical delivery teams can build effective solutions.
1. Define and clearly articulate requirements (user stories) and acceptance criteria (use cases).
2. Assists in managing requirements and prioritization within the product backlog through: business value ROI, alignment with product strategy, and resource capacity.
3. Build and leverage solid working relationships with business and product stakeholders.
4. Assist in the integration of programs across channels with internal partners and manages program effectiveness against target metrics.
5. Utilize effective communication skills to surface essential requirements information.
6. Own the product vision and product backlog. Manage requirements and prioritization within the product backlog through business value roi, alignment with product strategy, and resource capacity.
7. Coach, mentor, and support other product analysts. Communicate effectively, manage conflict among team members, and remove impediments.

Domicile: This position can be domiciled anywhere in the United States.

Domicile: This position will be domiciled in Collierville, Tennessee (Memphis area).

Remote Work: The ability to work remotely within the United States may be available based on business need.

Relocation: Relocation assistance may be available based on business need.

Minimum Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in computer science, engineering, or information systems and/or equivalent formal training or work experience. Four(4) years equivalent work experience in information technology or engineering environment. A related advanced degree may offset the related experience requirements.
FedEx. Where now meets next.
Our vision is to be the earth's most engaged advocates of connected commerce where open borders, new markets and fair, sustainable practices are the norm for the billions of personal supply chains being managed every day in our always on, mobile-first world. We stand for ease, access and opportunity. We lead purposeful innovation, champion entrepreneurs, advocate free trade and empower humans and their place in the era of autonomy and AI. We fight for our customers, a more sustainable planet and an ethical playing field.
FedEx inspires its more than 570,000 team members to remain focused on safety, the highest ethical and professional standards and the needs of their customers and communities. FedEx is committed to connecting people and possibilities around the world responsibly and resourcefully, with a goal to achieve carbon-neutral operations by 2040.

KLEAR Digital is a data analytics company that excels at helping clients grow through digital media and offline advertising. Klear Digital has a focus on data analytics and direct response marketing that delivers results. We are seeking a talented and highly motivated Account Executive to join our team.
ABOUT THE POSITION
KLEAR Digital is seeking a Junior level Data Analyst. This position reports to the Data Analytics Manager. The Junior Data Analyst will be a member of the data team and responsible for analyzing data across a variety of sources, creating measurable and actionable reports for both internal and external clients. When assigned, the Jr. Data Analyst will also assist in the creation and testing of data processes. This position is also responsible for building ad-hoc reports and analyses, validating and auditing external and internal data, as well as monitoring the quality and performance of incoming data sources and platforms.
Responsibilities:
Implements the company's proprietary data analytics processes and utilizes the company's proprietary tools
Analyzes data and translate into meaningful presentations
Identification and resolution of issues presented by data
Validation of client and licensed data
Assist with development of various data processes when assigned
Documentation of data environments and processes for the department
Interpret data needs and assess how to meet those requirements with the available data and tools
Adapt to priorities that can continually shifting priorities, based on business need
Communicate complex data findings in a clear, understandable manner among multiple teams, the Data Analytics Manager, or to the data analytics team
Analyze performance based on KPIs and recommend strategies to improve
Understands new data and translate into meaningful presentations
Develops and maintains understanding in the application of both statistics and advertising principles in order to drive business results
Requirements & Desired Skills:
A degree in economics, econometrics, statistics, or advertising with a statistics concentration and/or equivalent training and/or equivalent work experience
A fast learner and able to adopt new data analytical processes
Must have an intuitive grasp for utilizing data to drive business results
Prior experience with extracting data utilizing MYSQL or SQL a plus
Excellent oral and written communication skills with commitment to precision and detail
Ability to work well with others and other data analysts on projects
Ability to multi-task
Positive team player able to thrive in a highly motivated in a fast-paced environment

Location: San Francisco, CA 94107 (South Of Market area)•Remote
Description:
Join us as we pursue our disruptive new vision to make machine data accessible, usable and valuable to everyone. We are a company filled with people who are passionate about our product and seek to deliver the best experience for our customers. At Splunk, we’re committed to our work, customers, having fun and most importantly to each other’s success. Learn more about Splunk careers and how you can become a part of our journey!
Role:
Splunk is looking for a Business Analyst, Technical Support Strategy & Planning to join our passionate, fun and innovative Splunk Global Support organization. This role will support cross functional strategic initiatives on behalf of Global Support across Splunk.
This Business Analyst role will work closely with Global Support Leadership, Support Operations and Customer Success Strategy and Operations teams. The candidate will be responsible for weekly, monthly and quarterly business reviews, strategic narratives, assisting with planning organization-wide meetings among other programs and projects.
Responsibilities:
Strategy
Contribute with the development and planning of Splunk’s overall Global Support strategy to make a measurable impact on key outcomes like retention, annual revenue, cost to serve, time to value, customer experience, etc. Global Support Strategy must be aligned with Customer Success and overall Splunk priorities and backed by Data and customer insights
Develop and maintain an effective interlock working in strong collaboration with all other business functions to complete the Global Support strategy (e.g CS, Sales, PM, Engineering, Product).
Develop content for executive level presentations (QBRs, Strategy Narratives, etc.)
Business insights
Partner with Global Support leadership to develop data insights and dashboards to support the business and provide insights into operational efficiency
Analyze data to identify strategic opportunities to improve our business, in partnership with the operations and analytics team.
Strategic processes
Develop Narratives and supporting content for executive leadership within the business areas to create and maintain alignment around the business objectives, priorities, measurable benefits, success criteria, scope, and constraints impacting all functions of Global Support
Partner with the Global Support organization and greater leadership team to ensure strategies and narratives are aligned to programs/initiatives.
Ensure standard business analyst methodologies & processes are applied to address unique situations.
What you bring:
Critical thinking, thought leadership and foresight: You anticipate changes in customer expectations and quickly mobilize and strategize to guide the required customer experience shifts.
A passion for delighting customers and growth: You’re a pro using data driven insights to guide actions and outcomes.
You have a deep understanding of value drivers in recurring revenue business models and the support operating metrics relevant to a support organization.
Interpersonal, networking and influencing skills: Ability to communicate effectively with internal and external partners and customers at every level. Influence alignment and prioritization of initiatives critical to delivering the strategy. You embrace change and have a demonstrable ability to empower and influence across functions.
Problem-solving and analytical skills: Interpreting and using data insights for constantly improving customer experience.
Ability to understand business objectives and communicate critical initiatives accordingly: clear understanding of the company’s/organizational objectives and ability to align and document initiatives to contribute to the achievement of the business goals.
Long term strategic outlook and ability to break it down into achievable and measurable roadmaps: You can visualize the desired end result and then work backwards to plan, strategize and document.
Data-driven approach and a curiosity about technology
Requirements:
5+ years of demonstrated ability and proven track record of leading strategy and operations in a scaled B2B SaaS company. Efforts must demonstrate material impact on retention, expansion and growth.
3+ years of proven experience in strategic program execution building a scalable and repeatable approach to program management.
Experience in Technical Support or Technically focused organizations
Experience scaling during hyper growth, comfortable with ambiguity

You will also be expected to maintain a broad knowledge of various data visualization and reporting techniques, leveraging human centered design principles in report creation and delivery.

Experience with DAX and Power Query, PowerBI Report Builder, and experience with creating and maintaining paginated reports

Experience utilizing insights to drive business decisions at all levels of an organization.

Experience with SQL, and Python

The Finance Business Analyst is a member of the Finance & Accounting Systems/Administrative Services team within University Information Technology. This team provides Finance & Accounting IT support services to departments and central offices on all four campuses, ensuring that appropriate decision support systems are functioning, interfaces with the State accounting system function properly, and the financial users on all four campuses receive accurate, complete information with which to run their departments. The team provides programming support, information retrieval, and data delivery to the central financial offices, developing more efficient ways of doing business by using new and existing applications. The team interacts closely with the University Business Services and University Information Technology departments to meet the needs of campuses.

Duties and Responsibilities
Duties and responsibilities are in four primary areas: business processes/procedures, system administration, user support and project management for the MSU four-campus finance/accounting ERP system, EDM, & PCI.
Proactively identify and recommend system-enabled business process and/or procedure improvements in finance/accounting area.
Participate in the development and analysis of business processes. Collaborate with manager and finance/accounting teams to implement process improvements, reduce risks, increase controls and/or increase customer satisfaction.
Create, develop and maintain campus-wide online finance training. Coordinate with University Business Services/Accounting Services for users with training needs or “how to” questions.
Lead functional administration of the finance/accounting area ERP modules and other finance/accounting related systems (e.g., Commerce Manager, QuickPay) for all MSU campuses and agencies, ensuring system integrity and security.
Plan and execute finance/accounting area software upgrades, develop test plans and communicate effectively regarding timing and impacts both internally and externally to the organization.
Manage departmental communications across all four campuses on processes, schedules and other relevant information including month-end and fiscal year-end close.
Manage user account security for Banner finance/accounting systems, SABHRS, AssetWorks, PCI and ensure overall system security.
Manage departmental projects with limited scope and/or small project teams, creating schedules as well as communicating clearly with stakeholders.
Website maintenance for University Business Services, PCI, and EDM.


Required Qualifications – Experience, Education, Knowledge & Skills
Bachelor’s Degree in a technology field, accounting, finance or related field or an equivalent combination of relevant experience and education.
Professional work experience in systems administration and user support, preferably in the finance/accounting area.
Hands-on experience with ERP software systems, demonstrating an understanding of ERP system structure, relationships and impacts.
Experience with and proficiency in the Microsoft Office software suite.


Preferred Qualifications – Experience, Education, Knowledge & Skills
Project management experience with IT projects and/or project management certification.
Knowledge of enterprise and/or governmental accounting and policies and procedures.
Experience with information security and electronic document management (EDM).
Experience with payment card industry standards (PCI).


The Successful Candidate Will
Analyze system problems and errors at a detailed level as well as identify data-related problems that cause issues in attaining desired results.
Have the ability to ask probing questions, listen to a user’s needs, and translate that information into requirements and a strategy to solve problems.
Collaborate and negotiate effectively with a wide variety of constituents, often with competing needs.
Be forward-looking, able to anticipate system and technology needs and proactively address them.
Embrace and adapt quickly to changes in priorities, processes and work environment with a positive attitude.
Be highly organized with great attention to detail and a high level of accuracy in work product.
Establish and maintain effective working relationships with multiple offices, co-workers and managers in a diverse, team-oriented environment; represents department and the University in a positive, professional manner.
Demonstrate excellent, professional verbal and written communication skills.
Exercise initiative and independent judgment in solving complex problems and in interpreting and applying policies and procedures

Job Title: Business/Operational Analyst
Department: Finance
Company: Dimension Development
Reports To: Assistant CFO
Supervises: N/A

Job Purpose: Thoroughly analyzes financial and operational key performance metrics and clearly communicates findings to stakeholders.

Job Responsibilities:
1. Use proprietary software (Dimension Development Hotel Accounting Program) as well as external sources to identify, generate, gather, verify, review, research, analyze, comprehend, interpret, and report on key performance indicators and financial information.
2. Analyze variances and data trends and prepare reports, charts and other outputs as required. To convert information into insightful findings and actionable recommendations to optimize existing and future operations across the company.
3. Provide high-quality recurring and ad-hoc performance reports to assist senior management with operational decisions, as required.
4. Assist the Assistant CFO with the development and maintenance of various analytical models.
5. Prepare a monthly reporting package that includes financial, operational, competitive, and customer satisfaction metrics. To analyze key business trends.
6. Work closely with all regional and property leaders to identify areas of improvement. To support and contribute expertise to projects relating to the achievement of property financial, guest service, and operational goals.
7. Assist hotel leadership with the actual implementation of new processes.
8. Assist with the preparation of annual budgets. To consolidate budget data from business unit leaders, evaluate data received and follow up directly with budget holders as appropriate. Ensure that all budgets are accurate, comprehensive and completed on time.
9. Serve as a super user of business intelligence tools (such as Broadvine and MicroStrategy) in the creation of dashboards and reports.
10. Research and evaluate different analysis tools, business intelligence tools, and modeling techniques to identify possible opportunities for process improvement.
11. Other duties as assigned.

Job Skills:
1. Track record of problem solving complex issues and continuous process improvement skills.
2. Advanced Microsoft Excel skills are required, and will be tested, including pivot tables and advanced formulas. Must be proficient in Microsoft Office.
3. To maintain a thorough understanding of financial and operational metrics across the industry.
4. Ability to work proactively, independently and as a strategic partner in a cross-functional team environment. To establish and maintain cooperative working relationships with fellow team members, management, external contacts, guests, and the public. Demonstrated ability to manage conflict/resolution.
5. Demonstrated strong analytical skills. To define and analyze problems and identify root causes. To set challenging and productive goals; prioritizing tasks, accepting responsibility, and overcoming obstacles.
6. To work successfully in a dynamic, fast-paced setting, and effectively manage multiple priorities within a broad team of cross-regional and cross-functional members. To perform a variety of duties, often changing from one task to another of a different nature, with frequent interruptions and distractions. To adapt to frequent changes in the workload and be able to adjust priorities quickly as circumstances dictate while completing tasks within established timeframes.
7. To thrive in an environment that is both strategic and creative, and which requires rapid learning, multitasking and prioritizing under tight deadlines
8. To remain highly-driven and self-motivated. To remain positive, productive, and professional in high stress situations.
9. To maintain a high level of accuracy and attention to detail at all times. To be well-organized and detail-oriented in order to manage multiple tasks, deadlines, and expectations simultaneously.
10. To sustain a high level of confidentiality.
11. To demonstrate partnering, influencing, and communication skills at all levels of the organization.
12. To maintain excellent written and verbal communication and comprehension skills, including the ability to clearly explain complex analytical topics to a wide audience who may or may not be familiar with analytics or the subject matter.
13. Other duties as assigned.

Job Qualifications: Describe the minimum qualifications needed to complete the job responsibilities.

Education: Bachelor's Degree in a business or hospitality field, or equivalent work experience. Advanced degrees or certifications are preferred.

Experience: One year experience in the job offered or two year’s experience in a business intelligence or similar analytical capacity or related role. Hospitality/Entertainment Industry experience is preferred.

Work Location: Remote or home based

Job Title: Product Data Analyst- Xbox Product Services
Description:
Xbox is one of the world’s most valuable brands and enjoys millions of players and passionate fans. An important part of our plan is to grow our global player base and our multi-billion dollar a year Xbox console and accessories business. At Xbox, we believe Gamer Happiness is at the core to our mission of empowering every person and organization on the planet to achieve more.
As part of Xbox Product Services (XPS), Xbox Community (XBC) supports the growth and happiness of our broader gaming community, including ensuring the safety and security all our members. We provide thought leadership and execute on growing a truly inclusive community wherever people play games.
To do so, the Experiences Optimization and Insights (eXOI) team within the Xbox Community (XBC) team is looking for passionate individuals that know how to leverage data, tell a story, and partner with teams across Xbox to deliver on world class social experiences. You’ll play a key role in uncovering how Xbox gamers socially engage and help uncover new opportunities to drive social engagement within the Xbox network. You’ll also play a key role working with the Xbox Community leadership team to understand how we are tracking to our goals, and identify new ways to measure how we are delivering on our mission. If you have a passion for gaming, technology, social media, and leveraging big data, this is the team for you. Where else will you get to help gamers have more fun, find more friends to play with, and leverage your data skills?
Responsibilities
Shape, analyze, and tell a story leveraging data from varying sources to provide insights into how gamers are engaging in the Xbox ecosystem, and uncover new patterns to improve gamer experiences.
Partner with Product Management, Design, and Engineering teams to discover and craft metrics to measure our success and use of our ecosystem ….
Use and promote data-exploration techniques to discover new or previously unasked questions
Work with partner data teams to operationalize metrics, and drive analytics automation and enhance BI capabilities (dashboarding/insight retrieval)
Qualifications
Qualifications
2-5 years’ experience applying analytics to a consumer facing experiences or app (Social Media/Search/Mobile Games)
Solid knowledge in Statistics, A/B testing or causal inference
Experience in extracting, processing, and analyzing data using SQL or SQL-like scripting language (Hadoop, Cosmos, Kusto etc.)
Strong analytical problem-solving skills
Ability to manage through ambiguity and answer open-ended questions
BA/BS in Business Administration ,CS, Marketing, Economics, Statistics
Nice To Have's
Background in data sciences
Hands on experience with Python/R

PEOPLE BUSINESS ANALYST (North America)
Thirdera is searching for the right team player to assist in all aspects of People Operations for our North America region working alongside our People Senior Manager. This is an exciting opportunity for anyone looking to work on a generalist role with multiple opportunities to grow, develop and expand their careers. You will have your hands in every aspect of the employee life cycle, including onboarding, coaching, performance management and development, payroll, benefits, employee engagement, offboarding, system support and driving people related analytics.
Key responsibilities:
Serve as a subject matter expert and consult with line management and provide daily HR guidance
Execute onboarding and offboarding sessions and programs following the frameworks and guidance provided by the centre of excellence (CoEx)
Analyze trends and metrics with the People department
Assist and partner with people manager in resolving employee relations issues and address grievances
Partner with culture and talent development centres of excellence in deploying their processes and programs throughout the region.
Build strong business relationships with employees and managers in the region. Work closely with management and employees to improve work relationships, build morale and increase productivity and retention
Provide positive customer service by responding to employee and manager on People- related questions. Provide reference to People policies and procedures and deliver internal webinar / trainings as needed.
Coach managers to document performance and behavior. Actively manage performance and behavior issues to resolution.
Assist on payroll and on benefits programs’ design for USA and Canada
Assist Sr Manager with visa-related requirements
Recommend and perform quality control procedures as defined to ensure accurate and compliant records, including records related to promotions, job transfers and new hires.
Deliver culture activities and support our learning activities in USA and Canada.
Requeriments:
3 to 5 years of Human Resources Business Analyst or equivalent HR functional experience
Strong verbal and written communication skills.
Global mindset and experience working in global companies
Strong coaching and influencing skills.
Ability to manage and work in a fast-paced environment that is constantly changing.
Experience in leading change management initiatives.
Ability to effectively navigate through ambiguous situations.
Demonstrated ability to manage multiple priorities, assess People implications and manage details.
Experience in multiple HR disciplines including compensation practices, employee relations, talent management, diversity, performance management, and federal and state laws.
Someone ready to promote and encourage innovative thoughts and ideas!
Maintain a high level of confidentiality, professionalism, integrity, respect and teamwork in all matters.
Experience working in an IT Services environment a plus.
Excellent interpersonal, presentation, and facilitation skills.
Thirdera is a federal contractor that requires all employees to be fully vaccinated as a condition of employment. Thirdera will require proof of vaccination and/ or will consider requests for medical or religious exemption to the vaccination requirement during the hiring process.

We are looking for a Data Analyst to join Spotify’s Legal & Internal Audit (“IA”) Systems team within the Financial Engineering mission. The Legal & IA Systems team is responsible for driving a variety of initiatives within Spotify’s legal, audit and data privacy landscape. This team owns the data strategy for legal retention requirements and produces analyses to surface insights for legal and compliance and other stakeholders, including product and engineering.
Location
New York or Remote Americas
Job type
Permanent
What you'll do
Perform analyses on large sets of data from various sources to build analytical reports and extract insights that will help satisfy a legal data strategy.
Collaborate with the team’s Product Manager to prioritize work and develop a data-driven strategy for legal and relevant business teams.
Partner with data engineers and scientists to build a scalable and flexible data landscape to respond to the various needs of the legal, compliance and audit business teams.
Partner with the legal team to provide timely, appropriate, and accurate responses to data requests from regulators, partners, litigations and policymakers.
Immerse yourself in Spotify’s data culture to assess new technologies and best practices, and their relevance to the team’s overall scope of work.
Clearly communicate your work, progress and vision of the data strategy to stakeholders - tailoring communication as appropriate to ensure relevance to the audience.
Work closely with multi-functional teams across the company who are passionate about Spotify’s success.
Develop a deep understanding of Spotify’s legal and compliance landscape, both the current needs and future vision.
Take accountability for data integrity.
Who you are
B.A. / B.S. in Economics, Statistics, Computer Science, or another quantitative field.
Minimum of 2-3 years of relevant experience. Background in legal matters and consumer technology companies is a plus, but not required. Willingness to learn relevant legal concepts as underpinnings of analysis is a must.
Strong communication skills, including ability to speak tech to a non-tech audience and to translate complex business/legal needs into specifically-defined work.
Comfortable with working with data producers across the organization to understand the sources and assumptions on which our data depends.
Extensive experience manipulating and analyzing complex data with SQL and other tools, such as Python.
Familiarity with Google Cloud Platform (Big Query), MS Azure, or AWS.
Experience operating independently in a fast-paced work environment and collaborating with senior business leaders across multiple time zones.
You have inclusive and collaborative working habits.
Where you'll be
We are a distributed workforce enabling our band members to find a work mode that is best for them!
Where in the world? For this role, it can be within the Americas region in which we have a work location.
Prefer an office to work from home instead? Not a problem! We have plenty of options for your working preferences. Find more information about our Work From Anywhere options here.
Working hours? We operate within the Eastern Standard time zone for collaboration.
Our global benefits
Extensive learning opportunities, through our dedicated team, GreenHouse.
Flexible share incentives letting you choose how you share in our success.
Global parental leave, six months off - fully paid - for all new parents.
All The Feels, our employee assistance program and self-care hub.
Flexible public holidays, swap days off according to your values and beliefs.
Spotify On Tour, join your colleagues on trips to industry festivals and events.
Learn about life at Spotify
Spotify is an equal opportunity employer. You are welcome at Spotify for who you are, no matter where you come from, what you look like, or what’s playing in your headphones. Our platform is for everyone, and so is our workplace. The more voices we have represented and amplified in our business, the more we will all thrive, contribute, and be forward-thinking! So bring us your personal experience, your perspectives, and your background. It’s in our differences that we will find the power to keep revolutionizing the way the world listens.
Spotify transformed music listening forever when we launched in 2008. Our mission is to unlock the potential of human creativity by giving a million creative artists the opportunity to live off their art and billions of fans the chance to enjoy and be passionate about these creators. Everything we do is driven by our love for music and podcasting. Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service with a community of more than 345 million users.
This position is not eligible to be performed in Colorado.

Are you ready to restart your career and build the future? The Amazon Returnship Program offers you an opportunity to reboot your skills, refresh your resume with new experience, and relaunch your journey toward your professional goals in a supportive, real-world environment.

The Returnship Program is a paid 16-week, 100% virtual opportunity available to candidates who are returning to their professional career after experiencing 1 or more years of unemployment and/or underemployment. The successful candidate must meet all of the basic qualifications of this position and can reside anywhere within the United States.

The Consumer Talent Programs and Analytics team is looking for a Business Analyst (BA), Promotions to drive the innovation and analytics behind reimagining promotion processes within Field, Corporate and Tech functions. The BA will use data to support promotion process optimization recommendations, evaluate the impact of new or changed promotion processes, and identify opportunities to improve efficiencies and scale. We are looking for a creative, curious thinker with deep analytics experience who is enthusiastic about supporting a highly innovative team operating in an ambiguous, fast-paced environment. The successful candidate has an interest in talent management in addition to analytics and wants to use that to help grow talent.

Major Responsibilities Include:

Obsess over the voice of employees, HR, and business leaders to ensure their perspectives are at the forefront of science and process development and implementation
Collaborate with the promotions program team to translate business needs into requirements for data objects including metrics, attributes, reports, and dashboards
Design a data metric library for common metric definitions and reporting requirements
Build data visualization reports and tools for self-service consumption using visualization tools like Quicksight or Tableau
Extract, analyze and model relevant data from operations and HR
Identify opportunities to automate and streamline promotion processes
Develop new techniques to process large data sets, address quantitative problems, and recommend white spaces for experimentation
Partner with research science and analytics teams to improve data assets, quality, metrics and insights.
Dedication to problem-solving to deliver innovative solutions to core business problems and employee needs
Draft concise documents communicating results to stakeholders, visualizing data where beneficial to drive decision-making

Company Name: The Ohio State University Wexner Medical Center
Location: Columbus, OH 43210 (The Ohio State University area)
Description:
The Business Operations Analyst (Defensive Line) will provide strategic analysis and essential project management at an executive level. You will lead in the development of high impact projects across all departments, ensuring understanding of deliverables and allocation of resources. You will develop relationships across all levels and geographies to maintain the cultural pulse of the team. We are looking for both strategic framing and project execution. Furthermore, the Defensive Line will analyze resource allocation and budgetary spend.

RESPONSIBILITIES
Areas that play to your strengths
All the responsibilities we'll trust you with:
Expand all
Strategic Planning & Analysis
Contribute to the development of long-term strategic missions and goals across business segments and responsibilities.
Develop Goal tracking and business metric dashboards
Evaluate proper use and allocation of resources across business segments and responsibilities and provide solutions
Engage and secure leadership partnerships
Provide analyses of business goals; identify helpful and harmful factors contributing to their success
Develop scorecards, trackers, tools, and reports that assist the LT (Marketing, Key Accounts, On Premise, and Distribution) in assessing BU performance.
Evaluate proper use and allocation of resources across business segments and recommend solutions to increase efficiency.
Provide qualitative analytic support on projects requiring financial or data analysis.
Business Process Improvement
Work with department and regional leads to evaluate and improve current business and role processes and provide recommendations to leadership on improvements, automation, or new capability opportunities.
Develop improvements to EABU project and annual BP process to increase focus, efficiency, and empowerment with the field and ensure understanding across all levels of your team
Help identify performance gaps across the EABU business and provide solutions to close gaps that increase efficiency and growth.
Project Management
Provide leadership and support from project development to implementation including business case proposals, budgeting, scheduling, managing, and reporting results.
Partner with project leaders to manage documentation and tracking of project milestones, schedules, and resource needs
Develop and enhance project management methodologies ensuring that a streamlined process exists, and ensure that projects are implemented and delivered to meet requirements.
Build relationships across all levels and geographies to monitor the cultural health and pulse of the team and make recommendations based on those assessments.

EXPERIENCE
Your areas of knowledge and expertise
that matter most for this role:
3+ years experience in an project management role
Understanding of P&L, goals, and interactions
Experience in CPG marketing
Understanding of business insights/ category management principles
Can organize meetings and communications
Collaborative with the ability to work with executives across multiple departments
Bachelors in Business, Marketing, Finance or related field
Bachelor’s Degree preferred
Fluent in English, additional language skills an advantage
Travel up to 10%

SEEKING TOP TALENT TO CONNECT WITH OUR ICONIC BRAND
Overview
Tiffany & Co. is one of the most legendary brands in the world today. With a history that spans back to 1837, Tiffany & Co is a jeweler and specialty retailer, whose merchandise offerings include an extensive selection of jewelry, as well as timepieces, sterling silverware, china, crystal, stationery, fragrances and accessories. Tiffany & Co. operates a manufacturing facility in Cumberland, RI where jewelry products unique to our company are crafted by a diverse workforce.
Tiffany offers our employees the resources they need to be successful in an environment that recognizes and rewards creativity, innovation and dedication. We take great pride in helping each of our employees design an exciting future within our enduring tradition of excellence. At Tiffany & Co. an inspired career is life’s best accessory.
The Contract ERP Data Analyst for Tiffany Internal Manufacturing will be responsible for the analysis, modification, and entry of Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) system data to ensure and improve proper system functionality and data integrity. Primary focus will be in the areas of item master definition, Engineering Change Notice (ECN)/ Engineering Change Order (ECO) coordination, Bill of Materials (BOM) and Routing accuracy, inventory consumption accuracy, intercompany material flow, and other internal manufacturing concerns. This position will interface with engineering, manufacturing, supply chain, and life cycle management teams to ensure ERP system information is accurate and change control activity is executed in a timely manner. This role is seated in our Cumberland, RI facility, and projected to be an indefinate contract assignment.
Responsibilities:
Work safely at all times by consistently following safe work procedures for your position, as well as all safety procedures required at your worksite. Update item data and product documentation to support changing business needs, product relocation, product revision, and document search requirements. Drive the pace of change through defined workflows and approval requirements. Work closely with Engineering and New Products teams to manage timely input of all new product data into Tiffany & Co.'s Enterprise Resources Planning (ERP) and document control systems. Ensure item data is aligned with Engineering, Planning, and Manufacturing needs and the product life cycle. Define document approval workflows, monitor document libraries, configure document control software and support documentation control software users. Work to ensure availability of documentation to authorized parties. Play a key role in the expanded use of Tiffany & Co.'s document control systems. Perform large volumes of item master data analysis for inconsistencies across multiple manufacturing branches and recommend appropriate changes. Requires the item setup, bill of materials (BOMs) and routings. Assist in the gathering and reporting of performance Key Performance Indicators (KPI) metrics for Engineering Change Notice (ECN)/Engineering Change Orders (ECO) activity. Drive improvement in change management process through data analysis and effective supervision of approval workflows. Engage users and managers to improve engineering change cycle times.
Qualifications:
Bachelor degree or 5 years related experience in manufacturing or engineering data support in Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) systems, documentation control and support, or product configuration
General understanding of Bill of Materials (BOMs), Routings, and Item Master Data
Very good data analysis skill using Excel
Highly organized
Experienced in JD Edwards, Oracle, SAP, or other modern ERP/MRP system
Experience in ADEPT or other sophisticated document control software

Business Analyst, Used Cars
Description:
The Business Analysis, Used Cars team drives business critical decisions, ensures cross functional alignment of goals and execution, and helps the North America Used Car Organization drive new initiatives forward. We stay focused on aligning the highest-level company priorities with strong day-to-day operations and build capabilities to power hyper-growth.
As the Business Analyst, Used Cars, you will partner with members of the North America Used Cars leadership, Finance and Sales Analytics teams to provide key insights into the fast-growing used car business.
Responsibilities:
§ Analyze key performance indicators, unit economics, inventory data and forecast future performance (includes developing models and decision-making tools)
§ Provide strategic insights and conclusions based on analysis, including concise, digestible arguments with data to present to leadership
§ Identify and implement system improvements to optimize operational flow, used car inventory refurbishment, turn time, and cash conversion cycle
§ Partner with stakeholders across the organization to ensure data integrity and accuracy, and automation of recurring tasks
Qualifications:
§ MBA or bachelor’s degree in Business, Economics and/or equivalent experience
§ Expert modeling skills in Excel required
§ Competency with SQL, Power Query, Power BI, Visio and R strongly desired
§ Proficiency with Tableau or other data visualization tools
§ Experience working with large, complex and incomplete data sets
§ 3+ years in cross-functional project management experience
§ Very strong quantitative/analytical skillset
§ Superior business judgement – ability to flex between big picture thinking, understand and distill complex ideas, and analyze data to drive strategic objectives
§ Problem solver that is action-oriented with ability to look at problems in new ways
§ Trustworthy and discreet with highly sensitive non-public information
§ Passion for Tesla’s products and belief in Tesla’s mission to accelerate the transition to sustainable energy
§ Location – Fremont, California (Bay Area)
*Authorization to work in the US without sponsorship*

As a full time Tesla employee you will receive full benefits from day 1 for you and your dependents.

3 medical plan choices with $0 paycheck contribution
Vision & dental plans (including orthodontic coverage)
Company paid Life, AD&D, short-term and long-term disability
401(k), Employee Stock Purchase Plans, and other financial benefits
