Job Title: Quantitative Business Analyst, Analytics and Decision Suppor...
Description:
This role may also be located in our Playa Vista, CA campus.
Note: By applying to this position you will have an opportunity to share your preferred working location from the following: San Bruno, CA, USA; Los Angeles, CA, USA; New York, NY, USA.
Minimum qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Computer Science, a quantitative field, or equivalent practical experience.
3 years of experience in working with datasets and conducting data analysis using SQL and Python.
Experience creating executive communications (e.g., memos, slide decks, etc.) and presenting to non-technical/analytics audiences.
Preferred qualifications:

Master’s degree in a quantitative discipline (e.g., Business Analytics, Statistics, Computer Science, Economics, Math, Physics, Engineering).
Experience designing data models or table schema.
Experience in application of machine learning such as supervised/unsupervised learning, forecasting, predictive modeling, etc.
Experience working in consulting, direct-to-consumer, or similar industries.
Experience working with multiple functions/domains and managing projects.
About the job
The YouTube Strategy, Business Operations (BizOps), and Analytics (SBA) team’s mission is to make YouTube commercially sustainable and more valuable, by identifying and steering the business towards opportunities, guiding the organization to make the best possible decisions, and enabling effective implementation and operations. With teams world wide, SBA teams work with YouTube leadership across the product, engineering, and business organizations to address challenges and opportunities across the company, help chart the long-term direction for YouTube, and provide analytics and decision support for planning.
As a Quantitative Business Analyst within Analytics and Decision Support, you'll be part of a community of technical data analysts who work on impactful projects analyzing the content and distribution partnerships, the creator and user ecosystem, and business generation. You will help guide business leadership on optimizing the effectiveness and efficiency of our partner, operations, and business-facing teams. You will work on strategic business challenges centered on the economics of YouTube’s content business. You will provide analytical support for the business teams, including performance measurement, causal impact, estimation, predictive modeling, and metric definition.
At YouTube, we believe that everyone deserves to have a voice, and that the world is a better place when we listen, share, and build community through our stories. We work together to give everyone the power to share their story, explore what they love, and connect with one another in the process. Working at the intersection of cutting-edge technology and boundless creativity, we move at the speed of culture with a shared goal to show people the world. We explore new ideas, solve real problems, and have fun — and we do it all together.
Responsibilities
Act as a thought leader in the creation of planning, strategy, objectives and key results (OKRs), and KPI development for the business domain. Make strategic and operational recommendations to achieve goals.
Utilize excellent communication skills to work cross-functionally with business leaders, Marketing, Operations, and Product teams in order to identify opportunities, design, and assess improvements to YouTube’s business.
Make business recommendations using effective presentation skills, conveying findings at multiple levels including executive leadership, managers, and peers through visual displays of quantitative information.
Manage larger strategic and cross-functional initiatives both on an on-going basis and on an ad-hoc basis.
Conduct non-routine analyses, including data gathering from large and complex datasets, processing, analysis employing advanced statistical and machine learning methods, with ongoing deliverables to improve the quality of Insights teams.
Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.

Why Housecall Pro?

Help us build solutions that build better lives. At Housecall Pro, we show up to work every day to make a difference for real people: the home service professionals that support America's 100 million homes.

We're all about the Pro, and dedicate our days to helping them streamline operations, scale their businesses, and—ultimately—save time so they can be with their families and live well. We care deeply about our customers and foster a culture where our company, employees, and Pros grow and succeed together. Leadership is as focused on growing team members' careers as they expect their teams to be on creating solutions for Pros.

We also offer:

A generous benefits program that supports the whole you with medical, dental, vision, life, disability, and 401(k)
Paid holidays and flexible, take-it-as-you-need-it paid time off
Equity in a rapidly growing startup backed by top-tier VCs
Monthly tech reimbursements
A culture built on innovation that values big ideas, no matter where they come from

Let's talk if you are:

Curious: You possess a growth mindset with a desire for experimentation - you don't rest until you find the "Why" and "How".

Collaborative: You will straddle the line between analytics and the business to help bridge the gap and improve efficiency using business intelligence and database tools such as Tableau and SQL.

Partner-focused: You will help guide the business in improving processes, products, services and software through data analysis that drive our Customer Success interactions.

Logical and Data-driven: You find the problem, analyze the data, and implement a solution without being told how to do it. You are able to use both your analyst skills and creativity to find ways to build and improve processes within the business.

Passionate: Passion for learning, for new experiences, and for being the best at what you do.

What you'll be doing:

Become an expert in financial technology products and services, and gain a deep understanding of the entire Fintech ecosystem
Drive results by supporting business and product stakeholders in identifying and answering key questions through data-driven analysis
Provide analysis and identify opportunities to grow our Fintech product lines including payments, financing, card issuance, and more
Build reporting for new and existing Fintech products; monitor and report results


Finding opportunities to improve the business and executing them: This is the fun part. We know where we are and where we need to be, so how do we get there?

Interpret data and findings and translates them into feasible options, communicate these back to the business stakeholders
Work with stakeholders and team to prioritize requirements
May include leading other analytics resources

Qualifications

Bachelor or Master degree, preferably in business administration, finance, economics or data analytics
2-3 years of related work experience (examples: customer success analytics, data analysis, process management, and project management)
High analytical ability
Curious, proactive and driven for impact
Experience with SQL
Advanced excel skills or experienced in the regular use of business intelligence (BI) tools such as Tableau, Looker, or Demo

 Compensation: Min $75,000 OTE

Founded in 2013, Housecall Pro champions home service professionals by giving them the tools to work simpler and grow smarter across all aspects of their business. Our core SaaS software platform helps Pros with scheduling, dispatching, job management, invoicing, payment processing, marketing, and more. We support more than 20,000 businesses and have over 400 ambitious, mission-driven, genuinely fun-loving employees in San Diego, Denver, and all over the world. If you want to do work that impacts real people, supported by a team that'll invest in you every step of the way, we'd love to hear from you.

Housecall Pro celebrates diversity and we are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees with equal treatment and opportunity in all aspects of recruitment, selection, and employment without regard to gender, race, religion, national origin, ethnicity, disability, gender identity/expression, sexual orientation, veteran or military status, or any other category protected under the law. Housecall Pro is an equal opportunity employer; committed to an environment free from discrimination, harassment, and retaliation. #LI-SG1

requirements.Coordinate and communicate closely with the operations analysts to monitor productivity rates, case review quality, and consistency, process efficiency, system availability, and employee skillset mix to maintain continuous operations.Lead the implementation of project requirement changes as directed by the customer and/or project leadership by modifying SOPs, process tools, and job aids.Support the development, implementation, and maintenance of the Quality Audit Plan, as required and directed by the Quality Assurance Manager.Support the development and submission of project deliverables, as assigned.Support and provide input on the development of training materials to ensure operational readiness of the project team.Participate in and support the project and/or customer meetings, as required.Assist the operations staff with any barriers, including identifying and defining needed changes to the case management system, improving process documents, reviewing and may be used in lieu of a Bachelor’s Degree.Continuous Process Improvement, Six Sigma, or related training is a plus.Knowledge/Skills/Abilities:Ability to assess and improve operational processes and workflows.Ability to interpret customer requirements and efficiently operationalize them.Ability to document business requirements, create operational process documents, and job aids.Software Tool Position:  Senior Data Analyst (CalvertHealth – Prince Frederick, MD)(Apply to: https://pm.healthcaresource.com/cs/cmh/#/job/5146)Why CalvertHealth? CalvertHealth was established over 100 years ago and remains an independent, non-profit community hospital committed to providing safe, quality patient care. Be part of an amazing team performing life-changing work to make a difference in the lives of community members. Prince Frederick, MD is a bayside community which offers the best of rural living with easy access to urban resources. Surround by water, Calvert County offers the tranquility of the Chesapeake Bay while at the same time is within 40 minutes of Washington, DC and Annapolis, MD. Enjoy a stress-free commute, excellent schools, and beautiful natural resources.Note:  This position requires onsite work once per week.What you will do: Assist in analysis and development of enterprise-wide financial and clinical reporting, and creating and maintaining reports and delivery systems for operational and strategic decision making. Uses available clinical data tools to extract and analyze data from appropriate internal and external data sources.Meet demands and requirements from the organization to provide a powerful and versatile reporting platform of data/information from available databases.Develop tools on the data analytics platform to assist leaders in accessing data.Create data reports to better meet customer needs.Use available clinical data tools to extract and analyze data from appropriate internal and external data sources.Ensure data integrity is maintained at all times between analytic systems and transactional systems.What you will need: Position requires a Master's Degree in Data Analytics, clinical field, or 5 years equivalent combination of education and experience in related area.Minimum one year prior experience administering Microsoft SQL Server, including custom report writing, required; with Meditech Data Repository, preferred.Previous experience in an information systems position or hospital department supporting IT applications preferred.Previous experience with writing efficient SQL queries and reports, practical knowledge of SQL statements and constructs such as queries, stored procedures, and functions, preferred.What We Offer: A Clear Vision: CalvertHealth's amazing team of dedicated staff have a clear vision to make a difference in every life touched.Professional Enrichment:  CalvertHealth invests in its employees with an above average educational assistance program and certification pay. CalvertHealth also offers competitive compensation and benefits as well as paid meal periods.Life-changing Work:  Recognized and rated as one of the top Health Systems in the State of Maryland based on quality and safety metrics.Growth:  Completed a recent expansion costing nearly $50 million dollars, providing state-of-the-art private patient rooms. Recently completed a $5 million renovation project to the Behavioral Health Unit making CalvertHealth home to the largest mental health facility in Southern MD.Culture:  Engaged and competent teams with professional leadership in a community environment.Job Type: Full-timeBenefits:401(k)401(k) matchingDental insuranceEmployee assistance programEmployee discountFlexible scheduleFlexible spending accountHealth insuranceHealth savings accountLife insurancePaid time offProfessional development assistanceReferral programTuition reimbursementVision insuranceSchedule:8 hour shiftDay shiftMonday to FridayCOVID-19 considerations:New hires must be vaccinated against Covid-19 or obtain an approved medical or religious waiver prior to an offer.Application Question(s):What is your desired salary?Experience:SQL: 1 year (Required)Work Location: One location

Job Title: Business Systems Analyst, Business Intelligence and Analytic...
Description:
Minimum qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering, or related field, or equivalent practical experience.
8 years of experience in system implementation projects (e.g. requirements documentation, systems configuration, test documentation/execution, issue identification and resolution).
Experience developing/architecting BI and analytics solutions including data warehousing, Power BI, data engineering, and/or ETL warehousing.

Preferred qualifications:

Master's degree in Computer Science or a related technical field.
Experience with one or more of the following functional areas: finance, FP&A, Profit & Loss, Human Resources, service systems.
Experience integrating and or developing with one of the following technologies: SQL, Informatica, Tableau, Pantheon, SAP BW BI.
About the job
At Google, we work at lightning speed. So when things get in the way of progress, the Business Systems Integration team steps in to remove those roadblocks. The team identifies time-consuming internal processes and then builds solutions that are reliable and scalable enough to work within the size and scope of the company. You listen to and translate Googler needs into high-level technical specifications, design and develop recommended systems and consult with Google executives to ensure smooth implementation. Whether battling large system processes or leveraging our homegrown suite of Google products for Googlers themselves, you help Googlers work faster and more efficiently.

At Google, data comes first, and the BSA team is at the heart of that promise. We are part of the broader Corporate Engineering group at Google, and our team is responsible for building holistic data storage, transformation and warehousing solutions that empower POps, finance, and Business Intelligence (BI) organizations with self-service reporting capabilities and enable them to make data driven decisions. We partner closely with engineering and platform teams as well as other BI teams within Google to build, deploy and support BI systems that fulfill both analytical and operational data needs across organizations.
Behind everything our users see online is the architecture built by the Technical Infrastructure team to keep it running. From developing and maintaining our data centers to building the next generation of Google platforms, we make Google's product portfolio possible. We're proud to be our engineers' engineers and love voiding warranties by taking things apart so we can rebuild them. We keep our networks up and running, ensuring our users have the best and fastest experience possible.
Responsibilities
Work with cross-functional teams to understand process and system dependencies, and have a good handle on data flow.
Closely collaborate with business users to translate data requirements into clearly defined technical requirements.
Design and develop data warehouse solutions for business processes using Google-internal tools and technologies as well as 3rd party tools.
Support existing data pipelines. Troubleshoot and fix production issues and implement enhancements in existing data pipelines and reports.
Participate in system implementation projects (i.e. requirements documentation, systems configuration, test documentation/execution, issue identification and resolution).
Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.

Job Description Summary
Responsible for activities and processes that help the sales organization achieve business objectives
Operates with some autonomy but are typically subject to standard sales practices and procedures. The role is subject to regular review of sales results. Some judgment may be required but this is typically with guidance. May be responsible for medium-sized sales territories.
Job Description
Roles and Responsibilities
Sales force effectiveness, productivity analysis, allocation of resources and territory coverage, sales incentives, Salesforce CRM platform and tools, lead for commercial planning and forecasting, Inquiry to Order (ITO) processes, ITO lead for business reviews. Cleans and maintains data in Commercial and other core systems (CRMs, SFDC, ERPs, etc.).
Developing in-depth knowledge of sales territory, product lines, markets, sales processes or customer groups. Uses prior experience and acquired commercial expertise to execute policy/strategy.
In-depth understanding of key business drivers; uses this understanding to accomplish own work. In-depth understanding of how work of own team integrates with other teams and contributes to the area.
Most decisions are within a defined framework, but some autonomy in the final decisions for a project, product line, market, sales process or customers. Uses prior experience and on-the-job training to solve straightforward tasks. Has access to technical skills and analytic thinking required to solve problems. May use multiple internal sources outside of own team to arrive at decisions.
A job at this level is likely to be an individual contributor, with proven interpersonal skills. Communication with direct colleagues and the business about design and coordination services rendered. Provides informal guidance to new team members. Explains complex information to others in straightforward situations.
Required Qualifications
For roles outside of the USA- This role requires advanced experience in the Sales & Sales Operations. Knowledge level is comparable to a Bachelor's degree from an accredited university or college ( or a high school diploma with relevant experience).
For roles in USA - Bachelor's degree from an accredited university or college (or a high school diploma / GED with at least 6 years of experience in Job Family Group(s)/Function(s)).

Our AI Data Solutions vastly enhance AI systems across a range of applications from advanced smart products, to better search results, to expanded speech recognition, to more human-like bot interactions and so much more.Position Open: The position will allow you to work from home as an Independent Contractor on a flexible schedule of up to 20 hours per week completing tasks in a web-based evaluation tool. The tasks will involve determining the relevance and accuracy of information by performing online research and referring to guidelines provided to you. You will be rating tasks to validate data. You will be helping to authenticate data that will be used in live online search tools and applications by millions of users across the world.Ideal Candidate: Candidates for this position will need to have good research skills and a strong understanding of local and national information. Cultural, geographical, social media and current affairs knowledge are important in this role.Job Requirements: · You must speak and write in English at an idiomatic level.· You must be living in the United States· Working knowledge of local and national geographical areas· Passing an online evaluation to demonstrate capability of reading and applying the guidelines· Experience/know-how of using online maps, search engines and website research· You must have familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media and cultural affairs in United States· Access to and use of a broadband internet connection and associated computer and software to perform the work, all provided at your own expensePart-time hours: up to 20 per weekThis is a freelance independent contractor position.Job Types: Part-time, TemporaryPay: Up to $14.50 per hourBenefits:Flexible scheduleWork Location: One location

Position:  Senior Data Analyst (CalvertHealth – Prince Frederick, MD)(Apply to: https://pm.healthcaresource.com/cs/cmh/#/job/5146)Why CalvertHealth? CalvertHealth was established over 100 years ago and remains an independent, non-profit community hospital committed to providing safe, quality patient care. Be part of an amazing team performing life-changing work to make a difference in the lives of community members. Prince Frederick, MD is a bayside community which offers the best of rural living with easy access to urban resources. Surround by water, Calvert County offers the tranquility of the Chesapeake Bay while at the same time is within 40 minutes of Washington, DC and Annapolis, MD. Enjoy a stress-free commute, excellent schools, and beautiful natural resources.Note:  This position requires onsite work once per week.What you will do: Assist in analysis and development of enterprise-wide financial and clinical reporting, and creating and maintaining reports and delivery systems for operational and strategic decision making. Uses available clinical data tools to extract and analyze data from appropriate internal and external data sources.Meet demands and requirements from the organization to provide a powerful and versatile reporting platform of data/information from available databases.Develop tools on the data analytics platform to assist leaders in accessing data.Create data reports to better meet customer needs.Use available clinical data tools to extract and analyze data from appropriate internal and external data sources.Ensure data integrity is maintained at all times between analytic systems and transactional systems.What you will need: Position requires a Master's Degree in Data Analytics, clinical field, or 5 years equivalent combination of education and experience in related area.Minimum one year prior experience administering Microsoft SQL Server, including custom report writing, required; with Meditech Data Repository, preferred.Previous experience in an information systems position or hospital department supporting IT applications preferred.Previous experience with writing efficient SQL queries and reports, practical knowledge of SQL statements and constructs such as queries, stored procedures, and functions, preferred.What We Offer: A Clear Vision: CalvertHealth's amazing team of dedicated staff have a clear vision to make a difference in every life touched.Professional Enrichment:  CalvertHealth invests in its employees with an above average educational assistance program and certification pay. CalvertHealth also offers competitive compensation and benefits as well as paid meal periods.Life-changing Work:  Recognized and rated as one of the top Health Systems in the State of Maryland based on quality and safety metrics.Growth:  Completed a recent expansion costing nearly $50 million dollars, providing state-of-the-art private patient rooms. Recently completed a $5 million renovation project to the Behavioral Health Unit making CalvertHealth home to the largest mental health facility in Southern MD.Culture:  Engaged and competent teams with professional leadership in a community environment.Job Type: Full-timeBenefits:401(k)401(k) matchingDental insuranceEmployee assistance programEmployee discountFlexible scheduleFlexible spending accountHealth insuranceHealth savings accountLife insurancePaid time offProfessional development assistanceReferral programTuition reimbursementVision insuranceSchedule:8 hour shiftDay shiftMonday to FridayCOVID-19 considerations:New hires must be vaccinated against Covid-19 or obtain an approved medical or religious waiver prior to an offer.Application Question(s):What is your desired salary?Experience:SQL: 1 year (Required)Work Location: One location

Join us as we work towards Microsoft’s mission of empowering every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. The Modern Life Experiences (MLX) team is expanding its global footprint and we need your help in bringing consumer products directly to the people who need them. We are agile team at Microsoft with the goal of developing consumer features for the modern workforce across surfaces and platforms. We work collaboratively and iterate quickly. We keep alive an inherently startup-like, risk-taking culture but we also take the responsibility seriously to carry one of the world's most recognizable software brand names - Microsoft. Our mission is to build customer-driven experiences that transform personal data into personal value and empower modern achievers and families to accomplish what matters most. By creating easy-to-use mobile and web experiences, we are helping individuals and families gain peace of mind, to ultimately allow them to focus on what’s most important: each other.
We are looking for a Data Scientist with passion and knowledge of A/B testing, causal inference with observational data and driving growth business metrics and customer lifecycle to join our cross-functional data team. You’ll sit right at the junction of product, marketing and engineering to help us understand the current state of our customers, come up with hypothesis for improving the products and work with feature and content experiments. You’ll contribute to the data integrity and constantly help improve our internal processes. This is a great opportunity to apply statistical and more advanced data science techniques to engagement, retention, and growth programs that have meaningful and visible impact on our business.
Responsibilities
Work with Product to define business metrics and identify opportunities to growth.
Propose and refine experimental designs to optimize business strategies across product surfaces and marketing channels
Communicate campaign and experiment results to internal audiences, make recommendations on product roadmap and decisions
Apply advanced analytical and modeling methods to improve user retention, engagement and conversion metrics
Provide comprehensive analysis of funnel conversion, perform ad-hoc deep-dive on user behavior, and visualize the findings in dashboards that are the base of product decision making
Passion to learn new techniques
Qualifications
Great understanding of statistical analysis and modeling
Great understanding of experimental design and AB testing
1-2 years of experience using analytics to solve problems, understand user behavior and drive business decisions
Experience with data collection and building data pipelines (Hadoop/Spark or COSMOS/Scope)
Familiarity of funnel optimization best practices that can positively impact key business metrics
Ability to collaborate with product and partner teams and streamline requirements in actionable deliverables
Machine learning modeling experience
Experience with a program language like python, R or SQL
BS/BA Degree in Math, Engineering, CS or another Quantitative field

As a member of our Business Analysis team, you'll play a crucial role in identifying, improving, and developing technology solutions that drive our strategic goals. This is a tremendous opportunity to learn about high-priority initiatives and collaborate with colleagues throughout the firm. Working at the intersection of business and technology, you'll sharpen your understanding of business processes and data analysis, while continuing to develop your leadership, management, and communication skills. No matter where your career ultimately takes you, you'll make a meaningful impact and lasting connections with outstanding colleagues and mentors.
This role requires a wide variety of strengths and capabilities, including:
BS/BA degree or equivalent experience
A strong understanding of at least one business function in the firm, as well as a broader understanding of other areas.
Proficiency in business applications, data usage, and management
Ability to liaison between lines of business and the development team, while working with a wide range of stakeholders and collaborating with your team
Ability to work collaboratively in teams and develop meaningful relationships to achieve common goals

Job Title: Business Intelligence Analyst, Digital Marketing Analytics
Description: Cygnus Education is a fast-paced, rapidly growing marketing and technology company serving the higher education market. We are passionate about utilizing innovative, data-driven digital marketing strategies to drive best-in-class results for non-profit and for-profit online and campus-based colleges, universities, and technical schools.In 2021, Cygnus was recognized as the 596thfastest growing private company in the United States by Inc5000. Due to significant growth, we are looking for an experienced Business Intelligence Analyst, Digital Marketing Analytics to join the company.As a passionate and data-driven BI Analyst, you will partner with Performance Media and Client Success to provide meaningful business insights and optimization of online marketing campaigns. The BI Analyst will produce critical analyses, reports, and actionable insights to support Cygnus’ business and help its clients meet – and exceed – their goals.CharacteristicsYou have a data driven mindset with an exceptional attention to detail.You look forward to working with Performance Media and Client Success to move our clients from reviewing numbers to leveraging data to inform business decisions.You are obsessed with going beyond reporting the numbers to helping communicate, always looking to take analyses one step further to fully answer “why”.You believe that data can tell a fascinating story.You want to have an impact - driving higher revenues and organizational efficiencies, as well as improving all applicable KPIs across delivery departments.Responsibilities: Provide meaningful insights to various stakeholders and departments within the organizationIndependently mine data, discover learnings, and communicate findings through reports and presentationsBe instrumental in mining client data to help inform key inputs like audience, messaging, channels, etc. in marketing enablement strategies and roadmaps.Provide predictive outcomes and/or insights on business and/or marketing decisions.Clearly communicate insights and recommendations to the team backed by dataDesign and maintain dashboards for various stakeholders in the organization to improve company performance.Analyze reports in VEGA (Cygnus proprietary technology solution) and/or analytics platforms to address client data insights and collaborate with strategists to identify actionable recommendationsCollaborate with data engineers and product designers to implement the data architecture and database designPlan and manage multiple parallel projects with competing deadlinesMaintain necessary processes, controls and procedures to ensure data accuracy and organizational functionality and comply with the various regulatory, privacy, and security policies and regulationsExecute in an intense, fast-paced, and highly iterative environmentQualificationsBachelor’s degree (B.S./B.A.) in Business Administration, Marketing, Mathematics or other quantitative fields. TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok has global offices including Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Mumbai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul, and Tokyo. We are now looking for talented individuals to join us in 2022 - people who want to inspire creativity and co-create the future with TikTok.

Our team uses data analysis to help drive the company’s monetization strategy and operations. We’re looking for a Business Intelligence (BI) analyst to drive analytics initiatives that guide operational excellence for our Americas business. You will have a ground floor opportunity to shape TikTok’s growth and monetization efforts in Americas.

In this role, you will:

Collect, process, and clean data from disparate sources using SQL, Python, and BI tools to investigate key business trends, issues and opportunities
Develop scalable analytical solutions such as tables, datasets, models and dashboards
Conduct Ad-hoc analysis that helps the business better understand key value drivers and growth opportunities
Effectively communicate actionable insights across all levels to inform monetization efforts
Work closely with cross-functional partners, including local monetization teams, sales & sales operations, international strategy and data teams to drive analytical initiatives to completion
Pursuing a BA/BS degree in math, statistics, data science, business analytics, engineering, computer science or other quantitative major
Solid analytical aptitude with strong exposure or interest in strategy
Strong programming (SQL, Python, R etc) and statistical modeling skills
Expertise in BI visualization tools such as Tableau, Looker is a plus
Self-starter attitude: You’re someone who can initiate and drive complex analysis to completion with minimal guidance and then synthesize and communicate insights
Get-it-done mindset: You’re motivated to work hard and efficiently in a fast-paced, cross-cultural environment.

Job Title: MPP Strategic Senior Analyst Business Development
Description:
MPP Strategic Sr. Analyst Business Development
Do you have your four-year degree and at least two years of Sales or Marketing experience? Are you passionate about working with customers and building relationships? Join our Dell Member Purchase Program (MPP) team!
Our Member Purchase Program team is a strategic function within our Consumer sales organization. The team is focused on developing new business opportunities and interacts directly with customers on a daily basis. Account Managers are responsible for leveraging our commercial relationships to develop new and innovative ways to reach our consumer customer base. You will be responsible for driving sales by securing marketing placements and developing unique program opportunities within your specific set of accounts. You will find creative ways to engage key influencers to gain their support in active promotion of our offers and campaigns. Our account managers work with large amounts of information and must be comfortable drawing conclusions and driving actions from their analysis.
You will:
Utilize sales tools and marketing resources to drive balanced growth between core account set and new account acquisition.
Research new account acquisition opportunities leveraging the Retention, Acquisition and Development account and share of wallet data.
Use sales tools to identify program coordinators, either in existing or prospective accounts through SalesForce and by engaging with segment sales teams.
Recommend business solutions considering customer needs and Dell interests. Build relationships with customers based on knowledge of Dell’s technology, products, services. Come up with unique, creative solutions and program components for certain industries or segment verticals.
Measure and track account-level financial performance of existing accounts. Leverage data to assess efficiency of demand gen efforts. Makes educated decisions based on synthesis of account information and data analysis. Is able to re-prioritize focus based on account trajectory, growth or decline.
Work with Employee Purchase Program account support resources to effectively channel and resolve customer and segment partner escalations. Engage outbound sales support team to follow up on prospective leads and prioritization of outbound call activities.
Assist in execution of marketing activities intended to increase customer opt-in rates.
Take the first step towards your dream career
Every Dell Technologies team member brings something unique to the table. Here’s what we are looking for with this role:
Essential Requirements:
Good understanding of relevant IT solutions, market dynamics and technology. Good knowledge of the organization's business model, customer base and segmentation strategy.
Good knowledge of marketing principles, application and brand management. Good analytical skills, particularly with statistics and competitive analysis.
Good knowledge of internal processes.
Good negotiation skills, including cross-cultural negotiation experience
Good understanding of accounting principles, primarily profit and loss statements.
Bachelor's degree
2+ year of sales, account management, and retail experience; experience in Marketing a plus
Able to articulate to customers all MPP program elements including payroll deduction, subsidy programs, Dell Advantage and other promotions (training will be provided). Must be comfortable presenting to customer executives in a formal setting (e.g., Dell Executive Business Center, Virtual meetings).
Must be able to engage Relationship sales teams to promote the program both internally and externally.
Here’s our story; now tell us yours
Dell Technologies helps organizations and individuals build a brighter digital tomorrow. Our company is made up of more than 150,000 people, located in over 180 locations around the world. We’re proud to be a diverse and inclusive team and have an endless passion for our mission to drive human progress.
What’s most important to us is that you are respected, feel like you can be yourself and have the opportunity to do the best work of your life - while still having a life. We offer excellent benefits, bonus programs, flexible work arrangements, a variety of career development opportunities, employee resource groups, and much more.
We started with computers, but we didn’t stop there. We are helping customers move into the future with multi-cloud, AI and machine learning through the most innovative technology and services portfolio for the data era. Join us and become a part of what’s next in technology, starting today.
You can also learn more about us by reading our latest Diversity and Inclusion Report and our plan to make the world a better place by 2030 here.
Dell is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at Dell are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, national, social or ethnic origin, sex (including pregnancy), age, physical, mental or sensory disability, HIV Status, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital, civil union or domestic partnership status, past or present military service, family medical history or genetic information, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. Dell will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics. Dell encourages applicants of all ages. Read the full Employment Opportunity Policy here.

Job Title: Business Intelligence Analyst Senior - Bank (100% Remote Ava...
Description:
Purpose of Job
We are seeking a talented Business Intelligence Analyst Senior for either our San Antonio, TX, Plano, TX or Phoenix, AZ facility. This person may also work remotely in a 100% Remote Work Environment.


Analyzes complex business problems and issues using data from internal and external sources to provide insight to analysts and decision makers. Identifies and interprets trends and patterns in datasets to locate influences. Creates specifications for reports and analysis based on business needs and required or available data elements. May participate in consultation to users and lead cross functional teams to address business issues. Prototypes solutions for displaying information based on business needs.
Job Requirements
About USAA
USAA knows what it means to serve. We facilitate the financial security of millions of U.S. military members and their families. This singular mission requires a dedication to innovative thinking at every level.
USAA Careers – World Class Benefits (31 seconds)
Primary Responsibilities:
Identifies and manages existing and emerging risks that stem from business activities and the job role.
Ensures risks associated with business activities are effectively identified, measured, monitored, and controlled.
Follows written risk and compliance policies and procedures for business activities.
Leads and participates in gathering complex and often unique business requirements by partnering with customers to define the business problem and data needs.
Utilizes an advanced understanding of multiple data structures and sources to lead the development and implementation of business intelligence solutions, which may include data visualization, data transformation, or data collection.
Strategically partners and works with IT execution teams on the development of analytic infrastructures, data engineering, or related business intelligence efforts. Includes collaborating on the design and implementation of technical standards and governance practices.
Applies data visualization best practices - often selecting the right data ‘tool for the job’ to identify and interpret trends or patterns while following standard Enterprise branding.
Understands the value of prototyping, usability, and the end-user experience to maximize the impact of the final data visualization product (dashboard, report, insight, or analysis).
Acts as a trusted data visualization advisor to the stakeholder/end-user in order to drive business value. Provides system thinking to influence relevant data, information, and application architecture decisions.
May serve as an Agile champion who is responsible for the methodology, execution, and team education on best practices.
May provide internal team leadership by providing guidance on business intelligence tools, techniques and processes.
Actively participates in industry, COE, or other discipline-relevant groups/panels to keep abreast of industry trends and share best practices with team.
Minimum Requirements:
Bachelor's degree in quantitative analytics field such as Economics, Finance, Statistics, Mathematics, Actuarial Sciences, Operations Research, Data and/or Business Analysis, Data Science or other business-related discipline.
4 years work experience in statistics, mathematics or quantitative analytics or related experience can be substituted in lieu of a degree in addition to the minimum years of work experience required.
6 years of progressive functional business experience within the respective industry of responsibility (i.e. P&C, Bank, Finance, etc.) to include 4 years of experience in data & analytics OR Advanced degree in Business, Science, Finance, Mathematics, Economics, or relevant discipline and 4 years of experience in data/analytics or functional business experience within the respective industry of responsibility (i.e. P&C, Bank, Finance, etc.)
Demonstrated experience in the identification of innovative approaches to address moderately complex business problems and solutions.
Advanced experience developing business deliverables that leverage business intelligence platforms, data management platforms, or SQL-based languages (Tableau, Business Objects, Snowflake, Hadoop, Netezza, NoSQL, ANSI SQL, or related).
Proven, expert ability to leverage or build business knowledge through meaningful partnerships at the individual contributor, leadership, and EMG levels.
Demonstrated expert-level communication skills with the ability to deliver presentations to all levels of management.
Demonstrated the ability to embed intuitive story telling within the business intelligence solutions and platforms including concise presentation of complex technical details.
When you apply for this position, you will be required to answer some initial questions. This will take approximately 5 minutes. Once you begin the questions you will not be able to finish them at a later time and you will not be able to change your responses.
Preferred Experience:
Experience in dashboard development, visualization, data integration and performance reporting using tools like Tableau.
Experience analyzing unstructured and structured data and in cloud environments like AWS or Snowflake.
Experience in Payments processes and/or analytics.
Experience working with IT using Agile framework.
The above description reflects the details considered necessary to describe the principal functions of the job and should not be construed as a detailed description of all the work requirements that may be performed in the job.
Compensation:
USAA has an effective process for assessing market data and establishing ranges to ensure we remain competitive. You are paid within the salary range based on your experience and market position. The salary range for this position is: $88,200 - $158,900* ( this does not include geographic differential that may be applied based on your work location)
Employees may be eligible for pay incentives based on overall corporate and individual performance or at the discretion of the USAA Board of Directors.
Geographical Differential: Geographic pay differential is additional pay provided to eligible employees working in locations where market pay levels are above the national average.
Shift premium: will be addressed on an individual-basis for applicable roles that are consistently scheduled for non-core hours.
Benefits:
At USAA our employees enjoy best-in-class benefits to support their physical, financial, and emotional wellness. These benefits include comprehensive medical, dental and vision plans, 401(k), pension, life insurance, parental benefits, adoption assistance, paid time off program with paid holidays plus 16 paid volunteer hours, and various wellness programs. Additionally, our career path planning and continuing education assists employees with their professional goals.
Please click on the link below for more details.
USAA Total Rewards

Are you passionate about leveraging large volumes of data sets to draw deep insights designed to improve business strategies and customer experience with marketing programs to drive impact? If yes then IDEAs (Insights Data Engineering and Analytics) group is looking for qualified candidates to work with us with us to leverage the power of data, the skill of analysis, the science of learning to empower our stakeholders with insights on growth levers.
Our team plays a key role in providing data and analytics for Microsoft 365 and owns the end to end reporting and owns key data assets utilized for leadership review.
Responsibilities
Conduct data analyses deliver insights and learnings on marketing initiatives / programs (BI) for Commercial Managed segments.
Define, generate, and monitor KPI metrics for different Modern Workplace solutions and Land and Expand initiatives
Automate reporting and provide exploration capability for reporting users
Partner with multiple marketing and engineering teams to explore data, design learning plan, and conduct analyses
Present insights and learnings to key stakeholders / executives with data backed story telling
Provide thought leadership on modern workplace marketing based on the insights / learning from analyses
Qualifications
2+ years of experience in analyzing large volumes of data, extracting insights processing large data sets using SQL or SQL-like scripting language
2+ years of experience in processing and building visualizations using reporting tool as Power BI
Strong skills in statistics/machine learning languages and packages such as Python, R, Azure ML
Excellent written and oral communication skills, particularly the ability to synthesize complex issues/scenarios into easy-to-understand concepts
Attention to detail with self-discipline and a drive for results
Demonstrated ability to work in ambiguous situations and across organizational boundaries
Experience breaking down problems into hypothesis that can be analyzed and validated to drive data driven decisions with strong story telling
Bachelors or Master’s degree in statistics, data science, applied mathematics, computer science, econometrics or a related field, or equivalent alternative education, skills, and/or practical equivalent experience

Who we are: At PayPal (NASDAQ: PYPL), we believe that every person has the right to participate fully in the global economy. Our mission is to democratize financial services to ensure that everyone, regardless of background or economic standing, has access to affordable, convenient, and secure products and services to take control of their financial lives. We’re a purpose-driven company, and our beliefs are the foundation of how we conduct business every day. We’re guided by our core values of Inclusion, Innovation, Collaboration, and Wellness. Collectively, these values inspire us to work together as One Team with our customers at the center of everything we do, and to take care of ourselves, each other, and the communities in which we live and work. We challenge the status quo, ask questions, and find solutions. Join us as we enable the hopes, dreams, and ambitions of millions of people around the world.
Job Description Summary: The PayPal Developer Experience team ensures the 1,000+ internal product delivery teams developing and delivering PayPal software can do so with minimal friction and maximum speed. It provides the tools, processes, and best practices that guide the Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC) for all developers and all software stacks. This group helps simplify the process of delivering software so that engineers can spend more time developing and less time managing infrastructure and their pipeline. This is a critical function that ensures every team has the tools and support they need to stay in flow and deliver products globally to compete and win the $5 Trillian dollar FinTech market. This critical role helps quantify the process of software development at PayPal and develops insights that drive investment strategy for ongoing improvement. It requires an understanding of the key feedback loops that drive developers daily, knowledge of what factors contribute to software quality, and development of hypothesis that will enable developers to work more productively. By deeply understanding these processes, designing the data strategy, and turning the resulting data into useful intelligence that can inform product strategy, you will play an important role in PayPal’s ability to deliver market-winning products. It requires partnering closely with key leaders in the groups delivering developer services and helping them build strong, data-driven strategies to drive their roadmap.
Job Description:
Roles and Responsibilities:
Translate business questions into structured analysis and data analytics into business insights
Strong communication with business acumen who can work efficiently and effectively with key stakeholders across multiple teams and geographies to define and produce business metrics and insights within a given time frame
Develop a strong understanding of different data sources, and strategically implement data flows for robustness and scalability
Perform analysis on key business trends from different perspectives and package the insights into easily consumable presentations and documents
Own the production, development, and maintenance of all aspects of BI solutions – ETL, Data Quality, Visualization, Documentation, and Support
Design and build BI dashboards in short timeframes via rapid prototyping and agile development
Apply advanced visualization techniques to reveal business insights
Perform rigorous data analysis to proactively identify any inconsistencies or data quality issues. Provide recommendations for improvements
Work to improve the day-to-day activities of the analytics team with technology and automation
Desired Skills and Experience:
A persistent person who has the willingness to spend time in an area and become a SME in that domain
4+ years of experience in analyzing large, multi-dimensional data sets and synthesizing insights into actionable solutions
Minimum 3 years of experience managing ETL of data from multiple sources using Advanced SQL and Jupyter Notebooks
Strong analytical skills including experience, familiarity, and ease with analyzing large, multi-dimensional data sets
Exceptional communication and collaboration skills to engage with multiple stakeholders and different teams to deliver BI solutions efficiently
Highly motivated, result-oriented self-starter who enjoys working in a fast-pace environment. Proven ability to function well independently as well as in a team
Data driven mindset with degree in a quantitative discipline such as Computer Science, Statistics, Engineering, Mathematics or Economics
Experience in Fintech/Banking/Credit/Payment industry a strong plus
Experience with a statistical programming language like R or Python is a plus
For more than 20 years, PayPal has remained at the forefront of the digital payment revolution. By leveraging technology to make financial services and commerce more convenient, affordable, and secure, our open digital payments platform gives PayPal’s 400 million active account holders the confidence to connect and transact in new and powerful ways. Through a combination of technological innovation and strategic partnerships, PayPal creates better ways to manage and move money, and offers choice and flexibility when sending payments, paying, or getting paid. Available in more than 200 markets around the world, the PayPal platform, including Braintree, Venmo and Xoom, enables consumers and merchants to receive money in more than 100 currencies, withdraw funds in 56 currencies and hold balances in their PayPal accounts in 25 currencies.

In addition, PayPal will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities.

As a New Business Analyst, you'll work in a fast-paced environment and form partnerships with our sales representatives and brokers throughout the United States to provide all levels of quote support for group benefit product sales via a centralized Proposal Center.

Applying office level customization by understanding key broker relationships and assessing benefits of current carrier to align Principal plan designs by having a high level of knowledge of our quoting process including underwriting and product guidelines.

Perform other job-related duties and special projects as required.
This position is also a great way to advance your career. As a growing company with over 16,000 employees around the world, Principal offers a lot of ways for you to learn more, earn more and achieve more!

Strong problem solving, analytical decision-making and time management skills.
Flexibility to adjust to changing priorities and meet client expectations.
Effective written and verbal communication, planning and organizational skills.
Ability to build positive relationships by maintaining high levels of efficiency, quality and exhibit strong attention to detail.
Proactive and ambitious to accomplish work with limited supervision and general work direction.
Strong skills working with spreadsheets, formulas, graphs and tables.

Deloitte's Strategy team architect's programs that transform our clients' businesses. To do this, we have assembled a practice of leading business and technology strategy experts that each contribute unique capabilities and insights - including Corporate & Business Unit Strategy, Strategy Execution, Growth Transformation, Technology Strategy & Insights, Enterprise Model Design, Enterprise Cloud Strategy, and Business Transformation.


Strategy professionals serve as trusted advisors to our clients, working with them to make clear, data-driven choices about where to play and how to win in order to drive growth and unlock enterprise value.


Strategy helps our clients:

Identify strategies for growth and value creation
Develop the appropriate business models, operating models, and capabilities to support their strategic vision
Maximize the ROI on technology investments and leverage technology and Cloud trends to architect future business strategies.


Qualifications


Required:


1+ year of prior experience in a research or business analyst role
Undergraduate degree with a focus in economics, engineering, finance or accounting preferred
Outstanding academic achievement and demonstrated leadership
An interest in consulting and/or investment management
Strong quantitative and analytical skills
Ability to build Excel-based financial and operating models a plus
Excellent written and verbal communication
Strong interpersonal and influencing skills
A passion for learning, professional growth and knowledge sharing
A desire to be part of an entrepreneurial, fast-paced and fun team environment
Limited immigration sponsorship may be available
Travel up to 50% (While 50% travel is a requirement of the role, due to COVID-19, non-essential travel has been suspended until further notice.)


Preferred:
Ability to define trends across industries and articulate their impact to clients' business and strategic choices
Knowledge of or experience in broader G&A functions (i.e. HR, IT, Finance, Procurement, Commercial Operations
Exposure to customer journey maps - must be able to understand customer journeys, consumer behavior, including engagement with digital channel
Basic understanding of the core digital technologies that underpin world class customer experiences (e.g. CRM, E-Commerce, Content Management)
Experience creating road maps and detailed financial business cases for change
Experience and comfort in using analytical methods to create project analysis and recommendation support
Past experiences should include customer journey mapping, primary customer research, solution design, roadmap development, business case development
Advanced degree in business (e.g., MBA) from a top tier program

Are you ready to restart your career and build the future? The Amazon Returnship Program offers you an opportunity to reboot your skills, refresh your resume with new experience, and relaunch your journey toward your professional goals in a supportive, real-world environment.

The Consumer Talent Programs and Analytics team is looking for a Business Analyst (BA), Promotions to drive the innovation and analytics behind reimagining promotion processes within Field, Corporate and Tech functions. The BA will use data to support promotion process optimization recommendations, evaluate the impact of new or changed promotion processes, and identify opportunities to improve efficiencies and scale. We are looking for a creative, curious thinker with deep analytics experience who is enthusiastic about supporting a highly innovative team operating in an ambiguous, fast-paced environment. The successful candidate has an interest in talent management in addition to analytics and wants to use that to help grow talent.

Major Responsibilities Include:

Obsess over the voice of employees, HR, and business leaders to ensure their perspectives are at the forefront of science and process development and implementation
Collaborate with the promotions program team to translate business needs into requirements for data objects including metrics, attributes, reports, and dashboards
Design a data metric library for common metric definitions and reporting requirements
Build data visualization reports and tools for self-service consumption using visualization tools like Quicksight or Tableau
Extract, analyze and model relevant data from operations and HR
Identify opportunities to automate and streamline promotion processes
Develop new techniques to process large data sets, address quantitative problems, and recommend white spaces for experimentation
Partner with research science and analytics teams to improve data assets, quality, metrics and insights.
Dedication to problem-solving to deliver innovative solutions to core business problems and employee needs
Draft concise documents communicating results to stakeholders, visualizing data where beneficial to drive decision-making

The HRBP Analyst 1 will serve as the HR broad-based resource in support of assigned functional groups. Serves as the primary point of contact for researching various HR issues/solutions and managing small/large projects in support of the functional groups. The key areas of focus for the HRBP will include: Talent Management, Strategic Workforce Planning, Strategic Staffing and Recruiting, Employee Engagement, Organizational Development and Change Management, and Compensation Administration (performance calibration). The HRBP also serves as a consultant partner in the execution of COE programs as well as identification of opportunities to promote successful business outcomes. This role will support functional teams within Nissan's Sales division.

Job Functions

The following job function statements describe the general nature and level of work being performed. They are not to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required of personnel so classified. The job function statements reflect expectations of the fully trained, proficient incumbent who meets all performance criteria.

Facilitates effective communication between HRBPs, HR Centers of Excellence (C.O.E.) and functional groups to provide visibility to upcoming HR initiatives and employee issues

Manages and balances multiple demands and priorities to achieve optimal results. Maintains a positive outlook and stays motivated to team and clients, able to generate innovative and creative solutions and alternatives even under resource constraints, demonstrates perseverance in achieving objectives despite obstacles

Active engagement and planning with all levels of client groups to develop trust and credibility

Ensures functional groups motivate and drive employees to assure an engaged workforce

Awareness of appropriate levels of retention and facilitate creation of action plans to positively impact retention rates – specifically for key talent

Coordinates and supports coaching and communication with managers for employees not meeting job expectations

Leads career path development planning with functional groups (including rotations, development and training) for key talent. Engages with functional groups to align talent to critical and key roles to meet functional and corporate objectives

Data Management: Serve as HRBP lead in execution of HR system transactions and reporting including, but not limited to: Support of the job requisition process (creation/tracking of requisitions, etc.), job data changes, processing of employee documents, and generation of reports (new hires, terminations, transfers, attrition, diversity etc.).

Communications: Write, create and/or update HRBPs, HR Centers of Excellence (COE) and functional client group communications including, but not limited to organizational charts, presentations, promotional letters and internal memos, scheduling of meetings and calendar maintenance.

Data Analysis: Proactively read, interpret, analyze and leverage data and metrics (e.g., HR data analytics, business unit metrics) to answer questions, identify trends, and solve problems.

As necessary, performs other related duties of which the above are representative

Minimum Qualifications

The following qualification statements reflect the minimum skills and abilities required of the qualified applicant.

Bachelor’s degree in HR, Business or related field

1+ year of directly related professional level Human Resources experience or Functional experience.

Requires working knowledge of word processor, PowerPoint, spreadsheet, other PC applications, or Mainframe applications, etc. to produce non-standard, creative products.

HR Technical Skills and Knowledge, Business Acumen, Strategic Analysis and Innovation, Judgment and Decision Making, Effective Communication, Partnering with the Business, Professional Presence and Credibility, Relationship Building / Organizational Savvy, Initiative and Perseverance, Adaptability, Negotiation and Influence

Strategic Planning, Succession Planning, Change Management, Organizational Development, Coaching, Employee Relations, Performance Management, Motivating, Influence, Trust, Transparent, Adaptability, Talent Management, Leadership and Vision, Global Mindset

Purpose of Job
We are seeking a talented Business Intelligence Analyst Senior for either our San Antonio, TX, Plano, TX or Phoenix, AZ facility. This person may also work remotely in a 100% Remote Work Environment.


Analyzes complex business problems and issues using data from internal and external sources to provide insight to analysts and decision makers. Identifies and interprets trends and patterns in datasets to locate influences. Creates specifications for reports and analysis based on business needs and required or available data elements. May participate in consultation to users and lead cross functional teams to address business issues. Prototypes solutions for displaying information based on business needs.
Job Requirements
About USAA
USAA knows what it means to serve. We facilitate the financial security of millions of U.S. military members and their families. This singular mission requires a dedication to innovative thinking at every level.
USAA Careers – World Class Benefits (31 seconds)
Primary Responsibilities:
Identifies and manages existing and emerging risks that stem from business activities and the job role.
Ensures risks associated with business activities are effectively identified, measured, monitored, and controlled.
Follows written risk and compliance policies and procedures for business activities.
Leads and participates in gathering complex and often unique business requirements by partnering with customers to define the business problem and data needs.
Utilizes an advanced understanding of multiple data structures and sources to lead the development and implementation of business intelligence solutions, which may include data visualization, data transformation, or data collection.
Strategically partners and works with IT execution teams on the development of analytic infrastructures, data engineering, or related business intelligence efforts. Includes collaborating on the design and implementation of technical standards and governance practices.
Applies data visualization best practices - often selecting the right data ‘tool for the job’ to identify and interpret trends or patterns while following standard Enterprise branding.
Understands the value of prototyping, usability, and the end-user experience to maximize the impact of the final data visualization product (dashboard, report, insight, or analysis).
Acts as a trusted data visualization advisor to the stakeholder/end-user in order to drive business value. Provides system thinking to influence relevant data, information, and application architecture decisions.
May serve as an Agile champion who is responsible for the methodology, execution, and team education on best practices.
May provide internal team leadership by providing guidance on business intelligence tools, techniques and processes.
Actively participates in industry, COE, or other discipline-relevant groups/panels to keep abreast of industry trends and share best practices with team.
Minimum Requirements:
Bachelor's degree in quantitative analytics field such as Economics, Finance, Statistics, Mathematics, Actuarial Sciences, Operations Research, Data and/or Business Analysis, Data Science or other business-related discipline.
4 years work experience in statistics, mathematics or quantitative analytics or related experience can be substituted in lieu of a degree in addition to the minimum years of work experience required.
6 years of progressive functional business experience within the respective industry of responsibility (i.e. P&C, Bank, Finance, etc.) to include 4 years of experience in data & analytics OR Advanced degree in Business, Science, Finance, Mathematics, Economics, or relevant discipline and 4 years of experience in data/analytics or functional business experience within the respective industry of responsibility (i.e. P&C, Bank, Finance, etc.)
Demonstrated experience in the identification of innovative approaches to address moderately complex business problems and solutions.
Advanced experience developing business deliverables that leverage business intelligence platforms, data management platforms, or SQL-based languages (Tableau, Business Objects, Snowflake, Hadoop, Netezza, NoSQL, ANSI SQL, or related).
Proven, expert ability to leverage or build business knowledge through meaningful partnerships at the individual contributor, leadership, and EMG levels.
Demonstrated expert-level communication skills with the ability to deliver presentations to all levels of management.
Demonstrated the ability to embed intuitive story telling within the business intelligence solutions and platforms including concise presentation of complex technical details.
When you apply for this position, you will be required to answer some initial questions. This will take approximately 5 minutes. Once you begin the questions you will not be able to finish them at a later time and you will not be able to change your responses.
Preferred Experience:
Experience in dashboard development, visualization, data integration and performance reporting using tools like Tableau.
Experience analyzing unstructured and structured data and in cloud environments like AWS or Snowflake.
Experience in Payments processes and/or analytics.
Experience working with IT using Agile framework.

HCA Healthcare is dedicated to the growth and development of our colleagues. We will provide you the tools and resources you need to succeed in our organization. We are currently looking for an ambitious Financial Analyst to help us reach our goals. Unlock your potential here!
As a Financial Analyst, you will provide operational and financial analysis to SSC operational unit leaders and senior leadership. The Financial Analyst generates and delivers variance analysis, reports key financial statistics and assists business unit leaders in managing information effectively to optimize departmental efficiency and performance.
What you will do in this role:
 Works closely with operations departments to assess and report performance.
 Coordinates scheduled and ad hoc data and analysis requests across SSC operational units
 Develop, test and deliver scheduled and adhoc reports
 Assists in the development of financial data collection and measurement tools within the SSC.
 Proactively review and provide data analysis and financial impact assessments to support SSC operations
 Prepares and analyzes monthly MORs.
 Prepares uncompensated care projections and variance analysis for accounts receivable and net revenue performance.
 Monitor defined reports and work with applicable departments to ensure AR is properly stated at month end.
 Creates and supports exception-based report generation for all departments.
 Understands revenue cycle operations and technologies currently in place.
Qualifications
EDUCATION
Bachelor's degree with focus in Accounting, Finance, Economics or other Business-related field, required.
Equivalent work experience may substitute degree requirement

We are looking for a Data Analyst to join Spotify’s Legal & Internal Audit (“IA”) Systems team within the Financial Engineering mission. The Legal & IA Systems team is responsible for driving a variety of initiatives within Spotify’s legal, audit and data privacy landscape. This team owns the data strategy for legal retention requirements and produces analyses to surface insights for legal and compliance and other stakeholders, including product and engineering.
Location
New York or Remote Americas
Job type
Permanent
What you'll do
Perform analyses on large sets of data from various sources to build analytical reports and extract insights that will help satisfy a legal data strategy.
Collaborate with the team’s Product Manager to prioritize work and develop a data-driven strategy for legal and relevant business teams.
Partner with data engineers and scientists to build a scalable and flexible data landscape to respond to the various needs of the legal, compliance and audit business teams.
Partner with the legal team to provide timely, appropriate, and accurate responses to data requests from regulators, partners, litigations and policymakers.
Immerse yourself in Spotify’s data culture to assess new technologies and best practices, and their relevance to the team’s overall scope of work.
Clearly communicate your work, progress and vision of the data strategy to stakeholders - tailoring communication as appropriate to ensure relevance to the audience.
Work closely with multi-functional teams across the company who are passionate about Spotify’s success.
Develop a deep understanding of Spotify’s legal and compliance landscape, both the current needs and future vision.
Take accountability for data integrity.
Who you are
B.A. / B.S. in Economics, Statistics, Computer Science, or another quantitative field.
Minimum of 2-3 years of relevant experience. Background in legal matters and consumer technology companies is a plus, but not required. Willingness to learn relevant legal concepts as underpinnings of analysis is a must.
Strong communication skills, including ability to speak tech to a non-tech audience and to translate complex business/legal needs into specifically-defined work.
Comfortable with working with data producers across the organization to understand the sources and assumptions on which our data depends.
Extensive experience manipulating and analyzing complex data with SQL and other tools, such as Python.
Familiarity with Google Cloud Platform (Big Query), MS Azure, or AWS.
Experience operating independently in a fast-paced work environment and collaborating with senior business leaders across multiple time zones.
You have inclusive and collaborative working habits.
Where you'll be
We are a distributed workforce enabling our band members to find a work mode that is best for them!
Where in the world? For this role, it can be within the Americas region in which we have a work location.
Prefer an office to work from home instead? Not a problem! We have plenty of options for your working preferences. Find more information about our Work From Anywhere options here.
Working hours? We operate within the Eastern Standard time zone for collaboration.
Our global benefits
Extensive learning opportunities, through our dedicated team, GreenHouse.
Flexible share incentives letting you choose how you share in our success.
Global parental leave, six months off - fully paid - for all new parents.
All The Feels, our employee assistance program and self-care hub.
Flexible public holidays, swap days off according to your values and beliefs.
Spotify On Tour, join your colleagues on trips to industry festivals and events.
Learn about life at Spotify
Spotify is an equal opportunity employer. You are welcome at Spotify for who you are, no matter where you come from, what you look like, or what’s playing in your headphones. Our platform is for everyone, and so is our workplace. The more voices we have represented and amplified in our business, the more we will all thrive, contribute, and be forward-thinking! So bring us your personal experience, your perspectives, and your background. It’s in our differences that we will find the power to keep revolutionizing the way the world listens.
Spotify transformed music listening forever when we launched in 2008. Our mission is to unlock the potential of human creativity by giving a million creative artists the opportunity to live off their art and billions of fans the chance to enjoy and be passionate about these creators. Everything we do is driven by our love for music and podcasting. Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service with a community of more than 345 million users.
