We are UMG, the Universal Music Group. We are the world’s leading music company. In everything we do, we are committed to artistry, innovation, and entrepreneurship. We own and operate a broad array of businesses engaged in recorded music, music publishing, merchandising, and audiovisual content in more than 60 countries. We identify and develop recording artists and songwriters, and we produce, distribute, and promote the most critically acclaimed and commercially successful music to delight and entertain fans around the world.
Interscope Geffen A&M Records (“IGA”) is home to some of the biggest artists in the world including: U2, Eminem, Kendrick Lamar, J Cole, Lady Gaga, and many more. As a leader in the music industry, we are always looking for talented and driven individuals to join our family.
How you’ll LEAD:
As a part of the Research, Reporting & Analytics Group at Interscope Records, this person will work with the team to provide data and detailed analysis with a focus on artist consumption, release, account, consumer and revenue strategies.
The analyst will need to be a proven self-starter, solutions based creative thinker with a hunger to constantly learn and evolve strategies associated with the company’s artists and commercial partners.
The analyst will be required to dive deep into performance across streaming platforms with a requirement to make recommendations based on compelling analyses, insights and big data queries. These recommendations will be used by management and senior executive team to make informed business decisions.
The ideal candidate should be well-versed in data analysis. Candidates should have advanced skills in Excel, and experience with SQL, Tableau, Alteryx, DOMO, or other data manipulation / visualization platforms.
How you’ll CREATE:
Deliver data-driven solutions and recommendations to executives and necessary parties that incorporate rigorous research and analysis
Develop dynamic / automated models to help key stakeholders with business decisions
Create SQL scripts to extract necessary data from files that could be greater than 100 TB in size within Google BigQuery or other SQL platforms, and build visualizations in Tableau, Alteryx, and various other visualization tools to present findings in a visually compelling way
Identify user/partner/ track/album/market trends
Present overall findings to executives throughout the company in a clear and concise manner
Research & build customized reports based on financial and marketing data.
Build, develop and maintain various partner, consumer behavior, and consumption trend projects with ongoing summaries and recommendations.
Monitor and understand key performance indicators relating to our streaming partner’s consumer behavior and consumption trends to integrate into data analysis.
Help develop and review methodology for cross-departmental reporting tools.
Other duties as assigned.
Bring your VIBE:
Passion and curiosity for music and the data that is used within the industry, preferably with an-depth knowledge of current music industry trends including key account, consumption pattern shifts, and the impact/variety of social media.
Ability to query our databases (using platforms such as BigQuery) accurately and efficiently using SQL
Advanced level Excel skills, with the ability to develop dynamic models using named ranges / formulaic references
Understanding of API usage for importing data for analysis
Understanding of TikTok and social media trends
Familiarity with statistical concepts and tools, along with the ability to use them effectively in analyses
Ability to visualize data within Alteryx, Tableau, DOMO, or other data visualization platforms. Experience with Alteryx Designer a plus.
Adept in distilling large amounts of data into concise, actionable summaries.
Highly organized and detail-oriented team player.
Ability to present findings in a visually compelling and articulate manner.
Self-sufficient with the confidence to independently pursue information.
Ability to thrive in fast paced environment, manage multiple tasks at once and work to deadlines
1 – 2 years of work experience in data analysis, management consulting, entertainment industry analysis, or similar role. Music Industry preferred but not required.
Experience working with analytical tools including, but not limited to Excel, Tableau, BigQuery, Alteryx, etc.
BS in Business Administration, Accounting, Computer Science, Mathematics, or a similarly quantitative degree

Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Job Title: Business/Operational Analyst
Department: Finance
Company: Dimension Development
Reports To: Assistant CFO
Supervises: N/A

Job Purpose: Thoroughly analyzes financial and operational key performance metrics and clearly communicates findings to stakeholders.

Job Responsibilities:
1. Use proprietary software (Dimension Development Hotel Accounting Program) as well as external sources to identify, generate, gather, verify, review, research, analyze, comprehend, interpret, and report on key performance indicators and financial information.
2. Analyze variances and data trends and prepare reports, charts and other outputs as required. To convert information into insightful findings and actionable recommendations to optimize existing and future operations across the company.
3. Provide high-quality recurring and ad-hoc performance reports to assist senior management with operational decisions, as required.
4. Assist the Assistant CFO with the development and maintenance of various analytical models.
5. Prepare a monthly reporting package that includes financial, operational, competitive, and customer satisfaction metrics. To analyze key business trends.
6. Work closely with all regional and property leaders to identify areas of improvement. To support and contribute expertise to projects relating to the achievement of property financial, guest service, and operational goals.
7. Assist hotel leadership with the actual implementation of new processes.
8. Assist with the preparation of annual budgets. To consolidate budget data from business unit leaders, evaluate data received and follow up directly with budget holders as appropriate. Ensure that all budgets are accurate, comprehensive and completed on time.
9. Serve as a super user of business intelligence tools (such as Broadvine and MicroStrategy) in the creation of dashboards and reports.
10. Research and evaluate different analysis tools, business intelligence tools, and modeling techniques to identify possible opportunities for process improvement.
11. Other duties as assigned.

Job Skills:
1. Track record of problem solving complex issues and continuous process improvement skills.
2. Advanced Microsoft Excel skills are required, and will be tested, including pivot tables and advanced formulas. Must be proficient in Microsoft Office.
3. To maintain a thorough understanding of financial and operational metrics across the industry.
4. Ability to work proactively, independently and as a strategic partner in a cross-functional team environment. To establish and maintain cooperative working relationships with fellow team members, management, external contacts, guests, and the public. Demonstrated ability to manage conflict/resolution.
5. Demonstrated strong analytical skills. To define and analyze problems and identify root causes. To set challenging and productive goals; prioritizing tasks, accepting responsibility, and overcoming obstacles.
6. To work successfully in a dynamic, fast-paced setting, and effectively manage multiple priorities within a broad team of cross-regional and cross-functional members. To perform a variety of duties, often changing from one task to another of a different nature, with frequent interruptions and distractions. To adapt to frequent changes in the workload and be able to adjust priorities quickly as circumstances dictate while completing tasks within established timeframes.
7. To thrive in an environment that is both strategic and creative, and which requires rapid learning, multitasking and prioritizing under tight deadlines
8. To remain highly-driven and self-motivated. To remain positive, productive, and professional in high stress situations.
9. To maintain a high level of accuracy and attention to detail at all times. To be well-organized and detail-oriented in order to manage multiple tasks, deadlines, and expectations simultaneously.
10. To sustain a high level of confidentiality.
11. To demonstrate partnering, influencing, and communication skills at all levels of the organization.
12. To maintain excellent written and verbal communication and comprehension skills, including the ability to clearly explain complex analytical topics to a wide audience who may or may not be familiar with analytics or the subject matter.
13. Other duties as assigned.

Job Qualifications: Describe the minimum qualifications needed to complete the job responsibilities.

Education: Bachelor's Degree in a business or hospitality field, or equivalent work experience. Advanced degrees or certifications are preferred.

Experience: One year experience in the job offered or two year’s experience in a business intelligence or similar analytical capacity or related role. Hospitality/Entertainment Industry experience is preferred.

Work Location: Remote or home based

Job Title

Sr. Business Intelligence Analyst & Developer

Job Description Summary

As part of the Client Account Team and liaison to Cushman & Wakefield's Global Business Intelligence (BI) team, the Sr. BI Analyst & Developer is responsible for delivery of all data analytics and governance in support of the Cushman & Wakefield's Client Team.
The responsibilities include data mapping, data assessments and analysis, data governance support, POC dashboard development, user acceptance testing, reporting support, opportunity assessments, tabular model support, workplace trend analysis, benchmarking analysis, and general product support for Client Account Team's BI platform.

Job Description

The responsibilities include data mapping, data assessments and analysis, data governance support, POC dashboard development, user acceptance testing, reporting support, opportunity assessments, tabular model support, workplace trend analysis, benchmarking analysis, and general product support for Client Account Team's platform. Position location is virtual with Central or East time zones preferred.

Responsibilities:
Support the Client Account Team to build, implement, and support the BI platform and data strategy initiatives.
Support the Data Governance Lead on all data governance initiatives for the BI platform.
Liaise with Product Owners and Data Governance Lead to ensure dashboard prototype design and build meets business requirements and aligns with the data and tabular model.
Proactively analyze the client’s portfolio and provide support in identifying risks and opportunities.
Lead data assessment exercises with new service lines while onboarding onto the BI platform.
Lead data mapping exercises to support system integration projects.
Drive continuous improvement in the automation and standardization of data requirements.
Partner with the development team to expand client's BI product offering through dashboard POCs, tabular model measure development and product feature enhancements.
Utilize advanced analytics tools such as Alteryx and AWS tools to transform data, automate workflows and develop analytical tools.
Work effectively with all areas of the business to identify required dashboard visualizations and associated calculations to build dashboards.
Technical documentation and process documentation as required for activities within the data workstream
Provide guidance and training to the account team employees on C&W’s BI platform.
Support custom reporting requests
Provide both verbal and written updates to management on the progress of work.
Liaise with service line leadership to extract data from point applications for uploading into the BI platform.
Promote effective and consistent communication – both within your team and cross-departmental.

Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in Business, Engineering or Technology
Experience in AWS is preferred
Experience in business analytics or data visualization software Tableau
Experience also in Power BI is preferred
Experience in SharePoint
Experience in data mapping and modelling
Experience in SQL is preferred
Experience in ETL tool such as Alteryx or Python is a plus
Experience in being part of a software product team or BI product team is a plus
Experience handling commercial real estate data is a plus

Skills & Personal Qualities:
Excellent communication in English
Great attention to detail, diligent, focused, and highly analytical
Committed, able to work to deadlines, prioritize and juggle between tasks
Business writing and reporting skills
Thoughtful, collaborative, and proactively ready to engage with stakeholders across the globe
Experience in Agile Development
Able to work in a high-pressure environment
In depth experience working as an Analyst in a professional working environment.
Able to communicate effectively at all levels, including the ability to negotiate and resolve conflict.
Experience in documenting business processes in the form of process maps and step-by-step user manuals.
Experience in supporting system testing with entry and exist criteria.
Commitment to quality and a thorough approach to work.
Workshop facilitation skills for requirements gathering analysis.
Ability to build & maintain effective working relationships with internal and external personnel.
Demonstrate flexibility and ability to deliver.
Ability to produce high quality documentation (reports, specifications, requirements, etc.)
Good team player, also able to work independently.
Curiosity and drive to solve problems.

About Us:

New datasets are being created every day and companies need to incorporate them to remain competitive.

YipitData is the go-to, 200+ person data team for hundreds of the largest institutional investors and corporations in the world. We identify, screen, license, clean, and analyze alternative data to help clients answer their key questions.

We have amazing reviews (and a 5-star rating!) on Glassdoor and are one of Inc's Best Workplaces - a fast-growing technology company based in NYC, backed by Norwest Venture Partners and with a strong culture focused on mastery, ownership, and purpose.

About The Role:

In 2019 YipitData launched a new business unit providing alternative data insights to corporations. Our Corporate business is growing quickly and we are expanding our data team by hiring a Junior Data Analyst (Official Title: "Associate Data Consultant") who will be key to the success of the initiative.

This is a fantastic opportunity for candidates with 1-2 years of experience as you will support building our Corporate business from the ground up and develop the core skills required to succeed at the intersection of tech, data, and client-facing work.

This is a remote-friendly opportunity that can sit in NYC (where our headquarter is located), or anywhere in the US.

US work authorization is required for this position.

In this role, you'll gain experience in:

Programming and data: learn (or sharpen) big data analysis skills, develop compelling data-driven analyses, and present to clients and prospects
Learn and master Python, SQL, Pyspark, Tableau, Databricks, Airflow, and other key big data analysis tools
New product development: this early stage initiative gives you a unique chance to collaborate on product discovery, identify and empathize with customer pain points, and help clients get value from our insights products
Sales and client strategy: on a given day, you might help brainstorm product positioning or develop a new analysis to answer a prospect's question, all while ensuring an amazing experience in supporting our existing clients

You are likely to succeed if:

You have 1-2 years of experience in an analytical role within an existing product team, management consulting firm, large Financial Services institution, economic consulting firm, at a data provider, or at a software company
You have an entrepreneurial spirit and are excited to help build a new business from the ground up
You are willing to persevere through the highs and lows of creating something new
You are a methodical problem solver
You have a commitment to learning to code and/or honing your existing coding skills
You have an ability to manage many different priorities
You are both a self-starter and a collaborative and considerate a team player

Meet Your Team:

Check out this video to learn why our Corporate team members love being part of YipitData!

What We Offer:

Our compensation package includes equity and highly competitive salary
We care about your personal life and we mean it. We offer flexible work hours, unlimited vacation, generous 401K match and parental leave policy, team bonding events, a wellness budget, learning reimbursement, and more!
Your growth at YipitData is determined by the impact that you are making, not by tenure, facetime, or office politics. Everyone at YipitData is empowered to learn, self-improve, and master their skills in an environment focused on ownership, respect, and trust. To learn more about our culture and values, check out our Glassdoor page!

Job No: 501741; 7/29/2021

BUSINESS SYSTEMS ANALYST
Analyst/Programmer- Career

Information Technology Services


Salary Range: $4,372 - $10,792/Monthly

Work Schedule: Full-Time, Monday – Friday, 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m..; Weekend and evening work may be required; exempt classification.

Essential Functions: Under the general direction of the Director of Enterprise Applications, the incumbent provides overall technical and functional analysis, project management support, high-level technical development support, and consultation to the managers and staff of the Enterprise Applications and the University departments that utilize the various Enterprise Systems, such as PeopleSoft Campus Solutions or Human Resources Management (HRM), and the systems they integrate with. The incumbent consults with area managers and staff to recommend changes to business processes to make more effective and efficient use of applications/technology and develop detailed requirements, business process flows, and project plans to implement upgrades and enhancements to the applications. The incumbent also assists in collecting, analyzing, and disseminating Chancellor's Office (CO) Common Management Systems (CMS) module updates, PeopleSoft Update Manager (PUM)/Maintenance Pack (MP) release notes, Student Administration User Group (SAUG), Technical User Group (TUG), new Oracle releases, and features, and other affinity groups impactful to the campus user community. The incumbent collaborates with the campus community to create and foster a collaborative culture and gathers feedback to improve services and features; participates in various University and CSU committees and assists in managing Enterprise Applications project portfolio; maintains and updates the Enterprise Applications web contents; collects, analyzes, and generates accurate statistical data and analysis for use in reports, such as semester report and accountability report; coordinates and documents project activities such as defining project charter, scope, goals, and milestones in support of project owners; coordinates and conducts various meetings and provides meeting summaries; participates in campus and systemwide committees, task forces, and working groups as assigned; designs participates and co-leads training programs for supported products.

Required Qualifications & Experience: Bachelor's degree in computer science or business from a four-year accredited college or university, or equivalent training and applied experience. The incumbent must have four years of related work experience supporting an IT department or division; with web content management system (CMS) such as Drupal; with Information Technology Service Management (ITSM) application such as Service Now; and with the following software applications: MS Windows, MS Word, Access, PowerPoint, Outlook Web. The incumbent must have working knowledge of project management and change management methods; of ERP systems such as PeopleSoft Campus; and Solutions Student Information System, Human Resources Management and Finance systems, such as PeopleSoft. The incumbent must have excellent verbal and written communication skills. The incumbent must have the ability to track and document information between multiple parties with version control; attention to detail and solid organizational skills; schedule and prioritize in order to meet deadlines; work independently with minimal supervision; work effectively as part of a team and to give and receive constructive feedback; to draft and deliver technical processes, reports, presentations, and correspondence; and must have a demonstrated interest and/or ability to work in a multicultural/multiethnic environment. A background check (including a criminal records check) must be completed satisfactorily before any candidate can be offered.

Desired Qualifications: Higher education experience. Knowledge of web services and integration software (Dell Boomi or other developer tools), PAAS (mobile application platform), and SAAS (Canvas, Academic Works, etc.); and of data analytics tools, such as OBIEE, Tableau, or Power BI.

Closing Date: Review of applications will begin on August 12, 2021 and will continue until the position is filled; however, the position may close when an adequate number of qualified applicants are received. A COMPLETED ON-LINE CAL STATE LA APPLICATION FOR EMPLOYMENT IS REQUIRED. RESUMES WILL NOT BE ACCEPTED IN LIEU OF A COMPLETED APPLICATION.

As a Data Scientist, you will create innovative solutions to solve business problems by using advanced machine learning, statistical modeling, data mining, and optimization techniques to deliver real world solutions for decision making online or offline. You will work with other data scientists and data professionals to build new capabilities enabling world class customer service and next-generation digital execution. We welcome candidates from different backgrounds, as we believe that diverse, inclusive teams are better teams.
Understand business strategy and identify innovative data science opportunities that lead to significant impact in our evolving business
Apply advanced data science knowledge to leverage state-of-the-art methods and technologies; lead by example to establish best practices
Develop statistical and machine learning methods to solve business problems and derive actionable business insights and recommendations
Present insights and recommendations to executive and business stakeholders discovered from data analysis and statistical/machine learning algorithms
Work with data engineers to test and validate training and production data pipelines, and complete the Dev Ops lifecycle
Derive metrics for model performance and conduct continuous monitoring after model deployment
Engineer datasets from different sources for data analysis and model development, which includes wrangling, cleansing, and pre-processing data
Be proactive to identify opportunities and take ownership of the projects and tasks
Provide business solutions and support the implementation process
Collaborate with other data scientists and data engineers
Required Qualifications:
Bachelor’s Degree Analytics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering or a related quantitative discipline
3-5 years of experience in data science or advanced analytics
3-5 years of Python, R, and/or SAS
Strong understanding of high-performance algorithms and statistics
Expert knowledge of data modeling, queries and understanding of different data structures
Excellent analytical skills with an engineering, algorithmic mind to design tools, pipelines and systems to handle large-scale, real-time ML analysis, whether in batch or streaming
Demonstrated ability to facilitate and coordinate complex data analysis and development activities across teams in agile sprints with minimal direction
Proficient at collecting and mining data from disparate data sources, and willing to dig deeper and understand the process that creates the data
Must be comfortable with unstructured, fast moving and constantly evolving high-growth environment
Committed team player who is proactive, takes ownership over the success of their projects, and works hard to support those around them
Excellent verbal and written communication skills are essential for coordinating across teams
Preferred Qualifications:
Master’s degree in STEM with specialization in data science, machine learning, statistical modeling, and/or optimization
Knowledge and experience in marketing, supply chain optimization, customer behavior/journey modeling and prediction, product recommendation systems, online testing, etc. is highly desired

Working at the intersection of business and technology, you'll sharpen your understanding of business processes and data analysis, while continuing to develop your leadership, management, and communication skills. No matter where your career ultimately takes you, you'll make a meaningful impact and lasting connections with outstanding colleagues and mentors.
This role requires a wide variety of strengths and capabilities, including:
BS/BA degree or equivalent experience
A strong understanding of at least one business function in the firm, as well as a broader understanding of other areas.
Proficiency in business applications, data usage, and management
Ability to liaison between lines of business and the development team, while working with a wide range of stakeholders and collaborating with your team
Ability to work collaboratively in teams and develop meaningful relationships to achieve common goals

The Salesforce Administrator and Data Analyst will work as part of the team dedicated to ensuring that we are maximizing efficiency and capitalizing on the full features and benefits of the system based on the various user group needs. We are seeking someone with excellent technical, reporting and communication skills who can interface directly with our team to understand their needs in order to administer and enhance the system accordingly, and lead key SFDC and Business reporting, so LG can delight our customers. This person will serve as the "go to" for users, promote adoption, keep current on new releases and AppExchange solutions, provide training & governance, create reports/insights and more. Additionally, the Administrator will perform basic updates, such as add/delete users, and adding basic custom fields, as well as helping to define and enable key usages rules and operating principles.

Responsibilities:

Manage new releases of SFDC and efficiently roll out new features. Create and Manage Changes to the System, modifying the system to increase benefits and usability
Create and maintain fields, views, reports, dashboards, campaigns, custom objects, processes and governance for Salesforce
Handle on-going customization/ alteration of Salesforce.com, including Report and Dashboard Creation and Maintenance
Understand proactive reporting needs and key system reports for sales and marketing (ad hoc exec requests to regular weekly/monthly business views)
Maintain, enhance and create workflows, functions and configurations within the Salesforce.com environment; user satisfaction
Manage system changes without interruption to the user and communicate system changes to the users in advance so they understand the change and how to use it prior to implementation
Maintain System, Security and Integrity (plus organizing and cleaning as needed)
Map Salesforce.com hierarchy and territories in response to personnel changes
Reassign Accounts, Contacts, and Opportunities in response to personnel changes
Grant/ remove and maintain user licenses
Maintain security including sharing rules and security levels
Design, Create and maintain user roles, profiles and hierarchies
Monitor application storage usage and archive data as needed
User Assistance, Training, Adoption and Satisfaction
Create and administer training to existing or new users/groups
Provide one to one training to end users on an on-going basis
Expand use of Salesforce.com – attend planning meetings, assist with determining if /how Salesforce.com can be used in new ways as opposed to purchasing a new internal system
Assist management to create processes in Salesforce.com to help monitor activities, trends, sales and leads
Monitor and report on usage and mentor users/groups needing assistance
Be the company SME on Salesforce.com and provide support as needed
Process Creation, Documentation and Maintenance
Data Quality, Migration and Maintenance, manage duplicate records and monitor and improve data quality (importing data / data integrity)
Monitor neglected accounts and contacts as appropriate and monitor and maintain exception logs for back end system integration with SFDC
Develop complex, macro driven reports to summarize system information for Senior Management


ESSENTIAL REQUIREMENTS:
They must have solid Salesforce.com skills and ideally, understand the general concepts of Customer Relationship Management (CRM) and key reporting functionality. Most importantly they should be proactive, organized and logical.
QUALIFICATIONS:
3 to 5 years of Salesforce administration experience
In-depth knowledge of the standard capabilities of SFDC and have successfully expanded on those capabilities through the use of custom code (Apex, s-controls) and/or integration with external systems
Data Loader and Import Wizard (experience using these two would be important)
Knowledge of Sales Cloud and Service Cloud (we use both)
Salesforce Lightning experience (its SF’s new version of their platform)
Strong reporting background using standard reporting tools including standard salesforce.com reporting functionality
Previous re-engineering experience updating an existing Salesforce.com configuration to provide solutions for reporting, workflows and enhanced functions
Salesforce.com Administrator certification is required
Detail oriented and self-starter with strong written and interpersonal skills
Ability to work independently, as well as part of a team
Proven ability to utilize Salesforce.com as a sales analysis tool
Minimum expectation of a Bachelors degree OR equivalent education/experience
Team player with positive “Can-do” attitude
Great communication skills with enthusiastic personality
Computer literate and proficient in standard office applications Word, Excel and Outlook
Strong problem solving skills, data and software applications

Reporting to the Lead Business Analyst, you as the IT Business Analyst will manage requirements and tools used across the Red Bull Distribution Company (RBDC) technical landscape. You will promote communication between the IT organization and our users to provide technical solutions to meet Red Bull needs. Your expertise will span across the IT organization's systems and capabilities. You'll analyze business operations to determine opportunities to redesign or improve existing processes, and recommend technical solutions to help solve our problems. As our Analyst, you'll have an ability to translate high-level requirements into technical development items and promote these requirements through the full project implementation lifecycle. You will thoroughly analyze technical problems, and communicate solutions to senior leaders.

Experience in the Consumer Package Goods (CPG) and Distribution industries beneficial.

Are you ready to restart your career and build the future? The Amazon Returnship Program offers you an opportunity to reboot your skills, refresh your resume with new experience, and relaunch your journey toward your professional goals in a supportive, real-world environment.

The Returnship Program is a paid 16-week, 100% virtual opportunity available to candidates who are returning to their professional career after experiencing 1 or more years of unemployment and/or underemployment. The successful candidate must meet all of the basic qualifications of this position and can reside anywhere within the United States.

The Consumer Talent Programs and Analytics team is looking for a Business Analyst (BA), Promotions to drive the innovation and analytics behind reimagining promotion processes within Field, Corporate and Tech functions. The BA will use data to support promotion process optimization recommendations, evaluate the impact of new or changed promotion processes, and identify opportunities to improve efficiencies and scale. We are looking for a creative, curious thinker with deep analytics experience who is enthusiastic about supporting a highly innovative team operating in an ambiguous, fast-paced environment. The successful candidate has an interest in talent management in addition to analytics and wants to use that to help grow talent.

Major Responsibilities Include:

Obsess over the voice of employees, HR, and business leaders to ensure their perspectives are at the forefront of science and process development and implementation
Collaborate with the promotions program team to translate business needs into requirements for data objects including metrics, attributes, reports, and dashboards
Design a data metric library for common metric definitions and reporting requirements
Build data visualization reports and tools for self-service consumption using visualization tools like Quicksight or Tableau
Extract, analyze and model relevant data from operations and HR
Identify opportunities to automate and streamline promotion processes
Develop new techniques to process large data sets, address quantitative problems, and recommend white spaces for experimentation
Partner with research science and analytics teams to improve data assets, quality, metrics and insights.
Dedication to problem-solving to deliver innovative solutions to core business problems and employee needs
Draft concise documents communicating results to stakeholders, visualizing data where beneficial to drive decision-making

Learn more about Amazon Returnships at www.amazon.jobs/returnships

At Shutterfly, we’re all about people — bringing them together, making them feel welcome, and connecting them to experiences. We make our customers’ memories last a lifetime by capturing, preserving, and sharing them through photography and personalized products. Through our family of brands, trend setting products, cutting edge technology, and best in class customer service, we help our customers, and each other, share life’s joy.

What You'll Do Here:
The Business Intelligence team partners with Shutterfly’s Marketing, Finance, Operations and Business teams to design and develop reports and dashboards that drive business decisions. The Sr. Business Intelligence Developer supports Business partners by utilizing knowledge of company data structure and experience with BI tools to provide insightful reporting solutions using Tableau. This role requires an individual with strong technical and analytical skills, good communication skills and ability to learn new technologies quickly. The ideal candidate is a self-motivated team player who is detail oriented, enjoys problem solving, can work independently and understands the full BI reporting development process. This role will spend time in both a project management capacity where others will develop the report as well as developing reports themselves.
What You'll Bring:
Great to Haves (Your Skills)
You have demonstrated the ability to manage BI projects from start to finish, gather information and requirements from business partners on BI initiatives, translate requirements into project plans, track project status within Jira, set expectations and communicate with business partners, and ensure final deliverables meet business partner’s needs.
You have designed, developed, and maintained reporting and business intelligence solutions using Tableau reporting software while leveraging visualization best practices.
You have written complex SQL queries to build performant extracts in Tableau.
You have participated in QC/QA and UAT processes.
You have worked with data teams to deliver solutions for reporting needs.
Great to Haves (Your Background)
Bachelor’s Degree in quantitative field and 3+ years’ experience in business intelligence, primarily working with the latest versions of Tableau.
Advanced Tableau user with experience designing dashboards leveraging visualization best practices.
Proficient with SQL; familiar with database design; experience working with large data sets.
Excellent communication and project management skills.
Detail oriented with ability to independently validate / triangulate data and analysis.
Able to prioritize multiple requests while completing deliverables on time. Self-motivated and can work independently. Ability to troubleshoot, track, and resolve day-to-day issues.
Must be comfortable with unstructured, fast-moving and constantly evolving high growth environment. Passion for excellence and continuous improvement.
If this aligns to your career goals, skills and experience, we want to work with you!
We are unable to provide visa sponsorship or transfers for this role at this time. No candidates requiring visa sponsorship or transfer will be considered.

Reporting into the Chief Strategy Officer of Match Group, the Strategy and Analytics team is a nimble team that supports senior leaders and our portfolio businesses across Match Group on their most important strategic initiatives and challenges.
As a Sr. Business Data Analyst, you will extract critical data from multiple data sources and use your deep technical skills to develop reporting deliverables. Additionally, you will translate data into insights and actionable recommendations.
How you’ll make an impact:
You will develop a deep understanding of our products and businesses and their associated data
You will understand how metrics are defined and stored across multiple data sources and effectively combine them to enable custom reporting across Match Group portfolio businesses
You will succinctly and persuasively communicate your findings and make recommendations – anything from informing long-term product roadmaps to responding to competitive pressures
You will lead projects to continuously improve our data and reporting capabilities (e.g. proactively suggesting and building new reporting, fine tuning and automating existing reporting, etc.)
We could be a match if:
You have at least 2 years of experience in SQL (T-SQL and/or Redshift preferred) and at least 2 years of experience in a data / business analytics role
You are proficient in Excel including analyzing datasets and synthesizing findings via Pivot tables and charts
You have passion and analytical chops for developing and analyzing large, complex datasets and translating them into actionable insights
Your verbal and written communication skills are excellent, and you can effectively tailor your communication of insights to specific audiences
You have experience creating executive-facing PowerPoint presentations
You have completed an undergraduate degree in a technical or quantitative field
applicants will be required to complete a SQL skills assessment test
What’s the team like?
The members of the Strategy and Analytics team are passionate about using data to find solutions to challenges across our organization
In this role, you will report to the Sr. Manager of Business Analysis and work with leaders and stakeholders across all the Match Group products
This team is based in Dallas, TX. We will consider remote work for highly qualified candidates
Why Match Group?
Our mission is simple – to help people find love and happiness!
We love our employees too – here are some examples how:
Annual training budget for each employee
100% employer match on 401k contributions
Specific COVID-19 allowance for home office set-up
Matched giving to qualified organizations
100% paid Parental Leave
Happy Hours and Company events (they are all virtual now, but still a ton of fun!)

We value diversity at our company and will never discriminate based on someone’s race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok has global offices including Mountain View, Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Mumbai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul, and Tokyo.

The Monetization Product team at TikTok focuses on building a global marketing platform that fuels growth for businesses of all sizes. This role will support test, rollout & iterate products, as well as the communication throughout the product development cycle and growth efforts. Review user cases and on-platform behavior and synergize into product feedback and user education best practices
Coordinate, aggregate, and disseminate customer feedback throughout product life-cycle.

Work with cross-functional partners including Product Management, Business, and Compliance to guarantee operational readiness. Ensure functional partners are aligned on key objectives and timelines.
BA/BS degree
1+ years in operation, consulting, program management or equivalent roles
Strong communication skills across diverse functions and teams

Purpose of Job
We are looking for a Business Support Analyst in our San Antonio, Texas office or it can be a 100% Remote work environment. This specifically is for the Risk Reporting and Analytics group within the Retail Bank.

Supports the business by analyzing and evaluating relevant complex business data, information, metrics and processes to identify opportunities and solutions to business plan development and optimization of business operations. Responsible for supporting key functions and providing recommendations to achieve current and future business strategy needs/objectives.
Job Requirements
About USAA
USAA knows what it means to serve. We facilitate the financial security of millions of U.S. military members and their families. This singular mission requires a dedication to innovative thinking at every level.
We embrace a robust veteran workforce and encourage veterans and veteran spouses to apply.
USAA Careers – World Class Benefits (31 seconds)
Tasks:
Identifies and manages existing and emerging risks that stem from business activities and the job role.
Ensures risks associated with business activities are effectively identified, measured, monitored, and controlled.
Follows written risk and compliance policies and procedures for business activities.
Develops and maintains an understanding of overall complex business functions with in-depth knowledge of specific areas/functions and related activities.
Provides expertise in development of business goals and objectives to exploit all distribution channels, leverage use of data, and simplify processes.
Provides operational support on current complex processes and supports business operations and management in identifying opportunities and solutions to meet current and future business needs.
Validates information and interfaces with other departments to include presentations of documented findings, alternatives and recommended actions.
Participates in the planning, research, analysis, development, and implementation of new and modifications to existing applications and processes to provide new or improved capabilities, products, and/or services.
Maintains broad system knowledge, stays current on all system enhancements, identifies training needs and implements plans.
Maintains broad business knowledge, stays current on key business strategies & initiatives and identifies opportunities for support and enablement.
Assists with the documentation of new and revised departmental procedures.
Gathers information for complex processes, analyzes data and trends, identifies root causes, and develops work products.
Serves as a resource to team members on escalated issues of a routine nature.
Reviews and analyzes reports and provides recommendations to improve matrix and reporting controls,
Develops and analyzes additional ad-hoc reports as needed by Management and or Regulatory Agencies.
Contributes on policies, standards, risk management and controls related to relevant processes.
Minimum Education:
Bachelor's degree required OR 4+ additional years of related experience beyond the minimum required may be substituted in lieu of a degree.
Minimum Experience:
8 years of experience in end-to-end analysis and/or operations experience, including: requirement gathering and documentation, operational planning and forecasting, data analytics, or current/future state analysis, in direct support of business planning initiatives and optimization of business operations.
Advanced knowledge in a wide variety of systems coordination, process/product review initiatives and the development of management information requirements for related business functions.
Knowledge of business operations and systems/business requirements processes.
Experience facilitating and driving collaboration to common understanding of business requirements and driving standard enterprise wide business processes.
Knowledge of business analysis tools for ex: MS Visio MS Excel, Tableau, SQL.
Preferred:
Strong experience with Analytics and Reporting
Previous experience with Automation efforts
Familiarity with Risk and Controls framework
Compensation:
USAA has an effective process for assessing market data and establishing ranges to ensure we remain competitive. You are paid within the salary range based on your experience and market position. The salary range for this position is: $106,800 - $192,300 *(this does not include geographical differential, it may be applied based on your work location)
Employees may be eligible for pay incentives based on overall corporate and individual performance or at the discretion of the USAA Board of Directors.Geographical Differential: Geographic pay differential is additional pay provided to eligible employees working in locations where market pay levels are above the national average.

Reporting into the Chief Strategy Officer of Match Group, the Strategy and Analytics team is a nimble team that supports senior leaders and our portfolio businesses across Match Group on their most important strategic initiatives and challenges.
As a Sr. Business Data Analyst, you will extract critical data from multiple data sources and use your deep technical skills to develop reporting deliverables. Additionally, you will translate data into insights and actionable recommendations.
How you’ll make an impact:
You will develop a deep understanding of our products and businesses and their associated data
You will understand how metrics are defined and stored across multiple data sources and effectively combine them to enable custom reporting across Match Group portfolio businesses
You will succinctly and persuasively communicate your findings and make recommendations – anything from informing long-term product roadmaps to responding to competitive pressures
You will lead projects to continuously improve our data and reporting capabilities (e.g. proactively suggesting and building new reporting, fine tuning and automating existing reporting, etc.)
We could be a match if:
You have at least 2 years of experience in SQL (T-SQL and/or Redshift preferred) and at least 2 years of experience in a data / business analytics role

You have passion and analytical chops for developing and analyzing large, complex datasets and translating them into actionable insights
Your verbal and written communication skills are excellent, and you can effectively tailor your communication of insights to specific audiences
You have experience creating executive-facing PowerPoint presentations
You have completed an undergraduate degree in a technical or quantitative field
applicants will be required to complete a SQL skills assessment test
What’s the team like?
The members of the Strategy and Analytics team are passionate about using data to find solutions to challenges across our organization

This team is based in Dallas, TX. We will consider remote work for highly qualified candidates

Job Title: Senior Business Intelligence Analyst - Agency (Remote - Aust...
Description:
INTRODUCTION
The Zebra, named a Best Place to Work in Austin four years running, is seeking a collaborative, curious, and strategic-minded Senior Business Intelligence Analyst to join our growing Analytics team. This role will partner closely with The Zebra's Agency team to help drive smarter planning and operations decisions. In this pivotal position, you'll connect Agency data and initiatives to overall company performance while building out robust dashboards, reports, and processes to predict and communicate impact that drives decision making for partners.

While we are open to remote work across the contingent US, we are still in the process of establishing our company to support work in all states! Like many companies, pre-COVID we weren't set-up this way. We've recently made the shift from an in-office organization to a hybrid model and are loving the flexibility it allows our employees. We are set up to support employees who want to be fully remote, in-office only, and a mix of the two. Please note - we will not be supporting work based out of the following states: CA

This position is not currently eligible for visa sponsorship
WHAT YOU'LL DO:
Collaborate with Agency, Commercialization, and Data teams to gain a deep understanding of our user data across the entire customer journey.
Build and maintain robust dashboards and reports that communicate impact and business insights to the Agency and broader organization.
Become a domain expert in Agency data, serving as an advocate between Agency partners and the Data team to ensure data is accurate, available, and actionable.
Support Agency Leadership by catching material changes in our critical metrics, digging into the cause, and providing thorough reports on what is driving those changes.
Analyze performance trends and make recommendations to improve conversion and increase customer retention.
Gather requirements from partners and take a proactive, self-starter approach to analyzing the data to find opportunities for the Agency team.
REQUIREMENTS / QUALIFICATIONS:
3 - 5+ years of analytics experience
Experience with SQL and relational databases
Experience with BI (business intelligence) platforms (such as Looker, Tableau, PowerBI, MicroStrategy, Cognos, etc)
Reporting and dashboard creation (e.g. forecasting, pacing, etc.)
A passion for problem solving with strong analytical capabilities
Collaborate across an organization with superb communication skills (written, oral and interpersonal) and be comfortable engaging with management across multiple functions
EXPERIENCE THAT WILL IMPRESS THE HECK OUT OF US:
Experience in B2C
Insurance, E-Commerce, or Finance Industry experience
Programming experience in R
Data modeling or database mapping
BENEFITS + PERKS:
Competitive Compensation & Stock Option Offering
Health, Dental, Vision & Disability Coverages
HSA offering + employer contribution
401k with match
Unlimited PTO + flexibility to enjoy it
Paid Parental Leave Program
Wellness perk ($100/month)
Pet Adoption Reimbursement ($300/year)
Learning & Development Stipends
Bi-Monthly Wednesday Catered Lunch
Zeal Care - Monthly wellness subscriptions ($35/month)
Curated monthly snack box - sent to your house
Opportunity to join Employee Resource Groups (ERGs) or drive our diversity & inclusion stance by creating your own
Join a team that truly lives their values, and values their lives (outside of the office. Cliche, we know… but we really mean it)
ABOUT THE ZEBRA

The Zebra is the nation's leading insurance search comparison site. With its dynamic, real-time quote comparison tool, drivers can identify insurance companies with the coverage, service level, and pricing to suit their unique needs. The Zebra compares more than 100 car insurance companies and provides licensed agent support and educational resources to ensure drivers are equipped to make the most informed decisions about their policies. It's "insurance in black and white."

Headquartered in Austin, Texas, The Zebra has garnered the attention and investment of some of the nation's top venture capitalists, and the company's success has been profiled in publications like Inc., Time, Forbes, and TechCrunch. Austin Business Journal named The Zebra a Best Place to Work in 2015, 2016, 2017, 2018 and 2020. Austin American-Statesman awarded The Zebra as a Top Workplace in 2016, 2017 and 2018. Inc. Magazine also awarded The Zebra as Best Workplaces - 2018, 2019, 2020.

The Zebra is aiming to grow our fantastic team to add to our dynamic culture and continue building on our success. Working at The Zebra means never being bored, always being challenged, and supporting one another. We're a happy, hardworking group, and we're eager to add "new stripes" who share those values.

The Zebra is an equal opportunity employer and "at will" company.

As part of our dedication to maintaining an inclusive and diverse workforce, The Zebra provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, The Zebra complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

The Zebra expressly prohibits any form of workplace harassment based on race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, genetic information, disability, or veteran status. Improper interference with the ability of The Zebra's employees to perform their job duties may result in discipline up to and including discharge.

**No external recruiters or agents, please.**

Job Title: Business Systems Analyst, Business Intelligence and Analytic...
Description:
Minimum qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering, or related field, or equivalent practical experience.
8 years of experience in system implementation projects (e.g. requirements documentation, systems configuration, test documentation/execution, issue identification and resolution).
Experience developing/architecting BI and analytics solutions including data warehousing, Power BI, data engineering, and/or ETL warehousing.

Preferred qualifications:

Master's degree in Computer Science or a related technical field.
Experience with one or more of the following functional areas: finance, FP&A, Profit & Loss, Human Resources, service systems.
Experience integrating and or developing with one of the following technologies: SQL, Informatica, Tableau, Pantheon, SAP BW BI.
About the job
At Google, we work at lightning speed. So when things get in the way of progress, the Business Systems Integration team steps in to remove those roadblocks. The team identifies time-consuming internal processes and then builds solutions that are reliable and scalable enough to work within the size and scope of the company. You listen to and translate Googler needs into high-level technical specifications, design and develop recommended systems and consult with Google executives to ensure smooth implementation. Whether battling large system processes or leveraging our homegrown suite of Google products for Googlers themselves, you help Googlers work faster and more efficiently.

At Google, data comes first, and the BSA team is at the heart of that promise. We are part of the broader Corporate Engineering group at Google, and our team is responsible for building holistic data storage, transformation and warehousing solutions that empower POps, finance, and Business Intelligence (BI) organizations with self-service reporting capabilities and enable them to make data driven decisions. We partner closely with engineering and platform teams as well as other BI teams within Google to build, deploy and support BI systems that fulfill both analytical and operational data needs across organizations.
Behind everything our users see online is the architecture built by the Technical Infrastructure team to keep it running. From developing and maintaining our data centers to building the next generation of Google platforms, we make Google's product portfolio possible. We're proud to be our engineers' engineers and love voiding warranties by taking things apart so we can rebuild them. We keep our networks up and running, ensuring our users have the best and fastest experience possible.
Responsibilities
Work with cross-functional teams to understand process and system dependencies, and have a good handle on data flow.
Closely collaborate with business users to translate data requirements into clearly defined technical requirements.
Design and develop data warehouse solutions for business processes using Google-internal tools and technologies as well as 3rd party tools.
Support existing data pipelines. Troubleshoot and fix production issues and implement enhancements in existing data pipelines and reports.
Participate in system implementation projects (i.e. requirements documentation, systems configuration, test documentation/execution, issue identification and resolution).
Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.

At Shutterfly, we’re all about people — bringing them together, making them feel welcome, and connecting them to experiences. We make our customers’ memories last a lifetime by capturing, preserving, and sharing them through photography and personalized products. Through our family of brands, trend setting products, cutting edge technology, and best in class customer service, we help our customers, and each other, share life’s joy.

What You'll Do Here:
The Business Intelligence team partners with Shutterfly’s Marketing, Finance, Operations and Business teams to design and develop reports and dashboards that drive business decisions. The Sr. Business Intelligence Developer supports Business partners by utilizing knowledge of company data structure and experience with BI tools to provide insightful reporting solutions using Tableau. This role requires an individual with strong technical and analytical skills, good communication skills and ability to learn new technologies quickly. The ideal candidate is a self-motivated team player who is detail oriented, enjoys problem solving, can work independently and understands the full BI reporting development process. This role will spend time in both a project management capacity where others will develop the report as well as developing reports themselves.
What You'll Bring:
Great to Haves (Your Skills)
You have demonstrated the ability to manage BI projects from start to finish, gather information and requirements from business partners on BI initiatives, translate requirements into project plans, track project status within Jira, set expectations and communicate with business partners, and ensure final deliverables meet business partner’s needs.
You have designed, developed, and maintained reporting and business intelligence solutions using Tableau reporting software while leveraging visualization best practices.
You have written complex SQL queries to build performant extracts in Tableau.
You have participated in QC/QA and UAT processes.
You have worked with data teams to deliver solutions for reporting needs.
Great to Haves (Your Background)
Bachelor’s Degree in quantitative field and 3+ years’ experience in business intelligence, primarily working with the latest versions of Tableau.
Advanced Tableau user with experience designing dashboards leveraging visualization best practices.
Proficient with SQL; familiar with database design; experience working with large data sets.
Excellent communication and project management skills.
Detail oriented with ability to independently validate / triangulate data and analysis.
Able to prioritize multiple requests while completing deliverables on time. Self-motivated and can work independently. Ability to troubleshoot, track, and resolve day-to-day issues.
Must be comfortable with unstructured, fast-moving and constantly evolving high growth environment. Passion for excellence and continuous improvement.
If this aligns to your career goals, skills and experience, we want to work with you!
We are unable to provide visa sponsorship or transfers for this role at this time. No candidates requiring visa sponsorship or transfer will be considered.

ROLE RESPONSIBILITIES· Conduct requirements definition for Claims solutions. Collaborate closely with business stakeholders to understand theirbusiness requirements, informational needs and data sources. Translate these business needs into clearly defined anddocumented detailed business requirements/ functional requirements inclusive of business use cases, process flows, dataflows, traceability matrices as well as screen mock-ups· Provide claims processing subject matter expertise to the IT team throughout the project. Review development and testdeliverables as needed· Plan, facilitate, and conduct requirements elicitation sessions, meetings, and presentations· Collaborate with development and testing teams to provide subject matter expertise, ensure that out of the boxfunctionality is leveraged and to assist in troubleshooting and resolving issues· Lead review sessions for completed business/functional requirements with key business users focused on gainingconsensus and final business approval· Participate in the development of User Acceptance Test planning documentation, including test plans and scripts, basedon business and functional requirements· Facilitate UAT execution phase and work with business stakeholders and project manager to obtain user acceptance testsignoff· Conduct project planning and estimating efforts as neededTECHNICAL QUALIFICATIONS· 5+ years of proven experience in business analysis including defining Insurance business, functional and reportingrequirements and conducting user acceptance testing for business-critical solutions in complex environments· Experience with Guidewire Claim Center systems is required. Detailed claims processing knowledge and experience withexcellent problem-solving and analytical skills· Experience with Guidewire Policy Center is preferred· Proven hands-on experience in writing and executing MS SQL query is required· Insurance/Reinsurance industry experience and knowledge with an understanding of the terminology, business functions(Claims) and business processes· Experienced with formal SDLCs and business analysis methodologies and working knowledge of business analysisdocumentation standards· Agile Methodology experience a plus, but not required· Industry knowledge of claims processing for the Insurance or Reinsurance marketsGENERAL QUALIFICATIONS· Extensive experience in using standard project tools including Microsoft Team Foundation Server (via Visual Studio), Excel,Word, PowerPoint, and SharePoint· Excellent oral and written communication skills and the ability to clearly articulate to all project members andstakeholders. Must be a team player who works well with technical and non-technical resources· Strong initiative, able to self-manage. Comfortable with ambiguity and able to work through it to get the right thingsdone. Ability to handle multiple projects at the same time· Team player who works well with technical and business resources· Personal time management skills and ability to meet individual and team deadlinesJob Types: Full-time, ContractPay: $60.00 - $65.00 per hourSchedule:Monday to FridayWork Location: One location

Why Housecall Pro?

Help us build solutions that build better lives. At Housecall Pro, we show up to work every day to make a difference for real people: the home service professionals that support America's 100 million homes.

We're all about the Pro, and dedicate our days to helping them streamline operations, scale their businesses, and—ultimately—save time so they can be with their families and live well. We care deeply about our customers and foster a culture where our company, employees, and Pros grow and succeed together. Leadership is as focused on growing team members' careers as they expect their teams to be on creating solutions for Pros.

We also offer:

A generous benefits program that supports the whole you with medical, dental, vision, life, disability, and 401(k)
Paid holidays and flexible, take-it-as-you-need-it paid time off
Equity in a rapidly growing startup backed by top-tier VCs
Monthly tech reimbursements
A culture built on innovation that values big ideas, no matter where they come from

Let's talk if you are:

Curious: You possess a growth mindset with a desire for experimentation - you don't rest until you find the "Why" and "How".

Collaborative: You will straddle the line between analytics and the business to help bridge the gap and improve efficiency using business intelligence and database tools such as Tableau and SQL.

Partner-focused: You will help guide the business in improving processes, products, services and software through data analysis that drive our Customer Success interactions.

Logical and Data-driven: You find the problem, analyze the data, and implement a solution without being told how to do it. You are able to use both your analyst skills and creativity to find ways to build and improve processes within the business.

Passionate: Passion for learning, for new experiences, and for being the best at what you do.

What you'll be doing:

Become an expert in financial technology products and services, and gain a deep understanding of the entire Fintech ecosystem
Drive results by supporting business and product stakeholders in identifying and answering key questions through data-driven analysis
Provide analysis and identify opportunities to grow our Fintech product lines including payments, financing, card issuance, and more
Build reporting for new and existing Fintech products; monitor and report results


Finding opportunities to improve the business and executing them: This is the fun part. We know where we are and where we need to be, so how do we get there?

Interpret data and findings and translates them into feasible options, communicate these back to the business stakeholders
Work with stakeholders and team to prioritize requirements
May include leading other analytics resources

Qualifications

Bachelor or Master degree, preferably in business administration, finance, economics or data analytics
2-3 years of related work experience (examples: customer success analytics, data analysis, process management, and project management)
High analytical ability
Curious, proactive and driven for impact
Experience with SQL
Advanced excel skills or experienced in the regular use of business intelligence (BI) tools such as Tableau, Looker, or Demo

 Compensation: Min $75,000 OTE

Founded in 2013, Housecall Pro champions home service professionals by giving them the tools to work simpler and grow smarter across all aspects of their business. Our core SaaS software platform helps Pros with scheduling, dispatching, job management, invoicing, payment processing, marketing, and more. We support more than 20,000 businesses and have over 400 ambitious, mission-driven, genuinely fun-loving employees in San Diego, Denver, and all over the world. If you want to do work that impacts real people, supported by a team that'll invest in you every step of the way, we'd love to hear from you.

Housecall Pro celebrates diversity and we are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees with equal treatment and opportunity in all aspects of recruitment, selection, and employment without regard to gender, race, religion, national origin, ethnicity, disability, gender identity/expression, sexual orientation, veteran or military status, or any other category protected under the law. Housecall Pro is an equal opportunity employer; committed to an environment free from discrimination, harassment, and retaliation. #LI-SG1

Business Analyst, Used Cars
Description:
The Business Analysis, Used Cars team drives business critical decisions, ensures cross functional alignment of goals and execution, and helps the North America Used Car Organization drive new initiatives forward. We stay focused on aligning the highest-level company priorities with strong day-to-day operations and build capabilities to power hyper-growth.
As the Business Analyst, Used Cars, you will partner with members of the North America Used Cars leadership, Finance and Sales Analytics teams to provide key insights into the fast-growing used car business.
Responsibilities:
§ Analyze key performance indicators, unit economics, inventory data and forecast future performance (includes developing models and decision-making tools)
§ Provide strategic insights and conclusions based on analysis, including concise, digestible arguments with data to present to leadership
§ Identify and implement system improvements to optimize operational flow, used car inventory refurbishment, turn time, and cash conversion cycle
§ Partner with stakeholders across the organization to ensure data integrity and accuracy, and automation of recurring tasks
Qualifications:
§ MBA or bachelor’s degree in Business, Economics and/or equivalent experience
§ Expert modeling skills in Excel required
§ Competency with SQL, Power Query, Power BI, Visio and R strongly desired
§ Proficiency with Tableau or other data visualization tools
§ Experience working with large, complex and incomplete data sets
§ 3+ years in cross-functional project management experience
§ Very strong quantitative/analytical skillset
§ Superior business judgement – ability to flex between big picture thinking, understand and distill complex ideas, and analyze data to drive strategic objectives
§ Problem solver that is action-oriented with ability to look at problems in new ways
§ Trustworthy and discreet with highly sensitive non-public information
§ Passion for Tesla’s products and belief in Tesla’s mission to accelerate the transition to sustainable energy
§ Location – Fremont, California (Bay Area)
*Authorization to work in the US without sponsorship*
Employee Benefits
As a full time Tesla employee you will receive full benefits from day 1 for you and your dependents.
Kaiser and UnitedHealthcare PPO and HSA plans (including infertility coverage)
3 medical plan choices with $0 paycheck contribution
Vision & dental plans (including orthodontic coverage)
Company paid Life, AD&D, short-term and long-term disability
401(k), Employee Stock Purchase Plans, and other financial benefits
Employee Assistance Program, Paid Time Off, and Paid Holidays
Back-up childcare and employee discounts
