Job Title: Sr. Business Partner | Space Analytics & Insights (Full-Time...
Description:
About us:
Target is an iconic brand, a Fortune 50 company and one of America’s leading retailers.

Target Merchandising is evolving at an incredible pace. We are constantly reimagining how this $70 billion retailer offers the innovative, guest-inspiring items that Target is known and loved for. Our goal is to deliver exceptional value, quality and style to elevate Target as the premier retailer in a competitive global marketplace. Through intelligent and progressive business strategies that make the most of Target’s resources and partnerships worldwide, Merchandising works across product categories to create a localized shopping experience online and in our 1800 stores.
A role within Space Analytics & Insights (SAI) means you’re on a mission to create better store space and experiences for our guest while maximizing profitable sales. The SAI team combines data analytics and consulting to make space recommendations across Target’s 1800+ stores. From recommending space in remodels to evaluating performance of in-store experiences, the Sr. Business Partner role has a unique opportunity to make a large-scale impact while working in a small start-up like environment within Space and Presentation. In addition, you’ll have the opportunity to partner with cross-functional project teams in Merchandising, Store Design, Merchandise Planning, Finance, Store Operations and Visual Merchandising from strategy to execution to achieve an inspiring and convenient in-store guest experience.
As a Sr. Business Partner in Space Analytics & Insights, you could work on the following:
Own the development of new capabilities in partnership with Product and Data Sciences in order to elevate the role of analytics within Space and Presentation
Generate insights and forecast the financial impact of change to influence space allocation of future stores
Embrace a highly-analytical role with massive amounts of data and regular change, with a focus on making the right localized decisions for all stores
Partner with and influence senior leaders across Space and Presentation, Merchandising, and VM teams to ensure Target’s strategies come to life through space
Champion an agile, entrepreneurial spirit as you help lead within a newly-formed team
Be supported along the way with onboarding, as well as personal and career development, to help you grow as a strong Sr Business Partner.

Job duties may change at any time due to business needs.
About you:
Four-year degree or equivalent experience
2+ years of work experience
Self-starter who thrives in ambiguous environments
Strong analytical skills and experience; can easily translate data from an array of sources into actionable insights and recommendations
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Project or Product Management Experience
Ability to establish and nourish cross-functional working relationships across the enterprise
This position may be considered for a Full-Time Remote or Hybrid work arrangement based on Target’s needs. A Hybrid work arrangement means the team members core role will be a blend of virtual and onsite at a Target location. A Full-Time Remote work arrangement means the team member works full-time from home or an alternate location that’s not a Target location, does not have a desk at their primary HQ work location and may travel to HQ up to 4 times a year.
Colorado, Connecticut or Nevada Residents Only: The salary range for Colorado, Connecticut or Nevada residents is $62500 - $112,500 Pay is based on several factors including but not limited to education, work experience, certifications, etc. In addition to your salary, Target cares about and invests in you as a team member, so that you can take care of yourself and your family. Find competitive benefits from financial and education to well-being and beyond.”
Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA)
Target will provide reasonable accommodations (such as a qualified sign language interpreter or other personal assistance) with the application process upon your request as required to comply with applicable laws. If you have a disability and require assistance in this application process, please visit your nearest Target store or Distribution Center or reach out to Guest Services at 1-800-440-0680 for additional information.
Qualifications:

INTRODUCTION
The Zebra, named a Best Place to Work in Austin four years running, is seeking a collaborative, curious, and strategic-minded Senior Business Intelligence Analyst to join our growing Analytics team. This role will partner closely with The Zebra's Agency team to help drive smarter planning and operations decisions. In this pivotal position, you'll connect Agency data and initiatives to overall company performance while building out robust dashboards, reports, and processes to predict and communicate impact that drives decision making for partners.

While we are open to remote work across the contingent US, we are still in the process of establishing our company to support work in all states! Like many companies, pre-COVID we weren't set-up this way. We've recently made the shift from an in-office organization to a hybrid model and are loving the flexibility it allows our employees. We are set up to support employees who want to be fully remote, in-office only, and a mix of the two. Please note - we will not be supporting work based out of the following states: CA

This position is not currently eligible for visa sponsorship
WHAT YOU'LL DO:
Collaborate with Agency, Commercialization, and Data teams to gain a deep understanding of our user data across the entire customer journey.
Build and maintain robust dashboards and reports that communicate impact and business insights to the Agency and broader organization.
Become a domain expert in Agency data, serving as an advocate between Agency partners and the Data team to ensure data is accurate, available, and actionable.
Support Agency Leadership by catching material changes in our critical metrics, digging into the cause, and providing thorough reports on what is driving those changes.
Analyze performance trends and make recommendations to improve conversion and increase customer retention.
Gather requirements from partners and take a proactive, self-starter approach to analyzing the data to find opportunities for the Agency team.
REQUIREMENTS / QUALIFICATIONS:
3 - 5+ years of analytics experience
Experience with SQL and relational databases
Experience with BI (business intelligence) platforms (such as Looker, Tableau, PowerBI, MicroStrategy, Cognos, etc)
Reporting and dashboard creation (e.g. forecasting, pacing, etc.)
A passion for problem solving with strong analytical capabilities
Collaborate across an organization with superb communication skills (written, oral and interpersonal) and be comfortable engaging with management across multiple functions
EXPERIENCE THAT WILL IMPRESS THE HECK OUT OF US:
Experience in B2C
Insurance, E-Commerce, or Finance Industry experience
Programming experience in R
Data modeling or database mapping
BENEFITS + PERKS:
Competitive Compensation & Stock Option Offering
Health, Dental, Vision & Disability Coverages
HSA offering + employer contribution
401k with match
Unlimited PTO + flexibility to enjoy it
Paid Parental Leave Program
Wellness perk ($100/month)
Pet Adoption Reimbursement ($300/year)
Learning & Development Stipends
Bi-Monthly Wednesday Catered Lunch
Zeal Care - Monthly wellness subscriptions ($35/month)
Curated monthly snack box - sent to your house
Opportunity to join Employee Resource Groups (ERGs) or drive our diversity & inclusion stance by creating your own
Join a team that truly lives their values, and values their lives (outside of the office. Cliche, we know… but we really mean it)
ABOUT THE ZEBRA

The Zebra is the nation's leading insurance search comparison site. With its dynamic, real-time quote comparison tool, drivers can identify insurance companies with the coverage, service level, and pricing to suit their unique needs. The Zebra compares more than 100 car insurance companies and provides licensed agent support and educational resources to ensure drivers are equipped to make the most informed decisions about their policies. It's "insurance in black and white."

Headquartered in Austin, Texas, The Zebra has garnered the attention and investment of some of the nation's top venture capitalists, and the company's success has been profiled in publications like Inc., Time, Forbes, and TechCrunch. Austin Business Journal named The Zebra a Best Place to Work in 2015, 2016, 2017, 2018 and 2020. Austin American-Statesman awarded The Zebra as a Top Workplace in 2016, 2017 and 2018. Inc. Magazine also awarded The Zebra as Best Workplaces - 2018, 2019, 2020.

The Zebra is aiming to grow our fantastic team to add to our dynamic culture and continue building on our success. Working at The Zebra means never being bored, always being challenged, and supporting one another. We're a happy, hardworking group, and we're eager to add "new stripes" who share those values.

The Zebra is an equal opportunity employer and "at will" company.

As part of our dedication to maintaining an inclusive and diverse workforce, The Zebra provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, The Zebra complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

The Zebra expressly prohibits any form of workplace harassment based on race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, genetic information, disability, or veteran status. Improper interference with the ability of The Zebra's employees to perform their job duties may result in discipline up to and including discharge.

**No external recruiters or agents, please.**

Company Name: LifeSOULutions that Work dba Brave Thinking...
Description:
At Shutterfly, we’re all about people — bringing them together, making them feel welcome, and connecting them to experiences. We make our customers’ memories last a lifetime by capturing, preserving, and sharing them through photography and personalized products. Through our family of brands, trend setting products, cutting edge technology, and best in class customer service, we help our customers, and each other, share life’s joy.

What You'll Do Here:
The Business Intelligence team partners with Shutterfly’s Marketing, Finance, Operations and Business teams to design and develop reports and dashboards that drive business decisions. The Sr. Business Intelligence Developer supports Business partners by utilizing knowledge of company data structure and experience with BI tools to provide insightful reporting solutions using Tableau. This role requires an individual with strong technical and analytical skills, good communication skills and ability to learn new technologies quickly. The ideal candidate is a self-motivated team player who is detail oriented, enjoys problem solving, can work independently and understands the full BI reporting development process. This role will spend time in both a project management capacity where others will develop the report as well as developing reports themselves.
What You'll Bring:
Great to Haves (Your Skills)
You have demonstrated the ability to manage BI projects from start to finish, gather information and requirements from business partners on BI initiatives, translate requirements into project plans, track project status within Jira, set expectations and communicate with business partners, and ensure final deliverables meet business partner’s needs.
You have designed, developed, and maintained reporting and business intelligence solutions using Tableau reporting software while leveraging visualization best practices.
You have written complex SQL queries to build performant extracts in Tableau.
You have participated in QC/QA and UAT processes.
You have worked with data teams to deliver solutions for reporting needs.
Great to Haves (Your Background)
Bachelor’s Degree in quantitative field and 3+ years’ experience in business intelligence, primarily working with the latest versions of Tableau.
Advanced Tableau user with experience designing dashboards leveraging visualization best practices.
Proficient with SQL; familiar with database design; experience working with large data sets.
Excellent communication and project management skills.
Detail oriented with ability to independently validate / triangulate data and analysis.
Able to prioritize multiple requests while completing deliverables on time. Self-motivated and can work independently. Ability to troubleshoot, track, and resolve day-to-day issues.
Must be comfortable with unstructured, fast-moving and constantly evolving high growth environment. Passion for excellence and continuous improvement.
If this aligns to your career goals, skills and experience, we want to work with you!
We are unable to provide visa sponsorship or transfers for this role at this time. No candidates requiring visa sponsorship or transfer will be considered.

Job Description
Do you want to be a part of the team that helps make the City of Boca Raton one of the best places to live, work and play? We provide world class services, parks, beaches, and public safety. This can only happen when the best, brightest, and most committed individuals come to work for our City. We encourage like-minded individuals to apply and be part of our team! Come join us #WorkforBoca
BUSINESS SYSTEM ANALYST
Pay Grade: X35

GENERAL STATEMENT OF JOB:

 Performs professional and technical work in supporting enterprise business applications including planning, design, analysis, implementation, integration, and management of various computer systems for the City departments. This position reports to the IT Manager depending upon area of assignment.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:

Serves as the liaison between IT and the assigned department.
Attends assigned department staff meetings, manages multiple projects, and provides status reports of progress.
Works closely with the assigned department to create electronic forms and business workflow solutions for improved efficiencies.
Identifies and troubleshoots issues and provides resolution.
Monitors system activities and takes appropriate action to minimize down time;
Implements and maintains interfaces to and from other computer systems.
Develops and documents business requirements and project plans.
Develops integrations between systems.
Manages software upgrades with third party vendors and assists in testing and verification of the upgrades.
Contributes to and maintains compliance with IT system standards.
Provides assessment of future departmental and enterprise needs.
Works with network team to maintain and upgrade servers that support the assigned department.
Works with Microsoft SQL server, OBIEE, or similar reporting tools supporting systems and producing reports.
Participate in disaster recovery tests and planning.
Trains the users to be able to successfully use the system, minimize errors, and have knowledge to troubleshoot.

Depending upon area of assignment, may be required to support:

Development Services:
Software support includes but not limited to: software for building permits, planning & zoning, land management, cash receipts and code enforcement.
Avolve Projectdox electronic plan review software.
LobbyCentral visitor check-in software.

Financial Services:
Software support includes all purchasing, cash management, accounts payable, account receivable, utility billing, payroll, auditing, and general accounting.
Assists and leads departmental efforts in the conversion of the City's legacy financial system.
General knowledge of financial systems including online payment portals and PCI compliance.
Leads technical integration of all city systems into the financial system

Fire Rescue Services:
Serves as the system administrator for the Fire NFIRS and ePCR systems.
Manages the databases to support Fire's inventory, station management, and work order system.
Manages and serves as software system administrator of Telestaff scheduling system.

Information Technology:
Software support includes, but not limited to: Laserfiche, Compliance Suite, Halogen, Oracle Cloud Suite, and MCCI JustFOIA.
General knowledge of computer equipment as it relates to computer systems used including but not limited to: desktop and wide-format scanners, as well as servers.

Recreation Services:
Software support includes, but not limited to: Vermont Systems' Rectrac Activity (web) registration, Golf software, Pontem Cemetery, Motorola irrigation systems, Hiperweb inspection management software, social media, and website content management.
Maintains the activity management software, Vermont Systems, Rectrac, as the software system administrator.
General knowledge of computer equipment as it relates to computer systems used including but not limited to: point of sale equipment, cash drawers, tablets for park inspections, irrigation management, and library distribution systems.
Chairs Recreation Department technology team.
Works closely with the City's Marketing and Communications Division and serves as the website and social media auditor of marketing and public communication in coordination with Recreation Administration.

Utility Services:
Serves as the system administrator for the Maximo system.
Creates reports and dashboards utilizing Crystal Reports and other software.
Integrates ESRI GIS with department software systems and assists with maintenance.
Develops scripts for querying databases.
Develops forms and processes using programming languages and scripts to enhance City department workflow.

RELATED TASKS:

Stays abreast of new tools and techniques available to enhance business processes.
Works with vendor for software support and other technical issues.
Provides assessment of future departmental and enterprise needs.
Performs related tasks as required.

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES:

Must have experience and knowledge of the principles and techniques used to support ERP systems including purchasing, cash management, accounts payable, account receivable, payroll, benefits, and auditing.
General knowledge of the principles and techniques used in document capture, processing, and storage utilizing document management systems.
Extensive experience in project management for an organization supporting 1500 employees.
Extensive experience in system administration.
Excellent communication skills both oral and written, especially as related to the communication of technical concepts to non-technical individuals.
Ability to organize data, to think logically, and to analyze issues.
Ability to prioritize requests and problems.
Ability to prepare complex reports for assigned department.
Ability to manage multiple tasks and meet scheduled in a self-directed fashion.
Ability to work flexible schedules, on-call support and occasional after-hours projects and upgrades.
MINIMUM AND PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:

Bachelor’s degree in information technology or closely related field plus a minimum of three (3) years’ experience in system administration of business applications and a minimum of two (2) years’ experience in business process management utilizing Sharepoint, Laserfiche or similar systems; OR
Seven (7) years’ experience in system administration of business applications and a minimum of six (6) years’ experience in business process management utilizing Sharepoint, Laserfiche or similar systems.
Oracle or comparable financial system experience required.
Project Management PMP Certification preferred.
Experience with SQL, OBIEE, or similar reporting tools preferred.

SPECIAL REQUIREMENTS:

 Possession of a valid State of Florida Class "E" driver's license.

POST-OFFER BACKGROUND REQUIREMENTS:

 The background check process for this position may include:
Criminal Background Check
Employment Verification
Reference Checks
Motor Vehicles Report (MVR) Check
Educational Verification

TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok has global offices including Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Mumbai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul, and Tokyo. We are now looking for talented individuals to join us in 2022 - people who want to inspire creativity and co-create the future with TikTok.

Our team uses data analysis to help drive the company’s monetization strategy and operations. We’re looking for a Business Intelligence (BI) analyst to drive analytics initiatives that guide operational excellence for our Americas business. You will have a ground floor opportunity to shape TikTok’s growth and monetization efforts in Americas.

In this role, you will:

Collect, process, and clean data from disparate sources using SQL, Python, and BI tools to investigate key business trends, issues and opportunities
Develop scalable analytical solutions such as tables, datasets, models and dashboards
Conduct Ad-hoc analysis that helps the business better understand key value drivers and growth opportunities
Effectively communicate actionable insights across all levels to inform monetization efforts
Work closely with cross-functional partners, including local monetization teams, sales & sales operations, international strategy and data teams to drive analytical initiatives to completion
Pursuing a BA/BS degree in math, statistics, data science, business analytics, engineering, computer science or other quantitative major
Solid analytical aptitude with strong exposure or interest in strategy
Strong programming (SQL, Python, R etc) and statistical modeling skills
Expertise in BI visualization tools such as Tableau, Looker is a plus
Self-starter attitude: You’re someone who can initiate and drive complex analysis to completion with minimal guidance and then synthesize and communicate insights
Get-it-done mindset: You’re motivated to work hard and efficiently in a fast-paced, cross-cultural environment.

TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We believe individuals shouldn't be disadvantaged because of their background or identity, but instead should be considered based on their strengths and experience. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.

TikTok is committed to providing reasonable accommodations during our recruitment process. If you need assistance or an accommodation, please reach out to us at Accommodations-AMS@tiktok.com.

Job Title: Product Data Analyst- Xbox Product Services
Description:
Xbox is one of the world’s most valuable brands and enjoys millions of players and passionate fans. An important part of our plan is to grow our global player base and our multi-billion dollar a year Xbox console and accessories business. At Xbox, we believe Gamer Happiness is at the core to our mission of empowering every person and organization on the planet to achieve more.
As part of Xbox Product Services (XPS), Xbox Community (XBC) supports the growth and happiness of our broader gaming community, including ensuring the safety and security all our members. We provide thought leadership and execute on growing a truly inclusive community wherever people play games.
To do so, the Experiences Optimization and Insights (eXOI) team within the Xbox Community (XBC) team is looking for passionate individuals that know how to leverage data, tell a story, and partner with teams across Xbox to deliver on world class social experiences. You’ll play a key role in uncovering how Xbox gamers socially engage and help uncover new opportunities to drive social engagement within the Xbox network. You’ll also play a key role working with the Xbox Community leadership team to understand how we are tracking to our goals, and identify new ways to measure how we are delivering on our mission. If you have a passion for gaming, technology, social media, and leveraging big data, this is the team for you. Where else will you get to help gamers have more fun, find more friends to play with, and leverage your data skills?
Responsibilities
Shape, analyze, and tell a story leveraging data from varying sources to provide insights into how gamers are engaging in the Xbox ecosystem, and uncover new patterns to improve gamer experiences.
Partner with Product Management, Design, and Engineering teams to discover and craft metrics to measure our success and use of our ecosystem ….
Use and promote data-exploration techniques to discover new or previously unasked questions
Work with partner data teams to operationalize metrics, and drive analytics automation and enhance BI capabilities (dashboarding/insight retrieval)
Qualifications
Qualifications
2-5 years’ experience applying analytics to a consumer facing experiences or app (Social Media/Search/Mobile Games)
Solid knowledge in Statistics, A/B testing or causal inference
Experience in extracting, processing, and analyzing data using SQL or SQL-like scripting language (Hadoop, Cosmos, Kusto etc.)
Strong analytical problem-solving skills
Ability to manage through ambiguity and answer open-ended questions
BA/BS in Business Administration ,CS, Marketing, Economics, Statistics
Nice To Have's
Background in data sciences
Hands on experience with Python/R

Data analyst responsibilities include conducting full lifecycle analysis to include requirements, activities and design. Data analysts will develop analysis and reporting capabilities. Paramount+, a direct-to-consumer digital subscription video on-demand and live streaming service from ViacomCBS, combines live sports, breaking news, and a mountain of entertainment. The premium streaming service features an expansive library of original series, hit shows and popular movies across every genre from world-renowned brands and production studios, including BET, CBS, Comedy Central, MTV, Nickelodeon, Paramount Pictures and the Smithsonian Channel. The service is also the streaming home to unmatched sports programming, including every CBS Sports event, from golf to football to basketball and more, plus exclusive streaming rights for major sports properties, including some of the world’s biggest and most popular soccer leagues. Paramount+ also enables subscribers to stream local CBS stations live across the U.S. in addition to the ability to stream ViacomCBS Streaming’s other live channels: CBSN for 24/7 news, CBS Sports HQ for sports news and analysis, and ET Live for entertainment coverage. Brand/Division Overview:
Data plays a central role at ViacomCBS, and as part of the Data & Insights Group (DIG), our Business Intelligence team is a crucial part of our success. It drives business, content, product, and operational decisions by providing rich data, strategic insights and analytical products. Are you We are looking for a Business Intelligence Analyst who is passionate about data and entertainment and who thrives in a dynamic and fast-paced environment!
The position is anchored around our growing SVOD service Paramount+, which includes a wealth of established library content across CBS, MTV Entertainment Group, Nickelodeon, BET and more, together with its growing Originals’ slate, such as iCarly, Star Trek: Picard; RuPaul's Drag Race All Stars, PAW Patrol: The Movie; Queenpins, The SpongeBob Movie: Sponge On The Run and Why Women Kill and many more. Role Details:
Our team primarily focuses on social media for Paramount+ and developing and generating reports, insights, & analysis across multiple sources and solutions - covering account, content and competitor analysis, social listening and more. With a strong understanding of social trends, platform tracking nuances and also having a deep understanding of SQL, this analyst will work closely with the insights and social analytics group to ensure all needed APIs are ingested and appropriate dashboards are built for Paramount+ partners. You will be tasked to identify business, content strategy and social programming opportunities, challenges, and trends and be able to communicate your findings effectively to various partners in the marketing and content vertical. This role will be primarily focused on social data analysis work related to Paramount+. Your Day-to-Day:
Define and deliver social focused KPIs and reporting, that will inform social and content strategy
Write SQL to query a data warehouse (BigQuery) for data in order to answer questions from a variety of stakeholders in the content and social vertical
Support content, social and marketing teams with needed campaign reporting and analyses
Present insights and recommendations to the business in a confident and understandable manner
Develop and maintain statistical and spreadsheet models for social forecasting, scenario planning, and other predictive work
Use reporting/visualization tools such as Tableau, Data Studio, Sprinklr, DOMO, Talkwalker Analytics to build social-focused dashboards that allow non-data savvy users to generate insights and answer questions in a self-service fashion
Research industry trends and communicate how these could potentially impact the business from a social perspective Key Projects (examples):
Work with the data management team to ensure appropriate APIs are ingested and tables are set up appropriately
Design and develop comprehensive reporting tools/solutions for Paramount+’s associated social accounts
Measure social performance around original shows and tentpole events and their respective advertising campaigns
Collaborate with key partners and teams to develop appropriate social goals and forecasting solutions
Conduct downstream reporting and analysis for Subscriber Households who were acquired through social media
Identify social media opportunities for Paramount+, through competitor intelligence analysis and reporting Qualifications:
Bachelor’s Degree in a related field or equivalent experience
2-3 years experience in digital marketing/entertainment sector
Can provide accurate information in a usable form and on a timely basis.
Demonstrated experience in translating data into insights in a clear and succinct manner, adjusting to a variety of styles and audiences
Expert in social native reporting
Experience in social analytics tools such as Sprinklr, Talkwalker, ListenFirst
Knowledgeable in SQL; Tableau; Data Studio

At Shutterfly, we’re all about people — bringing them together, making them feel welcome, and connecting them to experiences. We make our customers’ memories last a lifetime by capturing, preserving, and sharing them through photography and personalized products. Through our family of brands, trend setting products, cutting edge technology, and best in class customer service, we help our customers, and each other, share life’s joy.

What You'll Do Here:
The Business Intelligence team partners with Shutterfly’s Marketing, Finance, Operations and Business teams to design and develop reports and dashboards that drive business decisions. The Sr. Business Intelligence Developer supports Business partners by utilizing knowledge of company data structure and experience with BI tools to provide insightful reporting solutions using Tableau. This role requires an individual with strong technical and analytical skills, good communication skills and ability to learn new technologies quickly. The ideal candidate is a self-motivated team player who is detail oriented, enjoys problem solving, can work independently and understands the full BI reporting development process. This role will spend time in both a project management capacity where others will develop the report as well as developing reports themselves.
What You'll Bring:
Great to Haves (Your Skills)
You have demonstrated the ability to manage BI projects from start to finish, gather information and requirements from business partners on BI initiatives, translate requirements into project plans, track project status within Jira, set expectations and communicate with business partners, and ensure final deliverables meet business partner’s needs.
You have designed, developed, and maintained reporting and business intelligence solutions using Tableau reporting software while leveraging visualization best practices.
You have written complex SQL queries to build performant extracts in Tableau.
You have participated in QC/QA and UAT processes.
You have worked with data teams to deliver solutions for reporting needs.
Great to Haves (Your Background)
Bachelor’s Degree in quantitative field and 3+ years’ experience in business intelligence, primarily working with the latest versions of Tableau.
Advanced Tableau user with experience designing dashboards leveraging visualization best practices.
Proficient with SQL; familiar with database design; experience working with large data sets.
Excellent communication and project management skills.
Detail oriented with ability to independently validate / triangulate data and analysis.
Able to prioritize multiple requests while completing deliverables on time. Self-motivated and can work independently. Ability to troubleshoot, track, and resolve day-to-day issues.
Must be comfortable with unstructured, fast-moving and constantly evolving high growth environment. Passion for excellence and continuous improvement.
If this aligns to your career goals, skills and experience, we want to work with you!
We are unable to provide visa sponsorship or transfers for this role at this time. No candidates requiring visa sponsorship or transfer will be considered.

Job Title

Sr. Business Intelligence Analyst & Developer

Job Description Summary

As part of the Client Account Team and liaison to Cushman & Wakefield's Global Business Intelligence (BI) team, the Sr. BI Analyst & Developer is responsible for delivery of all data analytics and governance in support of the Cushman & Wakefield's Client Team.
The responsibilities include data mapping, data assessments and analysis, data governance support, POC dashboard development, user acceptance testing, reporting support, opportunity assessments, tabular model support, workplace trend analysis, benchmarking analysis, and general product support for Client Account Team's BI platform.

Job Description

The responsibilities include data mapping, data assessments and analysis, data governance support, POC dashboard development, user acceptance testing, reporting support, opportunity assessments, tabular model support, workplace trend analysis, benchmarking analysis, and general product support for Client Account Team's platform. Position location is virtual with Central or East time zones preferred.

Responsibilities:
Support the Client Account Team to build, implement, and support the BI platform and data strategy initiatives.
Support the Data Governance Lead on all data governance initiatives for the BI platform.
Liaise with Product Owners and Data Governance Lead to ensure dashboard prototype design and build meets business requirements and aligns with the data and tabular model.
Proactively analyze the client’s portfolio and provide support in identifying risks and opportunities.
Lead data assessment exercises with new service lines while onboarding onto the BI platform.
Lead data mapping exercises to support system integration projects.
Drive continuous improvement in the automation and standardization of data requirements.
Partner with the development team to expand client's BI product offering through dashboard POCs, tabular model measure development and product feature enhancements.
Utilize advanced analytics tools such as Alteryx and AWS tools to transform data, automate workflows and develop analytical tools.
Work effectively with all areas of the business to identify required dashboard visualizations and associated calculations to build dashboards.
Technical documentation and process documentation as required for activities within the data workstream
Provide guidance and training to the account team employees on C&W’s BI platform.
Support custom reporting requests
Provide both verbal and written updates to management on the progress of work.
Liaise with service line leadership to extract data from point applications for uploading into the BI platform.
Promote effective and consistent communication – both within your team and cross-departmental.

Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in Business, Engineering or Technology
Experience in AWS is preferred
Experience in business analytics or data visualization software Tableau
Experience also in Power BI is preferred
Experience in SharePoint
Experience in data mapping and modelling
Experience in SQL is preferred
Experience in ETL tool such as Alteryx or Python is a plus
Experience in being part of a software product team or BI product team is a plus
Experience handling commercial real estate data is a plus

Skills & Personal Qualities:
Excellent communication in English
Great attention to detail, diligent, focused, and highly analytical
Committed, able to work to deadlines, prioritize and juggle between tasks
Business writing and reporting skills
Thoughtful, collaborative, and proactively ready to engage with stakeholders across the globe
Experience in Agile Development
Able to work in a high-pressure environment
In depth experience working as an Analyst in a professional working environment.
Able to communicate effectively at all levels, including the ability to negotiate and resolve conflict.
Experience in documenting business processes in the form of process maps and step-by-step user manuals.
Experience in supporting system testing with entry and exist criteria.
Commitment to quality and a thorough approach to work.
Workshop facilitation skills for requirements gathering analysis.
Ability to build & maintain effective working relationships with internal and external personnel.
Demonstrate flexibility and ability to deliver.
Ability to produce high quality documentation (reports, specifications, requirements, etc.)
Good team player, also able to work independently.
Curiosity and drive to solve problems.

Ability to multi-task
Positive team player able to thrive in a highly motivated in a fast-paced environment

Job Title: Business Analyst Rotation Program - Richmond, VA
Description:
8901 - Corp Office West Crk - 12800 Tuckahoe Creek Parkway, Richmond, Virginia, 23238

CarMax, the way your career should be!

About this Job:


Disrupting the marketplace more than 25 years ago, CarMax became the largest used car retailer in the US. However, our goals as a company aren't just to be the best in the industry but a leading retailer across all industries. To achieve this goal, CarMax has spent the last several years investing heavily in modernizing our digital and analytical infrastructure to support our customer-centric experience. Whether that be through building machine learning vehicle recommendation models in Python, or constructing Tableau visualizations to influence strategic decision making, CarMax is committed to equipping our analysts with industry-best tools and techniques to enable our continued success.

As a Business Analyst, you'll play a key part in driving this success for the future. This entry-level 24-month rotational position will provide the opportunity to apply strategic thinking, problem solving, and data analytics to unique and complex problems, influencing company performance and success from Day 1.

How you'll impact CarMax:


Research & Analytics - Business analysts are the analytical authorities at CarMax. Apply your analytical skillset to CarMax's proprietary, industry-leading data to formulate and test theories about specific business areas. Leverage your new understandings to translate large datasets into insightful metrics and predictive models.

Strategy Consulting - Business analysts are key collaborators driving major corporate functions and initiatives and are encouraged to work proactively and independently. They work closely with leadership in field execution, technology, marketing, and other business areas, to inform our strategy and execution. They help CarMax create powerful, compelling narratives and influence corporate decision-making at the most senior levels.

What we offer:

Rotational Program: To maximize professional development and career growth, new analysts will join a 2-year rotation program that provides three 8-month rotations on different teams across the CarMax analyst community. This enables you to develop the breadth of skills and experiences necessary to further your success.
Career Progression: CarMax is seeking analysts with high potential and will invest heavily in your growth and development. Focusing on results rather than tenure, CarMax has many career opportunities for internal progression at a fast-growing, best-of-breed company.
Best in class training opportunities: CarMax offers hands-on training from Day 1, focusing on areas such as Analysis & Decision Making, Communication and Influence, and SQL. Our community is also committed to your success, offering knowledge and support along every step of the journey. You can expect to use the following software in your rotations:
SQL
Python
Tableau
Excel
PowerBI
And more!
Unique community: We pride ourselves on offering a great company culture with great work-life balance and a diverse community. CarMax has been named one of the '100 Best Places to Work' by FORTUNE magazine each year since 2005 and was recognized recently by FlexJobs & Forbes as a top company for millennials seeking work-life balance.
Competitive benefits: CarMax offers highly competitive benefits including but not limited to: Flexible time away, work-life balance, employee stock purchase, 401k matching, company-sponsored healthcare

What you need to succeed:

Passion for problem-solving and desire to develop into a strong business leader
Top-caliber critical thinking skills and intensely curious personality
Highly organized and proven ability to multitask
Excellent verbal, written and interpersonal skills
Dedication to continuous improvement and innovation
Passion for growth, development and learning new things

To be eligible:

Must be legally authorized to work for any U.S. employer on a full-time basis without the need for sponsorship now or in the future

Interviewing Process


Due to COVID-19, most of our employees are working from home. We've implemented a virtual hiring process and continue to interview candidates by phone or video. We value the safety of each member of our community because we know we're all in this together.

Work Location


Associates will have the opportunity to work in our Richmond Headquarters.

To be considered for this role, you should submit a resume through your school career site, and formally apply at link
CarMax is an equal opportunity employer, and all qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Upon an applicant's request, CarMax will consider reasonable accommodation to complete the CarMax Job Application.

Overview
Guidehouse is a leading global provider of consulting services to the public and commercial markets with broad capabilities in management, technology, and risk consulting. We help clients address their toughest challenges and navigate significant regulatory pressures with a focus on transformational change, business resiliency, and technology-driven innovation. Across a range of advisory, consulting, outsourcing, and digital services, we create scalable, innovative solutions that prepare our clients for future growth and success. The company has more than 10,000 professionals in over 50 locations globally. Guidehouse is a Veritas Capital portfolio company, led by seasoned professionals with proven and diverse expertise in traditional and emerging technologies, markets, and agenda-setting issues driving national and global economies. For more information, please visit: www.guidehouse.com.

Responsibilities
The Data Visualization Analyst would provide data visualization and analysis support to the Bureau of Political-Military (PM) Affairs’ Strategic Impact Assessment Framework (SIAF) team to support in developing and updating SIAF visualization and analytical tools. Responsibilities will include visualizing and analyzing complex data sets, including a thorough aptitude for conducting quantitative and qualitative analyses; selecting and applying the appropriate analytical techniques in order to increase organizational efficiency and providing knowledge of data science applications to extract knowledge to help predict, explain, or analyze research questions. The candidate will coordinate with non-technical users to identify data visualization and analytics needs support and use facilitation skills and techniques to elicit requirements from a diverse range of stakeholders.

Successful candidates should have an interest in learning about the State Department, have experience with policy analysis, work well in a collaborative environment, think creatively, thrive under pressure, and are able to adjust to shifting priorities quickly.

Qualifications
The following skills/experience/knowledge are required to be considered for this role:
Due to our contractual requirements, to be eligible for this role, you must be fully COVID-19 vaccinated at time of hire.
Bachelor's degree in computer science, statistics, data analytics, mathematics, engineering or equivalent.
Minimum three years of visualization and analytical experience, supporting U.S. government agencies, with an interest in international defense trade and licensing regulation preferred.
Excellent visual skills, including demonstrable design knowledge, such as layout, typography, color, interaction design.
Must have experience in data analysis methods, and Tableau or similar tools to develop visualizations.
Familiarity working with Python or R.
Active SECRET level security clearance required.
The following skills/experience/knowledge are preferred to be considered for this role:
Advanced degree in international relations, international security studies, political science, or equivalent
Strong analytical and organization skills with attention to detail and experience with working in collaborative team environment.
Outstanding communication, diplomacy, teamwork, and project management skills.

Additional Requirements
The successful candidate must not be subject to employment restrictions from a former employer (such as a non-compete) that would prevent the candidate from performing the job responsibilities as described.

Drive usage of OSC, Sales Manager Central, Touchstone, SI and the pipeline dashboards â€“ to ensure efficiency, consistency and adoption relative to renewals. Obtain feedback on automation opportunities and bring forward for implementation.

Product experience in Sales, Marketing and Service Automation

Team player who will work within the company to continue improving organization processes

We are GDIT. We support and secure some of the most complex government, defense, and intelligence projects across the country. At GDIT, a Business Analyst is not just a singular part of our mission—it connects every one of us because it’s embedded into every aspect of what we do.
GDIT is your place. You make it your own by bringing your ideas and unique perspective to our culture. By owning your opportunity at GDIT, you are helping us ensure today is safe and tomorrow is smarter. Our work depends on a Business Analyst joining our team to support a US Government Agency customer in Fort Lee, VA. The selected Business Analyst can work remotely, anywhere in the CONUS United States.
At GDIT, people are our differentiator. As a Business Analyst supporting this federal government customer, you will be trusted member of a software engineering team focused on improving existing defense software.
In this role, a typical day will include:
Determines cost of operations by establishing standard key performance indicators by departments, by divisions, and by events; collecting operational data.
Conduct monthly variance analysis by providing financial analytics by departments, by division, and by events.
Guides cost analysis process by establishing and enforcing policies and procedures; providing trends and forecasts; explaining processes and techniques; recommending actions.
Monitors project progress by tracking activity; resolving problems; publishing progress reports; recommending actions.
Reconciles transactions by comparing and correcting data.
Work closely with IT to maintain database integrity by entering, verifying, and backing up data.
Recommends actions by analyzing and interpreting data and making comparative analyses; studying proposed changes in methods and materials. Maintains compliance with company policies, practices and procedures.
Participates in proactive efforts to achieve departmental and company goals. Works effectively and communicates clearly with other employees.
Handles changing deadlines and priorities.
Reviews work for accuracy, completeness and proper authority.
WHAT YOU’LL NEED:
Proficient in Office 365, ChangeGear
IAT II or above qualifying certification (most common is CompTIA Security+)
Years of experience required: 3+ years of direct related experience
Bachelors degree or higher
WHAT GDIT CAN OFFER YOU:
Full-flex work week
401K with company match
Internal mobility team dedicated to helping you own your career
Collaborative teams of highly motivated critical thinkers and innovators
Ability to make a real impact on the world around you
Not sure this job’s the one for you? Check out our other openings at gdit.com/careers.

Do you have a friend or colleague this posting describes? Let them know about the opportunity by clicking “Share.”
This position requires being fully vaccinated against COVID-19 by January 18, 2022 or the start date, if after January 18. Individuals who work in or reside in Texas or Montana or work outside of the United States may be excluded from this requirement.
The likely salary range for this position is $49,583 - $82,804, this is not, however, a guarantee of compensation or salary; rather, salary will be set based on experience, geographic location and possibly contractual requirements and could fall outside of this range.
View information about benefits and our total rewards program.
We are GDIT. The people supporting some of the most complex government, defense, and intelligence projects across the country. We deliver. Bringing the expertise needed to understand and advance critical missions. We transform. Shifting the ways clients invest in, integrate, and innovate technology solutions. We ensure today is safe and tomorrow is smarter. We are there. On the ground, beside our clients, in the lab, and everywhere in between. Offering the technology transformations, strategy, and mission services needed to get the job done.

GDIT is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status, or any other protected class.

We are UMG, the Universal Music Group. We are the world’s leading music company. In everything we do, we are committed to artistry, innovation, and entrepreneurship. We own and operate a broad array of businesses engaged in recorded music, music publishing, merchandising, and audiovisual content in more than 60 countries. We identify and develop recording artists and songwriters, and we produce, distribute, and promote the most critically acclaimed and commercially successful music to delight and entertain fans around the world.
Interscope Geffen A&M Records (“IGA”) is home to some of the biggest artists in the world including: U2, Eminem, Kendrick Lamar, J Cole, Lady Gaga, and many more. As a leader in the music industry, we are always looking for talented and driven individuals to join our family.
How you’ll LEAD:
As a part of the Research, Reporting & Analytics Group at Interscope Records, this person will work with the team to provide data and detailed analysis with a focus on artist consumption, release, account, consumer and revenue strategies.
The analyst will need to be a proven self-starter, solutions based creative thinker with a hunger to constantly learn and evolve strategies associated with the company’s artists and commercial partners.
The analyst will be required to dive deep into performance across streaming platforms with a requirement to make recommendations based on compelling analyses, insights and big data queries. These recommendations will be used by management and senior executive team to make informed business decisions.
The ideal candidate should be well-versed in data analysis. Candidates should have advanced skills in Excel, and experience with SQL, Tableau, Alteryx, DOMO, or other data manipulation / visualization platforms.
How you’ll CREATE:
Deliver data-driven solutions and recommendations to executives and necessary parties that incorporate rigorous research and analysis
Develop dynamic / automated models to help key stakeholders with business decisions
Create SQL scripts to extract necessary data from files that could be greater than 100 TB in size within Google BigQuery or other SQL platforms, and build visualizations in Tableau, Alteryx, and various other visualization tools to present findings in a visually compelling way
Identify user/partner/ track/album/market trends
Present overall findings to executives throughout the company in a clear and concise manner
Research & build customized reports based on financial and marketing data.
Build, develop and maintain various partner, consumer behavior, and consumption trend projects with ongoing summaries and recommendations.
Monitor and understand key performance indicators relating to our streaming partner’s consumer behavior and consumption trends to integrate into data analysis.
Help develop and review methodology for cross-departmental reporting tools.
Other duties as assigned.
Bring your VIBE:
Passion and curiosity for music and the data that is used within the industry, preferably with an-depth knowledge of current music industry trends including key account, consumption pattern shifts, and the impact/variety of social media.
Ability to query our databases (using platforms such as BigQuery) accurately and efficiently using SQL
Advanced level Excel skills, with the ability to develop dynamic models using named ranges / formulaic references
Understanding of API usage for importing data for analysis
Understanding of TikTok and social media trends
Familiarity with statistical concepts and tools, along with the ability to use them effectively in analyses
Ability to visualize data within Alteryx, Tableau, DOMO, or other data visualization platforms. Experience with Alteryx Designer a plus.
Adept in distilling large amounts of data into concise, actionable summaries.
Highly organized and detail-oriented team player.
Ability to present findings in a visually compelling and articulate manner.
Self-sufficient with the confidence to independently pursue information.
Ability to thrive in fast paced environment, manage multiple tasks at once and work to deadlines
1 – 2 years of work experience in data analysis, management consulting, entertainment industry analysis, or similar role. Music Industry preferred but not required.
Experience working with analytical tools including, but not limited to Excel, Tableau, BigQuery, Alteryx, etc.
BS in Business Administration, Accounting, Computer Science, Mathematics, or a similarly quantitative degree
Perks Playlist:
Competitive Compensation Package including Salary, Benefits and Generous 401k Savings Plan
Paid Time Off – Paid Holidays, “Winter Break”, Summer Fridays
Student Loan Repayment Assistance
Employee Developmental Support
Annual Gym Reimbursement Package
Pet Insurance, plus much more!
Universal Music Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer

The Sales Operations department is looking for a talented, motivated Business Analyst to add to our Business Control team. This role will be responsible for core sales operations artifacts related to GHX business verticals and will report to the Manager, Sales Operations. This role is responsible for coordination of data related to monthly, quarterly, and annual reporting for the GHX sales team & leadership.

Functions include collecting, analyzing, evaluating, and reporting on the business results stemming from sales, renewals, and any other related commercial efforts. The Business Analyst will perform ad hoc data analysis, provide data insights, and manage special projects as needed.

This role will be managing datasets which will be expected to identify improvements in productivity, efficiency, effectiveness, and organization of the sales team(s). This role will also identify gaps in data needs or reporting and will be responsible to resolve those issues as sustainably as possible. This role will often need to coordinate interdepartmental dependencies, providing analytical support for technical and business activity planning and helping drive repeatable processes into the GHX operating model.

Key Responsibilities
Participate directly in month-end bookings reconciliation process and publishing actual bookings results to include analysis of actuals to forecast variances
Tracks and reports on key sales metrics, evaluates sales performance measured against sales goals; distributes results to sales management in a timely manner
Assist team with detailed deal tracking, forecasting, review, and analysis
Provides data analysis, organizes, and filters data to report monthly commissions to appropriate stakeholders
Develops, coordinates and facilitates professional relationships with internal and external subject matter experts and cross functional stakeholders
Seeks to develop process improvement both within their work product but also cross-functionally on processes that the sales function views as dependencies
Key Duties
Maintains rep scorecards and rankings related to quota and territory performance
Provides general sales reporting and information to finance, product and other business stakeholders
Evaluates and helps improve data quality and cleanliness; assists with any data conversion efforts
Performs ad-hoc analysis and projects, as needed, to support business needs
Other duties as assigned
Key Competencies
Strong organization and prioritization skills, intense attention to detail, capable of balancing multiple projects
Fast learner who is resilient and thrives in a fast-moving environment to get things done
Proven ability to meet deadlines, follow-through on details, and provide input and feedback as needed
Ability to balance competing business and technical needs and assist in reaching best business practices
Required Education, Certifications, and Experience
BA/BS degree in Business, Finance or related field or equivalent work experience
2+ years’ hands-on data analysis experience, to include querying and reporting experience
Preferred Qualifications
Experience at a fast-paced SaaS, Technology or Healthcare company highly preferred
Must be highly proficient in Microsoft Office applications (advanced or higher in MS Excel)
Demonstrated experience with Salesforce.com and CPQ tools
Working knowledge of commercial processes, contracting, Accounting & Revenue fundamentals


Estimated Salary range for this position: $60,585 - $84,000

The base salary range represents the anticipated low and high end of the GHX’s salary range for this position. Actual salaries will vary and will be based on various factors, such as candidate’s qualifications, skills, competencies, and proficiency for the role. The base salary is one component of GHX’s total compensation package for employees. Other rewards and benefits include: health, vision, and dental insurance, accident and life insurance, 401k matching, paid-time off, and education reimbursement, to name a few. To view more details of our benefits, visit us here: https://www.ghx.com/about/careers/


GHX: It's the way you do business in healthcare

Global Healthcare Exchange (GHX) enables better patient care and billions in savings for the healthcare community by maximizing automation, efficiency and accuracy of business processes.

GHX is a healthcare business and data automation company, empowering healthcare organizations to enable better patient care and maximize industry savings using our world class cloud-based supply chain technology exchange platform, solutions, analytics and services. We bring together healthcare providers and manufacturers and distributors in North America and Europe - who rely on smart, secure healthcare-focused technology and comprehensive data to automate their business processes and make more informed decisions.

It is our passion and vision for a more operationally efficient healthcare supply chain, helping organizations reduce - not shift - the cost of doing business, paving the way to delivering patient care more effectively. Together we take more than a billion dollars out of the cost of delivering healthcare every year. GHX is privately owned, operates in the United States, Canada and Europe, and employs more than 800 people worldwide. Our corporate headquarters is in Louisville, Colorado, just outside of Denver, with additional offices in Europe, Chicago, Illinois, and Omaha, Nebraska.

Description
The Cloud Renewal Strategy Manager (RSM) is responsible for maintaining a focus on renewals within their assigned segment pillar. They will provide subject matter expertise in working with Oracle ASMs to secure the renewal and contracted revenue growth of Oracle Cloud accounts. This is strategically important to the health and growth of Oracleâ€™s Cloud business. The Renewal Strategy Manager will have a defined segment (e.g. Up market, Majors/SMB, Public Sector) within the Oracle CX Sales and Service Product Pillar. The Renewal Strategy Manager is responsible for participating in weekly forecast cadence calls and knowing/communicating the renewal status of all accounts in the teamâ€™s territories.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities
Renewals Leadership: Responsible for overseeing the Renewals business associated with the assigned sales segment to include achievement of specific renewal goals assigned. Understand renewal rate and churn trends within the assigned segment. Partner with the segment GVP to develop a plan to improve future renewal rates and minimize churn based on these trends.
Mentorship: train and mentor Inside Sales Representatives (ISRs) in your assigned segment to ensure they follow best practices in their prosecution of renewals opportunities.
Strategic Renewals Plan: Develop a strategic Renewals plan to include the goals, objectives and tactics associated with the assigned sales segment. Drive programs that proactively position our customers for successful and timely renewals.
Collaboration: It is critical that the RSM collaborates with our center of Excellence (COE) organization and our Cloud Field Sales organization to ensure optimal engagement with clients in advance of, and during the renewal cycle.
Trusted business partner : Become a trusted renewal advisor to the sales GVP and team you support. Get to know the renewals business and understand the market you support. Provide thought leadership and find innovative ways to make improvements. Understand the renewals business trends, goals, issues, requirements.
General Awareness: Ensure your sales teams are focused on Renewals. Understand the renewals in your segment and drive a regular cadence (in partnership with the ASMs) to ensure all risk is understood.
Future focus: Proactively inspect future quarter renewals (5 quarters out) and advise your leadership as issues are uncovered. Identify key â€œat-riskâ€� renewal clients early in the cycle and define issues inhibiting a successful, timely renewal. Ensure usage trends are understood relevant to upcoming renewals.
Annual Plan: Identify all upcoming renewals for the year to be sure accurate quota assignments occur; address any potential churns with Finance to ensure accuracy.
Forecast accuracy/deal inspection: Review all renewals forecasted each week to identify any areas of concern and engage with ASMs to address get well plans if needed.
Sales Tools : Enable ASMs on the tools that are critical to drive renewals. Drive usage of OSC, Sales Manager Central, Touchstone, SI and the pipeline dashboards â€“ to ensure efficiency, consistency and adoption relative to renewals. Obtain feedback on automation opportunities and bring forward for implementation.
Essential Knowledge, Skills, Abilities, and Background
Experience with cloud-based/SaaS business process solution offerings
Product experience in Sales, Marketing and Service Automation
Finance background is beneficial â€“ understanding of accounting and financial principles such as Budgeting, ROI, Project Payback, Time Value of Money, TCO-based Selling
Understanding of the basic legal and financial concepts in SaaS contracts such as ramping, SLAs and Revenue Recognition
Ability to effectively negotiate in both challenging and collaborative sales engagements
Ability to excel in a high-energy, quarterly-results driven sales culture
Team player who will work within the company to continue improving organization processes
5-7 Years sales experience in technology-based company
Bachelorâ€™s degree in Finance or IT related discipline
Intermediate / advanced excel skills, experience in word, power point and CRM systems


Provides programs to improve operational efficiency, consistency, and compliance in support of the organization's financial and tactical business objectives. Provides business practices and processes. Develops, communicates, and trains the organization on business practices and processes.


Serve as a liaison with other divisions such as Finance, Contracts, HR, Legal, Shared Services, Accounts Receivable, Purchasing, and Risk Management in an effort to ensure accurate and timely transaction processing. Collect, input, verify, correct, and analyze data to measure key performance indicator actual versus business objectives. Provide updates to management regarding budget to actual, informing them of deviations and opportunities. Provide management with economic impact and compliance issues surrounding key business decisions and/or deals. Communicate Oracle Business Practices to the organization and monitor process and approvals for full compliance. Drive implementation of new processes and procedures.


Leading contributor individually and as a team member, providing direction and mentoring to others. Work is non-routine and very complex, involving the application of advanced technical/business skills in area of specialization. Ability to collect, organize, and display data in spreadsheet format. Follow-through skills necessary to get information from internal and third parties and have data errors/omissions corrected. For this, relationship management skills strongly desired. Strong written and verbal communication skills. 8 plus years relevant work experience.

Gift Card Business Analyst


About Us:
The Gift Card group is a fast-growing multi-channel/multi-million dollar business in the Fandango portfolio, encompassing an assortment of products and responsible for a large portion of Fandango’s overall incoming revenue and consumer acquisition. The Gift Card team is responsible for strategy, marketing, sales, growth, creation and enhancement of our products sold through physical & digital retailers, D2C and B2B. Our product lines include both our own O&O brands (Fandango, Vudu, MovieTickets.com) as well as bundled partnerships, thus providing our consumers with an assortment of entertainment gifting solutions.

This is an exciting opportunity for a high-performing, fast-moving, innovative and strategic marketer to join our Gift Card Team. The Gift Card Business Analyst will be responsible for thorough tracking and analysis of Gift Card products in all three channels (retail, B2B, D2C) with the emphasis on retail marketing and analysis. Position will also be responsible for directing production and card implementation at Retail & B2B. Goals include driving new customer acquisition & retention, consumer engagement, cross channel optimization and leverage of studio/content IP. You will partner with internal divisions such as finance, business development, product management, design, marketing, finance and legal as well as across other teams within the NBCU/Comcast/Peacock Family.

We are looking for an individual who is motivated, brings enthusiasm for the customer, passionate about the entertainment industry and experience in managing multiple projects simultaneously. Proven analytical thinking and passion for data is essential - you should be fluent in analyzing both business performance and marketing metrics, have strong project management skills, attention to detail, and exceptional collaboration skills. You should be a self-starter and effective communicator, able to think strategically and execute at a high level. The individual should demonstrate strong business judgment, have a strong track record of relationship management, has a passion for experimentation, is a problem-solver and thought leader. Experience with digital, retail marketing and consumer products is ideal.

Core job responsibilities include:
Analysis of all proposed Retail/B2B/D2C promotional campaigns, recommending based on ROI/Strategy/Sales performance
Marketing directives/recommendations for best practices
Provide analysis reports, performance recaps and financial updates across all Channels
Own invoice management across the business and with state holders, liaison with Finance
Own budget tracking across the business
Track monthly sales and all promotional sales across the business
Analysis and directive for production and inventory placement of product and specific denomination
Production and inventory management, direct the order process & inventory control
Recommend and direct creative execution of brand/card art
Qualifications/Requirements
Bachelor’s Degree in Marketing , Data Analytics or related field or equivalent experience3-5+ years of experience designing, developing, testing, and implementing high-performance, scalable, and secure business intelligence and analytic solutions in a high-volume environmentExperience performing high level data analysis; needs to have a general understanding of databases and structures and must enjoy working with dataAbility to multi-task, problem-solve and communicate in a challenging, fast-paced environmentHighly organized, strong attention to detail and outstanding time management skills
Desired Characteristics
Strategic thinking and creative problem solvingProven ability to analyze data for decision making by teamStrong interpersonal & communication skills to drive alignment across the team and organizationAbility to interpret data and concisely communicate findings through presentations to senior levelsAdvanced knowledge of Excel, spreadsheets and Tableau (or other reporting systems)Consumer Products experience a plus
Sub-Business
Fandango
Career Level
Experienced
City
Beverly Hills
State/Province
California

United States
About Us
At Fandango, we love movies. From showtimes and ticketing, to engaging content and innovations in movie going- we strive to deliver the perfect movie going experience—anytime, anywhere. And to be the go-to destination for moviegoers, we think it’s all about collaboration. Anyone can build a website or app, but it takes a special group across many disciplines to create an experience that can live across multiple platforms and connected devices. Thanks to an exceptional team, we’re working hard to make Fandango a little bit better every day. Our 30 million (and growing!) online and mobile monthly visitors can now buy movie tickets at over 25,000 screens nationwide and stay for exclusive trailers, our award-winning original video series, movie reviews, celebrity interviews and more. So, if you’re looking to inspire, be inspired and work at the intersection of entertainment and technology look no further than Fandango. Visit Fandango.com/careers for a behind-the-scenes look at Fandango and follow us on LinkedIn for the latest news and updates. Fandango is an NBCUniversal Company.


NBCUniversal owns and operates over 20 different businesses across 30 countries including a valuable portfolio of news and entertainment television networks, a premier motion picture company, significant television production operations, a leading television stations group, world-renowned theme parks and a premium ad-supported streaming service.

Here you can be your authentic self. As a company uniquely positioned to educate, entertain and empower through our platforms, Comcast NBCUniversal stands for including everyone. We strive to foster a diverse and inclusive culture where our employees feel supported, embraced and heard. We believe that our workforce should represent the communities we live in, so that together, we can continue to create and deliver content that reflects the current and ever-changing face of the world. Click here to learn more about Comcast NBCUniversal’s commitment and how we are making an impact.

NBCUniversal will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with relevant legal requirements, including the City of Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative For Hiring Ordinance, where applicable.

Careers that Change Lives

Do you like solving problems that seem to have everyone stuck? Do you enjoy simplifying complex data to tell a clear story? Have you ever pumped your fist and celebrated under your breath “Yes!” after figuring out a complicated query, formula, or line of code?
Join a team of analysts chartered to advance the analytics of the General Surgery & Market Access (GSMA) Operations Network.
We focus on creating innovative analytic solutions & data visualization to influence and drive sound business decisions.
Sitting in somewhere between a shared services team and a center of excellence, we deliver solutions that are broadly deployed across the GSMA Network (21 mfg. sites) as well as niche solutions that drive unique value to functional leaders.
We bring a combination of analytics, data science, and a continuous improvement mindset to the problems that we solve & the solutions that we deliver. This role will work closely with peers, customers, and stakeholders to identify opportunities to improve data integrity, support data-based decision-making for our operational partners, and improve ease of work in the organization.
We seek out and hire a diverse workforce at every level: We need fresh ideas and inclusive insights to continue to be an innovative industry leader that’s why we make it a point to seek out, attract and develop employees who are patient-centric, passionate, and who represent the same wide variety of life experiences as our patients.
A Day in the Life
The Advanced Analytics Analyst is part of the GSMA Data & Analytics team, reporting to the Director of the team.
Deliver insights via ad hoc reporting, dashboards, structured analysis or custom apps
Leverage analytical tools and coding languages to deliver solutions that help solve business problems (Power BI, SQL, & DAX. Also nice to have: R & Python)
Deliver ongoing reporting & analytics of key performance indicators (KPIs) to the GSMA Leadership Team
Develops, mines, transforms, and models data to raise productivity, improve decision making, and gain competitive advantage.
Use data visualizations to facilitate storytelling and data exploration.
Ability to lead small-sized and support medium-sized data analysis and development projects
Develop training materials, lead training sessions, and provide ongoing support for dashboard users.
Must Have: Minimum Requirements

Bachelors degree and 0 years of experience in business analytics, data analytics
Nice to Have
Prior experience with our primary reporting tool, Power BI
Project Management Skills
OpEx, Six Sigma, & process improvement
Degree in engineering, business administration, computer science, data science, or related field
Manage the detailed analysis, design, coding, testing, implementation and maintenance of reports, dashboards, and other delivery methods used to support business, clinical, and research analysis
About Medtronic
Together, we can change healthcare worldwide. At Medtronic, we push the limits of what technology, therapies and services can do to help alleviate pain, restore health and extend life. We challenge ourselves and each other to make tomorrow better than yesterday. It is what makes this an exciting and rewarding place to be.

We want to accelerate and advance our ability to create meaningful innovations - but we will only succeed with the right people on our team. Let’s work together to address universal healthcare needs and improve patients’ lives. Help us shape the future.
