Provides comprehensive and in-depth analytics for employees of the Illinois Farm Bureau (IFB) and affiliated companies. Applies qualitative or quantitative analytical techniques to analyze data and/or information obtained from research.
This position offers a hybrid work schedule and is based out of our corporate offices in Bloomington, IL.
How does a Business Research Analyst make an impact?
Drives business decisions and innovation by providing quantitative and qualitative data analysis and reporting of patterns, insights, processes and trends to decision makers.
Collects, aggregates, and analyzes data from multiple internal and external sources to drive insights into business performance.
Produces actionable reports that show key performance indicators, identifies areas of improvement within current operations, and displays root cause analysis of problems.
Provides reporting solutions and responds to ad-hoc report requests across multiple business areas.
Designs and develops business intelligence reporting tools.
Provides consultation to clients and leads cross-functional teams to address business issues.

Qualifications
Do you have what we're looking for?
Typically requires bachelor’s degree and at least 2 years of analytical research experience (or equivalent, such as 4 years of experience or master’s degree and no experience).
Why work with us?
We planted our roots in 1916 and are one of the largest Farm Bureau organizations in the United States. We are a voice for Illinois farmers, farm families, and anyone involved in food and agriculture. That covers a lot of ground. We represent our members in local communities, Springfield, IL and Washington D.C. When you become a part of Illinois Farm Bureau, you become part of something that touches the lives of people every day. You truly make a difference.
You’ll be able to take advantage of our benefits package, which includes insurance benefits (medical, dental, vision, disability, and life), 401(k) with company match, parental leave, paid time off, paid company holidays and time off to volunteer. Please click here to learn more about Illinois Farm Bureau and the many benefits we offer our employees.
Illinois Farm Bureau is committed to providing equal opportunity in all areas of employment, and in providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, age, gender, sexual orientation, veteran status, national origin, disability, or any other status protected by applicable laws or regulations.
Come join our team at Illinois Farm Bureau today!
Illinois Farm Bureau does not generally sponsor individuals for employment-based visas for this position.

ABOUT US:

The Pro's Closet Inc. (TPC) is the world's largest and most trusted brand for pre-owned bikes. We purchase new and pre-owned bikes and accessories from manufacturers, retailers, and individuals. Each bike undergoes a rigorous Certified Pre-Owned inspection and top-to-bottom service to ensure every bike is delivered in next-to-new condition. Our innovative Buyback Guarantee gives customers full transparency by offering guaranteed trade-in values for 18 months after purchase. With hundreds of bikes to choose from, we offer the world's largest and most diverse selection of high-quality road, mountain, gravel, cyclocross, triathlon, and e-bikes, as well as a full line of parts, accessories and apparel. We are experiencing phenomenal growth, and on the lookout for highly talented, like-minded people who want to take part in our mission: to change the way people buy and sell bikes.

WHAT SETS TPC APART:

We are committed to building a great company and we believe this starts with great people and a great company culture. Each individual has a key role to play in TPC's success, but we all work as one team dedicated to constant improvement and efficiency. We welcome making mistakes and learning from them.

Our structure allows you to take responsibility and shape the company for the better and be recognized for it. From top to bottom, we adhere to core beliefs in transparency and openness. We love to work hard, but always leave time to ride bikes.
ABOUT THE JOB:

As a Pricing Analyst you will be a valued member of the Analytics team. You will be key to ensuring our pricing strategy is competitive and revenue maximizing, while contributing to the analysis and execution of pricing initiatives. You will be uniquely positioned to contribute to the profitability of the company through your research, analysis and strategic recommendations to help increase organizational value. To be successful in this role, you will use your technical skills and strong business acumen to learn about our products, marketing, and merchandising efforts to help tackle business and profitability challenges.


WHAT YOU'LL DO:

Partner with the Analytics team and cross-functional stakeholders to fully understand our pricing and recommend actions to optimize price points in order to maximize revenue.
Conduct competitive research and analysis, understanding industry trends, sell through rate analysis, inventory level analysis, supply analysis and customer feedback.
Complete competitive pricing and inventory level analysis across our full range of product offerings
Identify mispriced items (both items which are too high and too low)
Identify items which may not be not mispriced but rather are not well marketed or poorly merchandised
Progressively improve the analysis process from a manual, high touch initial approach to automated, data driven logic designs.
Partner with the VP-Analytics to perform cross-functional ad-hoc analyses in order to find opportunities and risks in the business


ABOUT YOU:

You have a bachelor's degree in Analytics, Marketing, Merchandising, Business, Economics, or Mathematics
You're able to present information in a way that visually tells a story which leads to the right conclusions and drives the right decisions
Excel and PowerPoint skills
Experience with SQL and / or a modern BI Platform like Tableau, Power BI or QuickSight is a plus
You have a strong interest and aptitude for developing outstanding data exploration and analysis skills via SQL, Excel, QuickSight, Python, etc.
Problem solving comes naturally to you and you can demonstrate a disciplined approach to past situations
You are intrinsically motivated to contribute, learn, grow, and share
You rarely miss the details and are precise and conscientious about your work
You're driven pursue a career in business analytics or ecommerce
Enthusiastic about the outdoor/cycling industry, the people it attracts, and all the gear!
TPC requires employees to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19 for in person work and company events as required by your role, unless you qualify for an exemption allowable under the law


THE PERKS OF WORKING AT TPC:

Salary Range: $75-95k, depending on experience
3 weeks paid vacation, 6 paid holidays, and a paid day off on your birthday
100% medical, dental, vision benefits, with a 60% dependent contribution
Company paid disability and life insurance
401k with generous company matching
Stock options: we're all owners!
A fun, relaxed, and flexible work environment
WFH Flexible: Some of the team is mostly remote, but office in Louisville has flex space
Weekly all-hands company meeting keeps you engaged and connected to the business and your team members
A culture of transparency with regular updates on company performance
Group rides and amazing industry discounts

Job Title: Business Data Analyst II - Part Time
Description:
Department Overview:

The Business Data Analyst 2 gathers, complies, analyzes and provides qualitative and quantitative information and statistical data, and presents this information in narrative or schematic form for use in business planning and administrative decision making.
This is the second of a three level series. The Business Data Analyst 2 is distinguished from the lower level by providing analysis of the data, advanced technical skills in report writing and by providing recommendations for business outcomes from the analyzed data. The Business Data Analyst 2 is distinguished from the higher level by the lack of responsibility for writing complex computer programs, planning studies, managing complex business research and providing complex interpretations and recommendations, consultative and decision support to division and/or executive leaders.
Function/Duties of Position:

Business Analysis: (30%)
Leads collecting data for both C3PO and IMPACT data registries for the cardiac program.
Works in collaboration with the team and cardiac program to identify trends in data.
In collaboration with the Quality team, identifies opportunities to streamline data collection across registries.
Report Generation: (30%)
Develops reports and visuals of the data from the registries.
Business Consulting: (30%)
Builds relationships with other heart centers data analysts.
Serves as the backup analyst for the other cardiac registries.
In conjunction with the Pediatric Quality program, develops processes for validation and analysis of data.
Serves as an internal resource for the staff in all departments and, acts as a liaison for other system entities.
Project Management: (10%)
Primary support for improvement efforts for IMPACT & C3PO, supplying data ideas, measurement, tools and visualization.
Supports additional improvement efforts in the hospital as needed.
Required Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in a business field and one year of experience that included analytical, database, spreadsheet and/or financial experience, technical writing, quantitative analysis or use of statistical principles; OR
Associates degree in a business field plus three years of experience that included analytical, database, spreadsheet and/or financial experience, technical writing, quantitative analysis or use of statistical principles; OR
Five years of experience that included analytical, database, spreadsheet and/or financial experience, technical writing, quantitative analysis or use of statistical principles; OR
An equivalent combination of education, training and/or experience.
Must be able to perform the essential functions of the position with or without accommodation.
All are welcome: Oregon Health & Science University values a diverse and culturally competent workforce. We are proud of our commitment to being an equal opportunity, affirmative action organization that does not discriminate against applicants on the basis of any protected class status, including disability status and protected veteran status. Individuals with diverse backgrounds and those who promote diversity and a culture of inclusion are encouraged to apply. To request reasonable accommodation contact the Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Department at 503-494-5148 or aaeo@ohsu.edu.

Position overview

CWT Meetings & Events is seeking a Business Analyst who is responsible for the analytical support of mid-size to large meetings & events programs. With supervision, the primary focus will be on maintaining operational reporting and developing strategic analytic models that allow for focused efforts on increasing program compliance and reducing costs. This individual will also be responsible for supporting the ongoing development of CWT Meetings & Events Solutions reporting and consulting deliverables as applicable.

Utilize web-based reporting systems to pull client-specific data, while identifying recurrent trends, source and cause, in order to provide feedback and suggestions for improvement, to analyse travel and meeting traffic patterns
Anticipate and identify stakeholder needs, prepare program deliverables and reviews incorporating relevant benchmarking information. Perform time tracking as requested by management

Proactively escalate potential client, program, or delivery issues for timely resolution to management
Drive and support the development of data analysis standards and methodologies and create quality control filters to support program optimization
Participate and contribute to quarterly industry updates and marketplace analysis
Increase Meeting and Events industry knowledge by attending internal training, external events, supplier presentations, and team meetings
Knowledge of Microsoft Access and Excel. Ability to design formulas, create pivot tables, complete v-look ups, and link cells/workbooks are required to develop client reporting, interactive dashboards and scorecards
Manage education efforts and conduct on-going opportunity assessments to drive compliance, data quality, and cost savings for meetings & events programs
With support of Senior Business Analysts and management identify upselling opportunities and action
Perform other duties as assigned which may include various special project and mentoring junior staff

#LI-AM2

Qualifications
Position Requirements

Bachelor’s Degree in related field* and/or Minimum 3 years of related experience.
Meetings & Events and/or travel industry experience preferred
Strong computer aptitude on a variety of Microsoft Office products (Excel, PowerPoint, Word, Access). Knowledge of Project Management procedures. Meetings & Events and/or travel industry knowledge preferred
Ability to remain calm in stressful situations. Ability to set priorities and multitask in a fast-paced, multi-project environment. Ability to work well as a team player. Ability to be self-motivated and ability to work independently. Ability to process financial information. Ability to problem solve independently and in team situations. Ability to learn new information quickly. Ability to independently learn new systems and willingness to be a team player.
Ability to travel no more than 5-10%

An equivalent combination of education and experience may be considered

Create and maintain reports and dashboards to deliver business intelligence to the organization.
Duties and Responsibilities:
Provide assistance and support the development and publication of reports and dashboards.
 Assist in gathering, analyzing, and interpreting data sets to identify patterns and trends.
 Formulate recommendations to executive management and other teams in defining business goals and needs.
 Research new data gathering and analysis techniques.
Study business / economic trends, political situations, policies and regulations; and understand how they may impact financial institutions and associated lines of business.
 Develop knowledge of credit union operations and knowledge of current industry trends as well as current methods and technologies that relate to analytics, statistics, and reporting.
Perform other duties as assigned.
Qualifications:

Education: Bachelor's degree in Business, Finance, Accounting, Mathematics, Computer Science or related field.
Creditable Experience in Lieu of Education: Minimum of three years progressive experience in a comparable position.
Experience/Skills: Strong oral, written, administrative, organizational and inter-personal skills. The ability to analyze problems, develop alternatives and recommendations. Proficiency in converting analytical requirements into actionable interpretations and recommendations. Proficiency in self-service analytics tools such as Excel, Tableau, SQL, SnowSQL, Python and/or R, etc. Familiarity with business intelligence, visualizations, and master data management is desired.

Tenure: Assignment to the Business Intelligence Analyst I category 10, Business Intelligence Analyst II category 09, Business Intelligence Analyst III category 08, or Senior Business Intelligence Analyst category 07 will be determined by the candidate's education or experience. Advancement requires management recommendation and will be based on the candidate's certifications and/or performance.
Equal Opportunity Employer

The Data Analytics â€“ Business Analyst has a strong level of data curiosity, discovery and understands how data can be used to drive results and analyze business processes. Data modeling is a foundational skill in this role and the experience of working with data from different sources is a key success factor in this job opportunity. Problem solving and critical thinking with data are also important skills to have in this role.
The person in this role has strong work experience in creating visualizations based on structured and unstructured data and can recommend improvements for visualizations. This role requires a mastery of one or two analytical data mining, report writing or dashboarding tools.
Understanding business acumen is an important competency in this role to facilitate collaboration and communication with key stakeholders before, during and after a data analytics solution is implemented. One of the primary skills required for this role is being able to elicit requirements from the business and interpret requirements into new or existing data models for data analytics purposes.
The Data Analytics â€“ Business Analyst can create and present professionally styled reports and dashboards to project teams to help drive decisions and can make recommendations based on knowledge about the data model and business requirements.
In some cases, the person in this role will be asked to work with Project Managers to ensure successful technology delivery, including the resolution of issues, project timeline monitoring, and may need to deliver status reports as needed.
The ability to teach and mentor others on data modeling, report writing, data mining and dashboarding is an advanced capability in this role.
Role Talking Points
Understands overall business strategy and goals and incorporates these into data analytics solutions
Collaborates with key stakeholders and follows established processes and guidelines for data analytics capabilities throughout the project execution process
Communicates and provides guidance to the business and project resources when necessary
A trusted advisor and cooperates with the broader Brunswick technology team as well as partners and advocates to ensure efficient processes and data security for all stakeholders
Provides coaching/training to peers in the organization on how to define requirements, demonstrate milestone achievement, and communicate outside of the IT organization
Essential Duties and Responsibilities
Work effectively with a project team or individually depending on the size and complexity of the task.
Distribute information to appropriate parties
Perform quality assurance activities
Reconcile requirements with reporting capabilities, identify gaps and recommend solutions
Highly organized with the ability to excel across multiple, simultaneous initiatives
Strong business acumen with understanding of business goals across functional areas and how they relate business intelligence and reporting
Strong documentation and writing abilities
Presentation and oral communication skills
Ability to become an expert and train others
Understanding technologies and their application within the business
Participate in solving complex problems
Build relationships across multiple groups to collaborate and deliver project results
Am I Qualified to be a Data Analytics â€“ Business Analyst ? (Critical Success Factors)
Analytic Ability: Can work with data to identify patterns, uses judgment to form conclusions that may challenge conventional wisdom, and focuses on the crux of issues to identify high leverage intervention points and strategies
Creativity: Applies original and innovative thinking to produce new ideas and create innovative outcomes
Process Orientation: Identifies problems and initiates necessary changes; designs practices, procedures, and systems to manage work simply
Communication: Clearly conveys information, listens, organizes communication in logical sequence, adjust to audience, ensures understanding by seeking input, stating clearly what you expect from others, maintain constant flow information.
Decisiveness: Recognizes the impact a decision will make on organization and capable of making timely decisions even in ambiguous situations.
Business Acumen: Understands key objectives of both the Brunswick and IT organizations including risks, opportunities, and strategy while also knowledgeable of current industry trends.
Accountability: Completes assigned tasks and performs the duties required by their job.
Drives Execution: Can overcome challenges ad obstacles to successfully meet goals.
Customer-Centric: Makes customers (internal and external) and their needs a primary focus of their actions; develops and sustains productive relationships.
Technical Knowledge
Candidates should have moderate to expert ability in the following tools:
Microsoft Office 365 Suite
PowerPoint
Word
Excel
Outlook
Teams
Report Writing Tools â€“ one or more of the following: Business Objects, OBIEE, Power BI, or other reporting writing tools
Candidates should have high-level understanding of the following:
Data Modeling and visualizing data sets
Agile Project Methodology
Experience/Educational Qualifications:
Five years’ experience delivering data solutions across various technologies and functional areas across the business
Bachelor’s degree in Business, Computer Science, Data Analytics, or related field
Preferred:
Data analytics experience across multiple industries, markets, and/or functional areas
Lean Six Sigma certification or experience
Azure DevOps or another development, delivery, and operations tool
SQL

Description
The Cloud Renewal Strategy Manager (RSM) is responsible for maintaining a focus on renewals within their assigned segment pillar. They will provide subject matter expertise in working with Oracle ASMs to secure the renewal and contracted revenue growth of Oracle Cloud accounts. This is strategically important to the health and growth of Oracleâ€™s Cloud business. The Renewal Strategy Manager will have a defined segment (e.g. Up market, Majors/SMB, Public Sector) within the Oracle CX Sales and Service Product Pillar. The Renewal Strategy Manager is responsible for participating in weekly forecast cadence calls and knowing/communicating the renewal status of all accounts in the teamâ€™s territories.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities
Renewals Leadership: Responsible for overseeing the Renewals business associated with the assigned sales segment to include achievement of specific renewal goals assigned. Understand renewal rate and churn trends within the assigned segment. Partner with the segment GVP to develop a plan to improve future renewal rates and minimize churn based on these trends.
Mentorship: train and mentor Inside Sales Representatives (ISRs) in your assigned segment to ensure they follow best practices in their prosecution of renewals opportunities.
Strategic Renewals Plan: Develop a strategic Renewals plan to include the goals, objectives and tactics associated with the assigned sales segment. Drive programs that proactively position our customers for successful and timely renewals.
Collaboration: It is critical that the RSM collaborates with our center of Excellence (COE) organization and our Cloud Field Sales organization to ensure optimal engagement with clients in advance of, and during the renewal cycle.
Trusted business partner : Become a trusted renewal advisor to the sales GVP and team you support. Get to know the renewals business and understand the market you support. Provide thought leadership and find innovative ways to make improvements. Understand the renewals business trends, goals, issues, requirements.
General Awareness: Ensure your sales teams are focused on Renewals. Understand the renewals in your segment and drive a regular cadence (in partnership with the ASMs) to ensure all risk is understood.
Future focus: Proactively inspect future quarter renewals (5 quarters out) and advise your leadership as issues are uncovered. Identify key â€œat-riskâ€� renewal clients early in the cycle and define issues inhibiting a successful, timely renewal. Ensure usage trends are understood relevant to upcoming renewals.
Annual Plan: Identify all upcoming renewals for the year to be sure accurate quota assignments occur; address any potential churns with Finance to ensure accuracy.
Forecast accuracy/deal inspection: Review all renewals forecasted each week to identify any areas of concern and engage with ASMs to address get well plans if needed.
Sales Tools : Enable ASMs on the tools that are critical to drive renewals. Drive usage of OSC, Sales Manager Central, Touchstone, SI and the pipeline dashboards â€“ to ensure efficiency, consistency and adoption relative to renewals. Obtain feedback on automation opportunities and bring forward for implementation.
Essential Knowledge, Skills, Abilities, and Background
Experience with cloud-based/SaaS business process solution offerings
Product experience in Sales, Marketing and Service Automation
Finance background is beneficial â€“ understanding of accounting and financial principles such as Budgeting, ROI, Project Payback, Time Value of Money, TCO-based Selling
Understanding of the basic legal and financial concepts in SaaS contracts such as ramping, SLAs and Revenue Recognition
Ability to effectively negotiate in both challenging and collaborative sales engagements
Ability to excel in a high-energy, quarterly-results driven sales culture
Team player who will work within the company to continue improving organization processes
5-7 Years sales experience in technology-based company
Bachelorâ€™s degree in Finance or IT related discipline
Intermediate / advanced excel skills, experience in word, power point and CRM systems


Provides programs to improve operational efficiency, consistency, and compliance in support of the organization's financial and tactical business objectives. Provides business practices and processes. Develops, communicates, and trains the organization on business practices and processes.


Serve as a liaison with other divisions such as Finance, Contracts, HR, Legal, Shared Services, Accounts Receivable, Purchasing, and Risk Management in an effort to ensure accurate and timely transaction processing. Collect, input, verify, correct, and analyze data to measure key performance indicator actual versus business objectives. Provide updates to management regarding budget to actual, informing them of deviations and opportunities. Provide management with economic impact and compliance issues surrounding key business decisions and/or deals. Communicate Oracle Business Practices to the organization and monitor process and approvals for full compliance. Drive implementation of new processes and procedures.


Leading contributor individually and as a team member, providing direction and mentoring to others. Work is non-routine and very complex, involving the application of advanced technical/business skills in area of specialization. Ability to collect, organize, and display data in spreadsheet format. Follow-through skills necessary to get information from internal and third parties and have data errors/omissions corrected. For this, relationship management skills strongly desired. Strong written and verbal communication skills. 8 plus years relevant work experience.

Tuknik Government Services a Koniag Government Services Company is looking to hire a Senior Business Analyst to join our growing team.

We offer competitive compensation and an extraordinary benefits package including health, dental and vision insurance, 401K with company matching, flexible spending accounts, paid holidays, three weeks paid time off, and more. Please note: This position can be worked remote. The salary range for this position is $110,000 to $120,000.
The Senior Business Analyst – Transition is an integral component of a team supporting a Federal client’s organizational and digital transformation within an enterprise infrastructure and integrated with an expansion in cloud operations.
The ideal candidate is an entrepreneurial and progressive thought leader, with proven experience supporting and architecting strategic and operational capabilities. He/she is proficient in the design, development, delivery, documentation, and creation of business solutions for complex problems. The Senior Business Analyst – Transition will:
Assist the team and our clients in developing and implementing business strategies and training
Design effective business and operating models, ITIL capabilities utilizing internal tools like ServiceNow, Science Logic, and Alteryx
Improve customer experience by delivering a cohesive and effective set of solutions through a clear strategy and data-driven delivery model
Proactively learn new concepts and technologies in the event analysis of situations requires an in-depth knowledge of organizational objectives
Be comfortable interacting with senior management, which involves influencing on significant matters along with a consistent team-focused message on direction.
Ability to drive and lead conversations in regards to overall objectives with both current and future goals and technologies.
Forward thinking individual that has a balance of practical hands-on technical experience but is also capable of accurately and convincingly championing organization changing deliverables.
Essential Functions, Responsibilities & Duties may include, but are not limited to:
Assist with identifying, building, and executing strategic and tactical capabilities focused on running technology as a business model circled around planning, development, capability design, continuous improvements, communication plans, governance structures and investment prioritization for a large enterprise operation
Must be able to work across multiple operational and technical disciplines enabling organizational growth, innovation, and effectiveness
Assist with defining and creating future visions and identified areas of opportunity, thus delivering value across people, processes, technology and information
Evaluate results and present findings in a logical and easy-to-understand format
Assist with and/or drive key client deliverables, while ensuring that projects are completed on time and within scope
Seek innovative and creative solutions to complex technical/business problems within a logical, rigorous, and analytical framework
Lead requirements gathering sessions by asking the right questions and digging for the answers
Prepare and deliver client presentations and work products/prototypes
Identify where improvements and pain-points lie and develop a strategy focused on inserting the correct and maintainable technologies
Manage technical projects through the SDLC process and/or an agile, iterative process
Scan internal and external environments to identify areas of opportunity development through analysis and inquisitive conversations with subject matter experts
Able to articulate with a business case/business model the benefits of change and investment required vs. expected return
Create a portfolio of high-value opportunities with strategic imperatives, including consensus building through alignment of vision, mission, goals and objectives
Education
Bachelor’s degree in IT, Engineering, Business or related
Knowledge, Skills and Experience
3-7 years of experience in strategic and technical management, with a minimum of at least 5 years’ hands on experience in delivery management and/or transition strategies
Experience writing technical documents (both collaboratively and independently); comfortable crafting documentation without templates and sometimes with minimal input from others
Experience in business strategy development/execution; and providing strategic technical advisory services to clients
Excellent consulting/relationship management skills; ability to mitigate/mediate complex and/or politically charged issues
Familiarity with/knowledge of:
Business cases and ROI calculations
First-hand knowledge of SLA’s
Business operations design & analysis
IT strategy development, ideation workshops, governance and effectiveness
Strategy roadmap & execution plans
Business process outsourcing, sourcing and vendor strategy
Enterprise/Business Architecture
Strong communication and leadership skills; able to communicate effectively with a diverse audience; comfortable working with C-level executives
Proven history of progressive responsibilities
Able to analyze complex issues and distill concepts to clients
Comfortable acting as a liaison between business and technical teams in order to drive solutions
Able to comprehend new concepts, ask pertinent questions, execute and document ideas and concepts with minimal day-to-day direction
Able to stay on task and on schedule while adhering to non-flexible deadlines
Exceptional presentation skills with the ability to convey technology and business value propositions
Previous Federal consulting experience preferred, but not required
Office Location and Travel:
Northern Colorado / Fort Collins Preferred or remote position.
Ability to travel within Fort Collins as required.
Working Environment & Conditions:
This position is primarily indoors, consistent with a standard office position and has a noise level of mostly low to moderate. The incumbent is required to stand; walk; sit; use hands to manipulate, handle, or feel objects, tools, or controls; reach with hands and arms; talk and hear. The work load may require the incumbent to sit for extended periods of time. The incumbent must be able to read, perform simple math calculations and withstand moderate amounts of stress. The incumbent must occasionally lift and/or move items that weigh up to 25 lbs. Specific vision abilities required for the job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, depth perception, and the ability to adjust focus.

Our Equal Employment Opportunity Policy:
The company is an equal opportunity employer. The company shall not discriminate against any employee or applicant because of race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender or gender identity (except where gender is a bona fide occupational qualification), national origin, age, disability, military/veteran status, marital status, genetic information or any other factor protected by law. We are committed to equal employment opportunity in all decisions related to employment, promotion, wages, benefits and all other privileges, terms and conditions of employment. The company is dedicated to seeking all qualified applicants. If you require an accommodation to navigate or to apply to a position on our website, please contact Heaven Wood via e-mail at accommodations@koniag-gs.com or by calling 703-488-9377 to request accommodations.

About our Company:
Offering innovative and cutting-edge IT, Environmental Resource Management and Professional Services solutions, Tuknik Government Services is uniquely positioned in the federal marketplace. An ANC 8(a)-certified program combined with the full corporate support of Koniag Inc.’s Government Services Sector, TGS is backed by a full range of industry partners. Innovative technology, highly qualified professionals and proven processes are the hallmarks of TGS. We pride ourselves on delivering exceptional service to our clients and maintaining a supportive environment for team members and partners.

Far Consultants is now hiring for a Sr. Business Analysis for Strategy & New Growth Development business line. The New Growth & Development organization is focused on identifying and analyzing areas of future growth and plans to achieve sustained and balanced growth across the enterprise. The organization works to answer "what's next" for our customers. We develop growth hypothesis and test those hypotheses through 1) skunkworks 2) investing in new businesses 3) traditional R&D 4) identifying strategic partnerships and 5) exploring emerging businesses. Job Title: Business Intelligence Report Writer for Data Analytics and R...
Description:
The Center for Information Technology Services (CITS) has an exciting opportunity available for a Business Intelligence Report Writer for Data Analytics and Reporting. The selected candidate will be part of the newly formed data analytics and reporting office, and primarily responsible for developing reports and expanding UMB’s enterprise data, analytics, and reporting platform. This individual supports and maintains the Quantum Analytics reporting application. The selected candidate will have the opportunity to learn the Oracle Analytics Cloud platform for developing reports and analytics components. This position will support the university’s effort to document data definitions and reports using a cloud-based data documentation system (Datacookbook.com). Other duties include supporting data quality efforts to test reports and data. We are looking for a highly creative individual that is eager to learn and possesses a good work ethic.
The Report Writer will design, develop, fix, test, and assist in the implementation of functional aspects of reports. The position will receive guidance as needed to become proficient in the requisite duties. The associate developer will troubleshoot, resolve issues, and escalate complex matters to the appropriate team members.
UMB offers a comprehensive and competitive benefits package to eligible employees. This position receives an annual leave package starting with 22 accrued vacation days, 14 floating and observed holidays, 15 sick days, and 3 personal days; comprehensive health insurance and retirement options; professional learning and development opportunities; flexible schedules and teleworking options; and tuition remission for employees and their dependents at any of the Campus System of Maryland schools.
UMB requires all faculty, staff, and students to be vaccinated against COVID-19. Exemptions for medical or religious reasons will be processed through Human Resources.
Primary Duties:
Design, develop, fix, test, and assist in the implementation of functional aspects of reports.
Translate business requirements into specifications to implement reporting solutions that enable data-driven management practices.
Assist in the configuration, development, and coordination of dashboards and reports created from multiple data sources to support decision making and planning at all levels of the university.
Troubleshoot, resolve issues, and escalate complex matters to the appropriate team members.
Assist with documenting data elements, report specifications, and report implementations. Escalate complex matters to the appropriate team members.
Create and execute test plans, evaluates results and documents new features for report enhancements.
Performs other duties as assigned.
Qualifications

Education: Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, Data Science, Statistics, Accounting, Business, Finance, or a related field.
Experience: Related experience working with applications and/or using data analysis including extracting, converting, and transforming data from applications is preferred.
Other: Related experience may be substituted for education.

General knowledge and understanding of SQL and database technology.
Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:
Knowledge of position requirements. Knowledge of all applicable requirements, regulations, and laws. Skill in effective use of applicable technology/systems. Ability to effectively communicate both verbal and written thoughts, ideas, and facts. Ability to work cooperatively with others and independently. Ability to demonstrate, understand, apply, and adhere to the UMB Core Values of Respect and Integrity, Well-being and Sustainability, Equity and Justice, and Innovation and Discovery.
Hiring Range: Approximately $55,000 - $61,000, commensurate with education and experience.
UMB is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law or policy. Taylor is proud to now offer Daily Pay. With Daily Pay, you can get paid on your very first day. No more waiting for direct deposit or a paper check!
Your Opportunity: Taylor Corporation is looking for a Business Systems Analyst . The Business Systems Analyst is responsible for understanding the capabilities of business solutions and how they bring value to our customers and our business. This role supports and understands current business processes throughout all departments within the organization; utilizes analysis, IT skills and business knowledge on projects to identify and implement solutions, and facilitates this work with heavy reliance on team based processes.

Your Responsibilities:
Elicit requirements from the business partners and Clients (i.e.: Business Requirements, Functional Specifications, Non-Functional Specifications, Use Cases, other artifacts).
Clearly and concisely document requirements and functional specifications using appropriate requirement tools/techniques (such as use cases, process maps, etc.).
Perform gap analysis of current state and desired end-state of an application.
Solution assessment and validation to ensure there are no gaps from the requirement process and development stages.
Facilitate requirement review sessions (with the project team, including business partners, developers, and others)
Participate in system testing.
Act as a Subject Matter Expert (SME) for business partners, clients and/or the technical team for post deployment product support, relating to business process and workflow.
Assist with task realization, guided / mentored by a senior Business Systems Analyst, Technical Lead or Project Manager.
Serve as a liaison for project managers, development staff and the platform stakeholders.
Work with platform stakeholders to identify, document and validate requirements. Help to scope the system, identify potential areas of automation and process improvement.
Work with developers to translate requirements into something that they understand, and then translate developers' subsequent questions into something the stakeholders can understand.
Conduct and summarize informal and formal requirements reviews as items are being developed.
Final sign off of software delivery to customer ensuring alignment of delivery to requirements all within high quality standards.
Translate and document client business requests into written IT baseline detailed business requirements for application development.
Translate new business requests (from both internal and external audiences) into formal proposal including drafting, creating and documenting statements of work, timeline and deliverable expectations and the expressed scopes of work.

You Must Have:
Bachelor’s degree in Business or Computer Science or related technical area.
2 to 4+ years of equivalent/relevant professional experience in the field or in a related area.
Knowledge of the fundamental concepts, practices, and procedures of business analysis, project management, and client support
This position requires experience and judgment to plan and accomplish goals and make decisions that are aligned with company policies and practices.
The ability to respect and maintain confidential information
The ability to build rapport with our clients and internal cross-functional teams
The ability to effectively communicate information to internal/external vendors/clients, staff, and management verbally and in written form
Adaptable and accountable individual with strong interpersonal skills
Strong organizational skills and the ability to handle changing priorities and multiple projects at the same time
The initiative to take responsibility for finding alternative approaches to solve or troubleshoot issues
Working knowledge of the Microsoft Office product suite (Word, Excel, Outlook and PowerPoint)
Skilled at utilizing dotted line relationships to influence behaviors and accomplish objectives.
Able to escalate and make problems visible to facilitate completion of initiatives and commitments.
We Would Also Prefer:
Knowledge of Agile and/or Kanban as well as the Waterfall Frameworks
Familiarity with the software development life cycle (SDLC)
Basic knowledge of marketing, and/or application development
Experience in the Financial or Print Industry
DevOps backlog management standards
About Taylor Corporation

One of the top five graphics communications companies in North America, Taylor’s family of companies provide a diverse set of products, services and technologies addressing the toughest communication challenges. For 45 years, Taylor has been a premier provider of powerful and innovative products, services and expertise for individuals, businesses and distributors large and small. Our 10,000+ employees spanning more than 25 states and nine countries work diligently to create the interactive, printing and marketing solutions that have helped build some of the world’s more recognizable brands. Everything we do begins with identifying the unique priorities and needs of our customers and creating one-of-a-kind solutions. We offer a full range of benefits to power our employees’ potential including: health, dental, vision and life insurance; a 401(k) plan; paid time off (PTO) and holiday pay, and more.

Description
The Cloud Renewal Strategy Manager (RSM) is responsible for maintaining a focus on renewals within their assigned segment pillar. They will provide subject matter expertise in working with Oracle ASMs to secure the renewal and contracted revenue growth of Oracle Cloud accounts. This is strategically important to the health and growth of Oracleâ€™s Cloud business. The Renewal Strategy Manager will have a defined segment (e.g. Up market, Majors/SMB, Public Sector) within the Oracle CX Sales and Service Product Pillar. The Renewal Strategy Manager is responsible for participating in weekly forecast cadence calls and knowing/communicating the renewal status of all accounts in the teamâ€™s territories.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities
Renewals Leadership: Responsible for overseeing the Renewals business associated with the assigned sales segment to include achievement of specific renewal goals assigned. Understand renewal rate and churn trends within the assigned segment. Partner with the segment GVP to develop a plan to improve future renewal rates and minimize churn based on these trends.
Mentorship: train and mentor Inside Sales Representatives (ISRs) in your assigned segment to ensure they follow best practices in their prosecution of renewals opportunities.
Strategic Renewals Plan: Develop a strategic Renewals plan to include the goals, objectives and tactics associated with the assigned sales segment. Drive programs that proactively position our customers for successful and timely renewals.
Collaboration: It is critical that the RSM collaborates with our center of Excellence (COE) organization and our Cloud Field Sales organization to ensure optimal engagement with clients in advance of, and during the renewal cycle.
Trusted business partner : Become a trusted renewal advisor to the sales GVP and team you support. Get to know the renewals business and understand the market you support. Provide thought leadership and find innovative ways to make improvements. Understand the renewals business trends, goals, issues, requirements.
General Awareness: Ensure your sales teams are focused on Renewals. Understand the renewals in your segment and drive a regular cadence (in partnership with the ASMs) to ensure all risk is understood.
Future focus: Proactively inspect future quarter renewals (5 quarters out) and advise your leadership as issues are uncovered. Identify key â€œat-riskâ€� renewal clients early in the cycle and define issues inhibiting a successful, timely renewal. Ensure usage trends are understood relevant to upcoming renewals.
Annual Plan: Identify all upcoming renewals for the year to be sure accurate quota assignments occur; address any potential churns with Finance to ensure accuracy.
Forecast accuracy/deal inspection: Review all renewals forecasted each week to identify any areas of concern and engage with ASMs to address get well plans if needed.
Sales Tools : Enable ASMs on the tools that are critical to drive renewals. Drive usage of OSC, Sales Manager Central, Touchstone, SI and the pipeline dashboards â€“ to ensure efficiency, consistency and adoption relative to renewals. Obtain feedback on automation opportunities and bring forward for implementation.
Essential Knowledge, Skills, Abilities, and Background
Experience with cloud-based/SaaS business process solution offerings
Product experience in Sales, Marketing and Service Automation
Finance background is beneficial â€“ understanding of accounting and financial principles such as Budgeting, ROI, Project Payback, Time Value of Money, TCO-based Selling
Understanding of the basic legal and financial concepts in SaaS contracts such as ramping, SLAs and Revenue Recognition
Ability to effectively negotiate in both challenging and collaborative sales engagements
Ability to excel in a high-energy, quarterly-results driven sales culture
Team player who will work within the company to continue improving organization processes
5-7 Years sales experience in technology-based company
Bachelorâ€™s degree in Finance or IT related discipline
Intermediate / advanced excel skills, experience in word, power point and CRM systems


Provides programs to improve operational efficiency, consistency, and compliance in support of the organization's financial and tactical business objectives. Provides business practices and processes. Develops, communicates, and trains the organization on business practices and processes.


Serve as a liaison with other divisions such as Finance, Contracts, HR, Legal, Shared Services, Accounts Receivable, Purchasing, and Risk Management in an effort to ensure accurate and timely transaction processing. Collect, input, verify, correct, and analyze data to measure key performance indicator actual versus business objectives. Provide updates to management regarding budget to actual, informing them of deviations and opportunities. Provide management with economic impact and compliance issues surrounding key business decisions and/or deals. Communicate Oracle Business Practices to the organization and monitor process and approvals for full compliance. Drive implementation of new processes and procedures.


Leading contributor individually and as a team member, providing direction and mentoring to others. Work is non-routine and very complex, involving the application of advanced technical/business skills in area of specialization. Ability to collect, organize, and display data in spreadsheet format. Follow-through skills necessary to get information from internal and third parties and have data errors/omissions corrected. For this, relationship management skills strongly desired. Strong written and verbal communication skills. 8 plus years relevant work experience.

ABOUT THE JOB (JOB BRIEF)
KeyBank is looking for a talented, analytical, highly motivated, and results-driven professional to join its Enterprise Business analytics team. This team aims to bring industry expertise and an analytical mindset in an integrated package to our Line of Business partners, both to drive immediate value and to build a data-drive analytical culture for other teams to model after.
The Senior Business Analytics Associate is primarily responsible the formulation of hypotheses, translation of data, design/measurement of experiments and generation of insights to inform business decisions by using various data mining techniques. The Senior Business Analytics Associate uses data to perform more complex diagnostic analyses to provide answers to questions such as “Why did it happen?” and “What action can I take?” Through the use of cross-functional reporting and execution of complex analyses, mapping out processes and applying necessary controls, the Senior Business Analytics Associate identifies trends and outliers and suggest solutions to resolve business challenges or implement process improvements. Success criteria include: leveraging business acumen, critical thinking, industry knowledge, trends, and anticipation of business need to inform analyses and recommendations; leading conversations with business partners and effectively communicate with all stakeholders; and providing solutions based on an understanding of impacts / intersections with other business partners and lines of business.
If you are excited about the opportunity to build experience across a variety of financial products within a world-class organization; comfortable gathering and analyzing information, formulating and testing hypotheses, and developing and communicating recommendations, then this role could be ideal for you.
ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS
Leverage critical thinking and business acumen to develop insights, deliver analysis, and provide solutions to increasingly more complex business problems
Develop and deliver presentations that include the right data and “tells the right story” to business partners
Effectively communicate key points to respective stakeholders, with the right amount of detail Identify and anticipate business need, understand how to obtain information
Make process improvement suggestions
Review work product of junior staff; provide input, direction, and mentorship
Lead conversations with business partners
REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS
Master’s degree in Analytics, Computer Science, Economics, Finance, Financial Mathematics, Statistics, or the Natural Sciences and 3 years of relevant experience; or Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Economics, Finance, Financial Mathematics, Statistics, or the Natural Sciences and 5 years of relevant experience
Proficient with:
Analytical programming languages (Python / SAS)
Query writing/coding including complex joins
Data visualization
Microsoft Excel / PowerPoint
Knowledge of:
Source systems
Process flow
Skill & ability to:
Work with big data
Navigate data warehouse and/or data supply chain
#LI-Remote
COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS
This position is eligible to earn a base salary in the range of $70,000 to $110,000 annually depending on job-related factors such as level of experience. Compensation for this role also includes eligibility for short-term incentive compensation and deferred incentive compensation subject to individual and company performance. Please click here for a list of benefits for which this position is eligible.

As a result, this role may be mobile or home based, which means you may work either at a home office or in a Key facility to perform your job duties.

About Us
Clearway Energy Group is leading the transition to a world powered by clean energy. Along with our public affiliate Clearway Energy, Inc., we own and operate over 7.5 gigawatts of renewable and conventional energy assets across the country. As we develop a nationwide pipeline of new renewable energy projects for the future, Clearway’s 5 gigawatts of wind, solar, and energy storage assets offset the equivalent of nearly 8.8 million metric tons of carbon emissions for our customers today. Clearway Energy Group is headquartered in San Francisco, CA with offices in Carlsbad, CA; Scottsdale, AZ; Houston, TX; and Princeton, NJ.
Job Summary
As a key member of an established team of investment and project development professionals, the Analyst will have responsibility for supporting commercial strategy for utility-scale wind, solar, and battery assets under development as well as valuation, due diligence, and execution of project acquisition opportunities. Additionally, this role will support Clearway’s entry into hydrogen and offshore wind development.

This position will be based in our San Francisco office.
Principal Responsibilities & Key Results
Asset origination and acquisition: Support origination, structuring, and closing of high-quality, profitable solar and wind acquisitions as a key member of a transaction team
Own the project financial model. Work with Project Finance and Risk teams to ensure conformance with underwriting guidelines, investment metrics and forecasted cash flows. Run sensitivity analyses and generate ideas to optimize valuations.
Coordinate with functional teams on due diligence and financial model inputs to qualify project investments prior to executing acquisition documents.
Prepare detailed memos and presentations for senior management and investment committee.
Create and manage tools to monitor market activity and track internal origination strategy to identify new growth areas and M&A targets.
Support on-going origination, development, and financing activities for projects:
Support pricing analysis and bidding strategy to originate offtake contracts for Clearway Energy Group’s 8GW+ development portfolio of utility wind and solar projects.
Develop statistical analyses to quantify risk in highly structured commodity transactions.
Perform quantitative and qualitative analysis to workout impediments to negotiations and closings.
Work with functional groups, third party consultants and various other stakeholders to drive projects forward and perform quantitative analyses to support development and financing decisions.
Support Initiatives aimed at improving the set of tools, and business activities at Clearway
Develop additional functionality for new and innovative financial structures (in excel and VBA) and improve existing quantitative analyses tools.
Assist with other projects to improve financial optimization, underwriting, deal tracking, etc.
Lead other special projects in support of business strategy.

Knowledge & Skills
Advanced capabilities in Excel and PowerPoint is required.
Aptitude for analytical and financial modeling with demonstrated attention to detail.
Quantitative skills are a must for this position.

Qualifications
Bachelor's Degree in finance, business administration, economics, engineering, or computer science.
0+ years of experience in renewable development, IPP, investment banking, cleantech, or related quantitative/transactional role. Relevant coursework and/or internships is highly preferred.
Experience navigating discounted cash flow models is required.
Fundamental knowledge in renewable energy, cleantech, power markets, or infrastructure finance with prior internship (or similar) experience in these fields.
Prior introductory programming experience is a plus.


Clearway will not sponsor nonimmigrant visas for this position (H-1B, TN, E-3, etc.).

The Business Analyst joining our team will be very comfortable in handling large amounts of structured and unstructured data. Working in close partnership and collaboration with team members and key senior stakeholders across Industry Solutions and Microsoft to design and create Sales Models, PowerBI Dashboards, Blueprints, and ad-hoc reports. Exploring and identifying patterns and insights in the data. Turning these insights into compelling Sales Model and Blueprint business cases to influence and drive the Sales and GTM team in their Strategic Pursuits.
Responsibilities
We are looking for a Business Analyst who will own the following core responsibilities:
Define the business requirements for BI and reporting for the Sales and GTM team, factoring in the data and insight needs of our LT, executive leadership, and business group stakeholders
Design and build analytical models working alongside a strong team of Leads, Analysts, Architects to monitor sales model, pipeline, and blueprint performance in alignment with the strategic roadmap for Microsoft Industry Solutions
Participate in yearly Sales Model planning involving account targeting, seller productivity, headcount and blueprint, and coverage model development and management
Partner closely with internal Sales and GTM teams to design and maintain a BI dashboard that track sales model performance, seller resource mapping, and blueprint related KPIs for example - sales model landing insights.
Take complex data sets and create and design reports for the leadership team to provide business insights and patterns in the data
Act as an evangelist and catalyst for BI & Analytics innovation in Sales and GTM and the broader Industry Solutions Organization
Provide and maintain governance on Sales Model account data and align with business group stakeholders
Provide leadership team with ad hoc reports based on business needs
Qualifications
Required:
3+ years’ experience and a proven track record as a business analyst, data analyst, management consultant, business planner (or similar roles)
Preferred:
5+ years’ professional experience in the high-tech industry or learning industry
Previous experience navigating large matrixed organizations a strong plus
The successful candidate will demonstrate passion and skills aligned with business insights, data analysis, and data visualization
Business Intelligence professional with experience in computer science or related field
The candidate should be able to work under compressed deadlines in a fast-paced dynamic environment that demands flexibility, high quality, and creativity.
Effective cross-team collaboration is essential to align multiple stakeholder teams to a common vision. More specifically, the candidate will meet the following qualifications:
Effective analytical skills to synthesize multiple complex data sets into easy to consume and actionable business insights
Demonstrated expertise in cross team collaboration across multiple stakeholder groups to deliver relevant reporting and data insights
Attention to detail and the ability to drive clarity in ambiguous situations
Strong oral and written communication skills and executive presence
Strong design sense along with experience in Power BI and advanced Excel (VBA) skills

At Splunk, we’re committed to our work, customers, having fun and most importantly to each other’s success. Learn more about Splunk careers and how you can become a part of our journey!
Role:
Splunk is looking for a Business Analyst, Technical Support Strategy & Planning to join our passionate, fun and innovative Splunk Global Support organization. This role will support cross functional strategic initiatives on behalf of Global Support across Splunk.
This Business Analyst role will work closely with Global Support Leadership, Support Operations and Customer Success Strategy and Operations teams. The candidate will be responsible for weekly, monthly and quarterly business reviews, strategic narratives, assisting with planning organization-wide meetings among other programs and projects.
Responsibilities:
Strategy
Contribute with the development and planning of Splunk’s overall Global Support strategy to make a measurable impact on key outcomes like retention, annual revenue, cost to serve, time to value, customer experience, etc. Global Support Strategy must be aligned with Customer Success and overall Splunk priorities and backed by Data and customer insights
Develop and maintain an effective interlock working in strong collaboration with all other business functions to complete the Global Support strategy (e.g CS, Sales, PM, Engineering, Product).
Develop content for executive level presentations (QBRs, Strategy Narratives, etc.)
Business insights
Partner with Global Support leadership to develop data insights and dashboards to support the business and provide insights into operational efficiency
Analyze data to identify strategic opportunities to improve our business, in partnership with the operations and analytics team.
Strategic processes
Develop Narratives and supporting content for executive leadership within the business areas to create and maintain alignment around the business objectives, priorities, measurable benefits, success criteria, scope, and constraints impacting all functions of Global Support
Partner with the Global Support organization and greater leadership team to ensure strategies and narratives are aligned to programs/initiatives.
Ensure standard business analyst methodologies & processes are applied to address unique situations.
What you bring:
Critical thinking, thought leadership and foresight: You anticipate changes in customer expectations and quickly mobilize and strategize to guide the required customer experience shifts.
A passion for delighting customers and growth: You’re a pro using data driven insights to guide actions and outcomes.
You have a deep understanding of value drivers in recurring revenue business models and the support operating metrics relevant to a support organization.
Interpersonal, networking and influencing skills: Ability to communicate effectively with internal and external partners and customers at every level. Influence alignment and prioritization of initiatives critical to delivering the strategy. You embrace change and have a demonstrable ability to empower and influence across functions.
Problem-solving and analytical skills: Interpreting and using data insights for constantly improving customer experience.
Ability to understand business objectives and communicate critical initiatives accordingly: clear understanding of the company’s/organizational objectives and ability to align and document initiatives to contribute to the achievement of the business goals.
Long term strategic outlook and ability to break it down into achievable and measurable roadmaps: You can visualize the desired end result and then work backwards to plan, strategize and document.
Data-driven approach and a curiosity about technology
Requirements:
5+ years of demonstrated ability and proven track record of leading strategy and operations in a scaled B2B SaaS company. Efforts must demonstrate material impact on retention, expansion and growth.
3+ years of proven experience in strategic program execution building a scalable and repeatable approach to program management.
Experience in Technical Support or Technically focused organizations
Experience scaling during hyper growth, comfortable with ambiguity

Brightline is pleased to offer a competitive compensation and benefits package, and the opportunity to make a difference while making history as the only privately funded express train service in the country.At Brightline, we believe in creating meaningful connections through exceptional travel experiences. We operate at the intersection of hospitality and transportation and we are on a mission to encourage America to Go Car Free. Carefree. Brightline owns and operates an express passenger rail system connecting major population centers in Florida, with plans to expand operations further in Florida, Los Angeles, Las Vegas and elsewhere in North America. We are the first new major private passenger intercity railroad in the United States in over a century, and we believe our business represents a scalable model for twenty-first century passenger travel in North America.Brightline currently operates between Miami and West Palm Beach, one of the most heavily traveled and congested regions in the U.S. We are about hallway finished with construction of our Florida passenger rail system's expansion to Orlando, Florida, and we intend to further expand our rail service to Tampa, Florida with an intermediary stop at Walt Disney World Resort. We can operate up to 32 trains daily that are capable of speeds of up to 125 miles per hour, and we own stations located in the heart of downtown cities and major transit hubs in Florida. Our passenger rail system offers a travel option that is faster, safer, more eco-friendly, more reliable, less expensive, more productive, and more enjoyable than travel by car or air.Brightline provides a unique and enriching opportunity to be a part of a new transportation alternative that is keenly focused on hospitality and guest service.Essential Functions:Update daily KPI and Forecasting reports for executive management.Responsible for tracking and monitoring sales activities, advertising spend, ridership, financials, web metrics, and other reporting dailyTrack and trend reporting requests to ensure the most efficient and effective data and analysis occurResponsible for executing development and refinement of Revenue reporting and dashboards based on established prioritiesCollaborate with others to understand the business need to design and refine new and existing reportsDevelop reports to assist in the analysis and improvement of operational efficiency and standardizationIdentifies and makes recommendations to Management regarding performance metrics, marketing campaignsAccurately and timely perform all duties and responsibilitiesOther duties as required that could include financial analysis, budgetary support, and operational alignment and efficiently supportSupport other team members (internal and external to department) with learning data elements and reporting tools.Understand the Data Warehouse and the nuances of the data within the warehouse.Proactively recommend changes to reporting, with a focus on reducing redundanciesAnalyze large datasets, interpret trends, and identify actionable insights and opportunitiesQualifications:Bachelor's Degree (BA) in Decision Science or BI2+ years of related experienceAdvanced Excel and PowerPoint a mustIntermediate proficiency with database programs; knowledgeable in Tableau, SQLPreviously worked with executives on delivering high quality reports and analyticsPreferred knowledge of financial statements, revenue management, and marketing platformsBrightline Management, LLC is an Equal Opportunity Employer. In compliance with the Americans with Disabilities Act, Brightline Management, LLC will provide reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities and encourages both prospective and current employees to discuss potential accommodations with the employer.Job Type: Full-time

Mission Lane LLC is a fintech on a mission (no pun intended) to increase access to financial tools that help people thrive. We are raising the bar on fair credit access, easy money management, and convenient income discovery. Our philosophy is simple: when our customers do well, we do well. And we have only just begun.
The Credit Team is looking for a Sr. Business Analyst of Strategy and Analytics to drive forward our mission of financial inclusion. In this role you will help our customers succeed financially by unlocking access to credit and helping manage it well. We are based primarily in Richmond, VA and San Francisco, CA, and are open to considering remote candidates that would be open to travel to our offices on occasions.
The Impact You'll Make in this Role:

Given our customers have had challenges with credit, we start slow and set them up for success slowly.
Set up goals for customer success and lay down transparently how customers can achieve it.
Help make credit success a habit for customers.
Reward positive customer behavior by meeting their growing credit needs!
This is a mission critical role that is not only solving key customer problems but also generating a lot of business value.

To set you up for success in this role from day one, Mission Lane is looking for candidates who have:

Ability to lead the development and implementation of strategies that change the trajectory of the business and require collaboration with cross-functional teams.
1-2 years of experience in a highly analytical role (preferably in consumer lending).
Experience with hypothesis and frame work driven consumer analytics.
Bachelor's or Master's in Economics, Finance, Engineering, Mathematics, or similar quantitative field with record of strong academic performance.

You get bonus points for:

Experience helping scale a business in a fast-paced startup environment
Expertise in analytic and modeling tools (SQL, Python, etc.)

More about Mission Lane:

Mission Lane is based in the U.S., with offices in Richmond, Virginia & San Francisco, California. Founded in December 2018, we've rapidly grown to over 1 million customers.

It all started with a realization: nearly fifty percent of the adult population in the U.S. doesn't have access to a clear line of credit. And by "clear" we mean credit without crazy fees that only increase debt. Most traditional credit card companies either overlook or overcharge this group because they have less-than-prime credit scores or no score at all. We decided this just wouldn't do.

We understand that everyone doesn't have the same opportunities. We also know that everyone joins us at different stages of their financial journeys. Providing access to clear credit was a critical first step, but our work isn't done. We are actively developing new products designed to meet our customers where they are, according to their needs.

We get it - life happens. That's why Mission Lane is hard at work paving a better way forward.

Just like for our customers, Mission Lane creates opportunities for our employees to learn, grow, and prosper. We strive to create an environment that brings out the best in everyone, everyday.

******

Mission Lane is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to diversity and inclusion in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, race, color, age, national origin, religion, physical and mental disability, genetic information, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity/assignment, citizenship, pregnancy or maternity, protected veteran status, or any other status prohibited by applicable national, federal, state or local law.
Mission Lane is not currently sponsoring new applicant employment authorization for this position. And please, no third party recruiters.

Description
The Cloud Renewal Strategy Manager (RSM) is responsible for maintaining a focus on renewals within their assigned segment pillar. They will provide subject matter expertise in working with Oracle ASMs to secure the renewal and contracted revenue growth of Oracle Cloud accounts. This is strategically important to the health and growth of Oracleâ€™s Cloud business. The Renewal Strategy Manager will have a defined segment (e.g. Up market, Majors/SMB, Public Sector) within the Oracle CX Sales and Service Product Pillar. The Renewal Strategy Manager is responsible for participating in weekly forecast cadence calls and knowing/communicating the renewal status of all accounts in the teamâ€™s territories.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities
Renewals Leadership: Responsible for overseeing the Renewals business associated with the assigned sales segment to include achievement of specific renewal goals assigned. Understand renewal rate and churn trends within the assigned segment. Partner with the segment GVP to develop a plan to improve future renewal rates and minimize churn based on these trends.
Mentorship: train and mentor Inside Sales Representatives (ISRs) in your assigned segment to ensure they follow best practices in their prosecution of renewals opportunities.
Strategic Renewals Plan: Develop a strategic Renewals plan to include the goals, objectives and tactics associated with the assigned sales segment. Drive programs that proactively position our customers for successful and timely renewals.
Collaboration: It is critical that the RSM collaborates with our center of Excellence (COE) organization and our Cloud Field Sales organization to ensure optimal engagement with clients in advance of, and during the renewal cycle.
Trusted business partner : Become a trusted renewal advisor to the sales GVP and team you support. Get to know the renewals business and understand the market you support. Provide thought leadership and find innovative ways to make improvements. Understand the renewals business trends, goals, issues, requirements.
General Awareness: Ensure your sales teams are focused on Renewals. Understand the renewals in your segment and drive a regular cadence (in partnership with the ASMs) to ensure all risk is understood.
Future focus: Proactively inspect future quarter renewals (5 quarters out) and advise your leadership as issues are uncovered. Identify key â€œat-riskâ€� renewal clients early in the cycle and define issues inhibiting a successful, timely renewal. Ensure usage trends are understood relevant to upcoming renewals.
Annual Plan: Identify all upcoming renewals for the year to be sure accurate quota assignments occur; address any potential churns with Finance to ensure accuracy.
Forecast accuracy/deal inspection: Review all renewals forecasted each week to identify any areas of concern and engage with ASMs to address get well plans if needed.
Sales Tools : Enable ASMs on the tools that are critical to drive renewals. Drive usage of OSC, Sales Manager Central, Touchstone, SI and the pipeline dashboards â€“ to ensure efficiency, consistency and adoption relative to renewals. Obtain feedback on automation opportunities and bring forward for implementation.
Essential Knowledge, Skills, Abilities, and Background
Experience with cloud-based/SaaS business process solution offerings
Product experience in Sales, Marketing and Service Automation
Finance background is beneficial â€“ understanding of accounting and financial principles such as Budgeting, ROI, Project Payback, Time Value of Money, TCO-based Selling
Understanding of the basic legal and financial concepts in SaaS contracts such as ramping, SLAs and Revenue Recognition
Ability to effectively negotiate in both challenging and collaborative sales engagements
Ability to excel in a high-energy, quarterly-results driven sales culture
Team player who will work within the company to continue improving organization processes
5-7 Years sales experience in technology-based company
Bachelorâ€™s degree in Finance or IT related discipline
Intermediate / advanced excel skills, experience in word, power point and CRM systems


Provides programs to improve operational efficiency, consistency, and compliance in support of the organization's financial and tactical business objectives. Provides business practices and processes. Develops, communicates, and trains the organization on business practices and processes.


Serve as a liaison with other divisions such as Finance, Contracts, HR, Legal, Shared Services, Accounts Receivable, Purchasing, and Risk Management in an effort to ensure accurate and timely transaction processing. Collect, input, verify, correct, and analyze data to measure key performance indicator actual versus business objectives. Provide updates to management regarding budget to actual, informing them of deviations and opportunities. Provide management with economic impact and compliance issues surrounding key business decisions and/or deals. Communicate Oracle Business Practices to the organization and monitor process and approvals for full compliance. Drive implementation of new processes and procedures.


Leading contributor individually and as a team member, providing direction and mentoring to others. Work is non-routine and very complex, involving the application of advanced technical/business skills in area of specialization. Ability to collect, organize, and display data in spreadsheet format. Follow-through skills necessary to get information from internal and third parties and have data errors/omissions corrected. For this, relationship management skills strongly desired. Strong written and verbal communication skills. 8 plus years relevant work experience.

Itâ€™s when everyoneâ€™s voice is heard and valued, that we are inspired to go beyond whatâ€™s been done before. Thatâ€™s why we need people with diverse backgrounds, beliefs, and abilities to help us create the future, and are proud to be an affirmative-action equal opportunity employer.
