Job Purpose:
The role is a key member of the omni-channel technology team which, as a function, is responsible for the translation of business outcomes into technical specifications and recommendations for a wide range of Omni-Channel Digital tools and projects, together with communicating, onboarding and training users. Working under the Global Director of Omni-channel Technology and in close partnership with the broader omni-channel team, IT teams and business stakeholders, the jobholder is key to ensuring the smooth adoption of new digital tools, ideas and experiences to market. Works Globally across a matrix organization.
Key areas of accountability:
Develop required business guides to support operational implementation of new tools
Training for new/existing employees on marketing technology procedures/processes
Deliver governance reports for compliance action plans
Create/edit process, flow charts and diagrams to support omni-channel customer experience planning and stakeholder communication
Collaborate with IT to maintain an effective technology roadmap and assist with incorporation of new technologies
On a project basis, coordinate with business and IT partners to analyze business requirements of key stakeholders to provide recommended solutions
Regularly update Omni-Channel technology intranet pages
Coordinate with vendors for solution business reviews, demonstrations and evaluations
Attend appropriate scrum ceremonies to provide needed input on requirements, acceptance criteria and prioritization.
Minimum Requirements:
Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent years of directly related experience (or high school +13 yrs; Assoc.+9 yrs; M.S.+2 yrs; PhD+0 yrs)
The ability to fluently read, write, understand and communicate in English
5 Years of Relevant Experience
Skills & Experience:
Strong communicator verbally, visually and with presentation of content
Excellent research and analytic skills
Working knowledge of relevant business management principles
Excellent attention to detail
Ability to turn complex concepts into simple language
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Experience in global omni-channel/digital processes
Experience in working in matrix / global organizations

Job Title: SAP Project System PS Functional Business Analyst
Description:
Company Overview:
If a culture of excellence, innovation and ownership is what you’re searching for, consider putting your experience in motion at Flowserve. As an individual contributor, or as a leader of people, your enterprise mindset will ensure Flowserve’s position as the global standard in comprehensive flow control solutions. Here, your opportunity for professional development and industry leading rewards will be supported by our foundational commitments to the values of people first, integrity and safety. Thinking beyond opportunity and reward, at Flowserve, we are inspired by working together to create extraordinary flow control solutions to make the world better for everyone!
Role Summary:
In this role you will be responsible for the PS thread on our S4/program, with focus at minimum on the following SAP modules: PS (Project System), CPM (Commercial Project Management) and Integration with SD, MM, FICO, CATS, HR mini-master and Logistics Execution.
Responsible for functionally & process quality of SAP & implementation/improvement project life cycles
Strong on global enterprise enablement
Work with SAP Consultants/Business Analysts and numerous regional & global business partners.
Work closely with the production support team
Responsibilities & Requirements:
Responsibilities:
Conduct requirements gathering workshops with business users
Design SAP solutions using SAP PS/CPM modules to meet business needs including gap analysis and make recommendation on industry and technology best practices to stakeholders
Configure solutions in SAP, perform unit testing, integration testing, regression testing and train the trainer
Write functional specifications for WRICEF objects and work with offshore developers to get them implemented
Ability to lead functional and technical team members during implementation
Ability to work independently with minimal supervision
Excellent communication / presentation skills (verbal and written)
Responsible for functionally & process quality of SAP & implementation/improvement project life cycles
Work with SAP Consultants/Business Analysts and numerous regional & global business partners
Work closely with the production support team
Be able to cope with multi-tasking assignment excellent analytical, interpersonal and communication skills
Requirements:
8-10 years of experience in implementing SAP Project Systems with Work Breakdown Structures (WBS), Networks and Activities
Bachelor of Technology, Bachelor of Engineering or Bachelor of Science required
Master’s in computer related field is preferred
Working experience on similar capacity for more than 8 years with at least 2-3 SAP implementation life cycles
Critical problem-solving skills a must
Expert subject Matter expert for PS – Project system on S4
At least have led at least 3 full life cycle implementations
Must have led requirement gathering workshops
Team player with excellent communication skills
Project Creation & Status Management
Project Cost and Revenue Planning
Project Commitment & Cost Tracking, Project Procurement
Project Integration with SD, MM, FICO, CO-PA, CATS, HR mini-master and Logistics Execution.
System integration experience with Milestone Billing, Progress Analysis, Percentage of completion, Revenue Recognition and Logistics Execution for shipments
Project scheduling using Project Systems and Workforce Planning integration for Resource Scheduling
Project Settlement & Closure
Experienced implementing CPM – Project Workspace, Master Projects, Alerts Framework, Issues and Change Management and Risk Management
Implemented end-to-end Resource Related Billing setup in a complex business environment
Project System integration experience with MRS (Multi Resource Scheduling) or 3rd party Resource Scheduling tool
SAP PS certification
S4/ HANA experience
Fiori APPs development and rollout
Willing to travel when required, up to 50% domestic and/or international travel to any of the world-wide Flowserve sites
Preferred Experience / Skills:
Preferred:
Nice to have skill for CPM – Commercial Project Management on S4
Capable to troubleshoot and provide quality problems resolution.
Working experience in a manufacturing industry will be an added advantage
Strong on global enterprise enablement
Be able to cope with multi-tasking assignment excellent analytical, interpersonal and communication skills
Working experience in a manufacturing industry will be an added advantage
Team Player, responsive, organized
Critical problem-solving skills, capable to troubleshoot and provide quality problems resolution.

Who we are:

Process Street is a no-code workflow platform startup from San Francisco. We help our customers build, document, automate, and track recurring workflows. Our platform stores knowledge where the action happens, ensuring thorough and error free execution of workflows that our global customers run their businesses on.

We service over 3k customers around the world, such as Airbnb, Spotify, AstraZeneca and Accenture, and are VC-backed by Accel, Salesforce, and Atlassian.

Process Street was founded on a strong belief in the work-life benefits of a healthy, collaborative remote culture. We value flexibility because many of us are parents, travelers, or just creatives who aren't inspired by the construct of a mundane 9-to-5. Spread across 9 different time zones, we communicate asynchronously, work autonomously, and take real ownership of our work.

If you're entrepreneurial and seek an environment that values your effective creativity, congratulations, you've found your new home!


The Opportunity

You will be Process Street's first in-house data engineer and analyst, and your responsibilities will encompass all-things data! As the first data hire, you will initially report to the Director of Revenue Operations and will have the opportunity to shape our data strategy and architecture to take our data-driven decision-making to the next level. Although this will start as an IC role, you will have ownership and autonomy from day 1. With delivering business value and strong results, you can anticipate short-term leadership potential!


What you'll do:

Understand Process Street's business and redesign our company's data architecture to support our next generation of product and data initiatives.
Make architectural and tool decisions to implement real-time data systems.
Work with stakeholders across the business, including the leadership team to define strategic objectives, product direction, roadmaps, growth goals, retention strategies, etc.
Evangelize data analysis through storytelling and easy-to-consume reporting for business teams to act on.
Produce insights (e.g. performance drivers, retention analysis, behavioral personas) to help grow the business.
Monitor, clean, and maintain data for high performance.
Partner with the key cross-functional teams to optimize strategic decisions and build scalable tools (and dashboards) that assess the impact and improve decision-making.
Expand the data culture by growing new relationships, hosting learning sessions, and improving team processes.


What you bring to the table:

At least 4 years of experience in an analytical role with a minimum of one year with engineering responsibilities.
Advanced skills in SQL and experience working with data warehouses, including Snowflake.
Experience working at a B2B SaaS startup with self-serve and sales-led motions.
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, or another quantitative field.


Our Benefits

Fully remote team – No offices, no commute, check-in from a destination of your choosing!
Unlimited PTO policy – Most take 3-4 weeks, plus their major holidays, AND a company-wide week off in December
Annual company offsite* (when not in a pandemic of course) In lieu of an offsite, we do encourage and sponsor small group meetups so that you can meet your teammates face to face around the world.
Social time – We know human connections are what make teams strong. We regularly do coffee chats, game-playing, story-telling, house tours (only if you're comfortable), and more to build connections.
Generous health insurance for US employees and their families
Equity for all full-time roles

Job Title: Business Data Analyst II - Part Time
Description:
Department Overview:

The Business Data Analyst 2 gathers, complies, analyzes and provides qualitative and quantitative information and statistical data, and presents this information in narrative or schematic form for use in business planning and administrative decision making.
This is the second of a three level series. The Business Data Analyst 2 is distinguished from the lower level by providing analysis of the data, advanced technical skills in report writing and by providing recommendations for business outcomes from the analyzed data. The Business Data Analyst 2 is distinguished from the higher level by the lack of responsibility for writing complex computer programs, planning studies, managing complex business research and providing complex interpretations and recommendations, consultative and decision support to division and/or executive leaders.
Function/Duties of Position:

Business Analysis: (30%)
Leads collecting data for both C3PO and IMPACT data registries for the cardiac program.
Works in collaboration with the team and cardiac program to identify trends in data.
In collaboration with the Quality team, identifies opportunities to streamline data collection across registries.
Report Generation: (30%)
Develops reports and visuals of the data from the registries.
Business Consulting: (30%)
Builds relationships with other heart centers data analysts.
Serves as the backup analyst for the other cardiac registries.
In conjunction with the Pediatric Quality program, develops processes for validation and analysis of data.
Serves as an internal resource for the staff in all departments and, acts as a liaison for other system entities.
Project Management: (10%)
Primary support for improvement efforts for IMPACT & C3PO, supplying data ideas, measurement, tools and visualization.
Supports additional improvement efforts in the hospital as needed.
Required Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in a business field and one year of experience that included analytical, database, spreadsheet and/or financial experience, technical writing, quantitative analysis or use of statistical principles; OR
Associates degree in a business field plus three years of experience that included analytical, database, spreadsheet and/or financial experience, technical writing, quantitative analysis or use of statistical principles; OR
Five years of experience that included analytical, database, spreadsheet and/or financial experience, technical writing, quantitative analysis or use of statistical principles; OR
An equivalent combination of education, training and/or experience.
Must be able to perform the essential functions of the position with or without accommodation.
All are welcome: Oregon Health & Science University values a diverse and culturally competent workforce. We are proud of our commitment to being an equal opportunity, affirmative action organization that does not discriminate against applicants on the basis of any protected class status, including disability status and protected veteran status. Individuals with diverse backgrounds and those who promote diversity and a culture of inclusion are encouraged to apply. To request reasonable accommodation contact the Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Department at 503-494-5148 or aaeo@ohsu.edu.

JOB TITLE: Business Intelligence Analyst
SUPERVISOR: IT Training and Support Services Supervisor

HOURS PER WEEK: Variable/Exempt
DEPARTMENT: Information Technology
*This is a work from home position. Must be located in Oregon or Washington*
HIRING BONUS!
$500 bonus to be paid upon reaching 90th day of hire.$500 bonus to be paid upon successful completion of 1 year of employment.
The following information is designed to outline the essential functions and position requirements of this job. It does not identify all tasks that may be expected, nor address the performance standards that must be maintained.
PRIMARY FUNCTION: To act as the primary resource dedicated to designing, building, testing and activating and maintaining reports using Epic reporting tools. Gathers business needs, document requirements, identify appropriate data sources, develop and update reporting objects and analyses, and deliver solutions to both internal and external stakeholders.
DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: (*ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS)
1. Validate Model System reports and identify advanced reporting needs with report consumers.*
2. Meet with application coordinators and report consumers to understand their reporting needs.*
3. Create design specifications for new reports.*
4. Identify and validate the appropriate technological solutions for various reporting needs.*
5. Create new reports, using a third-party report writing tool, to display Clarity data.*
6. Modify existing reports, as necessary.
7. Perform data analysis and data validation to ensure accurate reporting results.*
8. Serve as a knowledge and reporting resource in various reporting initiatives, including but not limited to Meaningful Use, PCPCH, CPCI, and PQRS.*
9. Design, develop and maintain efficient SQL code.*
10. Develop and utilize query and reporting standards to ensure a high degree of consistency surrounding layout and usability of reports.*
11. Coordinate with users, technical analyst, and database administrators to monitor system data integrity and to coordinate corrections to either the data, or resulting queries and reports.*
12. Collaborate with application analysts to build reports specific to functional area.*
13. Receive, analyze, and resolve Helpdesk requests.*
14. Coordinate the timely delivery and distribution of queries and reports.*
15. Analyze and develop access strategies to ensure high-availability end-user generated reporting which will not negatively impact system response time.*
16. Participate in project planning as a member of the IT department.*
17. Champion the project, provide support in the ongoing implementations, optimizations, and upgrades.*
18. Participate as an active team member in a patient-centered medical home.
19. Assist in system upgrades or enhancements to existing workflows.*
20. Assists in developing and maintain documentation and procedures as needed.
21. Provide system configuration and new project development, design implementation, workflow optimization, change management, and issue resolution related to reporting.*
22. Use independent analysis and research issues to produce solution options including pros, cons, risks, benefits, and unintended consequences. *
23. Collaborate with other IT analysts and vendors to identify system optimization and enhancements in order to design and implement effective solutions.*
24. Perform work and duties after hours and on weekends as required.*
25. Other tasks as assigned.*
26. Attend work regularly as scheduled.*
EDUCATION/LICENSES REQUIRED:
Bachelor’s degree in Information Services or a related IS or healthcare field or an equivalent combination of education and relevant experience.
Epic application certification.
Epic Clarity certification or achieve certification within 6 months of hire.
EXPERIENCE/QUALIFICATIONS REQUIRED:
4 years business intelligence analyst experience or 2 years relevant healthcare experience with 2 years business intelligence or systems analyst experience.
Aptitude and willingness for learning new processes and software applications.
Excellent knowledge of English grammar and spelling for use in both verbal and written communication.
Ability to accept responsibility and use initiative to proceed with necessary tasks without direct supervision.
Maintains calm demeanor under pressure.
Experience in a clinical, administrative, financial, or technology department in healthcare setting is strongly desired.
Proficiency in Microsoft Windows and Office Suite.
Attention to detail.
Ability to work independently and manage multiple conflicting priorities.
Critical thinking and an analytical mind.
Familiarity or aptitude to learn Epic applications and database structure.
Ability to gain an in-depth understanding of the data model.
Prior experience working in a healthcare environment, including use and experience supporting an EHR system.
Ability to translate user requirements into functional and design specifications.
Strong organization, time management, project management, and negotiation skills.
Familiarity with report writing tools, including Clarity, Crystal Reports, Epic Reporting Workbench, and/or SAP Business Objects.
EDUCATION/LICENSES PREFERRED:
Multiple Epic Certifications
EXPERIENCE/QUALIFICATIONS PREFERRED:
Previous Epic application analyst experience.
Able to present in front of large groups.
Demonstrated hands-on experience producing business or clinical report documents from source databases.
Comfort with relational database concepts.
Ability to adapt to a changing environment, problem solve, and develop solutions.
Experience with Visio software to document workflows and diagrams.
COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS:
401k plan with Employer Matching up to 4.5% annually
Comprehensive Medical, Dental and Vision insurance
Flexible Spending Account
Voluntary benefits: Life, Dependent Life, Short-Term Disability, amongst others
3+ weeks PTO accrual per year
One paid Wellness day, and one paid Volunteer day per year
Employee Assistance Program

Title: Business Analyst Finance
Duration: 6 Months
Location: Kennesaw, GA


Short Description:
Responsible for conducting financial data analysis, design, collection, and report solutions to satisfy and support finance stakeholders.

Complete Description:
Local Candidates

Serves as the liaison between functional and technical teams by understanding and conceptualizing applications from each area's point of view. Responsible for conducting financial data analysis, design, collection, and report solutions to satisfy and support finance stakeholders. Monitors the quality of various technical and functional business processes, identifies data issues, and provides resolutions. Responsibilities will include collecting requirements, developing reports and dashboards, testing, assisting with the implementation of new software applications, process improvements, and training to support the objectives of the Institution.

MINIMUM EDUCATION REQUIRED:
Bachelor's Degree from an accredited institution of higher education in Business, Finance, Accounting, Information Systems or related field or equivalent combination of education and/or experience

MINIMUM EXPERIENCE REQUIRED:
Four (4) years previous experience in Business, Finance, Accounting, Information Technology or Systems Analysis

ADDITIONAL QUALIFICATIONS: (Preferred qualifications)
Experience with reporting/query tools and coding in Tableau, SAS, SAS Enterprise Guide, Oracle Databases, and/or SQL (or gathering data from other relation database systems)
Extensive experience in data analysis, dashboards, analytics and decision support systems
Experience successfully working as part of a team with a collaborative approach to problem solving
Working knowledge of fund accounting, budget and finance
Strong IT and Financial skills

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:
1. Interfaces with clients to define business processes, specifications, reporting needs, and functional requirements
2. Designs report and dashboard mock-ups to effectively meet business needs
3. Documents system processes, functionality and implements improvements as applicable
4. Develops and maintains user manuals, training documents and guidelines
5. Conducts meetings with end users to clarify issues, gather requirements, and resolve requests
6. Devises test plans to ensure that the outcome meets the specified requirements and expectations of business users
7. Develops and implements reports and dashboards to provide up-to-date information on functional actives
8. Maintains issues log and collaborates with team to mitigate risks and proactively searches for improvement opportunities
9. Prioritizes problem resolution based on business need, timelines, and scale of impact
10. Presents data resolution findings to relevant stakeholders with recommendations to ensure business needs are meet
11. Designs, builds, implements, and maintains Oracle SQL scripts and procedures in Oracle backend finance data warehouse SQL development software
12. Consults finance users on current and future data visualization and reporting solutions to identify customer needs
13. Provides backup support for operational and technical processes, and system changes
14. Administrator of PeopleSoft eProcurement responsibilities
15. Hosts training sessions on the system applications
16. Maintains content on the department and division webpage

Job Summary:
This role supports the Disney Central contact center. We’re looking for an intellectually curious, business-savvy, analytical powerhouse to join the Disney Central Workforce Planning and Analytics team. In this role, you will be responsible for designing the complete omni-channel future workload forecast across a sub-set of Disney Central’s 21+ unique business unit portfolio consisting of over 2000+ Cast Members at Walt Disney World, Disneyland and other Disney partners. Working collaboratively with cross-functional teams, you will develop, drive, and oversee new forecasting and labor strategies to ensure the growth of the business and the overall bottom line. As needed this role will be responsible for conducting ad hoc analysis to react to immediate business needs and provide cause of change insights, providing key information critical to the success of Disney Central.

Responsibilities:
Develop and maintain forecasting models to predict future workload demands to help manage and optimize staffing
Explore automation opportunities across the Workforce Analytics and Labor Services teams
Maintain knowledge of forecasting methodologies and software to provide accurate workload forecasts.
Remain current on Disney Central downstream impacts such as scheduling and time/pay processes throughout Disney Central, and understand future operational business needs
Perform ad-hoc research and analysis to produce summarized reports based on current initiatives and inquiries
Collaborate across teams to build and drive internal and external partnerships to support synergistic opportunities, achievement of shared objectives, and connectivity of information
Provide regular forecast report outs and recommendations to all levels of the organization
Strong knowledge of data analysis, manipulation, reporting and formatting.
Focus on continuous process improvement and increased efficiency through automation and ideating new ways to work smarter, not harder.
Be part of a great team but also capable of operating independently to manage relationships, deliverables and expectations with business partners.
Basic Qualifications:
Experience with Excel, understanding multiple functions such as Vlookups, Pivot Tables, and Data Analysis.
Experience with Tableau and other data visualization software.
Understanding of statistical functions and experience with relational databases and data preparation
Knowledge of SQL and VBA
Present quantitative analysis with qualitative insight into compelling and actionable recommendations in a concise story.
Passionate about applying new process improvements and technology to improved ways of working.
High level of problem solving skills
Maintains a professional demeanor and comfortable speaking with various levels of leadership in the organization
WDW transfer guidelines apply

2+ years Walt Disney World experience
Basic knowledge of C#, Python, R, and/or Dataiku
Experience using Tableau
Experience using Teradata
Experience using Business Objects
Experience using SharePoint
Experience using SAS
Knowledge and understanding of the Walt Disney World Resort experiences, operations, and marketing

Preferred Education

The Roski School of Art and Design is seeking a Budget/Business Analyst to join its team! The Analyst will perform a variety of duties, including:
Assist with the preparation of the annual budget.
Assists in local planning of short and long term budgets by compiling and organizing data for use in forecasts.
Analyze overall departmental spending versus budget.
Prepares ad hoc financial reports as requested.
Administers assigned budget(s). Monitors actual income and expense and develops projections to authorize or extend financial commitments.
Forecasts future budget performance based on knowledge of assigned operations
Identifies and researches variances and trends and brings to the attention of the supervisor for discussion and resolution.
Troubleshoots problems, including research of pertinent facts and interacts with appropriate university staff to achieve resolution.
Sets up and maintains accounts.
Reconciles account balances and activity to university financial records and initiates correcting entries
Coordinates year end financial transfer and closing activity to staff and faculty.
Provides information to staff and faculty regarding university financial policies and procedures. Assists faculty and staff in financial transactions such as purchasing equipment and supplies and accounting for travel expenditures and reimbursements.
Review purchasing requests against budget and university guidelines.
Review purchasing and travel-card transactions to ensure compliance with university policies.
On a monthly basis, reconcile account balances and activity to the university financial system, researching and bringing budget variances to the attention of the supervisor for discussion and resolution.

2 or more years of relevant work experience in finance or accounting.
Bachelor's degree in business administration/ accounting or related field.
University budget experience and knowledge of university financial systems.
Strong computer skills including Excel spreadsheets.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Team oriented self-motivated, strong work ethic with the ability to meet deadlines and interact with all levels of management.

The USC Roski School of Art and Design offers an arts education that is as individual as the student. Join us!

TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok has global offices including Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Mumbai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul, and Tokyo. We are now looking for talented individuals to join us in 2022 - people who want to inspire creativity and co-create the future with TikTok.

Our team uses data analysis to help drive the company’s monetization strategy and operations. We’re looking for a Business Intelligence (BI) analyst to drive analytics initiatives that guide operational excellence for our Americas business. You will have a ground floor opportunity to shape TikTok’s growth and monetization efforts in Americas.

In this role, you will:

Collect, process, and clean data from disparate sources using SQL, Python, and BI tools to investigate key business trends, issues and opportunities
Develop scalable analytical solutions such as tables, datasets, models and dashboards
Conduct Ad-hoc analysis that helps the business better understand key value drivers and growth opportunities
Effectively communicate actionable insights across all levels to inform monetization efforts
Work closely with cross-functional partners, including local monetization teams, sales & sales operations, international strategy and data teams to drive analytical initiatives to completion
Pursuing a BA/BS degree in math, statistics, data science, business analytics, engineering, computer science or other quantitative major
Solid analytical aptitude with strong exposure or interest in strategy
Strong programming (SQL, Python, R etc) and statistical modeling skills
Expertise in BI visualization tools such as Tableau, Looker is a plus
Self-starter attitude: You’re someone who can initiate and drive complex analysis to completion with minimal guidance and then synthesize and communicate insights
Get-it-done mindset: You’re motivated to work hard and efficiently in a fast-paced, cross-cultural environment.

TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We believe individuals shouldn't be disadvantaged because of their background or identity, but instead should be considered based on their strengths and experience. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.

TikTok is committed to providing reasonable accommodations during our recruitment process. If you need assistance or an accommodation, please reach out to us at Accommodations-AMS@tiktok.com.

SB Underwriting Practices Analyst Job Summary
The SB Underwriting Practices Analyst, working under moderate supervision, is responsible for performing analyses, monitoring, and providing recommendations in support of the automated and transactional underwriting and pricing decisions in the small business (SB) segment. Works closely with and supports the SB Underwriting Practices Manager ensuring the achievement of target financial metrics and pass through rates that drive profitability, growth, and operational efficiency:
Industry and line of business risk appetite and risk selection
Underwriting, pricing, and authority policies, guidelines, and rules
3rd party customer data enrichment and underwriting artificial intelligence & learning models
Portfolio-level data integrity, risk profile, and underwriting & pricing quality KPIs

Desired Qualifications/Experience/Certification/Education (in order of importance)
2+ years of experience performing various analyses/reporting including research and development
Strong analytical thinking and problem-solving skills.
Knowledge of financial, statistical, and mathematical concepts used in business analysis.

CWT Meetings & Events is seeking a Business Analyst who is responsible for the analytical support of mid-size to large meetings & events programs. JOB TITLE: Business Intelligence Analyst
SUPERVISOR: IT Training and Support Services Supervisor

HOURS PER WEEK: Variable/Exempt
DEPARTMENT: Information Technology
*This is a work from home position. Must be located in Oregon or Washington*
HIRING BONUS!
$500 bonus to be paid upon reaching 90th day of hire.$500 bonus to be paid upon successful completion of 1 year of employment.
The following information is designed to outline the essential functions and position requirements of this job. It does not identify all tasks that may be expected, nor address the performance standards that must be maintained.
PRIMARY FUNCTION: To act as the primary resource dedicated to designing, building, testing and activating and maintaining reports using Epic reporting tools. Gathers business needs, document requirements, identify appropriate data sources, develop and update reporting objects and analyses, and deliver solutions to both internal and external stakeholders.
DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: (*ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS)
1. Validate Model System reports and identify advanced reporting needs with report consumers.*
2. Meet with application coordinators and report consumers to understand their reporting needs.*
3. Create design specifications for new reports.*
4. Identify and validate the appropriate technological solutions for various reporting needs.*
5. Create new reports, using a third-party report writing tool, to display Clarity data.*
6. Modify existing reports, as necessary.
7. Perform data analysis and data validation to ensure accurate reporting results.*
8. Serve as a knowledge and reporting resource in various reporting initiatives, including but not limited to Meaningful Use, PCPCH, CPCI, and PQRS.*
9. Design, develop and maintain efficient SQL code.*
10. Develop and utilize query and reporting standards to ensure a high degree of consistency surrounding layout and usability of reports.*
11. Coordinate with users, technical analyst, and database administrators to monitor system data integrity and to coordinate corrections to either the data, or resulting queries and reports.*
12. Collaborate with application analysts to build reports specific to functional area.*
13. Receive, analyze, and resolve Helpdesk requests.*
14. Coordinate the timely delivery and distribution of queries and reports.*
15. Analyze and develop access strategies to ensure high-availability end-user generated reporting which will not negatively impact system response time.*
16. Participate in project planning as a member of the IT department.*
17. Champion the project, provide support in the ongoing implementations, optimizations, and upgrades.*
18. Participate as an active team member in a patient-centered medical home.
19. Assist in system upgrades or enhancements to existing workflows.*
20. Assists in developing and maintain documentation and procedures as needed.
21. Provide system configuration and new project development, design implementation, workflow optimization, change management, and issue resolution related to reporting.*
22. Use independent analysis and research issues to produce solution options including pros, cons, risks, benefits, and unintended consequences. *
23. Collaborate with other IT analysts and vendors to identify system optimization and enhancements in order to design and implement effective solutions.*
24. Perform work and duties after hours and on weekends as required.*
25. Other tasks as assigned.*
26. Attend work regularly as scheduled.*
EDUCATION/LICENSES REQUIRED:
Bachelor’s degree in Information Services or a related IS or healthcare field or an equivalent combination of education and relevant experience.
Epic application certification.
Epic Clarity certification or achieve certification within 6 months of hire.
EXPERIENCE/QUALIFICATIONS REQUIRED:
4 years business intelligence analyst experience or 2 years relevant healthcare experience with 2 years business intelligence or systems analyst experience.
Aptitude and willingness for learning new processes and software applications.
Excellent knowledge of English grammar and spelling for use in both verbal and written communication.
Ability to accept responsibility and use initiative to proceed with necessary tasks without direct supervision.
Maintains calm demeanor under pressure.
Experience in a clinical, administrative, financial, or technology department in healthcare setting is strongly desired.
Proficiency in Microsoft Windows and Office Suite.
Attention to detail.
Ability to work independently and manage multiple conflicting priorities.
Critical thinking and an analytical mind.
Familiarity or aptitude to learn Epic applications and database structure.
Ability to gain an in-depth understanding of the data model.
Prior experience working in a healthcare environment, including use and experience supporting an EHR system.
Ability to translate user requirements into functional and design specifications.
Strong organization, time management, project management, and negotiation skills.
Familiarity with report writing tools, including Clarity, Crystal Reports, Epic Reporting Workbench, and/or SAP Business Objects.
EDUCATION/LICENSES PREFERRED:
Multiple Epic Certifications
EXPERIENCE/QUALIFICATIONS PREFERRED:
Previous Epic application analyst experience.
Able to present in front of large groups.
Demonstrated hands-on experience producing business or clinical report documents from source databases.
Comfort with relational database concepts.
Ability to adapt to a changing environment, problem solve, and develop solutions.
Experience with Visio software to document workflows and diagrams.
COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS:
401k plan with Employer Matching up to 4.5% annually
Comprehensive Medical, Dental and Vision insurance
Flexible Spending Account
Voluntary benefits: Life, Dependent Life, Short-Term Disability, amongst others
3+ weeks PTO accrual per year
One paid Wellness day, and one paid Volunteer day per year
Employee Assistance Program

Job Title: Sales Center of Excellence (SCOE) Business Intelligence Anal...
Description:
Your Impact:
**To meet compliance with work on US government projects US citizenship is required.
This is a REMOTE work opportunity.
At Jacobs, we’re not just building structures, we’re helping our clients innovate and grow by designing, engineering, and executing the construction of their state-of-the-art facilities that are changing our world.
The Sales Center of Excellence (SCOE) is looking for a Business Intelligence Analyst to help shape and implement analytics initiatives and solutions. Manipulating large data sets, building insightful visualizations, and presenting intuitive analytics, you will tell the story that guides decision-makers.
You’re a relationship-driven team member with acute attention to detail and customer service; a self-starter with a desire to deliver an exceptional quality product with a curiosity that drives analysis. You’ll work closely with the SCOE, Line of Business (LOB) Sales leaders, Corporate FP&A analysts and IT partners to take analytics to the next level.
The SCOE’s mission is to support global sales teams – helping them win more work, at higher margins, more efficiently. We are a central function that supports the entire company. Our major workstreams include knowledge management; sales tool product maintenance and enhancements; data connections and systems integration; connection and collaboration across global sales teams; sales pipeline metrics and insights; and facilitation of global sales working groups to take on our common, toughest tasks related to Jacobs’ sales acumen. Our internal customers include 10 global business units across two lines of business (LOBs). Our partners include other central functions, IT, and two design/service centers located in Asia and Europe.
You will be welcomed to a team of high-performing, enjoyable, smart, well-connected, and globally distributed colleagues. Our team works in a collaborative format, sharing ideas, solutions and adapting to exciting new business needs. Working together, we’ll help you grow and pursue what fulfills you so that we can make impacts on the future – big and small, global, and local.
You’re the link between business and data. In this role you’ll:
Design, develop and support compelling data stories that allow stakeholders to make informed data-driven decisions.
Turn data into actionable insights. By building creative and engaging data visualizations you’ll have global impacts that influence decisions throughout the company.
Grow into an SME and be a go-to person for all aspects of analytics; Tableau CRM data visualizations, Salesforce reporting, identifying business questions and developing insights
Interface with internal clients in-person and virtually to discuss strategy, solutions for complex needs and presenting these technical deliverables.
Explore, understand, develop an evolving AI/ML platform (Einstein Discovery)
Make an impact. We don’t stand still! Industry trends and technology are ever-adapting and it’s our mission to get ahead of what’s coming next in our technology platforms so we can evolve and provide more advanced solutions.
Provide scheduled and ad hoc cost reporting, budgeting, and analysis for the Sales COE
Here’s What You’ll Need:

Established or advanced experience in analytics development or business analysis or data transformation roles including experience with BI platforms (Power BI, Tableau, etc.)
Strong business acumen in the engineering/consulting/solutions industry
Microsoft Excel Expertise
Technical skills in a variety of systems or processes, which could include Microsoft SharePoint, Teams, and other O365 applications; HTML; and data analytics/visualization products
Demonstrated experience in working in analytics, and passion for bringing data to life for our internal clients
Ability to manipulate large datasets to build insightful visualizations for complex problems and present engaging and intuitive analytics (dashboards, reports)
Effective and professional written and verbal communication style; capable of adapting that style to a wide variety of sales staff and stakeholders with various levels of seniority
Orientation to and focus on details with a commitment to excellence
Proficient at data visualization, BI tools, Excel
Project management skills
Ideally, you’ll also have:
Project Controls experience
Exposure to & understanding of data transformation manipulation
Some knowledge of artificial intelligence/machine learning concepts
Experience with Salesforce
Understanding of sensitive content, data security designations and protocols
Facilitation and influencing skills
Creative and engaging approach to developing UI/UX (user interface/user experience)
Understanding or experience in programming languages
Understanding of database architecture concepts

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding, or medical conditions related to pregnancy, childbirth, or breastfeeding), age, medical condition, marital or domestic partner status, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression and transgender status, mental disability or physical disability, genetic information, military or veteran status, citizenship, low-income status or any other status or characteristic protected by applicable law. Learn more about your rights under Federal EEO laws and supplemental language.
At Jacobs, we’re challenging today to reinvent tomorrow by solving the world’s most critical problems for thriving cities, resilient environments, mission-critical outcomes, operational advancement, scientific discovery and cutting-edge manufacturing, turning abstract ideas into realities that transform the world for good. With $13 billion in revenue and a talent force of more than 55,000, Jacobs provides a full spectrum of professional services including consulting, technical, scientific and project delivery for the government and private sector.

Responsibilities
Gift Card Business Analyst


About Us:
The Gift Card group is a fast-growing multi-channel/multi-million dollar business in the Fandango portfolio, encompassing an assortment of products and responsible for a large portion of Fandango’s overall incoming revenue and consumer acquisition. The Gift Card team is responsible for strategy, marketing, sales, growth, creation and enhancement of our products sold through physical & digital retailers, D2C and B2B. Our product lines include both our own O&O brands (Fandango, Vudu, MovieTickets.com) as well as bundled partnerships, thus providing our consumers with an assortment of entertainment gifting solutions.

This is an exciting opportunity for a high-performing, fast-moving, innovative and strategic marketer to join our Gift Card Team. The Gift Card Business Analyst will be responsible for thorough tracking and analysis of Gift Card products in all three channels (retail, B2B, D2C) with the emphasis on retail marketing and analysis. Position will also be responsible for directing production and card implementation at Retail & B2B. Goals include driving new customer acquisition & retention, consumer engagement, cross channel optimization and leverage of studio/content IP. You will partner with internal divisions such as finance, business development, product management, design, marketing, finance and legal as well as across other teams within the NBCU/Comcast/Peacock Family.

We are looking for an individual who is motivated, brings enthusiasm for the customer, passionate about the entertainment industry and experience in managing multiple projects simultaneously. Proven analytical thinking and passion for data is essential - you should be fluent in analyzing both business performance and marketing metrics, have strong project management skills, attention to detail, and exceptional collaboration skills. You should be a self-starter and effective communicator, able to think strategically and execute at a high level. The individual should demonstrate strong business judgment, have a strong track record of relationship management, has a passion for experimentation, is a problem-solver and thought leader. Experience with digital, retail marketing and consumer products is ideal.

Core job responsibilities include:
Analysis of all proposed Retail/B2B/D2C promotional campaigns, recommending based on ROI/Strategy/Sales performance
Marketing directives/recommendations for best practices
Provide analysis reports, performance recaps and financial updates across all Channels
Own invoice management across the business and with state holders, liaison with Finance
Own budget tracking across the business
Track monthly sales and all promotional sales across the business
Analysis and directive for production and inventory placement of product and specific denomination
Production and inventory management, direct the order process & inventory control
Recommend and direct creative execution of brand/card art
Qualifications/Requirements
Bachelor’s Degree in Marketing , Data Analytics or related field or equivalent experience3-5+ years of experience designing, developing, testing, and implementing high-performance, scalable, and secure business intelligence and analytic solutions in a high-volume environmentExperience performing high level data analysis; needs to have a general understanding of databases and structures and must enjoy working with dataAbility to multi-task, problem-solve and communicate in a challenging, fast-paced environmentHighly organized, strong attention to detail and outstanding time management skills
Desired Characteristics
Strategic thinking and creative problem solvingProven ability to analyze data for decision making by teamStrong interpersonal & communication skills to drive alignment across the team and organizationAbility to interpret data and concisely communicate findings through presentations to senior levelsAdvanced knowledge of Excel, spreadsheets and Tableau (or other reporting systems)Consumer Products experience a plus

The Business Insight Analyst reports to the Vice President of Online Education and is responsible for supporting the management, reporting, budgeting, and business analysis needs within Champlain College Online (CCO). The Analyst will leverage data acquisition, manipulation, analysis, visualization, and storytelling skills to provide clear reporting insights and recommendations. As an inquisitive, independent, and detail-oriented contributor, the Analyst works with CCO leaders and strategic campus partners to create and link data structures, glean insights, and present data in understandable ways to ensure the division is closing data gaps and making data-driven decisions at every turn.
Primary Responsibilities
Develop, analyze, and report on budgets for the division
Develop quarterly projections for current fiscal year and prepare weekly, monthly, and quarterly management reports for the VP, President, and Board of Trustees
Develop new budgets and projections - both expenses and revenue- for upcoming fiscal years and for the 2030 financial model
Build predictive revenue models using historical data and current trends to drive strategic decisions within the unit
Responsible for monitoring, forecasting, and creating revenue growth strategies as outlined in the 2030 strategic plan
Create projections and report out Inquiry through Student data
Develop a working knowledge of various data sources and systems and the ability to extract data from these sources and combine for analysis
Develop enrollment projections based on historical data and current data trends
Identify KPIs and create and maintain reports that assess and explain ongoing performance
Ensure data quality for Inquiry through Student data
Ensure proper data collection and quality across the enrollment funnel
Resolve duplicate person or organization records
Secondary Responsibilities
Take ownership of requests for new data, identify potential data needs for Inquiry through Student data
Prepare mailing lists required by Marketing and other collaborators
Work with IS and key stakeholders to ensure proper collection and reporting of new data
Test system integrations to ensure data is moving properly between systems
Assist CCO report users in generating appropriate reports for data needs
Assist admission operations with process improvement strategies

Requirements:
Minimum of 5 years of experience in business intelligence, data analysis, forecasting, and/or budget analysis - ideally some experience/exposure to all of these areas
Proficiency in MS Excel, Tableau, and/or Power BI
Experience using a Customer Relationship Management (CRM), preferably Salesforce
Experience with relational databases like SQL and reporting tools like Datatel Informer
Working knowledge of data lakes and warehouses
Superior critical thinking skills and strong attention to detail
Demonstrated self-starter with the motivation, agility, and ability to see projects to completion
Ability to work independently and as part of a team
Excellent written, verbal, and interpersonal communication skills
Strong organizational and time management skills with exceptional attention to detail
Ability to adapt and remain flexible in a fast-paced, changing environment

TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity, celebrate individuality and bring people together. TikTok has global offices including Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Mumbai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul and Tokyo.

Passionate about social media and short video products

Job Title: Business/Operational Analyst
Department: Finance
Company: Dimension Development
Reports To: Assistant CFO
Supervises: N/A

Job Purpose: Thoroughly analyzes financial and operational key performance metrics and clearly communicates findings to stakeholders.

Job Responsibilities:
1. Use proprietary software (Dimension Development Hotel Accounting Program) as well as external sources to identify, generate, gather, verify, review, research, analyze, comprehend, interpret, and report on key performance indicators and financial information.
2. Analyze variances and data trends and prepare reports, charts and other outputs as required. To convert information into insightful findings and actionable recommendations to optimize existing and future operations across the company.
3. Provide high-quality recurring and ad-hoc performance reports to assist senior management with operational decisions, as required.
4. Assist the Assistant CFO with the development and maintenance of various analytical models.
5. Prepare a monthly reporting package that includes financial, operational, competitive, and customer satisfaction metrics. To analyze key business trends.
6. Work closely with all regional and property leaders to identify areas of improvement. To support and contribute expertise to projects relating to the achievement of property financial, guest service, and operational goals.
7. Assist hotel leadership with the actual implementation of new processes.
8. Assist with the preparation of annual budgets. To consolidate budget data from business unit leaders, evaluate data received and follow up directly with budget holders as appropriate. Ensure that all budgets are accurate, comprehensive and completed on time.
9. Serve as a super user of business intelligence tools (such as Broadvine and MicroStrategy) in the creation of dashboards and reports.
10. Research and evaluate different analysis tools, business intelligence tools, and modeling techniques to identify possible opportunities for process improvement.
11. Other duties as assigned.

Job Skills:
1. Track record of problem solving complex issues and continuous process improvement skills.
2. Advanced Microsoft Excel skills are required, and will be tested, including pivot tables and advanced formulas. Must be proficient in Microsoft Office.
3. To maintain a thorough understanding of financial and operational metrics across the industry.
4. Ability to work proactively, independently and as a strategic partner in a cross-functional team environment. To establish and maintain cooperative working relationships with fellow team members, management, external contacts, guests, and the public. Demonstrated ability to manage conflict/resolution.
5. Demonstrated strong analytical skills. To define and analyze problems and identify root causes. To set challenging and productive goals; prioritizing tasks, accepting responsibility, and overcoming obstacles.
6. To work successfully in a dynamic, fast-paced setting, and effectively manage multiple priorities within a broad team of cross-regional and cross-functional members. To perform a variety of duties, often changing from one task to another of a different nature, with frequent interruptions and distractions. To adapt to frequent changes in the workload and be able to adjust priorities quickly as circumstances dictate while completing tasks within established timeframes.
7. To thrive in an environment that is both strategic and creative, and which requires rapid learning, multitasking and prioritizing under tight deadlines
8. To remain highly-driven and self-motivated. To remain positive, productive, and professional in high stress situations.
9. To maintain a high level of accuracy and attention to detail at all times. To be well-organized and detail-oriented in order to manage multiple tasks, deadlines, and expectations simultaneously.
10. To sustain a high level of confidentiality.
11. To demonstrate partnering, influencing, and communication skills at all levels of the organization.
12. To maintain excellent written and verbal communication and comprehension skills, including the ability to clearly explain complex analytical topics to a wide audience who may or may not be familiar with analytics or the subject matter.
13. Other duties as assigned.

We develop energy management strategies that help customers buy, manage, and consume energy. Our retail unit is among the largest and most comprehensive in the industry. Our wholesale business serves utilities, municipalities and co-ops and features world-class risk management and energy trading capabilities.
PRIMARY PURPOSE OF POSITION
The Generation Strategy group is seeking a Senior Analyst to join our Business Performance & Analytics team in support of Constellation's retail business. The position will work closely with various parts of the organization including Sales, Operations, Credit, and Financial Planning & Analysis (FP&A) and will be responsible for measuring business performance and advising retail C&I power and gas sales leadership on strategies to increase profits and productivity. This position will also be IT liaison for the team.
PRIMARY DUTIES AND ACCOUNTABILITIES
Develop and maintain the tools and logic used by the team in the various IT Systems and act as the point person for all IT related issues supporting Retail C&I Gas business.
Identify areas where data is inadequate (either missing or poor Quality).
Development of new PowerBI reports and Dashboards to enhance Sales understanding of the business.
Use of Quantitative and Qualitative Analytics to solve business problems.
*Primary location is DePere, WI but we will also consider candidates for Baltimore, MD.*

Qualifications
POSITION SPECIFICATIONS QUALIFICATION

Strong SQL skills to implement complex business rules within reporting and good understanding of backend system designs and Database management Skills.

Self-Starter with ability to identify issues and opportunities within the business and develop relevant and impactful analysis.
Ability to work independently and manage multiple deadlines.

Proven written and oral communication skills to translate analysis into key messages, develop the story behind the insights and findings, and present it to wide variety of audiences from sales support to executive leadership.

3-4 yrs. of industry experience.

EEO is the Law Poster

Mission Lane LLC is a fintech on a mission (no pun intended) to increase access to financial tools that help people thrive. We are raising the bar on fair credit access, easy money management, and convenient income discovery. Our philosophy is simple: when our customers do well, we do well. And we have only just begun.
Mission Lane's Credit and Revenue Strategy Team is looking for a Senior Business Analyst to join our geographically diverse team. We have offices in Richmond, VA and San Francisco, CA, but are open to considering remote candidates.

The Impact You'll Make in this Role:

At Mission Lane, our analysts work on business problems that touch all facets of the business and have the opportunity to work on different teams within the organization as their careers develop. Your first role would be on the credit and revenue strategy team. This team is responsible for driving product strategy, managing overall lending profitability, all while staying true to our mission. You will be expected to use data driven analytics to optimize how we acquire, manage, and value customers.

As a Senior Analyst, you will:

Drive immediate ROI:
Take the lead in initiatives like expanding our products onto new channels, improving targeting & underwriting, building world-class customer experience and identifying & cutting off fraudsters
Optimize current acquisition and account management strategies in response to customer behavior and changing marketplace conditions
Enable long-term growth:
Push forward our testing agenda to build insights into consumer behavior and invest in future growth
Analyze customer data to develop our next generation of product, lending, fraud, and collections / recoveries strategies
Develop your own career:
Be a part of a well-funded fintech with a track record of achieving high growth goals
Work cross-functionally on initiatives with c-suite visibility alongside product, data science, and account management teams
Learn by doing – have the opportunity to rotate into analytical roles across the business (e.g. on Growth, Credit, Fraud and Collections & Recoveries)

To set you up for success in this role from day one, Mission Lane is Looking for candidates who have:

Proven ability to problem solve end-to-end: from framing the question and forming a hypothesis, to analyzing the data, to communicating and debating the answer with other stakeholders
Familiarity with SQL, python, or other tools for data analysis
2-5 years of experience in a highly analytical role
Bachelor's or Masters in Economics, Finance, Engineering, Mathematics, or similar quantitative field with record of strong academic performance

Bonus points for:

Experience doing analytical work with credit cards or other consumer lending products
Experience helping scale a business in a fast-paced startup environment
Expertise in SQL or Python

More about Mission Lane:

Mission Lane is based in the U.S., with offices in Richmond, Virginia & San Francisco, California. Founded in December 2018, we've rapidly grown to over 1 million customers.

It all started with a realization: nearly fifty percent of the adult population in the U.S. doesn't have access to a clear line of credit. And by "clear" we mean credit without crazy fees that only increase debt. Most traditional credit card companies either overlook or overcharge this group because they have less-than-prime credit scores or no score at all. We decided this just wouldn't do.

We understand that everyone doesn't have the same opportunities. We also know that everyone joins us at different stages of their financial journeys. Providing access to clear credit was a critical first step, but our work isn't done. We are actively developing new products designed to meet our customers where they are, according to their needs.

We get it - life happens. That's why Mission Lane is hard at work paving a better way forward.

Just like for our customers, Mission Lane creates opportunities for our employees to learn, grow, and prosper. We strive to create an environment that brings out the best in everyone, everyday.

******

About Press Ganey:

Press Ganey pioneered the health care performance improvement movement 35 years ago. Today Press Ganey offers an integrated suite of solutions that enable enterprise transformation across the patient journey. Delivered through a cutting-edge digital platform built on a foundation of data security, Press Ganey solutions address safety, clinical excellence, patient experience, and workforce engagement. The company works with more than 41,000 health care facilities in its mission to reduce patient suffering and enhance caregiver resilience to improve the overall safety, quality, and experience of care.


Position Description/Overview:
Research, analyze, and document tier two support issues experienced by our internal and external customers using our .NET applications, SQL Server Reporting Services reports, and SQL Server Integration Services projects. Delivery and maintenance of documentation and standard operating procedures that are associated with our internal processes and .NET applications.

This position requires exceptional communication skills, strong attention to detail, a flexible customer service attitude, and the ability to work effectively in a fast-paced environment.

This position will report to the Product Support Manager for the Population EngageTM division of SPH Analytics.
Duties & Responsibilities:

Exploring and examining data from disparate source when issues or questions are submitted to the product support queue.

Use Transact-SQL (T-SQL) to assist with performing data analysis and troubleshooting.

Write queries to fetch data from relational and non-relational databases for various requests from internal customers.

Meet with internal customers to discuss, formalize, and document functional requirements for enhancement requests.

Assist internal customers with day to day questions regarding application functionality in the production environment.
Drive insights and outcomes for both time-sensitive and long-term business questions.

Qualifications:

BS/BA in a mathematical, scientific, or technical field, or equivalent experience preferred.

5+ years of experience as a data analyst or comparable position.

Knowledge of Microsoft SQL Server databases and Transact-SQL (T-SQL).

Knowledge of various reporting tools such as SSRS, Crystal, etc.

Technical writing experience

Experience working with Microsoft Excel (formulas, VBA macros, pivot tables, graphs, etc. would be beneficial).

Experience working with Microsoft Access including creating queries, import and exporting data from SQL, etc.

Experience with/knowledge of inspecting, cleansing, and transforming small to large volumes of data.

Experience training individuals from various levels within a company.

Healthcare domain experience is a plus, but it’s not required. We can teach you everything you need to know.

Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.

Ability to diagnose and troubleshoot problems with limited information, e.g. the presentation layer is throwing an exception.

Strong time-management skills and desire to learn new applications, technologies, and domains.

Self-motivated team player with good interpersonal skills.

Strong verbal and written communication skills.

Harvard Medical School Information Systems seeks a Business Systems Analyst professional skilled in user-centered design, development, data analysis, reporting, testing, and support.

The position will participate in the full software development lifecycle (SDLC) from project inception through ongoing production support, including data analysis, testing, and training.
The position will require experience with desktop, mobile, or web-based software applications and relational databases with a service delivery approach. Familiarity with Peoplesoft Campus Solutions, Oracle Business Intelligence Enterprise Suite/Oracle Analytics, or Filemaker will be a plus.
The ideal candidate will be energized by solving problems in new and innovative ways. Work at a high level within a team on most phases of service analysis and consider the business implications of technology applications to the current and future business environment

Job Title: Sr. Analyst, Direct-to-Consumer Insights & Data Visualizatio...
Description:
Direct-to-Consumer is a key priority for GOLF with fast moving and aggressive growth goals. This role is integral to the GolfPass team.


The Sr. Analyst, Direct-to-Consumer Insights & Data Visualization will assist the DTC team in understanding members' and non-members' behavior through quantitative and qualitative methods. This role will help in creating meaningful stories with data in order to drive innovation throughout the entire product experience.

Your mission is to creatively and proactively translate a wealth of data into insights to better understand how to attract, convert and continually create a delightful experience for GolfPass members.


You’ll use methods from statistics, and quantitative social science to extract meaningful patterns from large datasets, surveys, GolfPass member transactional and engagement data, and other sources.


You’ll partner with a talented team of Engineers and Data Scientists working to improve our product and generate world-class insights to help them and our business better serve potential and current GolfPass members.

Job Duties
Support the GolfPass Acquisition, Retention, and Engagement teams by creating data-driven analysis and dashboards to support the strategic planning of each team with the goal of optimizing efforts and maximizing member LTV.
Utilize a combination of SQL and reporting tools like Tableau to design and build dashboards and produce reports summarizing Key Performance Indicators
Conduct ad hoc analyses as needed to deliver insights into non-member and member behaviors, interaction, and engagement with the product
Develop and enhance automated dashboards to provide visibility into performance of GolfPass for key stakeholders and presentations for leadership.
Leverage cross-functional skills by working with survey data and with our data science and engineering teams to develop and deliver impactful insight
Responsible for partnering with appropriate stakeholders to measure all aspects and deliver actionable insights and analysis for teams to iterate and improve member acquisition and retention campaigns through various channels such as: email, mobile, display, TV, CTV, and other marketing channels.
Qualifications/Requirements
Basic Qualifications

BA degree in Finance, Statistics, Operations Research, Decision Sciences, Management Science or a related field

2+ years of relevant analyst experience, preferably working in an e-commerce or other commerce-driven environment

Strong critical thinking, problem-solving skills, and ability to work through complex problems.

Advanced skills in Excel and in reporting tools like SQL, R, Business Objects, Tableau, etc. preferred

Experience with visual analytics, dashboard design best practices, and research questionnaire development preferred
Additional Job Requirements

Interested candidate must submit a resume/CV through www.nbcunicareers.com to be considered (note job #: 65667BR)
Desired Characteristics
Desired Qualifications

Experience working within the e-commerce and subscription business

Experience in a programming language commonly used for data manipulation and computational statistics (such as R, Python) and ability to work pragmatically with statistical concepts

Project management skills

Open to Remote and preferred location is Orlando, FL

About Us
NBC Sports Next is where sports and technology intersect. We’re a subdivision of NBC Sports and home to all NBCUniversal digital applications in sports and technology within our three groups: Youth & Recreational Sports; Golf; and Betting, Gaming & Emerging Media.


At NBC Sports Next, we make playing sports better through innovative technology and immersive experiences for athletes, coaches, players and fans. We equip more than 30MM players, coaches, athletes, sports administrators and fans in 40 countries with more than 25 sports solution products, including SportsEngine, the largest youth sports club, league and team management platform; GolfNow, the leading online tee time marketplace and provider of golf course operations technology; GolfPass the ultimate golf membership that connects golfers to exclusive content, tee time credits, and coaching, tips; TeamUnify, swim team management services; GoMotion, sports and fitness business software solutions; and NBC Sports Edge, a leading platform for fantasy sports information and betting-focused tools.


At NBC Sports Next we’re fueled by our mission to innovate, create larger-than-life events and connect with sports fans through technology that provides the ultimate in immersive experiences.


Come join us as we work together as one team to innovate and deliver what’s Next.

Job Description:
Pacific Life is investing in bright, agile, and diverse talent to contribute to our mission of innovating our business and creating a superior customer experience. We’re actively seeking a talented Data Analyst to join our Life Reinsurance team in Aliso Viejo, CA. This role can be on-site or 100% remote. This is a part-time role with the expectation of 16-24 hours per week with a flexible but consistent schedule.

As an Entry Level Data Analyst, you’ll play a key role in Pacific Life’s growth and long-term success by introducing innovative solutions to resolve and/or improve existing business processes and reporting functions. You will fill an existing role that sits on a team of 5 people in the Life Insurance division. You'll work closely with data analysts, actuaries, financial reporting, and Reinsurance Operations professionals. We strive to be a fully cross-functional team so you'll continue to grow and learn new skills.

How you will make an impact:
Develop and provide timely, relevant, and accurate reporting & analysis to facilitate decision-making for various levels of management throughout the organization.

Work with various stakeholders and IT to determine and recommend best practices for data storage and usage.

Troubleshoot issues related to applications, data, structures, and business processes.

Communicate data issues to the appropriate stakeholders in order to evaluate any potential business impacts.

Use best practices and knowledge of internal or external business issues to identify, recommend and improve existing business processes/issues.

Develop solutions to problems, requiring the regular use of ingenuity and creativity, within the larger context of the business needs and objectives.

Seek out and increase knowledge of systems, products, and the business and provide recommendations, as needed.

Proactively engage in knowledge sharing, cross-training, and documentation of processes.

Continually evaluate existing manual business processes to identify any potential automation opportunities and implement, as needed.

The experience you will bring:
Bachelors’ Degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Economics preferred

Intermediate knowledge of Excel, Alteryx, Tableau or QlikView

Experience with metrics gathering, tracking and reporting

What will make you stand out:
Intermediate knowledge of SQL, Python and/or R

Strong communication skills; both written and verbal

2+ years of experience manipulating and formatting large data sets

Some background in insurance/financial institution

More reasons to join:
At Pacific Life, the work we do matters. We work passionately each day to drive our company forward while enjoying job security, flexible scheduling, and great opportunities for career growth.

If you’re seeking a thriving career doing the type of meaningful work that’s all too rare at a Fortune 500 Company, Pacific Life is the place for you. If you are a self-starter who appreciates creativity and individuality in your colleagues – even better. We look forward to receiving your application.

You belong at Pacific Life

At Pacific Life we believe you belong. We foster a culture of belonging, a space where all employees are empowered to be authentic. We embrace and celebrate diversity, create a culture of equity and inclusion, and value and respect every employee.

Our workplace

In 2020, we demonstrated agility and swiftly shifted to a working-from-home environment with little to no disruption. Going forward, we will move toward a hybrid, digital-first workplace that encompasses flexible work policies, inclusive space design, and innovative technology solutions. At Pacific Life, we are pioneering a trail and challenging the status quo to build the next normal.

Want to learn more about life at Pacific Life? Take an inside look at our company culture: Instagram.com/lifeatpacificlife.
