Company Name: UT Health Science Center at San Antonio
Description:
Job Summary:
Under direct supervision, the Clinical Business Intelligence Analyst will champion and support the ongoing development and advancement of diverse BI/Data Analytics pursuits focused on data warehousing, data mining, data structuring, advanced visualization, and related technologies in furthering the missions of UT Health San Antonio. The Clinical Business Intelligence Analyst will provide first-tier support to counterparts from other application disciplines and end-users to successfully meet the development and implementation objectives for assigned applications.
Job Duties:
Gather and analyze business requirements to perform data modeling and mapping across multiple platforms for enterprise-wide BI initiatives
Apply research and evaluation standards, descriptive statistics, and data management principles to translate complex data into meaningful content.
Extract, load, and transform data from transactional software systems into analytical software/BI systems.
Design, create, test, and maintain a portfolio of reports, scorecards, and dashboards.
Role activities include problem analysis, break/fix, design/modeling, implementation/coding, and testing.
Responsible for navigating a wealth of data and turning it into actionable and insightful information.
Work autonomously and collaboratively with other team members and cross-functionally, guiding to define report requirements and validate results.
Develop and maintain appropriate documentation on all work products. Consult with business customers using analytical & reporting tools to develop effective clinical, cost, quality & satisfaction outcomes.
Other duties as assigned.

Education:
A Bachelor's Degree in a scientific, technical, healthcare informatics, mathematics, or a related field is preferred. Experience in place of education can be considered.

Experience:
Prior relevant experience in data analytics, data science, data warehousing, data lakes and marts, metadata management, and dimensional modeling is preferred.
Prior experience in a healthcare environment is preferred.
Must possess demonstrated critical and analytical thinking proficiencies and troubleshooting competencies.
Demonstrate the ability to understand troubleshoot software issues
Organizational management skills and knowledge to multitask
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Proficiency with sophisticated analytics tools and programming languages (SAS, R, Python, Java, Spark, Hadoop, Alteryx, SQL); proficiency with data visualization tools (Tableau, QlikView, and others) strongly preferred.

Certifications:
Certified in Tableau, Epic Cogito Data Warehouse & Caboodle Data Model preferred.
The ability to become Epic certified for assigned modules within eighteen (18) months of hire is required per Epic Corporation standards.
The ability to obtain additional certifications for assigned software analytical tools (such as Tableau or Power BI) within thirty-six (36) months of hire is required per Health-IT department standards.

ABOUT THE JOB (JOB BRIEF)
KeyBank is looking for a talented, analytical, highly motivated, and results-driven professional to join its Enterprise Business analytics team. This team aims to bring industry expertise and an analytical mindset in an integrated package to our Line of Business partners, both to drive immediate value and to build a data-drive analytical culture for other teams to model after.
The Senior Business Analytics Associate is primarily responsible the formulation of hypotheses, translation of data, design/measurement of experiments and generation of insights to inform business decisions by using various data mining techniques. The Senior Business Analytics Associate uses data to perform more complex diagnostic analyses to provide answers to questions such as “Why did it happen?” and “What action can I take?” Through the use of cross-functional reporting and execution of complex analyses, mapping out processes and applying necessary controls, the Senior Business Analytics Associate identifies trends and outliers and suggest solutions to resolve business challenges or implement process improvements. Success criteria include: leveraging business acumen, critical thinking, industry knowledge, trends, and anticipation of business need to inform analyses and recommendations; leading conversations with business partners and effectively communicate with all stakeholders; and providing solutions based on an understanding of impacts / intersections with other business partners and lines of business.
If you are excited about the opportunity to build experience across a variety of financial products within a world-class organization; comfortable gathering and analyzing information, formulating and testing hypotheses, and developing and communicating recommendations, then this role could be ideal for you.
ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS
Leverage critical thinking and business acumen to develop insights, deliver analysis, and provide solutions to increasingly more complex business problems
Develop and deliver presentations that include the right data and “tells the right story” to business partners
Effectively communicate key points to respective stakeholders, with the right amount of detail Identify and anticipate business need, understand how to obtain information
Make process improvement suggestions
Review work product of junior staff; provide input, direction, and mentorship
Lead conversations with business partners
REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS
Master’s degree in Analytics, Computer Science, Economics, Finance, Financial Mathematics, Statistics, or the Natural Sciences and 3 years of relevant experience; or Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Economics, Finance, Financial Mathematics, Statistics, or the Natural Sciences and 5 years of relevant experience
Proficient with:
Analytical programming languages (Python / SAS)
Query writing/coding including complex joins
Data visualization
Microsoft Excel / PowerPoint
Knowledge of:
Source systems
Process flow
Skill & ability to:
Work with big data
Navigate data warehouse and/or data supply chain

Collins Aerospace is looking for an Operations Business Analyst to help the business identify strategic projects that meet the company’s goals and objectives. You will be involved with modeling and analyzing manufacturing sourcing decisions, operations restructuring opportunities, potential acquisitions and divestitures and external strategic partnerships. You will have direct contact and communication with leadership and be given the opportunity to present directly to senior leadership your findings and recommendations.
The position is currently working remote, will be transitioned to a hybrid role with some onsite requirements when circumstances permit in 2022.
Primary Responsibilities
Perform business case modeling for part transitions (make to buy, buy to make, make to make) capturing the cost of the transition and the future cost savings if applicable
Support annual Strategic Plan initiatives with discounted cash flow modeling to identify projects with best financial results to the business
Support transition managers by assisting with business case evaluations and ensuring all business cases follow standard process for analysis
Communicate financial modeling results and recommendations to senior leadership
Lead effort to setup and establish standard data collection tools in Excel to capture key facility and operations information
Perform internet-based research and data gathering to support key initiatives
Track and report monthly departmental budget/spending
Help gather and coordinate data related to strategic projects
Basic Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree and 2 years of prior relevant experience OR
In absence of a degree, 6 years of relevant experience is required
Must be a U.S. Citizen
MS Office knowledge
Understanding of key business financial terms and tools including – NPV, IRR, Cost of Capital, Cash Flow, Profit & Loss
Understanding of supply-chain and manufacturing concepts
Knowledge of ERP system
Able to communicate and present results to senior level leadership
Ability to work independently and with minimal supervision
Able to travel up to 10% domestically / internationally when circumstances permit
Preferred Qualifications
Financial modeling experience
MS Excel-Pivot Tables and MS PowerPoint-creating presentations
Manufacturing environment experience
SAP experience
Collins Aerospace, a Raytheon Technologies company, is a leader in technologically advanced and intelligent solutions for the global aerospace and defense industry. Collins Aerospace has the capabilities, comprehensive portfolio and expertise to solve customers’ toughest challenges and to meet the demands of a rapidly evolving global market.
Collins Aerospace’s Aerostructures business is a world leader in the design, manufacture, integration and support of nacelles - the aerodynamic structures which house aircraft engines. Our nacelle technologies improve fuel efficiency, reduce engine noise and supply critical stopping power when an airplane lands. Today, our innovative nacelle systems are featured on many of the world’s newest and most game-changing commercial, regional and business jet platforms. And we’re not stopping there: we’re working hard to create the next generation of nacelles that are greener, quieter and more efficient. In addition, our Engineered Polymer Products division is a leading developer and manufacturer of advanced, high-performance composite and elastomeric structures and products for marine applications. Whether in the air or underwater, we’re pushing the limits of innovation. Want to join us on this important journey?
Diversity drives innovation; inclusion drives success. We believe a multitude of approaches and ideas enable us to deliver the best results for our workforce, workplace, and customers. We are committed to fostering a culture where all employees can share their passions and ideas so we can tackle the toughest challenges in our industry and pave new paths to limitless possibility.

Sharethrough is disrupting the legacy digital advertising supply chain as the first ad exchange to auto-enhance every standard impression by rendering a higher-performing ad that dynamically fits into any placement on any site. Our technology and approach enables advertisers to see substantial campaign performance improvements and cost savings using the same standard video and display creative as well as the buying workflow they use with standard exchanges. The Sharethrough Exchange (STX) powers over 225 billion monthly impressions and is integrated with more than 30 of the world's largest demand side platforms, enabling buyers to efficiently achieve their marketing objectives at scale.

As part of the Business Intelligence and Analytics team, you will transform data into insights that will help drive the business forward. Working with key stakeholders across the company, you will also identify trends, monitor data integrity, and provide valuable insights so they can confidently make decisions. JOB SUMMARY
The purpose of this position is to provide complex research, data mining/analysis, reporting and interpretation of global, national, regional, local and/or account company performance metrics.
The Senior Business Analyst position for the CBRE Business Analytics group acts as a project manager and technical lead for business intelligence projects focused on real estate data analyses for CBRE’s clients. Through data warehousing, visualization, and examination, this position helps our clients optimize their operations across all service lines: facilities management, project management, finance, portfolio administration, cost forecasting, etc.
A senior analyst works closely with our clients and database technical team to automate data collection from source operational systems, aggregate and standardize the information in a data warehouse, and develop Tableau dashboards that leverage the warehouse to generate meaningful client insights.
Additionally, the CBRE Business Analytics group helps our clients develop budgets, benchmark facility operating costs, and predict upcoming capital requirements. A senior analyst leads projects to collect the requisite client real estate data, build and refine cost models using CBRE tools, and present a meaningful financial story in formal reports and briefings.
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Perform both technical lead and project manager responsibilities for business intelligence and facility cost analyses projects for a variety of corporate and government clients.
Create, maintain and optimize creative data visualizations and dashboards (primarily in Tableau) to derive actionable intelligence.
Aggregation and analysis of quantitative data; forecast and trending of performance data.
Process mapping and efficiency analysis.
Lead on problem solving team that develops recommendations based on data interpretations.
Provide subject matter expertise on data-related processes and analyses.
Collect key financial and real estate portfolio data from clients for inclusion in cost models.
Develop and refine facility cost models for operating and maintain a real estate portfolio using CBRE proprietary software and other analytical tools.
Prepare formal written reports describing project methodology, scope, key assumptions, and results.
Present progress and results to clients (both in-person and virtually) and collects feedback for revisions.
Miscellaneous technical support for marketing materials, and data support for CBRE software systems.
SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES
No formal supervisory responsibilities in this position. Provides informal assistance such as technical guidance and/or training to coworkers. May lead project teams plan and supervise assignments of lower level employees.

QUALIFICATIONS
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required.


Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

EDUCATION and EXPERIENCE
Bachelor's degree (BA/BS) from 4-year college or university required. Master's degree preferred. Minimum of 5 years of related experience and/or training.

COMMUNICATION SKILLS
Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Strong organizational and analytical skills. Ability to provide efficient, timely, reliable and courteous service to customers. Ability to effectively present information.

DATA MANAGEMENT AND ANALYTICS
Excellent data management, manipulation and analysis skills. Ability to create integrated data models from disparate sources. Understanding of relational databases. Highly skilled in dashboard design and development. Proficiency in database technologies.
FINANCIAL KNOWLEDGE
Requires advanced knowledge of financial terms and principles. Ability to calculate intermediate figures such as percentages, discounts and commissions. Conducts advanced financial analysis.

REASONING ABILITY
Ability to comprehend, analyze, and interpret complex documents. Ability to solve problems involving several options in situations. Requires advanced analytical and quantitative skills.

OTHER SKILLS and ABILITIES
Advance experience in MS Office Products (Excel, Access, Power Point, Word, etc). Ability to use query and report generation tools. Self-service/web based application experience desired.
Tableau or PowerBI experience required.

SCOPE OF RESPONSIBILITY
Decisions made with thorough understanding of procedures, company policies, and business practices to achieve general results and deadlines. Responsible for setting work unit and/or project deadlines. Errors in judgment may cause short-term impact to department.

Job Title: Data Science Analyst - Microsoft Business Intelligence
Description:
Data Scientist, Predictive Modeling and Analytics
Nashville, TN – Direct Hire – 125K+


QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor’s Degree in Information Technology, Mathematics, or Statistics. Master’s Degree in Business or Data Science is preferred.
Minimum seven (7) years of experience in a business environment.
Minimum five (5) years of professional hands-on experience with reporting, predictive analytics and statistical modeling, data mining, and data visualization.
Minimum five (5) years of experience working with business units to assess data needs and to develop & implement strategies and tactics to improve data-driven decision making.
Working knowledge of IT systems, database structures, data relationships and programming environments. Database query languages; SQL helpful.
Strong Microsoft technology background including SQL Server, SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS), SQL Server Analysis Services (SSAS), Power BI, Azure.

Python scripting experience is important in this role and required.
Can display data visually, designing powerful dashboard and presentation mock-ups which effectively organize information and demonstrate the value of analytic deliverables.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.


RESPONSIBILITIES

The Data Scientist – Predictive Modeling & Analytics, supports data-informed decision making through validation of business data and participation in its collection and maintenance, through data mining, and through delivering predictive analytics solutions. Building collaborative relationships with leadership, internal stakeholders, and business partners, this position works to understand business needs and objectives, identifying opportunities for deep-dive analyses to drive tangible business results. The position is responsible for the predictive modeling strategy and for building models that will lead to better understanding of the influences on the end-to-end customer experience including touchpoints, behaviors, drivers, and preferences, and for presenting this data in a clear and compelling way to communicate insights and influence strategic and tactical decisions. The position also has secondary responsibility for developing and maintaining interactive reporting.

Must communicate effectively both verbally and in writing; work outcomes must meet and / or exceed productivity and quality standards. Must be able to work as part of a cooperative team environment and independent of direct supervision; adhere to Company and Department policies and procedures, including regular and predictable attendance.

About the USC Annenberg Norman Lear Center:
Founded in 2000, The Norman Lear Center is a nonpartisan research center whose mission is to study and shape the impact of entertainment and media on society. Its areas of interest include TV, movies and music; sports, politics and journalism; public health, public diplomacy and civic engagement. Its funders have included major foundations, government agencies and pro-social organizations. From its base at the USC Annenberg School, it has developed partnerships with 11 other schools at USC, as well as with academic institutions, centers of research and innovation, and content creators around the nation and the world. The Center is named for legendary TV and film writer, producer and director Norman Lear in appreciation of his extraordinary philanthropic generosity, as well as in tribute to the socially conscious entertainment he pioneered.

Overview:

WHAT ARE WE LOOKING FOR?
TDS is excited to share a newly created opportunity for a Senior Business Intelligence (BI) Data Analyst. If you are naturally curious, have strong problem-solving skills and can drive for results, come join our team!
WHO IS TDS?
TDS is a diversified Fortune 1000® national technology and communications services company. TDS provides wireless products and services; cable and wireline broadband, TV and voice services; and hosted and managed amenities throughout the country via our U.S. Cellular, TDS Telecom, OneNeck IT Solutions and Suttle-Straus brands.
LOCATION
We are open to filling this position REMOTELY or once safe, in any of our physical office locations: Madison, WI; Chicago, IL; Eden Prairie, MN; Urbandale, IA; Omaha, NE; Knoxville, TN; Denver, CO or Scottsdale, AZ.
Responsibilities:

WHAT WILL THE SR. DATA ANALYST DO?
Conduct detailed data analysis, proactively and as planned, on data (corporate supported) used across business units to evaluate business processes and improve on/create new analytic and reporting features
Respond to data and product related inquiries in real-time to support business and technical teams
Perform various data analytics using established company toolsets, statistical models, or other approved industry accepted tools
Provide expertise and translate the business needs to design; and develop tools, techniques, and metrics, and dashboards for insights and data visualization
Provide expertise in data storytelling, leading mentoring sessions, and training.
Consult with users and stakeholders to provide advisory services in relation to analysis and data storytelling.

Qualifications:

WHAT SKILLS & EXPERIENCE DO YOU NEED?
Bachelor’s degree -OR- 4+ years equivalent experience
5+ years experience in a data analyst, financial analyst or similar position; preferably with experience working in report creation, modeling, and trend forecasting
2+ years related IT experience
2+ years experience using data sets to build predictive models (e.g., logistic regression, decision tree)
Proficiency with analytics, querying and visualization tools (i.e. Power BI, SPSS, SAS, SQL, or Tableau)
WHAT SETS US APART FROM OUR COMPETITION?
TDS has a strong set of values and behaviors that help foster a high-performance culture.
We believe in partnering with local communities throughout the country and encourage all employees to participate in volunteer opportunities
TDS was recognized by Madison Magazine as one of the “Best Places to Work”
We make employee development and training a top priority
TDS promotes a healthy life / work balance in a professional, yet casual work atmosphere that values diversity and strong business ethics
Flexible work culture, wellness programs, tuition reimbursement, certification support, continuing education and more!
#TDS offers a competitive salary and strong total rewards package. To learn more about this position, or our company, please visit tdsinc.com.

The DCM Business Analyst is an entry level position responsible for the overall administrative activities of the NAM DCM business. The Business Analyst may assist in activities such as the tracking of business financials, managing employee headcount or coordination of other administrative needs. May work on ad hoc projects as requested.
The business management team reports to the BCMA Global CAO and acts as a partner to senior leadership within the DCM product. The business management team coordinates and partners with a number of different functions across Citi including Risk, Finance, Operations, Compliance, Legal, Technology, Audit, and HR.
The candidate must be able to work effectively in a cross-functional environment, with colleagues across different geographies. The candidate must have excellent verbal and written communication skills, as well as ability to partner with colleagues at all levels and in different parts of the organization.
Responsibilities:
Create presentations for senior management for business reviews and other ad-hoc events
Complete competitor benchmarking analysis through volume and fee-based market share
Assist with internal audit and external regulatory reviews
Support and maintain various DCM compliance and control initiatives
Manage deal and revenue pipelines
Produce revenue estimates in conjunction with relevant business heads
Review daily P&L to ensure it is accurate, acting as liaison between the business and Product Control Team
Assist in the annual plan and budgeting process as well as intra-year forecasting
Various ad-hoc analysis and projects for DCM businesses
Qualifications:
1-3 years of experience in a related field
Consistently demonstrates clear and concise written and verbal communication skills
Education:
Undergraduate degree in Finance, Management, Accounting or other business related fields
This job description provides a high-level review of the types of work performed. Other job-related duties may be assigned as required.

The University of Rochester Medical Center is made up of many parts, all devoted to providing highly advanced medical care. Our Mission of “Ever Better” means we improve the well-being of patients and communities by delivering innovative, compassionate, patient and family-centered healthcare, enriched by education, science and technology. Our Vision is to cultivate a diverse and inclusive environment that guides and transforms our approaches to healthcare, education, research and community partnerships.The University of Rochester Medical Center’s Office of Strategic Communications is now looking for a Strategic Business Analyst to help us understand where growth opportunity lies for new patient markets and services, in support of URMC’s strategic initiatives. URMC’s multi-year strategic plan strives to proactively prepare for new healthcare delivery models, create an inclusive and enriching culture and build programs of excellence that span research, education and clinical care.The Strategic Business Analyst is responsible for developing comprehensive data analyses with high-level conclusions and directives, leading to business strategy decisions and project concepts. The Strategic Business Analyst’s purpose is to strengthen URMC’s needs assessment capacity to help guide leadership toward data-driven business strategy decisions. This role’s scope and team could evolve over time.This is an excellent opportunity to work collaboratively with stakeholders across the enterprise including URMC Executive Leadership, Clinical and Research Chairs, UR Medical Faculty Group, Finance, Information Technology, URMC Decision Support, and UR Medicine Regional Strategy.The desired candidate will have: At least 5 years relevant business analyst experience, synthesizing multiple data sources and drawing high-level, actionable conclusions.Prefer experience in collecting, assessing and interpreting health system and financial data.The ability to collaborate and work effectively in a large, matrixed organization. Location: DFW Headquarters Building 8 (DFW-SV08)
Additional Locations: None
Requisition ID: 50132
Intro
Are you ready to explore a world of possibilities, both at work and during your time off? Join our American Airlines family, and you’ll travel the world, grow your expertise and become the best version of you. As you embark on a new journey, you’ll tackle challenges with flexibility and grace, learning new skills and advancing your career while having the time of your life. Feel free to enrich both your personal and work life and hop on board!
Why you'll love this job
This position is within our Operations Strategic Planning & Performance department and focused on two key Corporate Strategic Objectives for our business: double down on operational excellence and passionately drive efficiencies.
The team leads a variety of aspects of Operational Strategy and Reporting efforts at American Airlines. It serves as a resource for analytical needs throughout the Operational division, partnering with Sr leaders, front line leaders, Operational business units to get to root cause analysis as quickly and effectively as possible.

What you'll do
Mine, model, analyze and evaluate operational data to identify root cause factors impacting operational reliability and on-time performance
Derive meaningful and actionable insights from data that to help improve the operation
Develop statistical predictive models on large-scale datasets using statistical modeling such as linear regression, logistic regression, decision trees and other machine learning, or data mining techniques
Build optimization and combinatorics models for optimal resource allocations
Perform advanced business analysis using SQL to develop prescriptive operational improvement plans
Build data visualization tools for root cause analysis
Automate and improve current programs, processes, reports and forecasts within the Operations Performance and Analytics organization
Develop presentations and present findings with recommendations to key stakeholders and senior management across the company
Work collaboratively with various teams across the company to develop innovative and insightful solutions to improve operational performance

All you'll need for success
Minimum Qualifications - Education & Prior Job Experience
Bachelor's Degree in Applied Statistics, Data Mining, Operations Research, Industrial Engineering, Applied Mathematics, Information Systems, Computer Science, Business Analytics or related quantitative field
1 year of experience with SQL querying and/or reporting or equivalent coursework
Preferred Qualifications - Education & Prior Job Experience
Master’s degree in a quantitative discipline including Operation Research, Industrial Engineering, Mathematics, Information Systems, or Business Analytics
Skills, Licenses & Certifications
SQL proficiency
Knowledge/basic experience of data processing/manipulation languages such R and Python in large database environments
Highly proficient in use of Microsoft Office software, including Excel, Word, and PowerPoint
Experience with data visualization in Tableau, Power BI, Excel, Python, or others \
Excellent project management and organizational skills, with attention to detail and ability to manage multiple projects on an ongoing basis
Excellent quantitative and analytical skills with an aptitude for problem solving
Ability to work effectively, meet deadlines, and shift priorities appropriately in a fast paced, dynamic work environment with great attention to detail
What you'll get
Feel free to take advantage of all that American Airlines has to offer:
Travel Perks: Ready to explore the world? You, your family and your friends can reach 365 destinations on more than 6,800 daily flights across our global network.
Health Benefits: On day one, you’ll have access to your health, dental, prescription and vision benefits to help you stay well. And that’s just the start, we also offer virtual doctor visits, flexible spending accounts and more.
Wellness Programs: We want you to be the best version of yourself – that’s why our wellness programs provide you with all the right tools, resources and support you need.
401(k) Program: Available upon hire and, depending on the workgroup, employer contributions to your 401(k) program are available after one year.
Additional Benefits: Other great benefits include our Employee Assistance Program, pet insurance and discounts on hotels, cars, cruises and more
Feel Free to be yourself at American
From the team members we hire to the customers we serve, inclusion and diversity are the foundation of the dynamic workforce at American Airlines. Our 20+ Employee Business Resource Groups are focused on connecting our team members to our customers, suppliers, communities and shareholders, helping team members reach their full potential and creating an inclusive work environment to meet and exceed the needs of our diverse world.

Are you ready to feel a tremendous sense of pride and satisfaction as you do your part to keep the largest airline in the world running smoothly as we care for people on life’s journey? Feel free to be yourself at American.

Meta Platforms, Inc. (Meta), formerly known as Facebook Inc., builds technologies that help people connect, find communities, and grow businesses. When Facebook launched in 2004, it changed the way people connect. Apps and services like Messenger, Instagram, WhatsApp, and Novi further empowered billions around the world. Now, Meta is moving beyond 2D screens toward immersive experiences like augmented and virtual reality to help build the next evolution in social technology.Instructions on how to apply, click “Apply to Job” online on this web page.


Protect Facebook from data operations risks by delivering policy compliant custom insights and data request to Facebook's Partnerships teams to be leveraged for internal purposes, as well as externally with clients
Understand digital media industry metrics and focus on speed and accuracy of data
Utilize analytical skills and understanding of databases and data visualization to act as a multi-vertical data expert and partner with a variety of teams to solve problems
Work cross-functionally with key teams such as Sales, Marketing Science, Products, and Marketing to learn and apply best practices for high quality deliverables
Identify and analyze the most important metrics across program areas
Utilize expertise in Excel, Microsoft Office, Tableau, and other data visualization tools and techniques to conceptualize and build dashboards that are simple, visually appealing, yet showcase a powerful story
Interface with multiple areas in Facebook to obtain the necessary data from Facebook's databases
Utilize hands-on experience in SQL and MicroStrategy to lead data-driven projects and provide business insights


Employer will accept a Master's degree in Integrated Marketing, Marketing Analytics, Statistics, Economics, or related field and 24 months of work experience in job offered or in a business analyst-related occupation. Experience must include 6 months of experience in each of the following:
Data analytics in a client facing role
SQL or Python
Data visualization tools such as Tableau or MicroStrategy
Analytical and problem solving experience using data and providing business insights
Leading data-driven projects from definition through interpretation and execution
Building spreadsheets using Datorama Business Intelligence platform
Creating presentations using Keynote and PowerPoint
Building automated spreadsheets using Excel and APIs.

About You:

Are you well versed in digital analytics? Do you love doing data deep dives, analysis and reporting on interesting concepts? Do you like moving fast, thinking faster and dream of excelling at one of the fastest growing companies in Chicago? If so, we want you to join our group of friends. This is your opportunity to be a part of a fast-moving, innovative, lively company that prides itself on creating exceptional solutions and service in a landscape that is ever-changing.

About Us:

At Cars.com, we help shoppers meet their perfect car match, and people find their perfect career match. As one of the top places to work in Chicago, according to The Chicago Tribune, Built-In Chicago and others, we pride ourselves on a culture of growth and innovation.

Cars.com has revolutionized the automotive industry for both shoppers and sellers through technology and solutions for buyers and sellers alike. We never shy away from a challenge, move fast, collaborate across functions to approach problems from every angle. We've built a culture that's second-to-none and share core values that keep everyone working full-speed at the same goals with the same open, outcome-driven and bold attitudes.

Cars.com is a CARS brand. CARS includes the following brands: Cars.com, Dealer Inspire, DealerRater. Learn more here!

About the Role:

We are looking for a Data Analyst who will work closely with our Data, Product, and Engineering teams to implement, configure, and analyze analytics and reporting data across the Cars.com brand of websites. We need someone who cares about data, wants to make our clients succeed and loves learning about technology!

In this role you will work within a team to define and implement digital measurement strategies, implement tracking, perform testing and develop reports; all in an effort to improve website traffic leads and conversions. More specifically you will:

Play a key role in creating both product and client-facing analytics.
Work with the product leaders and managers, and actively participate in execution and planning of analytics strategies
Collaborate with a team of product managers, analysts, and other developers to define and lead data projects
Ability to translate business needs into technical requirements through active partnerships
Ability to problem solve data discrepancies through research and analysis
Configure Adobe and Google Analytics implementations
Analyze user behavior, online initiatives, and data from Adobe Analytics as well as Google Analytics
Create/review/implement tracking scripts
Use and implement tools for A/B testing, heat maps, visitor recordings, etc.
Set up goals, sales funnels, event tracking in Adobe and Google Analytics
Troubleshoot stuff that goes wrong

Qualifications:

Experience with digital/web analytics tools and concepts such as Adobe Analytics, Google Analytics, and tag management systems
Superior work ethic and eagerness to learn, attention to detail, and flexibility to thrive in our dynamic environment
Active listener with the ability to ask the right questions to understand the business problem and identify the analysis approach
Excellent written and verbal communication skills; ability to communicate findings with across multiple levels within the organization
Creative problem-solving skills, with the ability to extract insights and opportunities from data
Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing data
Strong prioritization and communication skills
Experience in SQL experience for data extraction, manipulation and analyses; including complex joins
Experience in data visualization
Experience with Javascript and Python is a plus

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Bluestem Brands is the parent company to five eCommerce retail brands. We have one mission: to build a dynamic retail enterprise that wins with direct-to-consumer excellence and entrepreneurial-minded employees focused on serving our customers’ unique needs. Our leadership is responsive and supportive, empowering those smart and passionate employees who drive our success. We are continually innovating and improving: we take risks, learn from mistakes and celebrate success as a team.
You work hard, and you deserve more than just a paycheck. Bluestem works to do what’s right for employees. From the big things (great benefits, employee discounts and incentive plans) to small touches (jeans-every-day dress code), this is the place you’ll want to be. And we don’t just talk about work-life balance, we try to live it. Join the Bluestem Brands team to make an impact, be inspired and be valued, every day.
We are seeking a Senior Business Analyst for Bluestem Brands. The Senior Business Analyst will serve as a key resource supporting Finance in the process analysis, requirements gathering, documentation, functional subject matter expertise, and testing of projects. This role will also support Finance production processes. This position will support Finance processes/systems involving Accounting, Financial Planning & Analysis, and Treasury. This role will be required to multi-task between supporting multiple projects, production processes, and other tasks as defined. This position will be required to lead initiatives (both production support and project-related) that may be cross-functional in nature. **We are open to this person being 100% remote**
DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Project Support (50%)
Documentation: Document requirements for various projects on behalf of Finance
Document Finance processes (as applicable) - Current state to New state
Solution Assessment:
Ensure Finance requirements are translated into proper functional specifications Identify any gaps, communicate & remediate
Testing: Create test cases (New functionality and Regression)
Perform new functionality, regression & production acceptance testing for Finance Work closely with IT on testing issues (from identification through resolution)
Serve as project lead from Finance and participate in project meetings Understand current systems and business processes to become the subject matter expert
Production Support (40%)
System Administration: Execute standard operating procedures in support of our financial systems.
Make needed configuration changes, report modifications, supply data/reporting as needed.
Serve as the first line of defense with a resolution of Finance production issues.
In this role, the individual will work directly with IT through issue resolution.
Audit support: Produce information to auditors on their various requests.
This would involve data mining our internal databases and providing application-specific information to support their work. General ad-hoc requests for new data queries, reports, and analysis
Other Tasks / Special Projects as defined (10%)
QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor’s degree (B.A.), or equivalent combination of education and experience 5+ years of related experience
Experience with Oracle Financials preferred; EBS is a plus!
Experience preparing business requirements, working with use cases and business process modeling
Analytical, problem-solving and critical thinking skills
Multi-tasking skills and the ability to balance multiple priorities and keep up with project scope changes
Self-starter and quick learner who is easily able to learn new products, systems, applications, and technologies
Strong attention to detail
Strong organizational skills
Ability to communicate with various audiences Strong oral and written communication skills
Ability to learn the technical systems used and how they interface with each other
Background in Finance business processes

Overview:

WHAT ARE WE LOOKING FOR?
TDS is excited to share a newly created opportunity for a Senior Business Intelligence (BI) Data Analyst. If you are naturally curious, have strong problem-solving skills and can drive for results, come join our team!
WHO IS TDS?
TDS is a diversified Fortune 1000® national technology and communications services company. TDS provides wireless products and services; cable and wireline broadband, TV and voice services; and hosted and managed amenities throughout the country via our U.S. Cellular, TDS Telecom, OneNeck IT Solutions and Suttle-Straus brands.
LOCATION
We are open to filling this position REMOTELY or once safe, in any of our physical office locations: Madison, WI; Chicago, IL; Eden Prairie, MN; Urbandale, IA; Omaha, NE; Knoxville, TN; Denver, CO or Scottsdale, AZ.
Responsibilities:

WHAT WILL THE SR. DATA ANALYST DO?
Conduct detailed data analysis, proactively and as planned, on data (corporate supported) used across business units to evaluate business processes and improve on/create new analytic and reporting features
Respond to data and product related inquiries in real-time to support business and technical teams
Perform various data analytics using established company toolsets, statistical models, or other approved industry accepted tools
Provide expertise and translate the business needs to design; and develop tools, techniques, and metrics, and dashboards for insights and data visualization
Provide expertise in data storytelling, leading mentoring sessions, and training.
Consult with users and stakeholders to provide advisory services in relation to analysis and data storytelling.

Qualifications:

WHAT SKILLS & EXPERIENCE DO YOU NEED?
Bachelor’s degree -OR- 4+ years equivalent experience
5+ years experience in a data analyst, financial analyst or similar position; preferably with experience working in report creation, modeling, and trend forecasting
2+ years related IT experience
2+ years experience using data sets to build predictive models (e.g., logistic regression, decision tree)
Proficiency with analytics, querying and visualization tools (i.e. Power BI, SPSS, SAS, SQL, or Tableau)
WHAT SETS US APART FROM OUR COMPETITION?
TDS has a strong set of values and behaviors that help foster a high-performance culture.
We believe in partnering with local communities throughout the country and encourage all employees to participate in volunteer opportunities
TDS was recognized by Madison Magazine as one of the “Best Places to Work”
We make employee development and training a top priority
TDS promotes a healthy life / work balance in a professional, yet casual work atmosphere that values diversity and strong business ethics
Flexible work culture, wellness programs, tuition reimbursement, certification support, continuing education and more!
#TDS offers a competitive salary and strong total rewards package. To learn more about this position, or our company, please visit tdsinc.com.

About Pinterest:
Millions of people across the world come to Pinterest to find new ideas every day. It's where they get inspiration, dream about new possibilities and plan for what matters most. Our mission is to help those people find their inspiration and create a life they love. In your role, you'll be challenged to take on work that upholds this mission and pushes Pinterest forward. You'll grow as a person and leader in your field, all the while helping Pinners make their lives better in the positive corner of the internet.
The IT Team is looking for a seasoned IT Data Analyst who will help launch a new IT wide focus area. We need someone who gets energy from collecting and analyzing data. You will identify trends and provide valuable insights through developing management dashboards and technical reports.
What you'll do:
Interpret data, analyze results and provide ongoing reports
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in data sets

The Boston University Global Development Policy (GDP) Center, a research center that focuses on policy-oriented research for financial stability, human well-being, and environmental sustainability across the globe, is seeking a Data Analyst to oversee its Global China Initiative’s Data Analysis for Transparency and Accountability (D.A.T.A.) project. This project seeks to increase the transparency of Chinese economic activity across the Belt and Road Initiative (BRI) so that host country governments, Chinese policymakers, scholars, journalists, and civil society organizations can engage in more empirical-based discourse and action agenda geared toward greening the BRI.


The Data Analyst will be responsible for maintaining the GDP Center’s suite of databases, which currently includes the following: China’s Overseas Development Finance (CODF) Database; China’s Global Energy Finance (CGEF) Database; China’s Global Power (CGP) Database; China-Latin America Finance (CLAF) Database; and China-Africa Loans (CALD) Database.


The Data Analyst will work closely with PIs and research leads to identify, review, and integrate external data sources into GDP Center data; collaborate with the research teams in the conduct of the collection of data across the Center's various databases; clean, verify, and manage data input.


The Data Analyst will work across functional teams and with external consultants on the design and presentation of interactive data visualizations.


Responsibilities:

Data management, including extraction and cleaning of raw data from primary and secondary sources.
Derivation of new variables, labeling and formatting of raw and derived variables, and multiple imputation.
Identify and troubleshoot coding errors.
Document processes involved in data preparation, manipulation, and analysis.
Use statistical tools to interpret data sets, paying particular attention to trends and patterns that could be valuable for diagnostic and predictive analytics efforts.
Extract information from the datasets and the Center’s databases for inclusion in reports to internal and external audiences.
Other duties as assigned.

Required Skills

STATA required
Experience in R strongly preferred
A bachelor's degree is required; a master's degree is preferred
3-5 years related work experience


This is position is for a two-year appointment and is subject to periodic performance reviews. Potential renewal is contingent upon funding availability.

Overview
Do you have a passion for making huge business impacts by leveraging data-driven insights? Do you love working collaboratively in an innovative environment? Would you love to make an impact on our customers’ lives? Come join Intuit where you can grow your career and be empowered to do the best work of your life!
We are looking for a hands-on Business Data Analyst who is a creative problem solver with a passion to deliver advanced data-driven solutions. You will work alongside product managers, marketers, and others to grow our business at Intuit. We are an exciting, growing, and fun team that works with industry-leading analytics tools, techniques and best practices.
What you'll bring
1-3 years of experience in generating and presenting insights from marketing/product data; experience in advanced analytics and optimization a plus
Experience with customer behavioral analytics and or marketing analytics
SQL skills to perform data segmentation and aggregation from scratch; experience working with granular web clickstream data and behavior tracking tools
Domain experience in subjects such as experimental design and Multivariate/A-B testing is a plus

Strong communication skills with the ability to influence decision makers and build consensus with teams
Bachelor degree in Business, Engineering, Math, Statistics, Finance, Economics, or a related field or equivalent experience. MBA or graduate degree in a related field is a plus
How you will lead
Driving business strategy: you will be partnering closely with different business units, developing internal and external data sources to be used in propensity modeling and predictive analytics. Understand the current ecosystems, historical customer behaviors, and long-term trends in order to identify ways to improve and communicate the necessary information to key partners

Partner with leadership to prioritize areas of opportunity to drive growth
Driving self-serve and data literacy: democratize data by building and socializing decision tools (dashboards, reports); build key data sets/pipelines to empower operational and exploratory analysis.
